tjvCWLHr6kvt-btM47iLiQ.text: Amazing food and service but the temp in the restaurant was unbearable.  This is the second time we have been at this establishment where it seemed the air wasn't on.

VgAice6ARfLErTAZv6VDsA.text: Delicious! Went here for my birthday with my parents and everything was perfect. This place has no comparison to any pizza restaurant that I've had here in Las Vegas. My favorite is the Bianca pizza.

_PEnAYGUXIW4BIG9_CpxbA.text: Taste, yummy. Quality ingredients, fast and friendly service. But, the price to size ratio wasn't anywhere near where it should be in my opinion. It's a little $14 pizza that I could devour by myself in just a few minutes.  So, if you like fancy, small pizzas then this place is for you. If you have a man sized appetite I'd suggest finding somewhere else to go for your pizza fix.

J9dLciuvqlBAtFzYEcGi2w.text: All I can say is that I tried to overdose on the Settebello!  Ahhh the SAUSAGE!!!

zww7eA5BtwahiAhPpvvB6g.text: Fresh, light, AMAZING pizza! I used to live in Italy and this is the next best thing!  DOC pizza is a must for anyone. I recommend starting with that and then going more adventurous.  Some of the flavored aren't for everyone and I won't lie I wasn't impressed with some of the weirder pizzas but their simple Doc (like a margarita but better) is simply perfect.   YUM!

2T0Aszz4O6mSlyMQKOR5Ww.text: Our server Chris was incredible. He guided us through the menu and his recommendations were spot on. Yes, I know it's pizza however, each pizza has a unique flavor and taste profile. My favorite is the "Pizza Brisket" the 48-hour sous-vide slow cooked brisket is AMAZING!!! with the caramelized onions is a must try.

Zd_Hje-QkC32Y1Xsnt9KMQ.text: It pains me to give this two stars. THIS IS ONE OF MY FAVORITE RESTAURANTS OF ALL TIME. But my last experience was so terrible. The food was great but my server Brian was the worst server I've ever had in my life. Rude, never checked on us, then after I paid 26$ for bottomless bellinis he basically kicked us out. I am a regular here I know the hours and that it closes at 10. At 9 o'clock he apparently wanted to go home early because he told me the place is closed and it was time to go. Then when I asked for the manager Vanessa she never came to hear how terrible my server was. Unbelievable. The next day when telling a friend about my experience she told me Brian has served her before and was just as terrible to her party. Won't be back to this location that's a promise. Matt however is a great server.

pEwuglYL3TL8HgnP15vAgw.text: Ordered 2  pizzas and cheese platter. The pizzas looked like mini pools . Tomatoes drowned the cheese and meats . The crust was so soggy. Cheese platter came so late is was covered by the place .  5 of us left hungry and  short of $40.00 GG. If you come here hungry don't expect to leave satisfied. Gotta go to In n Out now to fulfill our hunger

02wzzFjclbYTMdA2Do2zHw.text: Good Pizza, but very over priced.  Their claim to fame is they use New York water and flour from Italy. I did see the flour sacks, but honestly, it didn't make a difference.  I had the waiter bring me their "best house" pizza. It was no different than any other family style pizza in town.  Luckily, it was my friend's treat, or I would have felt that I had been taken.   I hate to admit it, but the $9.99 Costco extra large, with everything on it, is better. But if you are craving pizza and on a date, this place is a cut above California Pizza Kitchen, and they are nicer than Gramaldi's.   I have had Pizza in New York and it did seem better, but honestly, doesn't food taste better when you're visiting?  I still think Chicago has the best Pizza in the US.

AY5kBkInQlHKMN-C16FSuQ.text: First in the door, early lunch, craving pizza.  The reviews are good so why not.  The misto is a sampling of italian style meats, some cheese, veggies served with focaccia.  This is delicious.  I could munch on this old day.  Serve with a good vino, and it makes you feel good all over.  Since I was with my husband, we decided to try two pizza's, he picked one and and I picked one and we shared.  While both were good, I think mine was excellent.  Of course we got the settebello, crushed tomatoes, pancetta, sausage, mushrooms, pinenuts, mozzarela, basil and extra virgin olive oil. (my choice), and emilia, prosciutto cotto, panna fresh mozzarella, parmigiano reggiona, basil and extra virgin olive oil.   The crust is super thin and has a slight crispy bottom, the top flavors were a good mixture I must say, enjoyed, we ate every bite.  For a different type of pizza, a thin crust, this is an excellent choice.  Good service, good food.

T_sdLwgczI4KY0EGmGovHw.text: What a great place!  Friendly servers,  amazing pizza, great wine selection!  Cory, Maddy, Adrian and Ryan are amoung my favorites. There is always a new pizza to try. I love the bright fun atmosphere and wonderful food!

OIR1D91aqkG1e2-roNEmGQ.text: Okay saw this place on the food network and have been wanting to stop by every time we are in Vegas but never got around to it.  Well no it we are going to try and make it a regular stop every time. The location we went to was next to Green Valley Casino its across the street in a little strip mall type area.  It is very casual dress and the place is not very big but comfortable.  There is a bar area with T.V. in the corner of the place. The PIE...I have to say that the foundation is the bread crust.  It is so doughy and just a little salty but very chewy.  Greatest tasting crust I have had since having pizza in Italy.  We just the Margherita with buffalo mozzarella it was phenomenal.  We wanted to get meat on the pizza but being our first time we just wanted to taste it with nothing but sauce and cheese, the True tell of a good pizza.  Nothing to cloud the simplicity of great ingredients. We had the pear salad with arugula and balsamic glaze and marmalade.  It was also very tasty, peppery and sweet.  It all blended together very nicely. My recommendation would be to order two pizza cause one isn't gonna be enough.  When you finish the first one your gonna wish you ordered a second.  I would have to say the service was okay.  The water we had wasn't very ....hmmmm...helpful.  I mean he took our order and brought everything we asked for don't get me wrong.  It's just we told him it was our first time there and if he had any suggestions and his response was everyone orders the "insalata grande" which is basically a large salad.  I mean with all the salads on the menu that was his recommendation.  It wasn't like he had to be excited about his job, but at least try to sell us on something.  He could have been a little more descriptive or enthusiastic about the food but it was more a hey I'm your waiter let me know what you want.  But he was polite just know you may have to wing it on your first time.  Maybe it was his off night or his first night we just wish he was a little more helpful in recommending something.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pistachio gelato..
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. It&#39;s very thin crust and chewy tasty dough....
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Scale with straw at bottom of plate

wkIypcfYLADcTdXCvdEknQ.text: The pizza and dessert was great! I would suggest this restaurant to anyone. Though I wasn't crazy about their Nutella pizza, I would definitely come back for any of their pizzas. They are freshly made and I love how it taste like home.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

afqTNTLQSN1zO8d4S2VnJw.text: San Marzano tomatoes and perfect crust make a bad week so much better. It had been a while (too long actually) since I'd been back to Settebello but after having a rough week it was time. I was not disappointed. I was seated promptly, ordered a "Settebello" (it's the bottom offering on the menu but I love it the best) pizza, and with the first bite the stress of everything going on just faded away.   While I love Old School Pizzeria and Chef Gio's pizza, there's just something super special about this place. When you leave nothing on your plate but the faint remnants of the slightly singed crust, that says it all.   Still 5 Stars, Still Best of Las Vegas worthy, and I wonder if it warrants inclusion on my Mythical 6th Star List. If you haven't been here yet you really need to quit procrastinating and just do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Mine! No I&#39;m not sharing, not with something so damn good!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Got lunch?
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Their namesake pizza with a slight twist!

5cXW6kB6gL6xCAL0BmGQxw.text: I had the Insalata Grande and half Bianca & half Emilia pizza to share. They recommended that we choose both white sauce pizzas (or both tomato sauce) when ordering 'half and half.' Overall, the food was good, but I felt the Bianca side was a little salty.

_FvEmtXBddFHBI18eUOwLw.text: There's this amazing place that's small (according to me) and quaint. When you first walk in the door you can see the huge brick oven where the chefs are sliding things in and taking the goodness out.   We got the Settebello and the Nutella pizza along with some fresh minty drinks that I've forgotten the name of.   Everything was delicious as the hundreds if reviews already account for so stop reading and head on over!!

fuLiepiI-NjSuwEUxkFUrw.text: We went there enticed by a feature on them on Food Network spotlighting their Italian braised pork pizza.  We were told that they only make it for Christmas.  We then ordered a smallish, overpriced pizza that was limp and soggy.  See ya!

ALbHauSbttK3xo5bo-4OMQ.text: This is a awesome spot for pizza off the strip.  If you're looking for Italian style pizza crust, look no further.  I've went several times with friends that have lived in Italy and they rave about this place.  The pizza is delicious and the staff are amazing.  Lots of parking available.

FXmpcgxoywIaKX9167ODxA.text: Fantastic, see my review for the Sahara location below. The biggest difference between this location and the one on Sahara is that this one has some pretty amazing gelato. The Dream Bomba is amazing (chocolate-covered peanut butter gelato, wrapped around a caramel core). And I always like to finish my meals here with a lovely affogato (a scoop of vanilla gelato, topped with freshly brewed espresso) - divine. yelp.com/biz/settebello-...

n3uu-dAGgvZT2o1_9ZuzRw.text: Just ate there... Or at least I tried to. As soon as my dish came there was a really long brown hair cooked into my pizza. The waitress noticed and grabbed the plate. She told me she'd bring another pizza to me but instead I cancelled my order and the waitress disappeared. Gross! Would never recommend this place.   I also wanted to mention my table was sticky. Obviously it hadn't been wiped clean. Anyhow, plenty of other reasons why I wouldn't dine here but I'm sure the hair is the biggest one of them all.

B76oIO-3fwzvLCk-5fZVnw.text: We absolutely loved Settabello Pizza! We went in on valentines night it was very busy but they took very good care of us.

zwD3k59ky7CfQcbYnVphRQ.text: Actual rating: 4.5 Found this great restaurant courtesy of yelp and it was conveniently located in between the Strip and Hoover Dam(15 min), which had an amazing dam tour(pun intended). The fam and I parked in the parking lot with a Whole Foods, and when we came in, found the restaurant not very busy @2pm. Interior decor gave off a homey vibe and the brass pipes on the ceiling added a nice touch. They had (authentic?) mint candies nestled in a basket in the desk in front. So the food, which all of you are here to read about: Margarita w/ house made sausage: the margarita and house made sausage were pretty good; the sausage was ok, nothing to write home about. We also ordered the Capricciosa which was fantastic; the ham/prosciutto on the pizza was tender and so yummy! The crusts for both pizzas were slightly charred not the best part but that depends on the person. It was also really floppy from the tomato sauce which was btw super yummy Our waiter was courteous with his "miss" "mister" etc. and he was fast to get us our check. I went to the bathroom afterwords and OH MY GOD was it clean! You would expect the usual plastic stalls, fluorescent lighting, unidentifiable-liquid-on-the-floor,  but this bathroom was a cut above the rest. There was music, dim intimate lighting(to get you into a romantic pooping mood), wood accents, floral scented hand soap, paper toilet covers...it was the best $$restaurant bathroom I've ever been in... I would definitely make this into a regular stop if I lived in Las Vegas/Boulder City.

m8P_ChG0RDgIMoubhDI0uQ.text: This is truly my favorite pizza restaurant. The pizza is on the light side. You don't feel stuffed in pizza. Its quiet enough to enjoy a conversation. The president ordered from here when he was in town.

So8bjSHVUH9zWMBIFYVvjw.text: Yummie Great salad & awesome thin crust pizza. I don't even eat crust that much but there's is divine.

coeWGcwv3-qX8yRykxSzog.text: This is a quaint little Italian Pizza place that doesn't try and Americanize their pizza. It's straight up, delicious Italian pizza. Thin crust, not overloaded with cheese, it has real vegetables, and artichokes, delicious artichokes. (I mean you could order a pizza without artichokes, but why would you). You're either going to love it, or hate it. It's not pizza hut, and it doesn't pretend to be. You're getting an authentic experience here. If you're in the mood for some delicious Italian pizza, this is your spot, best in Vegas.

FnGGyKc8gIR9D0-F3l5Ipw.text: Delicious!!! We tried a bunch of pizzas and our faves were the settebello and the basil one. Perfect crust and flavorful toppings. Thought it was better than pizzeria Bianco in Phoenix!

0mREPkhrXuqI4O1VXXdxkA.text: It's extremely hot in the place ! Only bad part! Every single worker is so attractive it hurts. The pizza is great the service is even better! Best place in town.

-90MNqNvtIOqwiUTvRHT9Q.text: Love this pizza! No matter where you are from, NY, Chicago, or wherever else has pizza, come try THiS pizza all the way from Naples Italy. Well worth it.

-HYZ8FtJwbZFMAVwpob0VQ.text: Our server was very nice but the food was mediocre. The insalata grande was delicious but I was disappointed with the pizza. The toppings were scarce and we ordered 3 different pizzas which tasted exactly the same. Although the dough was delicious it was very floppy that you couldn't really eat with your hands. There was really difference in flavor for the 3 pizzas we chose. It's an okay place but probably wouldn't recommend it. Nothing special.

mY8k5KF3Sg5gNcJ4O6sdJA.text: Driving out to Green Valley is worth the drive, if you're looking for Napoletana style pizza.    What was ordered was the Vico and Quattro Formaggi.  Vico was not bad.  This was a white pizza.  Enjoyed the fennel, onion, and sausage combination.  Mozzarella and mascarpone gave it a nice creaminess to the pizza.  The star of this visit was the Quattro Formaggi.  The pizza comes topped with four different cheeses.  What really made this pizza delicious was the Gorgonzola.  If you enjoy the sharp creamy flavor of Gorgonzola you have to order this.  As it is randomly dispersed on the pizza, the most enjoyable bites are the ones that include that sharp Gorgonzola taste.  This is the third time I've been here.  I have always been satisfied when coming here.  There are a lot of other pizza places in Vegas.  I would like to try other places but it is difficult to not come here because there pizzas are delicious.   Unless we do a pizza only visit to Vegas sometime.  Doubt that would happen.

pfjudDsBJV3_WIO4gZuv1Q.text: I've been wanting to try this little pizza joint out for quite some time and last night I finally had the pleasure of digging into some of the tastiest Italian cuisine I've ever tasted.  The ambiance in the restaurant can be confusing. When I first entered, I thought I was a bit under dressed, but after being greeted by a t-shirt laden host and looking around at other patrons, I realized this wasn't the case at all. Casual dining in a fancy environment, I can dig it!   I've heard murmurings that this is the only joint to offer authentic Neapolitan pizza in Las Vegas and the menu stated that the oven was built brick by brick with ash from Mount Vesuvius. Whatever they're doing back there, they're doing it right. This was hands down the best pizza I've had in quite some time, second only to Ray's in NYC and possibly Lombardi's.   If you're looking for a place to dine, don't pass up this restaurant. I'll most definitely be back and in droves. I love this food!  For those interested in price, I had an Italian beer, one salad and one full pizza shared between two people and two cappuccinos.The total was $32. Delicious AND affordable!

BFqzGsb30_ze0kUCqHU2pA.text: WOW!  Freakin awesome pizza!  My wife and I were in The District for a mid-afternoon walk...not even that hungry but since we only come here maybe once a month I HAD to try this place after reading so many rave reviews.  This didn't disappoint at all.  The reviews lived up to all the expectations and I already can't wait to go back to try all the other pies they have.    We just split the margherita w/ half of it topped w/ cured prosciutto and bite after bite was simply heaven.  I hope this place is successful.  Why the hell would anyone go to Metro after having this????

ORGJYU2kfrk-KK7A4UWs2Q.text: I've been here a few times before with my family and every time the service and food is exceptional.   We went again today and the hostesses and the server came to the table every few minutes to ask if we need anything or if we wanted drink refills. Server gave recommendations and did his best to help us decide what to get. Exceptional service.   Now the food, my dad ordered the Diavola pizza and my brother got the kid's meal (kid's soda, 6" cheese pizza, hazelnut gelatto.) and I got the Focaccia, great food, my only complaint is that the oregano on the focaccia was burnt because it was put on top before it was baked, I'd personally think that it would be better mixed into the dough.   Overall, very happy with everything, this place has the most authentic italian pizza that I've ever tried. Everything in the restaurant screams authentic (even the salt and pepper are from Italy). Must try if you're living in Vegas or just visiting!

GrbVIr29OGanNZVZ-nO2Qw.text: The food is good, the prices are ok, the service was excellent. The place is cute, and has ample parking.

rqSx30-4DgHJKVfeHDta5g.text: My first taste of Napoletana style pizza and a very good introduction. My server when I dine in has been Ryan, super friendly and knowledgeable. Can't go wrong here: Margherita DOC, the Settebello, and the Diavola were all delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Settebello to go: eaten in the car. Napoletana style is prone to soggy bottom syndrome.

iPQLwzJdKL3HjSZzgJqsQQ.text: Love it!  I studied abroad in Italy when I was in college and this is one of the only places that comes close, is on par and/or supersedes pizza I ate almost on a daily basis there.  My favorites are the Settebello and Diavola; the Diavola is super spicy for me.  As much as I love the pizza, I do not always love the service.  Some waiters/waitresses are great, while others appear to be college students who can't be bothered.  E.g., if we ask for something, like straws or additional napkins, they seemed annoyed or are slow to come back to the table.  Nonetheless, the pizza is great so we keep going back.  (And the stars are for the food.)  Also, while the pizza is super good, the gelato is FANTASTIC. This is hands down the best gelato I've had outside of Italy, and a MUST every time. There's usually a special gelato of the day/week, in addition to what's listed on the menu.  If there's anything that's a must try, it's the gelato.

6dSp4Y-5gYLGs5ryhdU7hQ.text: Best pizza restaurant in green valley. I wish they offered delivery but for pizza this good we can pick up! They don't have pepperoni but they have something very similar just ask. All pizzas are 12" so get 2 for 3-4 people. For myself and 2 kids we usually get 2 and have a little left over. Highly recommend this place!

STzpUS5AAtZzotNErva9-w.text: Solid pizzas, salads, and beers. The pizzas are Neopolitan style so feel very rustic. Definitely feels a bit fresher than your normal pizzeria.   Crusts were slightly undercooked in our opinion, but next time we'll ask for them to leave it in an extra minute. We like crispier crusts, so this could just be us.  The beet salad was incredible: roasted beets, goat cheese, marcona almonds, arugula, balsamic vinaigrette. Delicious.  The pizza settebello (crushed tomatoes, pancetta, sausage, mushrooms, toasted pine nuts, mozzarella, basil, olio) was awesome, though consensus was that pignoli were out of place.  And our glasses weren't empty when we left, so they brought us to-go cups for the iced tea and topped them off. Really nice touch. Would be in the rotation for sure if we spent more time near GVR.

Ki8uSL82HsFnY3-Fr7atxg.text: Waited a while to try this place out because it's out of the way for me.  Finally had the chance to try this place out.  I wish I came sooner!  Their moscato was one of the better ones I've had.  I ordered the Settebello pizza and it was absolutely delicious!  Service was very attentive as well.

HZoCZq5ZZuBJ-cKjgGipnQ.text: It's hard to give a 5 star rating to an establishment.  Everything has to be inline and perfect.  From the food, to the service, to the cleanliness...it all has to work.  Settebello definitely falls into this category!  Being a pizza snob from NYC, it would take a lot for me to give a 5 star rating for pizza other then NY style pizza.  I do not recognize Chicago sytle pizza as pizza. It's more lasagna than Pizza.  I never loved Napoletana pizza either.  It's sauce on cracker thin dough, more on the torilla chip side with salsa than anything else.  The only pizza for me is NYC style pizza!  Thin, greasy, crispy bottom and crust with gooey cheese.  Settebello's Napoletana pizza changed all that for me!  First off, the Service and cleanliness was great.  Everyone was very helpful and anticipated our needs.  They were great!  The decor is great and it's a great date place as well as a wonderful family restaurant.  Now on to the food review.  My wife ordered the Mahagarita and I ordered it also with prosciutto.  The Pizza was PERFECT!  The dough was fresh and soft, with a hint of crisp burnt taste from the oven.  Each bite transcended the experience.  You can almost taste the history and love (that's right, I said love) that was put into the pizza for hundreds of years.  From the first person to make a pizza in Italy hundreds of years ago, to that day as it sat on my plate.  This morsel of time was a "foodgasim" that lasted from a single bite.  This is just from the pizza dough.  The sauce was tangy with the a tickle of sweetness.  The prosciutto gave it a wonderfuly salty balance.  The cheese was cooked perfect with the hint of the fresh basil giving the perfect aromatic kiss at the end.  It was like the first drop of morning dew, dripping off the left.  Splashing down on the ground, giving life to those around it, unassuming and perfect; as nature intended.   After I wiped away a tear from my eye from this uplifting experience, we ordered the Nutella/Banana Pizza desert.  I'm not a big Nutella fan, but once again the dough was spiritual and made me a fan.  Overall, the 2 pizza's, 2 iced teas and Desert Pizza was $37. Not cheap by any means, but well worth the price.  I highly recommend Settebello's and will be frequent this pizzeria very often.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella  pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Margarita with procuitto
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Mahagarita with Proscuitto

b5Jo-KeNNyU8kc53kcrVLg.text: One of our favorite pizza places in the Henderson/ Vegas area. The atmosphere is sleek and clean while the servers are friendly and attentive. The pizza is served quickly so it's hot and fresh. If you enjoy Napoli style pizza, you need to check this place out.   If you have a taste for spicy food and meat, the Diavola is a good choice. It's made with peppered salami, garlic, roasted red peppers and crushed red pepper.  If you love arugula and prosciutto, do the Bianca. It does not have crushed tomatoes (binding sauce) but has a generous amount of shaved parmigiano reggiano.  The Involtini di prosciutto is so good. It is basically, arugula wrapped in prosciutto and topped with par-reg and goat cheese, with drizzled olive oil and balsamic reduction.  The Caprese is fresh as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Bianca Pizza, Involtini di Prosciutto and Caprese

54rz6lVKJKB9UGHkwy1tJQ.text: The best pizza in Las Vegas. This is truly authentic Napoli pizza , fresh and crazy tasty. It has a unique dough that is just like in Napoli, Italy. Very similar to the oldest and the best pizzeria in the country, which is "Lombardi's" in New York. Everything is imported from Italy , all the ingredients which makes it healthy pizza as well. I have also tried their gluten free pizza and it is the best one that I have tried in Las Vegas and I have tried all of them pretty much.  The service is great also , my favorite location is the one in Henderson. Settebello pizzeria is the only place where I would go to have a pizza . Because it is so authentic and you can feel in every bite a taste of Italy. All those people that wrote bad reviews have NO IDEA how the authentic Italian pizza should taste.

ASI8w4Pwadak15CJm6rMaA.text: After living in Italy for a year I thought I'd never find pizza I liked here in Vegas. I was so thrilled to find this pizzeria as the pizza is fantastic! The thin crust is perfect and the toppings are perfectly paired! They have specials everyday for example $4 margaritas on Thursday and 50% off bottles of wine on Tuesday. Happy hour also has a lot of good choices for food and drinks. The service is excellent! Everyone is attentive, polite and fast!  All in all this is my favorite pizza place in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. 50% off wine on Tuesday!

bgO8yqONCbKWTDFquWyKCA.text: This is my favorite pizza place. I'm from Seattle, but make a point to come here every time I Visit Vegas. Their gluten free pizza is phenomenal!!! Probably the best I've ever had. Try the beet salad if you like beets.

T11dp1m6XhQUY72BY05Xlw.text: Wow 665 Reviews? I'll make this quick.   I've driven past this past numerous times and finally decided to pop in for a few drinks and a slice of Bolognese pizza, which my friend highly recommended. First off the service here is off the charts, right when you walk-in you're greeted and shown a seat. Water is dropped on the table and within a few minutes a server is greeting you and asking for drink orders while giving menu recommendations.  We ordered the Bolognese pizza, baked Gnocchi, and the Insalata. The salad was perfect for two and had mixed greens, balsamic vinaigrette, cracked pepper, shaved parmigiano. A very refreshing salad and a great green break with all the carbs I was about ingest.   The baked Gnocchi was ridiculous. Piping hot straight out the oven, covered in melted cheese and house marinara. I don't think I've ever had Gnocchi with marinara before, always just covered in pesto or white sauce. A must pre-meal snack while you're scanning the menu.  Bolognese Pizza. Just think pizza with a slow simmered meat sauce marinara and light addition of cheese all on some incredibly flavorful soft crust. Marone! This pizza here alone is worth the trip to come back and check out the rest of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Baked Gnocchi.
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Bolognese Pizza.

0Fe-id6gw9Q_a859zsBP-g.text: Really great pizza! The dough is perfect and chewy. The only thing is it got cold fast and quite soggy in the middle. So it wasn't crispy at all. That's the only thing I would improve on. But the flavors are all there and the crust was really good! We got the Settebello pizza. I think I have a slight gluten sensitivity and that night my tummy hurt so I think it's quite gluten heavy. But it was soooo good! Worth it!

xKz3ACkoFsZkTHuZ5BSTyw.text: I got to say that this place is pretty good!! I order jalapeno margarita (not on menu) special made and it was delicious..  We shared a salad Panzanella, it was very flavorful and fresh.  For main course we shared the Special pizza inferno; crushed tomatoes , coppa, jalapenos and Serrano peppers, pans cream mozzarella cheese, basil and olio.. wow!! It was delicious!!!! For dessert I order tiramisu and a latte!! Overall it was outstanding!  Patrick was our server and did a good job!  Thanks again for the delicious food and great service:))

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiramisu  DELICIOUS!!

JBHCGx-umknikX5ew5sbnA.text: Settebellos is simply amazing! My favorite pizza in Las Vegas. It is truly Authentic Italian pizza at its finest. This restaurant offers amazing an amazing cocktail and wine selection. Many of their high quality ingredients are sourced from Italy. One pizza is enough for two people, however they do not offer half and half toppings. My personal favorites are the pizza bolognese and settebello. Expect a wait if dining in the evening as this place is very popular.

sWCR_wafF8tCHIP6DfBh9A.text: If I could give more than 5 stars I would. I have also reviewed this restaurant on Find Me Gluten Free. We had an amazing experience. They easily accommodated my gluten free requests and made suggestions as well as my husbands allergy to onions. They even made changes for my toddlers request. We were with friends from out of country. It was amazing food and great service.

fdRGTZqOb_UBuEobDjkfIA.text: It's a little pricey, but always good. Service has always been friendly. If you like this style of pizza, you won't be disappointed.

l01Z56Yq14Kv-Sy_LmNlDQ.text: This place is very good. It is good for groups or a date night. I highly recommend the jalapeno pizza. The prices are fairly reasonable as well and the service is good.

oWCn9N1Ixu-eaommUfUTpQ.text: I am not a big yelper, BUT I do believe good service should be recognized! I popped in to Settebello today for a quick lunch. Charlene greeted me at the door, and seated me.  She went over the menu with me in great detail, and was extremely informed! It's great when the staff is knowledgeable and also willing to walk you through the experience! I feel in some establishments customer service is a dying thing. Not here! Charlene was kind, funny, and constantly on top of things!  Did I mention their pizza rocks?!  What more could you ask for?!   Thanks Charlene and Settebello! I WILL  be back!

kG1DuN4OlO5ZnyELmPgScA.text: This place is has the best pizza I highly recommend a margarita pizza and for dessert dive in to the tiramisu it's very decadent and worth every calorie! When you walk in feels like you're in a little place in Italy  very charming now the service sometimes it's not the best and take to long to come back to the table to check on your drinks   would still highly recommend this place!

OO_A6fAxo-A5lr5Tt8VsQA.text: I've eaten here 5 times. The menu is ok.  Basic but overhyped.  It's always overcrowded and loud to me and food tries a little to be eclectic pizza but it's just ok to me. I find this place very mediocre but easy to stop in for a quick bite  What I don't like is the lackluster service.  Usually when a friend suggests we go here, I just roll my eyes and suggest another place.  I'm just not crazy about their food.  I don't know what it is.  A bit overpriced for pizza, but my friends like it.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello

7PhWlVsl8fI8x6opdMM_0w.text: Not a bad place, but their pizza selections are a bit out of my preferred range. Lots of fancy combinations. At lunch time they run a good special, so that was nice. Beer selection wasn't great, so I stuck with a pop.  Keep in mind too that it is really, REALLY thin crust, so if you don't like that, you should probably move on. I see other reviews say it's crunchy, but I found it incredibly soggy. I had to actually use a fork for parts of the pizza.

NfI0CPkMGpjpjchnhuQrZg.text: Came back a second time and the place was empty.  Pizza was still tasty but a bit soggy as others have mentioned.  I''d precook the dough for a min before throwing the crushed tomatoes and toppings on.  Drinks were still good.  Still some of the best pizza I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Need to press some of the water out of the fresh mozz or drain tomatoes more before cooking.. Pizza was soggy

Nh2aka5ki7rMyCQiOsngpA.text: I've found the perfect pizza here! Light, chewy crust with a wonderful wood fired smokiness begin this taste excursion. Simmering tomato sauce, fennel sausage and onions topped it off. The great thing about this place is that they stay True to the Napoli style pie. Bravo !

L4l6Nn9SC9uGmqi1ZscaxA.text: Love the taste of Napoli style pizza! I have to say the pizza here is full of flavor! Started off with the Misto. Meat, cheese and veggie appetizer. So Good! All the pizzas are personal size, i believe he said 12". We had the margarita pizza and added sausage and loved it. Our server was very friendly and helpful. We will be back soon!

6okviQCMcEB2p-GXe-461w.text: Been here several times and never leave disappointed.  Always delicious!  Some of the best servers I've experienced in Las Vegas.

lcp9HFzljIho5EKViLc4JA.text: This place has sadly gone "American style ". The pizzas are more saucy and less Neopolitan style. It's supposed to be authentic! Not anymore. It's still really good, but not like it was! So sad!  I've just downgraded my rating because they are unmoored from the Neapolitan pizzeria. They should loose their status. The bread is not as good, the pizza has too much sauce on it and it gets really soggy. I'm so disappointed.

pR-93twijA19RSCpXas4Pg.text: If you're looking for great brick-over/wood-fire pizza, this is it!! Hands down one of the best in Vegas and beats Grimaldi's by far!   So what makes their pizza the best brick-over/wood-fire? I'm going to guess its a combination of things including the light dough, fresh tomatoes sauce, and the special toppings like prosciutto ham. The dough and crust is unbelievably good. I noticed they don't use a lot of flour or corn meal under the crust like other pizza places which helps preserve the flavor of the dough.   Today we ended up trying the Settebello & Bolognese pizza. The Settebello has a combination of items including ham, sausage, mushrooms, and mozzarella featuring their regular tomato sauce. The Bolognese has a rich creamier bolognese ragu sauce with fresh mozzarella. Both are equally epic!   If you haven't tried this place yet and you love this style pizza, this place is a must!

9ctiXlyehD03ezpQf5BI2A.text: Love this place. Great cocktails and the pizza carbonara is the bomb. Does get busy, so I usually come here during the day.

Ge4jVakrcxQISI2PSa3Jvw.text: I was schooled in the tradition of Neopolitan style pizza. I came here on a recommendation and was definitely impressed with the quality of ingredients and  strict adherence to traditional standards required. I'll definitely be back.

nONeu1ZgxjX4P29naRjcjw.text: I feel like the quality of food has dropped a little bit since I last ate here.  Went here for lunch yesterday and I was hugely disappointed.  Ordered the marinara pizza like I always do.  There was wayyyyyy too much sauce...to the point where the pizza dough was extremely soggy.  It just had an all around bad texture & taste... even my toddler wouldn't touch it after one bite.  I couldn't believe how terrible it was.  I also ordered the insalata grande salad and it didn't taste that great; not sure what the change was.  Not sure that I will go back anytime soon.

NWJYbAr0G-loJVRu2L8r_Q.text: Best neapolitan pizza in the  country.If you like real italian pizza baked in an oven from italy which runs at around 900 Degrees F.this is the place. If you like american pizza with 10 toppings DO NOT COME HERE,this place has super thin pizza.Only get 1-2 toppings,you dont need more. BTW great tiramisu.

eHRB_p0WQKH9KLji8DTlqw.text: Wow. These reviews must have been paid for. I got a settebello pizza and Im underwhelmed and dissappointed. Soggy, cold and chewy with almost no ingredients. 2 small underdone pieces of sausage. Won't be going back.

JjGO52koIy9Yith8vIsjhA.text: It's great place if you like individual pizza but don't go expecting one pizza will be enough to feed multiple people (they do tell you that beforehand thankfully).  We started with the flat bread appetizer which was good and is about the same size of the pizzas. For our main course we shared this pizza (which I can't remember or pronounce) but it had artichokes and olives. I didn't remember seeing ham or pork on the description but if I did I wish I could've asked for it to be on only half of it. At least my boyfriend likes it. :)  We did share a dessert as well. It was a lemon pastry covered in powdered sugar. It was really good but I'm now curious how good their popular one is.  I forgot to add how the service is friendly and helpful especially since I can't say anything on the menu correctly.   Overall, it's a nice place to eat pizza if you're on a date with your significant other.

2dcHXlldDd2nsPn2Qe0WGQ.text: Returned to this pizzeria with family and no balsamic vinegar on salads just oil. Pizza was soggy and burnt on the bottom. Told their was a wait over the phone and it was not crowded for a Saturday night.  Very disappointed won't be back. They aren't consistent. Returned after all and had sattelbello pizza and salad everything was fine.

Jvjngxmv3zheqNxnHDXNBA.text: This has been one of the best Pizza Restaurants I've been to. The service was incredible as soon as we walked in. They seated us right away even though they were pretty busy. The waiter refilled our drinks without us pestering him. The pizza is amazong. I ordered the bistro pizza, and if youre a fan of white sauce pizza, this is the one for you. I definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to try a new pizza restaurant.

j40ghYkkv_PPgic8MCMKWQ.text: This place has some of the best brick oven pizza I've ever eaten in my life. Whatever they're doing, it's done right.   Ordered the focaccia and it was delicious. Nice and warm and salty with a dip of olive oil, sea salt and oregano - perfection! It's a nice opener for the rest of the carbs you'll be consuming here.  I've also had the insalata grande and it was nice and filling for a salad. Love the pine nuts and shaved Parmesan, so delicious and fresh.  The topper here, though, is the pizza. Using a precise method this pizza is cooked right. Nice burnt edges, crispy and gooey. I had to eat my quattro formaggi with a fork! So delicious. I dislike Gorgonzola immensely, but it was a really subtle flavor here, luckily (as I didn't notice it was one of the four cheeses).   I've also had the gelato and it was divine, the taste was comparable to the gallons I ate in Rome!  This place is close to my house so I have to cover my eyes when I see it or I'll eat here all the time!    The only, only thing I dislike about this place is that, while the employees are super nice and give great service, they have this REALLY annoying habit of correcting pronunciation. I, for one, think that's horrible customer service when it's so obvious what someone is trying to order. Correcting someone is just condescending to me. Change that one little, tiny thing and this place would be absolutely divine perfection!

3dcCvDlHGuKbBjyWeqxSGQ.text: I've been craving Italian pizza with a homemade thin crust and fresh mozzarella.... And the pizzas here totally satisfied my craving!   We ordered the Diavola (basil, garlic, red peppers, gooey fresh mozzarella, marinara sauce) and the Capricciosa (prosciutto, artichokes, olives, mushrooms, basil, mozzarella, marinara sauce). They were both soooo very delicious! the crust was perfect- thin, but still doughy and the end of the crust was crisp. And the ingredients were so fresh with that melted mozzarella on top and the marinara sauce had good flavor. I want to go back to try the others and the get the Nutella dessert pizza!

I was glad to see it was still around, and most importantly that the Pizza was still very good. This time I went for the Margherita DOC (Crushed Tomatoes, Fresh Buffalo Mozzarella, Basil, Parmigiano Reggiano, Extra Virgin Olive Oil), $13. yelp.com/biz_photos/sett... yelp.com/biz_photos/sett... The Better Half opted for the Settebello (Crushed Tomatoes, Pancetta, Wood Oven Sausage, Roasted Mushrooms, Toasted Pine Nuts, Mozzarella, Basil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil), $13.50. yelp.com/biz_photos/sett... yelp.com/biz_photos/sett... Our friend who joined us for dinner was also very impressed. Although he's lived in Vegas for over 15 yrs, he never had Settebello until now. He also had the Settebello and was blown away. Service was good. The server kept our Wine and Water glasses full. Return Factor - 92%

I was a little disappointed that they did not offer Ricotta Cheese on their pizza.   They were located on S Green Valley Parkway in Henderson, NV. Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Moscow Mule

rs2OZojN0JpTMm-X2kS3SA.text: On a last minute lunch date, I decided to join 4 other coworkers at Settebello.  One, because I heard the place is amazing and two, I haven't been here before, so of course, I jumped at the opportunity to create a review!    This restaurant is located within the East side of the District.  When you walk in you'll notice the high ceilings and exposed air ducts.  Makes it feel like an industrial warehouse and super modern.  There are brick facade wall coverings, large windows, dark wood chairs, granite looking table tops and the delightful smell of pizza dough fills the air.  I especially noticed the eclectic pictures of Italian artistry.  The place looks like a high end pizzeria!  I was excited.  The server had very little interaction with our table and didn't seem to like the fact that we wanted to split the checks at the end.  What I did like were the hosts and serving assistants.  They were super attentive and kept checking on our table to see if we needed water or boxes for our leftovers.  Certainly made up for the server's attitude.  For my meal, I got the one and only, Settebello Pizza for $13.50.  This pizza is packed!  Crushed tomatoes, pancetta, wood oven sausage, roasted mushrooms, toasted pine nuts, fresh mozzarella, basil, extra virgin olive oil.  WOW, I was loving it!  The crust was crispy on the outside and perfectly cooked on the inside.  There were blotches of melted mozz balls throughout the pizza.  Love mushrooms on my pizza and they did it up!  The pancetta was fatty and savory, the sausage chunks were huge and dispersed evenly.  I think the crushed tomatoes and basil combination made the pizza taste super homemade.  This pizza was on point and super delicious!  Highly recommended.  If you're in the area, you NEED to try this place out!  In fact, I'm going back next week on another lunch escapade.  I was pleasantly surprised and super thankful I came along.  Another great find here in Las Vegas in my books.  Thanks Settebello!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello pizza for $13.50.

KdY4akpZwc1rPRfPGG3Whw.text: Natalia was great.She is the restaurant manager and there was a problem with the ordering of the kids meals. We we're told the kids meals were drink, pizza and desert. When the waitress came back after we ate  she said sorry there is no more left for desert. She said sorry nothing we can do. But then Natalia came to the table and took care of the kids meals and said sorry for the inconvenience. I would of never gone back to there if it wasn't for Vanessa the waitress and natalia doing what they did and taking care of us. Food was awesome also.

SWUlfkjNYrIb0aIaq4jkbw.text: The hype is True! Its hard to stand out in the pizza crowd, but this place does it with ease. Like anyone else, I love pizza, but this place has something special. My favorite pizza hands down. If you haven't tried it...? More for me :)

Iy5r5y54G1_nhKO-iM_JCg.text: Hmm... I'm not quite sure what this is supposed to be, but I guess the closest comparison is to a piece of soggy bread. The tiramisu was good, but a restaurant shouldn't take pride in its desserts being better than its signature product.

N4L7rfIszqG0SNWQLOo4NA.text: I first tried this pizza joint in Salt Lake City and I feel in love. It is fresh and authentic. The employees at the henderson location are friendly and quick to serve. Each time I have been here, they have not been very busy. I have gotten the diavola pizza. It's a little a spicy with red peppers. So good! Otherwise I had a margharita pizza and it was classic and delicious. I highly recommend going here if you want some delicious and authentic Italian pizza cooked in a brick oven.

Q26_pSVEjhcSLeiBPkex2Q.text: Settebello opened their second location in Salt Lake City, Utah (my home town) a few years ago, and I always wanted to give it a try; unfortunately, I moved to Phoenix before I ever got the chance to partake of their brand of pizza.  Last weekend I was in Las Vegas (Henderson) at Green Valley Ranch for a convention, and one night as my friend and I were strolling around the area we stumbled upon Settebello.  I remembered hearing that the Settebello in Salt Lake was related to a Las Vegas shop, and after a quick look online, I confirmed that this was indeed the same company.  Needless to say, I had to satiate my curiosity and stop in for dinner.  We started with Focaccia, a simple flatbread (basically their pizza crust) lightly seasoned and served with olive oil.  For our entree we had a Pizze Bianca, a white Pizza with a few basic ingredients.  For dessert, pistachio gelato.  Considering the huge number of five star reviews of this place, I won't go into too much depth.  The general consensus that this place rocks is well founded.  The prices are reasonable, especially for the quality, the service is good (albeit a bit slow at times), and the atmosphere is relaxing and inviting.  Settebello's is amongst the best pizza I have ever had, and at it's relatively affordable price point, this place presents an appealing offer of affordable luxury and traditionally elegant pizza you can do quite regularly.  Yeah, it's not $5 hot-and-ready cheap, but as you may expect, this pizza is to Little Caesars what McDonalds is to a gourmet burger joint.  In closing, I'd like to mention what my absolute favorite things is about this place: the elegant simplicity.  Lots of restaurants these days that try to differentiate themselves as gourmet or as offering a high-end or unique dining experience do so by making highly convoluted, and often seemingly haphazard, dishes made up of a long list of vaguely fancy sounding ingredients, often without regard to how well those ingredients play together.  Pizzerias are not immune from this behavior.  Settebello takes the opposite approach.  Instead of throwing down dozens of high end ingredients and hoping you'll be impressed into thinking the whole you are getting is haute cuisine because all of the parts are expensive and fancy, Settebello understands that the whole can be, and often is, more than the sum of its parts.  The pizza at Settebello is not overly complex.  They have a simple, traditional crust, upon which they place a few reasonably simple, high quality ingredients.  You won't see a bunch of ingredients on their menu you're unfamiliar with, but that's a good thing here.  It makes their pizza approachable, as pizza really should be.  Pizza isn't exotic cuisine, it's food for everyone.  What sets their pizza apart is all in execution: attention to detail, starting with simple, but high quality ingredients, and knowing when enough is enough.  Try Settebello.  It's pizza that knows its place in the world, and fulfills its culinary role masterfully.

Liny6CQcjwldggk_QcONKQ.text: There was a lot of hype coming into this place for me. Their pizzas are brick oven and have a flaky crust. I enjoyed a beet salad for the first time and was also very impressed.  The best thing I had was the arugula wrapped in prosciutto. I definitely would get that again. Overall a great experience, however nobody will have my experience because I had a smoking hot date :)

8WYAXnEVMznRyqvALyiyJA.text: This pizza was very good!  Apparently most of the ingredients that they use are imported directly from Italy.  The crust was my favorite part and the pizza is very thin crust which is good because I try to keep it light on the carbs.  The server was fantastic.  He must have come around to check on us at least 8 times.  We sat on the new patio outside when the sun was going down and it was very cool.  All around great place!

HQeVBJu8RqimwRnEvyWmKQ.text: This place is delicious!!! We have yet to have a meal that disappoints.  Try the Vico - I usually add mushrooms! My wife will usually order the pizza of the day. The panzanella salad is a must, dressed in a super tangy lemon vinaigrette. All ingredients are fresh and top of the line. This place is a must try.

EtclZI9YG2a9vnVnFcj4QQ.text: The place was quite nice for a small little restaurant. I took the CEO of the company I work for as well as a field tech. It was nice, clean, not loud and obnoxious and the pizzas were delicious! I recommend the Beet salad, yum.

bZWHRhdO3ikpNGRz7UmN0w.text: GREAT PIZZA. The price was good for the size of pizza they brought out. I had never heard of egg on pizza before and was a little hesitant to try it, but it was delish. The place has good service. The pizzas came out within 10-15 minutes which was reasonable considering how good the pizza was. I'm definitely bringing my family the next time I come here.

mJYPD4lZXmlUC13ja6zMRw.text: Honestly the best pizza I've found in Vegas, and that's saying a lot. A little inconsistent sometimes ( the pizza can, on occasion, come out a little mushy) but! When it's served right it's the absolute best !!! You need to try this pie !!

1HZRsXIDD9ucOSi_sJC2Pw.text: I went here on a recommendation from friends, but when I found out the establishment is owned by Brad Otton, that was another reason to pay homage to this joint.  The guy was an awesome QB at USC who led the team to one of the most-satisfying victories I had ever witnessed: 'SC's 1996 win over Notre Dame at the LA Coliseum.  But I digress.  I'm giving this rating with one caveat, though: I think the restaurant's HVAC was too cool, and consequently, the pizza got cold before I could finish eating the damn thing.  Nevertheless, if this is what authentic Italian pizza is like, it compares favorably, in my opinion, with NY-style pizza.  I had the Pizza Lasagna.  Excellent.  My friends and I went on a Sunday for lunch, which I have to say was perfect because there was no wait.  I will definitely return on my next visit to Vegas, because there were other selections on the menu that really caught my eye.

gxxmoq110u8VdP_lGz1Nmw.text: Just ate here for the second time and I'm starting to wonder why I don't come here more often. Perhaps it's the location, it's pretty hidden in the backside of The District over by Whole Foods.  The pizzas are roughly the size of a dinner plate so you get a lot of food. This time around I tried the Del Cafore - Wood Oven Roasted Fennel Sausage, Roasted Peppers, Roasted Onions, Mozzarella, Basil, & Extra Virgin Olive Oil.  Keep in mind this pizza has NO tomato sauce and after eating it, I'm a big fan. The waitress asked me if I'd like to add tomato sauce to it. I'm like "Why don't I just slap an Italian person right in the face? I want it authentic!"  I said that in my best Italian accent... she was impressed.  A few of my friends have lived in Italy and they've said that this pizza is about as close to Italian pizza as Las Vegas gets.  The caprese is good too, but I really don't know how you could screw up caprese.

JeuwGHY3knsBKt3KegjqrQ.text: I met a group here so the choice was not mine.  The menu was a little pricey for what you received.  I ordered one of the pizzas.  The waiter prefaced that "everyone should really get their own as they are personal size and not big enough for sharing".  Um, my friend wanted salad anyway, so no one to share with me, but for sharing it was 2-3 people worth anyway.  Except that this was the worst, flimsiest pizza I have ever had.  The so-called crust was thin and soggy and then the crust was burned black on purpose, which was too much.  So I ate one piece and brought home the leftovers to my husband who will eat anything.  He looked at me and said, this is the worst pizza ever without me even saying anything to him.    I will say though, awesome, attentive waiter.  Our drinks were never empty.  That is all I can say positive about this place.  Not returning.

pkn50hKF9mXQfJ4gJoBOIQ.text: Let me start by saying I'm a vegetarian....but not tonight (don't judge me). Seriously the misto, the cheese, the pizza the service all absolutly stunning! It was a special night tonight and I wanted to try something new. Thanks to yelp I stumbled across settebelos. Being Italian and having a special nack for cooking it myself I'm always Leary when it comes to Italian restaurants but I gave it a try. When we walked in we were immediately greeted with a smile and a hello. We sat down, the server Justin was awesome. He explained the menu and we started with the misto. Incredibly tasty. The parm,  zucchini and the meats brought me right back to my Childhood. We went for the settebelo pizza and the Bianca pizza. I was born and raised in Vegas and let me just say we needed pizza like this. I havent left a Restaurant this happy in a long time. Thanks to the excellent ser vice and amazing food they have truly made a Special night memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Misto and double espresso

qTjJglEwf9dIPQyXz5Exkg.text: Pros:  Ingredients were fresh and delish.  Service is great.  Nutella pie was wonderful.  Cons: A bit pricey averaging $14 a pie. Crust is very very very thin, if you don't consume you're pie right away...it gets soggy.  I guess I'm too loyal to Grimaldi's Pizzaria.  Restaurant is a bit small.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella pizza with banana and almonds
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello pizza

Cv5Qvy1nbs8AMg5KCQmNjQ.text: Great use of fresh ingredients but not filling. My husband and I did find it tasty but still prefer some other pizza joints to this. It's one of those places that after your meal you talk about picking up a snack or more food on the road on the way home. The service we got was ok. We were rushed in and out

OQZq9pIA0rc2-kJ2uKCvSw.text: This place makes me smile! I can not wait to come back and try more! We went this Friday evening around 8pm and it was packed. Seated in a corner table, our server was very nice. To my left was a large party of Italian speaking adults. It was almost as if they set the ambiance for us. You could hear the older lady just going on and on. I do not know if they are affiliated with the business or not but it made our 4 star experience a 5 star!   We started with the caprese and an order of focaccia bread. You can tell a lot from a caprese because of the simplicity of this dish. The tomatoes were perfectly ripe, the mozzarella creamy and the olive oil just flavorful enough. I cracked some sea salt and pepper onto the top and was in heaven.   The focaccia was not the bread I am used to. It was wonderful, but I was looking forward to the thick chewy bread I love. My husband said this was more traditional and he devoured it.  We then ordered our first pizza. The Settebello because if you are going to name a dish after yourself it should be the best you have. And it was! The prosciutto was incredible. It makes my mouth water thinking about it! the small sliced sausage cooked to perfection. I even loved the tomato sauce. Just a very light sauce.  Our next pizza was the Bianca. This was my husbands favorite. It had fresh arugula draped over the top, not tomato sauce but creamy amazing cheese.  Then we had dessert. A lemon tart with the most amazing crust. It was thick and flaky and heavenly.   I can not wait to return with friends!

kgD2aclQMbhuj1g9cslAmg.text: When I crave for pizza, I Crave for Pizza!! At first, I was thinking delivery from one of the chain pizzas or a mom & pop spot in my  area. I wanted to try somewhere new and I didn't want Chicago or NY style pizza (not that I don't like these types).. I thought Sammy's woodfired, CPK.. but they served the usual americanized pies and I've been there and done that as well. So, after doing some research here on Yelp, I found this place and it was Exactly what I was looking for!  I ordered 2 PIzzas  1. Settebello: crushed tomatoes, pancetta, wood oven roasted fennel sausage, roasted mushrooms, toasted pine nuts, mozzarella, basil, extra virgin olive oil  - I had to order this since they named it after the restaurant! Besides, the toppings sounded more than satisfying. It was Absolutely Divine! Everything from the dough, sauce and toppings were of high quality and was created with such harmony! Pine nuts.. Yeah, they were a nice touch. The only thing is that most of the toppings were placed towards the center and one of the slices didn't have much cheese on it.  2. Carbonara: crushed tomatoes, pancetta, egg, fresh mozzarella, basil, parmegiano-reggiano, extra virgin olive oil  - I loved the simplicity of the toppings and the addition of an egg. Now, it may not sound like much was put into this pie but they didn't have to put much at all. Due to their superb ingredients/toppings, a little went a long way! I engulfed this 'individual' sized dish in record time!   Dessert:  Tiramisu: Silky smooth! One of the creamiest and masterly balanced flavors that was subtle yet soooo luscious!!   * Not only are Most of their ingredients imported from Italy, Even their Freakin' Oven is Italian!! You won't find a conveyor belt or deck oven here!   * Just a note, they do not have Pepperoni!  Authentic, Gourmet Pizza with High Standard ingredients and True Italian baking! This place was a Real Treat!! But the sametime not a place I would often go to fulfill my pizza cravings.. I won't be filled with 1 pizza alone as their toppings were lacking but not because they were cheap but because that's their style and thats the proper way of serving their type of pizza. Not to take anything away from this fabulous place but I may just be accustomed more towards the mainstream pies!

oy1faEbaJGgrZmjvHL3IaQ.text: Probably the best pizza I've had in Vegas.  Had the Crushed Tomatoes, Prosciutto Cotto, Artichoke Hearts, Roasted Mushrooms, Olives, Mozzarella, Basil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil (minus ham & cheese, so I had it vegan style).  True Italiano!

-GsEc4cZ4GzHgdmWVttFFA.text: We just went here for our first time this morning. The staff worked really smoothly together, and they were all really talented and cool. Everything was so fast. I can also officially say this is now our favorite pizza in Nevada. They have a very traditional, delicious, wood-fire pizza selection as well as other classics. We tried the meat and cheese plate, which was really generous and spectacular. I can't wait to back!

79YZL91PUEzw5Ir8iqCIVA.text: Went here on a Saturday afternoon with my wife. It's a quaint place but did not see a tv anywhere in the place even though Yelp says it has a tv. The only draft beer they have are like 3 Italian brews that are all 8 bucks each! Ouch! The menus looked like newspapers that have been bouncing around in the wind outside for the last month. We couldn't recognize any of the pizzas on the menu, so we don't know what we'd have been ordering. We ordered the caprese salad which was two slices of mozzarella cheese and tomato slices with some kind of garnish. We also couldn't identify any pasta dishes on the menu. Our server, Patrick, was very nice and friendly, and the decor is interesting, but I like to know what it is I'm ordering from a menu. The prices are also higher than two stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Caprese salad
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Did they find this menu floating around the sidewalk outside?

iLeMZRcK9jBoPoyC1FM9sg.text: After watching David Chang's show "Ugly Delicious" on Netflix. I was craving Lucali Pizza. Or anything of the sort. We usually go to Pizza Rock for a good pie but I've been meaning to hit up Settebello for years but never made it there. Finally. And regret-tingly. Why didn't we go there.   We had the salads which were full of flavor. But they filled the plate so much that it was falling off. I don't mind because I wipe down the table with germx anyway so I had a big table sized plate.   The Lunch special was spectacular. You can pick any pizza for 9 bucks. Wife had Marg DOC and I had the 4 Cheese.   The crust is up there with the best we've ever experienced. Not had. Experienced. Because that's what it was. An experience. Money can't buy that.   Panna cotta dessert was spot on but the "whatever the name is" dessert with a gelato choice covered in espresso and caramel was one of the better desserts I've had in the last few years.   Service was good enough to warrant a decent tip. She came just enough to not wonder where she was.   Will def be back. Make the dive and visit ASAP. Even if there's a line. Can't be longer than the 2 hour lucali wait.

Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. This salad for a gorilla

hR8GDUecWJs9baga6Xy6ZA.text: Came here because of the high ratings! I just moved to the area and I was trying to find a pizza joint. First they messed up my order and gave me mushrooms all over my pizza, so they had to remake it. They then gave me a new pizza and when I got home I noticed they then gave me the wrong pizza!!! I was in a hurry so I wasn't able to go back! I was mad because their pizza is pricey, I would been better off with little casears.

gneEUoigoZWrlvjbuXJiBw.text: If you have ever read my reviews, you know I have been fortunate to travel the US and Internationally, including Italy.  I eaten pizza in many of those places, especially Napoletana style.  This place is among the best of Napoletana pizza restaurants anywhere.    Now, if you are not used to this original style pizza, it will seem a bit "soggy" in the center, because of fresh tomatoes, authentic mozzarella and other ingredients.  You can't expect it to be NY, Chicago, St. Louis, or other American style pizzas - not that they are bad, but there is enough difference in crust, sauce, meats, and cheese to be noticed. Just realize that Settebello's pizza is "autentico", and is as good as any I've eaten on either side of the ocean.

trny933U2OKSHCISZO9YoQ.text: This place is deeeelicious. I grew up in Southern Italy and this is the only pizza place in town that meets my standards for good Italian pizza. Our server was Austin and he did an awesome job. Super attentive and on top of things. This is one of our favorite places in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Diavola

Bgh7F9mZ82nD-ThXnO2l1A.text: This is the best food in Henderson hands down. The hosts and servers work together so well . My glass is never empty and the food never disappoints. If I could give 100 stars I would.

O3KXGX2EhMLojqElLM1Jzg.text: Great place and great food. Staff was very friendly and accommodative. Kids loved it too. We had the meatballs, arugula salad and 2 pizza. All was simply awesome. Oh and the Panna Cotta was absolutely amazing too. The place gets busy so be prepared to wait a bit to be seated.

_5XjTHeuDXrPiBv0h9iubA.text: Authentic Neapolitan pizza? In the South-West desert?  You better believe it!  After suffering a 'string' of serious pizza-let downs in 'Sin City', I was determined to find some good pizza eats. I had to travel outside of Vegas to Henderson to find Settebello.  Worth the trip!

cN8lPQmqf4TCUwaCIP9vkQ.text: Wonderful pizza and happy hour they have prosciutto wrapped fontina. Those are also outstanding.

Nk1oIpFNgGFj9hHqPTutog.text: Probably the best pizza in Las Vegas and I'm pretty well traveled and love all pizza.     The service is always great (and even when it isn't the best someone always recognizes it and acknowledges it.)  I would always recommend this place and do take people who have never been here with me all the time.

yY2w0wY11bJHFZZ5o4_Eag.text: In my top 10 for North America.  Very good and unique pizzas and a very nice dining room.  Worth a try if you're in the area.

MFttnWKUcw-HZJ-TADGIaA.text: Came here for happy hour on a Monday! 5 dollar Moscow Mule?! Hell yeah! $5 mini margherita pizza? Eff yesss! Sat at the bar, and my order was taken within 5 minutes. I got my Mule 3 minuted later and my pizza came out in about 7 minutes! Delicious certified neopolitan pizza, delicious mules! I will indeed be back again for future happy hours!

a6Des4WrPLPDa3RY-OsYYA.text: The best pizza ever! I come here to cheat on my diet once every quarter.  It sucks that there is a running shoes store across the street where I see runners gathering to exercise.   But the pizza is so well worth it!   I don't care, because it's so yummy  Dr B with Desert Dental

abm4b7HcJcFpCAkRaioUAg.text: Love their pizza! We've been to Italy and this is the real thing. I always order the Margherita pizza, the dough is just perfect.

zS-6uUMtTu0EXDHWSeQZJA.text: Second visit- again food and service was excellent!!! I love the cozy atmosphere and the tiramisu is to die for! We ordered 4 different pizzas- all phenomenal! Caprese salad and sangria was wonderful!! Our server was friendly and made great suggestions.

MGqYWXDGyCsxS4WTsG8HRA.text: I am the 1000th review of Settebello here! Congrats! Best pizza in town, and best salads! I love coming here for a power lunch or a dinner with family. Get the Quattro Stagioni, it's off menu but my personal favorite! The Settebello and Bianca are great as well. For the salads I prefer either the arugula salad with Parmesan, or the goat cheese and beets, which I think they call "warm beets" Soooooooo good! Come and see for yourself

ogVHHxqudxBecWyxUQEwKQ.text: The absolute best pizza I have ever had! The dough, the fresh ingredients... Yum! So scrumptious! Incredible service. They are all super friendly and make you feel so comfortable and I just got a Togo order. The caprese salad was so fresh and the mozzarella was so creamy and soft. I loved it so much I got one of their T-shirt's that were so cool. I wish I lived closer because this would be my spot! When I come back to Vegas I am definitely making it a point to come here. Thank you to all of the staff for all of your friendly smiles and making me feel like home.

vy2aNBMhnOAfK0x8y4mmIg.text: Hands down the best authentic Italian pizza, no pineapple at this place. Excellent vegan options with a pizza and their amazing salads. It's a regular place on our dining list.

hfFlc3YAiFbEt43gih0QWQ.text: I really loved this place. So much in fact that I had wished we had went back the next day.  Highlight dishes for me: - Bolognese Pizza: Just like the spaghetti sauce, this was layered onto your pie. A few at my table had wished there was pasta on it, I thought I was just fine without. I wouldn't have complained if there was a little more of that delicious sauce on it though!  - Brisket Pizza: A delicious pizza topped with brisket and caramelized onions. Enough said. Each slice is a hearty one filled with tender meat and delicious cheese.  - Diavola Pizza: This had the perfect amount of heat with every bite. But be warned, those crushed peppers can sneak up on ya! I really liked the sliced Finnochiona on top as well.  - Beet Salad: This came with red and yellow beets with greens in the middle, topped with goat cheese and drizzled with balsamic. To be honest, I skipped the greens because I loved the beets so much.  - Scotch Tea: This might have been one of my favorite drinks... ever. I know that's a bold statement, but I loved everything about it. Scotch with hints of jasmine. It was smooth, slightly sweet and had me asking for a second before I even finished the first. I'd come back and travel many miles just for that drink!  Service was fantastic and they have plenty of space for larger parties. I'll for sure be making my way back here. I really enjoyed all aspects of the evening!

cohOTPcI1309xVqEQoh5tw.text: Best pizza in Vegas. Brick oven style with a perfectly crispy, thin crust. All the ingredients were fresh and the service was friendly and prompt.  Had the caprese salad before pizza and the only improvement would be a better balsamic could be offered. I will definitely be back anytime I'm in Vegas!

m3IntS8tXRtjSwyba-NRCg.text: I've eaten at other locations and fell in love with their food. I wanted to get together with some coworkers for happy hour but their bar is tiny so we wanted to sit in the restaurant.  When I called to give them a heads up that I wanted to bring a group of 15-20 the manager wanted to charge a 750 dollar minimum. We just wanted to get some pizza and wine. They said if we didn't hit the minimum I would be responsible for the remaining balance! It was a Wednesday and they weren't busy. Needless to say we went somewhere else! Ridiculous!

0lwvQpRFACkvSam-3EOYJQ.text: I had lunch at Settebello on my Vegas depature date(8/22/15) looking for a good meal relatively close to McCarran Airport.I was also conducting an experiment: Can you get anything close to the best of New York Pizza in the LV area? The answer is a resounding YES. It is a pleasant space with a bar and many selections of craft bear. I chose a Hennepin Ommegang. It was delicious and refreshing.My server, Justin, was friendly and helpful. He gave me a nice explanation of the menu. I chose the Settebello(picture is posted), generously topped with sausage, mushrooms and pine nuts. It was an exceptional pizza and reasonably priced at $14.00. Frankly, I liked it much better than the pizza I ate at Grimaldi's in Garden City, Long Island. Settebello is now on my "to do" list when I return to Vegas.

kUUa4ZSt4F0h4WU6rRUbGQ.text: Capricciosa and  settebello are my favorite! I dont feel fat even after finishing the whole thing! Lol! Involtini is yummy and their gelatos are refreshing! I do feel that the henderson location is better than summerlin.

02m8kZNJl9oTEMG8ZjZM5w.text: Well, we just stopped by again for our usual first lunch in Las Vegas, or should I say Henderson. Settebello has always treated  us well over the years. The quality of the pizza is consistent and always varied as they usually have some specials on offer. Today I ordered the vico, which comes with roasted fennel, sausage, red onions, mascarpone, mozzarella, basil and olio. Not you're traditional American pie at all, but flavorful and delicious.  The wife chose the margherita DOC, which comes with the real deal mozzarella di bufala. Again her pizza was delicious with just the perfect chewy crust and balanced with the light tomato sauce. I was all caffeined out, but the wife got an espresso. Their coffee and espresso is also the real deal, if you need a pick me up.  The service is usually great, but it can get hectic if they are slammed. Usually the pizza comes out quick due to the thousand degree wood oven, so they are pretty efficient. Like I said, Settebello is a pretty standard place to visit whenever we are in Las Vegas, so we will be back again and again.

DYA0YjK4Q59YsK6U4f-6kQ.text: Loved the taste of the pizza. I'm a huge fan of thin crust, and they do the thin crust very well! The pizzas are a good size for one, if you're really hungry. Or perfect for two if you also share a salad! We had a merlot which was also very good, and went very well with our meal. The service was excellent as well, our waiter was very polite and gladly explained the menu and gave us good recommendations. Would come here again for sure.

1-L5M-UmBD9toG0NiYqRjQ.text: The food here was amazing, especially the Nutella pizza! The pizza is different than American so you have to expect that it's crispier toward the edges and softer toward the inner core. The Diavola was great! I loved the spicy salami that was on it and all that cheese! Mmmmm :) I loved the rucola salad and added shaved Parmesan to it which completed it.   The atmosphere was great and service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella pizza :)

cVZ-OZpDEiDVuNfJt-Bmvw.text: The best pizza in the United States.   Maybe the world.   Quirky service though,  (Millennial's ) you know what I mean.

3bxql5oO5wbdi6lT0XrD_g.text: True Napolitan pizza with great taste, chew and fair pricing.  We started our dinner with the Romano salad which was dressed nicely and tasted great!  One order was enough for 4 adults to share.  We then had 3 pizzas (Margherita, Settebello, and Bianco).  All were delicious having their own individual tastes.  The crust/dough was consistent and tasty on their own!  This will definitely be a place we plan to visit when we are in LA!

yoF-zikFOlIRGtOPkCMBlg.text: I've been here several times and this restaurant has never failed to deliver. Great food and wine. A must try for anyone looking for a great dining experience.

SSUA8Xa35BIYpEun9Er_bQ.text: It's always worth the trip to visit Henderson" for a taste of the authentic Neapolitan Pizza!!  Settebello never ceases to amaze me on their creativity. The last pizza I ate was a Chorizo, potato, grilled onions, and mozzarella pizza it sounds crazy but it tasted delicious.  The desserts are pretty good here too, after dinner I find myself drinking mocha latte and enjoying the Strawberry Panna Cotta, it's simply devine.  The staff are always nice, including when it gets busy which is awesome!!  Overall just a great place to go when your hungry!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Chorizo Pizza w/egg, Potato, Olio, mozzarella, basil and onion.

f2Xx5GWAMDlqj5hw9JRmjg.text: Good: Hostess was nice, pizza came out fast, good flavors  Bad:  Consistency: clearly I'm in the minority here in my opinion of this place but I don't like my pizza soggy. I've enjoyed some thin crust that I have to fold but this shit is ridiculous. It was a race to get the damn thing to my mouth before it all fell off. (The pizza won btw)  Quality: I ordered panchetta on my Diavlo and they gave me fatty slices of American bacon. I'm not an idiot, I know the difference between panchetta and regular cut bacon. If you're out just say so and give me my $2.50 back.  Cost: After tipping the hostess who took my order + the extra for the "panbacon" I spent $20 bucks for 4 slices of mush.   I am open to trying their salads but I will never order a pizza from them again or recommend them to anyone.

GJOya36z24IzvIj_X3l6FQ.text: The food here is good...our pizza was good but I really loved the vanilla ice cream it tastes home made

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

XHZjzx6E70sEmfKTi85wsQ.text: We are new to the area, and have heard from multiple services this is THE place for pizza in Henderson. We were not disappointed.  My father was in F&B his whole life.  He always said, "The best restaurants specialize in two/three dishes and that is what they do."  So we walk in, read the menu, and it is cocktails/beer/wine...pizza...and salads.  Taa daaa.    The ambiance is excellent, the lighting perfect and the vibe is great.  Service is very good.  We ordered a salad, drinks, wine and a salad. Nothing disappointed.  Margarita DOC was just like you would have in Napoli, Italia.  Very good, actually excellent.  The salad was wonderful, too.  Wine list is very good, by the glass, and very, very reasonable in pricing.    The only "OK," and not excellent dish was dessert.  We ordered Torta de la Nona, which is one of my favorite things to order on the sweet side in Italy.  It was good, but not excellent.  It just wasn't "lemony" enough.  But the Lavazza espresso was excellent.  Again, great menu, great food, excellent flavors and wonderful service.    I'll be back -- again, and again.  UPDATE:  We were there again this weekend. Fabulous, again. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The right Italian flour, the perfect pizza.

Am1Z_jKAbusrkHv5xizdaA.text: I'm Italian and I rarely eat Italian food out but this pizza is the best I have ever had.  It reminds me of the pizza I have eaten in Naples Italy.  They maybe char it a bit too much but that is definitely part of the authenticity.  The quality of all their ingredients is top notch.  Very impressive for such a little town.
