8EGDxbmj1RKhWEKF9l9xWQ.text: k listen the jalepeno pear jam pizza was the best pizza i have ever had and i have been to italy people. changed. my  life. better than any other there!

Rsxm1UNMm2vABe6QJ1CGfg.text: "peet-suh" / "peetsa" / "peedtza" / "pittsa"  However you say it, this is one of the best of its kind throughout the valley!!  Situated at The District in Green Valley Ranch, this location is quite big with plenty of seating either the inside dining room or the outdoor patio that can accommodate even a fairly large group.  There's also a nice bar setup with flat screen TVs, making the restaurant a great place to watch any sporting event.  Being Napoletana, the pizza is cooked for about a minute in a wood-burning oven.  This isn't your typical NY style pizza where it can be picked up and folded in half.  Instead, the use of cutleries is advised while eating this pizza since the crust is thin and soft which doesn't hold up especially if you stock up on toppings.  Out of multiple visits, everything I've had from this place so far has been really good.  I usually like to start with Panzanella or Involtini di Prosciutto.  As far as their pizzas, I prefer the ones with crushed tomatoes: classic Margherita (mozzarella, basil, Parmigiano Regiano), the Carbonara (pancetta, egg, mozzarella) and the Settebello (pancetta, wood oven sausage, roasted mushrooms, toasted pine nuts, mozzarella, basil).  Fresh ingredients, bold flavors and great topping combinations.  I normally have the 12 inch pizza to myself which doesn't leave any room for dessert.  If you can, however, go for their dessert pizza (sliced bananas, drizzle of Nutella and dusted with powdered sugar).  Overall, Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana is definitely one of the best pizza joints in Las Vegas.  Delicious food, pleasant ambiance and excellent service.  I will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello

L-j8IYfXEv7013CL1Mbiqw.text: I give this place a four for the food. There were four of us arriving around 5:30 on a Friday. It was a little busy but got right in and seated. Had salad and pasta dish. Both were very good. Had a few drinks during happy hour. Service was good, well, up until we were asked to move to the bar because they needed the table. Relaxing/eating/enjoying a couple cocktails for about 90 minutes. Guess that was too long...hmm! Never had that happen before. Actually we were quite shocked. We just said we were leaving and did just that. Definitely will not be back.

5kr_v5va7hbQ6WcIOLlOWg.text: Love the pizza here! The most authentic I've found outside of Italy. Some people are thrown off by how "wet" it is, but I think it's great.

fDgXPDtsNQk9W6TRyt7pEg.text: This place is my go to when I'm craving pizza! They have awesome happy hour deals and their cocktails are AMAZING. Never disappoint. When we go we normally get a couple of the meat and cheese platters for the table (they do have a happy hour deal for $5 that gives you a good selection and just enough for 2) we also always get the buffalo mozzarella and jalapeno pear marmalade for the side - so worth the extra $$ - SO DELICIOUS. When it comes to pizza though we never get the same thing twice because everything is so good! They have unique toppings that just work. Everything down to the focaccia bread at this place is to die for!  The only thing I could even try to say negative is sometimes they run out of their infused oil :( its so good!!! I normally dip the pizza crust and focaccia in it!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Delicious pizza and cocktails !

qU1hQvjaWHFdU0wZSd8iTw.text: YUMMY!  You can taste the difference from the ordinary Pizza. I am in love with the Pannacotta

sx80RNrtKi_5G3J6Yxa8jA.text: My favorite pizza in Las Vegas. I usually go with the marinara (no cheese) or margharita. Simple. Classic. Delicious. They in insalata grande is perfect to split for 3-4 ppl and they make a yummy limoncello shot. If you're there in the summer, the patio is nice before it gets hotter than hades.

i3GHfcoJq7Joh7ZGyRt5yg.text: Got the Margarita with prosciutto added and the Settebello. Both were delicious. Dough is perfect in crunchiness and chewiness.   Ordered for take out, they said 15 mins wait time but it was a lot quicker.   I'll be back. My new go-to pizza place in Henderson.

cN_Bui4pXq1XvQbJJamVKw.text: This place is amongst the best pizza joints in the Las Vegas area.  If you're looking for authentic Neapolitan style pizza, this place really can't be beat.  Perhaps the most remarkable aspect of their pizza is the mozzarella cheese -- it is unbelievably fresh.  To demonstrate this point, I suggest you order the caprese salad, which includes freshly sliced rounds of their buffalo mozzarella.  The cheese simply melts as you place it on your tongue - soft, creamy and rich.   I have yet to find better cheese anywhere else.  I was in Venice, Italy on vacation about a year ago and, while I searched the city for a pizzeria that could rival the flavor and quality of Settebello, I was completely unable to find any serious competitors.  It's the truth, Settebello's pizza is actually better than any pizza that I found in Venice.

HNWykHcfA5xMvf_cL3alJA.text: Always order the special. The flavors have always been harmonious. The coolest special I ever had included thin lemon slices cooked in and I always think about that pizza. Another time I had a special drizzled in truffle oil, so great. The service has gotten better the few times I've been back. This is a great place to bring non-adventurous eaters because they think it's just pizza. Little do they know they are actually eating something cool, thin crust, no slices, individual pizzas with real flavor. Settebello is not an everyday pizza joint. Come here for semi-casual occasion like taking your parents on a lunch date.

rxlTeUhjoL8NkqargReanA.text: This place has the best pizza! It reminds me of real Italian pizza. Happy Hour specials are good also!

c5OiDbQmus3yDc5XzuUcxQ.text: Was watching the Food Network on Friday and was craving pizza!  Went to Yelp! and found this place.  Why did it take me so long to check this place out?  Who knows but I'll definitely be back!    Had their special:  Settebello (Crushed tomatoes, pancetta, wood over roasted fennel sausage, roasted mushrooms, mozzarella, basil and what I thought was a nice touch... the toasted pine nuts!)  Yum!    We also ordered Del Cafone (Wood oven sausage, roasted peppers, roasted onions, mozzarella, and basil) -- this pizza has no tomato sauce which I personally like because I can actually taste the flavors of all the ingredients.  Sometimes the tomato sauce can over-power the taste of the roasted peppers & onions.   Our server, Joey, was very attentive and he's a GREAT singer too!  :-)

AUzdf2ojbbvDLKXpBDX8NQ.text: I've eaten pizza all over this country and have had some great pies and some really lousy ones too (yes you can have both bad sex and bad pizza). The pizza here is perhaps the best I've experienced ANYWHERE... If you love pizza, be sure to give this place a try it will make your top 5 pizzas list guaranteed...

f8WheqE9jkwyEHDtsfaX5g.text: Lived in Rome, Italy for 3 years, traveled extensively throughout Italy. This is the best place for Italian food that I have eaten in the U.S. Most places only resemble Italian food. There is also a location in Vegas. Highly recommend . Some great deals are offered during happy hour.

g025Rw0xs1MRcj4fF04sUA.text: Overall:  Good quality pizzas, especially if you're looking for authentic Italian (not NY) pizza.  Pizza dough is cooked well and tastes good, and the sauce, although light, is full of flavor.  Because of a good pizza foundation, any toppings would be a fine complement to the pizza.  If you're expecting a heavy pizza like Pizza Hut, don't go here.  Go to Metro Pizza or Grimaldi's.  Setting: Early Dinner w/ brother on Saturday, 05/28/2011  Thumbs Up: Misto appetizer (Italian meat sampler), Margherita con (pick your toppings - we got artichoke hearts and roasted mushrooms), Capricciosa pizza (if you've never had prosciutto on your pizza, you're missing out).

xrb5Mpx_vVUHM8q_5GpnDw.text: Fantastic!!! Loved our meals! Cant wait to go back!!!!! Cant beleive we didnt try this place sooner! Yummmmmmmm  As a vegetarian i ordered... the margarita pizza which was AMAZING and the Salad with pine nuts was DELISHHHHHHH!!!!!

QLV4eh1JVNhQYX6Xbii8_w.text: My search for good pizza continues...  When I first came across Settebello's reviews on yelp, I imagined a quaint Italian bistro, sitting in front of a wood fired oven.   We walked in, and I was disappointed at how commercial it looked. But getting to the food-the most important part, I didn't think it was worthy of 4 stars. Something about my sauce dripping off of my paper thin crust didn't appeal to me.  I've tried many different types of pizzas and this wasn't the hearty cheese+topping rich pie that I like. I shared a pizza with my fiance who shares my passion for pizza, and he agreed. We left feeling hungry.  On a brighter note, the ingredients although few were fresh.  Also, the tiramisu was delicious. Not too heavy or sweet.  Last but not least the prices were very affordable.

6_qPIHqrxK9lJaoVMzyueQ.text: Really good wood-fired pizza, competes with Pizzeria Bianco (compared within the same week). But go for the Settebello, it's their best option (we ordered 4 different pies and all agreed this was their best).

Gzww1rL3f6Kz0fwfWNJKqA.text: I have been on a quest to find great Pizza, unfortunately this is not.  I gave it one stars because it did have flavor but the crust is chewy and it reminded me of pita bread Not good. You can't pick a slice up with your hands. If you like Napoletana pizza this might be ok although I have never been to Naples.  I haven't been to the Henderson location but I didn't think it will be much better if the recipe is the same.  Everyone has an opinion and we all have our own taste.  The reviews that were 5 stars I can't for the life of me understand why unless they don't know great pizza.  Chicago and New York have great pizza and I will continue to search. ( Check this one off the list)

u4qkR8H-a03FWHrnz0xpPA.text: Wow, I have never been served so much carbon in my life! It is hard enough trying to get my kids to eat "traditional" pizza due to issues related to greasy cheese, runny sauce, etc. Mind you, I have spent some time in Italy (Florence, Milan) and am ready for a more traditional pie. However, the pizza we were served was inedible. The top was charred as if recently rescued from a burning building. The cooks must not clean their oven after each order, because the bottom of my pie was also burned with little bits of burned who-knows-what embedded into the crust. Let's talk sauce for a minute. A good pizza sauce will thicken while cooking (especially when burned to a blackened Frisbee). Amazingly, the sauce was so watery that it still ran in rivulets over each slice, thereby making each bite a soggy, carbony, yuck fest.

sJVsLXPnJcjW276aZxqD_A.text: Ever since arriving in Vegas from Australia I've been a big pizza complainer.  You see, I don't like New York Style pizza which I find too oily and soggy and I don't like Chicago Style pizza which I find too wet and saucy and not really what I even consider a pizza.  Now that i have alienated 95% of US pizza lovers, on with the review.  Today while craving pizza I did a little research in the hope of discovering some pizza around town that was neither of these two personally despised styles. I found Settebello on Yelp, liked the look of the photos and the reviews and the wife and I headed there for an early 11AM pizza.  I ordered the Diavola and wife had a custom built pizza with mushrooms and pine nuts.  The service at the restaurant was great, drinks were promptly refilled and the pizzas arrived fairly quickly.  I enjoyed my pizza, it tasted good and the ingredients were clearly of very high quality. I loved the peppered salami on mine. The only drawback was I found the pizzas became very difficult to eat and the middle sections became a bit soggier than I like. I look for a dense, slightly chewy crust about 2/3s of an inch thick and this was very thin in the middle. I think id be awarding this six stars if the crusts were about twice as thick as they are now.  Of course, despite the fact that I really enjoyed my meal here, this doesn't solve my pizza problem. Pizza is a food I want to grab on the way home to graze upon for the remainder of the evening in front of the TV or computer and this is most definitely not that sort of pizza.  In short - not what I was really looking for, but a high quality pizza restaurant for a sit down meal, not 100% to my personal tastes but probably the best tasting pizza I have eaten in Vegas. That's not saying much, but it's still a thumbs up overall.

4nD4tTjCS02u_uSq1sGLHQ.text: Great little place tucked away in Whole Foods shopping center. You have to love Naples style pizza to really dig them. Middle of the road on price and great service the night we went.   Classy place that definitely deserves a visit!

Ii75EPbzYKaCeFQanW3Pyg.text: I planned on staying away from pizza in Vegas, but Settebello made me very glad I changed my mind.     The prosciutto with the appetizer was great, not overly salty or tough. The pizzas were very tasty with a thin crust that was crispy but soft inside, even topping distribution, and fresh tasting sauce. The beer offerings were a pleasant surprise, with several imported Italian micro-brews. Our waitress was pleasant and attentive.

iYkvbJyTCN8qwOLj1QPb-Q.text: Great Neopolitan Pizza, Brings back memories of my youth in Naples in the 60's. It even had a sign with the street were I lived on the wall. I had the Margarita Pizza, the classic Neopolitan pie. It was perfecto.

kxrh1cN7x19F3H94IH_GfA.text: Great authentic Italian style pizza. Crispy super thin crust with very fresh ingredients.  This isn't New York style, Chicago style or generic American pizza, this is pizza napoletana which is different.  Just realize what your getting. I recommend the Capricciosa pizza which has crushed tomatoes, Prosciutto , Artichoke Hearts, Roasted Mushrooms, Olives, Mozzarella, Basil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil.

6LxYdaaqsmDRi-2GqejiAA.text: This place actually just moved and is worth the trip: yelp.com/biz/settebello-...

OEraMbOdbt1_y6NrfNuBYQ.text: The best pizza in Las Vegas, if not the entire west coast. If you are a fan of real pizza, then you will love Settebello's. I've been to the best places in NYC like Grimaldi's, Lombardi's, Patsy's etc. and Settebello is better than all of those places.  The crust is perfect, the tomato sauce is amazing. Really good pizza's.  There's not much else to say, I love this place.

K7SmuWv44vI6ZJgJ2dVfYQ.text: I was pumped about finding  Settebello and getting to eat there after reading the Las Vegas Weekly's year in awards and this placed finished in front of my favorite, Metro Pizza. To me, there was mininal amount on my pizza and was not a tasty as at least 3 other establishments (Metro, Home Plate, and even Roadrunner's chains of establishments seemed to outclass Settbello. Maybe it was an off night but I think I will stick with Metro and Home Plate before shelling out money for an overpriced product.

o0ycbINoL4BMBEw_H8CPxA.text: Not sure what the rave is about here.  2 personal pizza's with a salad and tap water - $57.    If you are not from NY or NJ then you will probably give this place good reviews.  On our particular night - the pizza had no flavor.

GY73K_5LngKL5Z3EYBvvnA.text: If you've never had Neapolitan pizza, then this is definitely worth a try.  This is not New York / Chicago / American pizza. This is Neapolitan pizza, so come expecting that. If you like Neapolitan pizza, then this is definitely the best place is vegas for it.  Personally this style isn't of pizza isn't for me. I don't like basil leaves baked into my pizza, or clumps cheese.   If you want a less hardcore authentic Neapolitan pizza check out Patsy Grimaldi's. Or if you just want something wood-fired I'd recommend Due Pizzeria.

OaroFm906_rfzL4GnItDdA.text: Everything has already been said, don't want to bore anyone with all compliments that come to my mind, but I'll say this: we come here at least two-three times a week from Summerlin. We brought 5 sets of friends, everyone loved it too, many of which are from the East coast.  For visitors with kids: there is a great Carousel right around the corner. Our kid can't wait to get there right after we are done with pizza.

KAF-Ju6yTkvTp5kBuzPQ6w.text: Excellent food, great service. Simple menu of pizza and salad. Wonderful.

04A2r3LmoFO3RtLcvMbXnA.text: This is the best pizza in town and anyone who says otherwise just doesn't know pizza.  I've had many pizzas in some of the best pizza cities in America (chicago and NY), and I've had pizzas from around Naples, so I know my pizza well.  I am also a chef who loves to find good pizza.  And this pizza is the most authentic pizza in Las Vegas if you're looking for Napoleon style pizza.   The ingredients are all imported from italy, and they even had the oven built by a company from Naples.  You can definitely tell the effort they put into it.  The crust is thin, but flavorful.  The sauce has a great balance of tomato flavor and beautiful acidity, perfect as a backdrop for the fresh ingredients.  Even the sausages and hams are imported from Italy, so you will be getting great toppings too.  The cheese melts perfectly, and is the perfect finish to the pizza.   If you ACTUALLY like Italian pizza (unlike all the people that don't like this place), then you will love Settebello!  Try their Happy Hour too.  2 for 1 drinks, and cheap appetizers.  The fried calzone on the happy hour menu is amazing!

uQiBWj3yf1S7cs48vTwFCA.text: My husband and I drove 22 miles across town to check this place out, after reading all the glowing reviews here on Yelp.  We started with the misto appetizer, which consists of slices of very fresh and excellent Italian coldcuts (salami, proscuitto, mortadella) , cheese, olives, mushrooms and foccacia bread.   It was really good.  Next, husband ordered the capricciosa and I ordered the settebello pizza.  We've been to Napoli so we knew what a Napoletana pizza should taste like (and this is what Settebello promises to deliver).  The pizza here was very good - correct thin flexible crust with a few blackened spots, foldable as it should be.  The toppings were much better than at the majority of pizzarias here in town (especially flavorful was the sausage on my pie).  But did this blow us away?  Sadly not.    That's why I'm giving it only four stars.  However, we ended the meal with the tiramisu, and that was one of the best  I have ever had anywhere!   Another point in their favor were the prices - the most expensive pizza was only $13.50.   In sum, it was a close and very good try, and we would go back again.  But we're still waiting for that blow your socks off pizza moment here in Vegas.

k0Jqs2HHqR9J5Wqc2JlVnQ.text: I absolutely love this restaurant! My favorite pizza here is the Settebello. I take all my visiting friends here and have them order the settebellow pizza. It's amazing! I absolutely love it!! highly recommended!

L4zJZr4Osm3uiuwQ8jw5JA.text: Their website claimed they have a special oven and flour and tomatoes from Italy, so I figured this should be an authentic place for pizza. Husband said this is very authentic compared to the ones in Italy. I never went to Italy but this tastes different than all the pizzas I've ever tried. The crust is definately thin and yummy. We ordered the Settebello pizza, insalata grande and tiramisu. The tiramisu is a must try, they claim it's made in-house. Overall, it was a very satisfying meal. And another plus for me since this was another "new" spot I took Husband to during our Vegas trip a few weeks back!

JFlflOA1zxJAYN2wM6u-Eg.text: Best pizza in town... I have been eating there once a month for a few years now , and i will never get tired of it .

IEKGeg7AG5lXZuleCUM8Fw.text: If you are looking for an authentic Naples style pizza, this is the place for you.  I have been a customer since they were on Horizon Ridge Pkwy and have taken all my friends and house guests to Settebello.   The high quality ingredients are amazing and the service is outstanding.  My favorite items are the house salad, the foccacia, and the pizza lasagna.  Fabulous!

IbgmD_wwQTxRU9yBWL0sDQ.text: we've made it a point to try the 5 star reviewed restaurants around.  this place definitely didn't disappoint!  what sold it for me was the crust/dough.  delicious!!  amazing pizza. definitely worth a try.  i got the diavalo and it was awesome.  we also got the insalato and that was tasty.

9QGN5hbAQRmCyY7q8PddGQ.text: i dig this place.  i love just tearing up the pizza like they do in italy.  the pizza was great...not at all greasy.  the servers are quick with the refills too.    i went there with a friend and the atmosphere seemed kind of dead though.  it's nice and clean...but i feel like they need to liven it up a bit.

Ez5zGUtUZMzNi2HgarE_ng.text: doesn't matter i what i order, i'm always happy!!!!!!! sooo good!!! i live on the other side and i dont care the drive!!!!

0CQjwoXpaYcdbGLkk9SHLw.text: Absolutely the best authentic Neopolitan-style pizza outside of Napoli! Thin crust baked in a wood-burning oven, fresh toppings.  Don't go here if your idea of an ideal pizza is Domino's or Pizza Hut -- unless you want to experience the real thing.  Great salads, Italian micro-brews and gelato, attentive service.

UFlLC8O3I6A3cguD7vakSQ.text: good pizza! happy hour m-f 3-5 2 for 1 drinks and $5 mini pizza's, haven't tried it yet but will do in the future!

aBulGmiW9k4QXfixFs8TQg.text: The best pizza I've had in the Continental USA. I lived in San Giuseppe Vesuviano, in province of Naples, Italy for 8 years, and I should know what I'm talking about. The True - only - pizza is the Margarita Pizza. In fact there is a place in Mergellina, Napoli, called "Da Michele", and that's all they serve (no pepperoni....) (the best pizza in Napoli). Let this be a pretext to my simple but effective review. Settebello's Margarita is subliminal, nostalgic. The crispness of the crust is unique, the texture of the San Marzano imported tomatoes is unnerving. The mozzarella is adequate (being imported it loses a little texture). The atmosphere is very suttle and reprises what you'd expect in Napoli (simple settings and not much else). Carmine, the owner, is from Castellamare, Napoli. And the thing I liked the most was the affordable pricing (10 bucks for an individual pizza). Buon Appetito!

JcFYu83-T-70tjq5CxtWkQ.text: This place is amazing!!!  I lived in Italy for a few years and I know my pizza.  If you're in Vegas and you want pizza that is exactly like pizza you get in Italy, then you have to go here.  They have been allowed by the EU's business licensing as Pizza Vera Napoletana, which you need to use all of the ingredients and True pizza tastes straight from Naples.  I started with the 'Insalata Grande' and then I had the Carbonara and I couldn't have been more happy.  Best meal I've had in a year, easily, and it didn't cost me an arm and a leg (like I spent the night before at Ago's at the Hard Rock).  The young American man, form Utah, that started this place has done an amazing job.  Every little detail, from the glasses to the way the utensils are wrapped in a napkin and paper ring, make you feel like you just walked into an Osteria in Naples or Rome.  Give this place your business if you're in Vegas, and you will walk away saving some cash to gamble with and a fulfilled appetite!!!

mjrRTnOnU2u_82w_cQve-g.text: great service, reasonable prices, i'm not a big fan of their style of pizza but my husband is...but i'm not typically a big fan of salads, however they have one of three i have ever had that i absolutely love. so both my husband and i love to go there, i can eat healthy and love it and he can have his pie and eat it to :)

kf7YnMTtxxr8eIuKD--EZQ.text: Finally a place that my daughter and I both love to eat at.... My girl is 12yrs old and her diet consists of Pizza, Chicken Tenders, Fries and Pasta with white sauce. So because I am trying to eat healthy, those dishes do not say much for HEALTHY!!!  I love sushi  and sushi makes her wanna barf (-her words, not mine). Anyways, back to Settebello - we love it. The pizza just has to be a whole lot healthier than other pizzas, I don't know that for a fact but I totally feel it- call it women's intuition (Women are never wrong!!!)  Appetizers- Focaccia - Warm pizza dough topped with sea salt,oregano & Olive oil  Ruccola Salad-Arugola, Lemon, Olive oil, fresh ground pepper & Sea Salt I had the Marinara Pizza- Crushed Tomatoes,Olive Oil, Garlic & Oregano -NO CHEESE - My Daughter had the Margherita Pizza- Crushed Tomatoes, Oilve oil, Garlic, Mozzarella - WE ASKED FOR NO BASIL AND ADDED EXTRA CHEESE- Dessert- TOO FULL  but next time we did plan on trying the Nutella Pizza that is topped with of course - Nutella, Whipped Cream, bananas and almonds. Sounds Glorious....... I love that every ingredient is simple and minimal but still so flavorful and satisfying. I will take pizza from Settebello over any other pizza hands down. Finally I can enjoy pizza without feeling like I am clogging my arties because of all the fat that pizza is known for.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Interior of Settebello Pizzeria
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Marinara Pizza- This pizza has no cheese but I didn&#39;t even miss it....Sorry cheese
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Ruccola Salad- Looks plain but ohh so flavorful!!!

X9o2KnezXp-QgfCSoKTW0g.text: Truly authentic!! I've been to Italy several times and fell in love with "REAL" pizza. Settebello is like being in Italy without taking the plane ride. The ingredients are so fresh!  I would recommend everyone try this stlye of pizza, you will not regret it!!

NGxxjcTJJiIs23m83BvwEA.text: This is no pizza hut or papa john's type pizza. It's thin, has unique toppings and is very traditional italian pizza. I LOVE every type I've had (I've had most of the menu). I'll definitely be coming back soon! Don't forget to grab some of their house made gelato. We had cookies and creme once and it was to die for!

SjmJR6FCeSHccVmC3OmMrQ.text: We initially had a bit of confusion during seating due to their happy hour policies. After a few moments of irritation, we were able to secure the same price for our beverages while seated in a booth (they normally require you sit at the bar, but one of our party was under age).   Our waiter recommended that we try their insolata appetizer, which was prosciutto wrapped around arugula with goat & other cheeses, olive oil and balsamic reduction. It was a delicious, light start.   We ordered two pizzas; the cappricioso (spelling?) and the special of the week, which was a white pizza with cannelini beans sauteed with salami. Both were satisfying and flavorful on a super-thin crust. My boyfriend found the special pizza to be rather bland and didn't finish his piece, neither did our friend. The other pizza had big hunks of kalamata olives that provided a strong briny flavor that complimented the pizza well. It also looked like they use a real wood-fire oven to cook their pizzas.   Their tiramisu was creamy with a good balance between sweet, bitter espresso and creamy cheeses. The lady finger bunny ears on top were a cute touch but they weren't very crisp.   I had sampled some of my boyfriend's left over slices the day before and declared the pizza to be crave worthy which was one of the primary reasons we ventured here. One of his friends had proclaimed it the best pizza in Vegas, which I doubt. It's tasty, yes, but a True pizza master could craft better. If we're back on this side of town we'll probably come back given my boyfriend's insatiable love of pizza. We'll  be sure to try lots of other places, though, before we can call this the absolute best.

udKsupj2XorzRRh10c8Dww.text: Although I am teetering between a three and a four star review, I need to try it again in a few different circumstances to rate it higher. A friend and I came here to catch up over their happy hour from 3pm-6pm. Settebello offers 2-1 well drinks and non-craft beers and four different menu items. We got a mini margherita pizza and the piatto misto (both $5). The magherita was not to go nuts over. It was luke warm and the juice from the tomato made everything slide right off. The marinaded veggies with pizza crust cut up into pita chips was a light snack with much flavor. We also got the Insalata Grande, not on the HH list. It needed to be doctored up with more balsamic, but I enjoyed it. The pine nuts, fresh slivers of parm, tomatoes, olives, and mixed greens was plated in a generous portion. We finished with a Nutella Pizza, also not on their HH specials. It is best with fresh strawberries. In total, four dishes and two Anchor Steams, our bill came out to $33. It was an adequate amount of food, but my friend says that the food is better when you are not sitting at the bar.   Adrian, our bartender/server, was attentive and checked in often enough without disturbing us. I want to come back and sit in the restaurant to see how the food differs. Right now, I cannot agree that it is the best pizza I have come across.

ldg1UVqyLTtepN0S9Szskg.text: This is probably the best pizza I've had since moving to Nevada. It's pretty unique but the ingredients are very fresh and despite it being about a 25 minute drive, I'll be going there quite a bit in the future. The Ceprese appetizer was delicious as well.

Gd-8wkqCXPc2TC2SQ7m7Tw.text: One of the best places in town for a proper pizza. Service is casual and friendly. though the wine list is neglected, they could offer much better wines at the same price point. Hope to see some changes in this area.

6CBj6MN4wF1e9Ds6wXCmSA.text: Although this place gets a little cramped during peak dinner times- the food makes up for it.  Never have I had such delicious flavors in PIZZA.  Light crust, melted cheese, the most amazingly flavorful olives I've ever had...etc.  Delicious.  The drinks are a little pricey and menus could be more descriptive but oh...that pizza.. Don't forget the massive cannoli too..

BWAXYaUQo95s5ZgpDMHYTg.text: Finally found the BEST pizza in Las Vegas.  As close to real Italian pizza as you can get.  Prices are appropriate as well.

RXI3Yra6pEFa5tonRagjFw.text: Oh man, this place is so good! I'd forgotten how good it was until I went again last night. I ordered the Settebello pizza - delicious! My friend and I shared the La Bomba dessert, which is also delicious (peanut butter gelato with caramel in the middle all coated in chocolate - yes please!) The service was great. I will definitely be back.

OMNoBglFA792F1APsrNIUw.text: Authentic Italian pizza, served just like it is in Italy, or if you prefer they will slice it for you.   The Rucola is fantastic, although occasionally will have a touch too much salt, depends on the chef I suppose.   Sufficient variety of Italian beers and a full bar if you want more.   All desserts on the menu are worth saving room for.   They are also family friendly and generally reasonably priced.

v-pjCxvgbJAWH26WIfu1Gg.text: Settebello is actually certified for its quality and authenticity by an Italian government agency. I only know of one other place (in Marina del Rey, CA) that carries this certification. This is as close as you can get (in Vegas) to actually eating in Italy. All their ingredients come from Italy. You can even buy bags of their Italian flour and take them home to try your own recipes. The place is just sensational. Very reasonable, especially their Happy Hour specials with $5 appetizers and 2-for-1 drinks.

HEhkoit___Y9vg1ZYJVUwQ.text: Best pizza I have had in the Las Vegas!  I have friends that swear by Grimaldis.... but I have yet to try it and compare. I will let you know when that time comes! (possibly tonight!) I used to be a sucker for Chicago-style deep dish pizza UNTIL I ate at Settebellos!! I LOVE LOVE LOVE their Naples-style thin doughy crust pizza. I got a classic margherita pizza with basil and prosciutto crudo on top. YUMMMMYYY!!! I literally almost ate every single piece, but decided to take one piece home for a late night snack.  My favorite thing to do is eat the whole slice.... then take the doughy crust and dip it into a plate of olive oil with a bit of balsamic, fresh red pepper flakes, and parmesan. SOOOO GOOD!

mlyknusjOOmd0DZljOtl9A.text: Had lunch here with some friends on a Friday noon. The place was maybe half full. We ordered the quattro formagio pizza and the settebello with the antipasti appetizer.  The antipasti was very good with 3 kinds of meat, 2 kinds of cheese, artichoke hearts, and garlic flat bread that was very very good.  The pizza here is thin crust, but not crispy... rather doughy. The taste is awesome on both pizzas, but the center part gets soggy which I don't like.  Would come back here with others, but probably not alone as I would not be able to finish one pizza by myself, and would not want to take it home as it will get too soggy.

NSR9fVITzs5muzxF3v5lFQ.text: All right... So far, my 3 other reviews have gotten either 4-5 stars... and I'm not just giving the stars away... Settebello is a little hidden gem in the desert just waiting to be found... like a 10 karat diamond, colorless, flawless one to be exact...  I've heard several great things about this restaurant and FINALLY got a chance to taste the goodness!!  It's a flat bread pizza with a flakey crust.  Sinking your teeth into this mouth watering pizza was... simply.... AMAZING...  You can tell the ingredients are of finest, the cheese alone was, drop your jaw-ONO (as we say in Hawaii)...  Eric and I ordered the 2 most popular pizzas on the menu (12") -although my memory gets me everytime and I can't remember the names...  they both have meat on it, so we requested both have half with meat (for him), half with no meat (for me)... It's not comparable to Papa Johns, California Pizza Kitchen, or TJ's...  Settebello is on a whole new level of it's own- far, FAR above those just listed.  I can't rave enough about it...  Nestled in the District in Henderson, it's a must try if you're in the neighborhood....and if you don't...tisk tisk, what a shame!!

82RqgtaXCXVqYOoYOwtBtA.text: I haven't had pizza like this since I was in Italy in 2005. Totally worth the wait we had in the evening and the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. The panna cotta was okay, but not like real Italian panna cotta - less heavy and more flan-ish. That was my only real complaint. The ingredients in the pizza were superior and I am already bragging about this place to everyone I know.  This is definitely my favorite pizza place, not just in Nevada, but the US entirely.

ygj6BRUkK8Bsq8clZc8YWA.text: This is my favorite pizza place in town.  The one I get most often is the quattro fromagio, the balance in the cheeses acidity of the tomato sauce and fragrant basil they use makes it anything but boring.  All the ingridients are so fresh and high quality.  If you are someone who needs a super crispy or thick crust it might not be for you.  It is generally easier to eat this with a fork and knife and quickly (which is not hard for me lol) because it can get on the softer side after a certain point.  I have found that if I have a left over slice you can just throw it on a frying pan at home and cover it.  It will allow the cheese to melt and crisp the crust back up.  Their sangria is also great, super refreshing.  The nutella pizza is big! I recommened getting it if you have a large group to share.  I used to love their panna cotta when it was made with cut up strawberries rather than a strawberry thats pureed into an over acidic sauce that takes over the whole dish.  They have a lemon type dessert that is light and lovely as well.  Their tirimisu is not the best I have had, it was a little dry actually.  Overall all though I do love their food, especially the pizza.  Sometimes they have a special bolgunese pizza I highly recommened.  Also a tip, if its super busy and they have no tables just go to the bar, it usually has some spots opened and its sectioned off a bit from all the other people.

jgIv0vwI7WVFqGhrFTZVeg.text: We went there late on a Tuesday night. The place was pretty empty. But there was a lot of phone order take-out.   The pizza was very good. One of best we had since Pizza Bianco in Phoenix. Wood fired brick oven delivered a nice charred crust. At first, the char flavor was a little overwhelming and it took a little bit more than a few bite before we started to enjoying them.   We ordered Magherita, and Del Cafone pizza. They both are very good. Del Cafone is sausage, roasted red pepper, onion, and mozzarella without the sauce which was a little dry. We solve the problem by splash some olive oil over the slices before we ate them.  Our favorite course was the appetizer "caprese", it was sliced round tomato with sliced fresh mozzarella topped with fresh basil and olive oil. The waitress brought over the appetizer split on two plate without us asking for it, we thought that was very good service on her part.  Overall, the food was wonderful.  I personal think the only reason this place is not packed is because of the price. I mean, all the items on th menu are very affordable, but after the meal I signed for $43 on my credit card. I started thinking if that is just a liitle too much to spend on pizza for two?

kmJNqdxUBFMH8M2SuS_iMw.text: I have to give 5 stars here. It is a great location, beautiful ambiance, and quality food. The pizza is True serious gourmet pizza but not too bad of a price. The caprese salad is heavenly! But really, the best thing on the menu is the nutella and banana dessert pizza with powdered sugar sprinkled on top. It is made with the same pizza dough as the savory pizzas. I ordered one for my husband and I, but I ended up eating the WHOLE thing. It was irresistible.

a3bPzpoUN9ckhFutIZuwBw.text: Ok I realize this place is really popular and it's supposed to be just like pizza in Italy and all that.  This sort of pizza just isn't my cup of tea, but it was flavorful.  Don't hate me for not loving it, sorry yelpers.  The sauce is very light and there isn't much cheese at all (it's probably fresh), and the toppings are used sparingly.  I prefer lots of veggies and a tiny amount of salt from a little meat (or anchovies, yum), and this wasn't like that at all.  My husband had the margherita with prosciutto and roasted garlic, and I had the quattro stagioni.  I really loved the quality of the mushrooms on my pizza and the salame.  After a little bit my pizza got very soggy and it wasn't so good.  I also had an ensalate which wasn't remarkable as it was just lettuce and Parmesan, but it made me feel like I got some veggies in my diet.  This pizza is really similar to the meal we had at Enoteca, Mario Batali's restaurant at the Venetian that I absolutely hated.  Settebello is definitely better than Mario's establishment, and the price is very reasonable.

hRxf0e1bwY3Zm9o9rIGcaA.text: Satisfying quickies are the best, especially in the end when you both know it was a very orgasmic experience.  Both being your tummy and the empty plate in front of you!  Three, four, five, or even 69 course meals are all nice and dandy but sometimes you just need that quick fix and Settebello hits the "spot" and delivers.    Eat it like you mean it!  You know what I'm talking about, because as soon as the pizza comes out of the oven you have to eat it right away otherwise it gets cold.  Right now I'm listening to JT's Blue Ocean Floor and I'll get this review done by the time this song ends, quickie quick quick.  So after visiting my parents and brother I left a little early to grub before heading to trivia and the closest bookmark I had to Shakespeare's was Settebello.  Looking at the menu I didn't see any distinct ingredients that I haven't had before on my pizza so I did the bro thing, we like our toppings on top, and chose the bottom most item which was the white pizza, Emilia.  I had a glass of the Sangria also.    My pizza came out perfect, the ingredients matches that of my other favorite place and you can tell it's from out of this country, especially my lovely Italian bacon.  Obliviously I ordered it traditional meaning uncut so it gets to my table faster but you can have the server bring it to you cut up.  Uh oh, JT is starting to repeat himself.  They do have happy hour at the bar but I didn't go for that since I could easily finish two pizzas by myself.  I didn't create my own pizza but you can add on ingredients to a pre-constructed pizza.  I love the inside and how there are servers, my server did an excellent job.  But the next time I need to try a salad, red pizza, dessert, and have straight up wine.  When rumors float around they are sometimes bad but if the rumors are True about Settebello and they open up a second location at Sahara and Ft. Apache then the Summerlin folks need to feel lucky!  Who wants to break that location in with me?!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Emilaaaaaa.
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Dessert menu.

OVQkMZtsH2aqmYlpKqIk0A.text: Nope, not a fan at all!  It's a quaint little restaurant and the staff are okay, as for the food..... well, if you're wanting real pizza... this is NOT the place?    Look at their MENU first!!! The portions and price are perfect, just not the pizza!    This place could have potential, if they offered real pizza choices!!!

-BgUTKiwfjjSbkiCexE1lQ.text: Great restaurant. Good food, good happy hour, good people (Bryan and Tyler). highly recommend

B27cTw6BMvrlCh718vJjEA.text: Although I usually like thicker crusted pizza, this place is delicious!

rcSgXcfEPAUPBj0n3UpeAg.text: 2nd favorite pizza place in the Vegas Valley! It'd be first if it wasn't for prices. I don't feel like I'm eating bread with a little cheese.. it's REAL pizza!!!! The original Italian with perfect sized crust and fresh ingredients. The atmosphere is perfect as they spent good time and money on the decorations inside(brick wall, marble tables, etc)

UGy7liG3EH4XH5NhIWpAIA.text: Good pie. Nice bar. Good service. Up side good prices down side it's in Henderson ughh. I would make the trip here weekly if it were in LV or summerlin even. Couple TV's to watch sports at he bar if your into the whole professional sports soap operas. Patio looks inviting would be nice if the weather was more suitable for outside dinning, alas we reside in an inferno.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pie to go because the first pie wasn&#39;t enough.
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Canoli was great

XZH-YvOu3_DYUaHvWqxfmQ.text: Fantastic!  Recommend dining in over take out. The pizzas are FRESH and HOT out of the oven... the crust is perfect .... the flavors all meld together into a mouth-watering-can't-stop-eating experience.  Their salads are really good as well.... and big enough for 2 people to share.   I am partial to the arugula salad... fresh, crisp... light dressing.  It's really the only time I like arugula is at Settebello.  At home it just tastes like weeds... at Settebello's it tastes so good I usually eat the whole thing by myself because I don't like to share it.  Their pizzas... like I mentioned are so yummy you can eat the whole thing in 1 sitting.... And at the end of the meal you don't feel bloated or greasy or icky like with normal pizza.  So... order your own... cuz you are more than likely NOT going to share it.  Settebello's pizzas are not your typical greasy, overly cheesy, thick crust affairs.  These pizzas are light and gourmet.  Their crust is super thin and the cheese is a complimentary topping... not smothered all over creating an impenetrable layer.    Location:  In the Whole Foods shopping center across from The District. It's a small shop and it's usually pretty crowded so go early or plan to wait a bit. Note... there is a small bar and you can eat at the counter there so if that's something you are willing to do you might find that as a viable option.

pbo-Ji6QyE8hnivmawoUGQ.text: I ordered the cheese plate only after I asked if it would come out first before my meal. The waiter said it would if I ordered it without the bread. Well, the cheese plate came out at the same time as my margarita pizza. The margarita pizza was incredibly greasy with little to no fresh basil. The pizza was also soggy. Very disappointed in my meal. Wouldn't recommend this place.

m6luCuWQp9XfNNqGo0YpNg.text: I love Settebellos but IT IS NOT A PET FRIENDLY RESTAURANT (even on the outside patio). So if you go make sure you dog is a certified service dog or leave them at home because they will ask you to leave.

AZhW23oYHF6lzaReRM0ctw.text: Love this place the pizzas are smaller one per person but really great flavor the jalapeno pear is my favorite and the Nutella with banana and strawberries is amazing for dessert.

M8H9PADSUYWruuvQ2s2Hew.text: I ended up here by accident. Definitely the best pizza that I ever ate in Vegas, very authentic Italian :) I chose the Quattro Formaggi with Pesto on one side that was great. The peak of my night was when I tried to put a bit of house olive oil on the pizza crust. The oil tasted heavenly. :) definitely highly recommend this place to anyone and coming back here!

R4A7QIDGGPGaafIoVLCQlg.text: Looking for a unique pizza? This is the one. Out of all the pizza restaurants in the Vegas area that I've been to this is the most unique.  The pizza is excellent. The beauty about this pizza is that you can tell its ingredients are original. You won't find anything like it. Also, you can order your own pizza and eat it. The whole thing and not feel terrible . It's little sauce and little cheese. Very thin crust.   The restaurant is excellent with service and cleanliness.   I've eaten here several times and will continue to in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. App
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Diavola (pep pizza) slice missing. Oops

5Jnm2hIy9JNkpETaLUQmBA.text: This place has 4.5 stars for a reason: awesome Neapolitan style pizzas.  I've been coming to this restaurant for 7 years, basically whenever I travel to Vegas I stop in, sometimes more than once per trip. If you've never had this style of pizza, and there are more and more places that are doing it, then you should definitely try it.  Settebello is one of the first places to have started making pizza like this in Vegas.    They've recently expanded the menu, offering more combinations of toppings.  I almost always go with the Margherita, which is insanely good for being just crust, sauce, mozzarella and a little basil.  A tip though: always ask for the pizza sliced (the standard is not to slice it).  The rest of the menu has expanded a bit, too, where they now offer a wider array of salads, salumi, and oven-roasted appetizers.  In my opinion, the Rucola salad is the best and unique - again, just arugula, lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper, and they manage to turn a set of humble ingredients into something great.

al_hCcVTQSXtqC5w9iLKng.text: I like good food, I don't like BS answers and that is what I got today from our server.  The food here is actually really good and worthy of a 4 or 5 star rating normally.  My wife ordered the Settebello Pizza which comes with the house made sausage amongst other items.  I ordered the Diavola and asked to add the house made sausage.  Both pizza's came and in looking at hers, it had big chunks of sausage all over her pizza and looked really good.  I got charged $2.50 to add on the sausage and was VERY disappointed.  3/4 of the pizza had very little sausage on it and the other 1/4 had absolutely NONE.   I told the waiter and he responded with they use a spoon so its not like they tried to give her more then you.  REALLY???  Just looking at the two you can tell there was a difference and to be charged an extra $2.50 for something they just did not deliver on and to have the server respond like that,  I probably would not be going back here for some time.  I can get a better deal for my money then getting cheated and then treated like and fool by the waiter.  This place does not have my vote and even though the food is good, the value especially when charged extra is NOT worth the price.  If you are going to charge $2.50 for add on's, they should equal or exceed what you are charging.

nZf-mJbuCchdst3zxrVkhw.text: Very disappointing. The pizza was mushy, greasy, and chewy, all at tbe same time. It might be considered decent my NV standards, but it wouldn't last a day in New York.  I'm updating this review an hour after eating. My friend got the cheese platter. The apple slices were mushy, the strawberries tasted like they'd been dipped in sugar sauce, and the cheese itself was nothing to write home about.  I'm going to have a hard time digesting tonight. Thank god I didn't finish my meal.

EA-KCpO-cUw5RQAHzfFtog.text: Outstanding!  My wife and I arrived at around noon and were greeted with smiles and seated immediately. The atmosphere of the place was warm and welcoming, with a nice soundtrack of Italian music playing in the background.  We started our lunch with a Misto antipasto, which was excellent, consisting of two kinds of prosciutto, salami, two kinds of cheeses, olives and pickled zucchini, and accompanied by a delicious focaccia bread. We ordered a pizza each - the wife had the "Quattro Formaggi" (four cheeses), which she loved, and I had the "Settebello", which was topped with crushed tomatoes, pancetta, sausage, roasted mushrooms, toasted pine nuts, mozzarella, basil and extra virgin olive oil. I'm from New York City, born and bred there for 40 pizza-eating years, so I'm very critical of pizza in general, but I can say that this was, by far, the best tasting, most authentic pizza I have ever had outside of Italy.  Fantastic pizza aside, what really made the visit worthwhile was our server, Tam, who treated us as old friends even though we had never been there before. He patiently explained everything on the menu, answered our questions, made great suggestions and never left us hanging or wanting for anything. This was our first time here, but it definitely won't be our last!

H7Zt8cxkLIabJvEZCSPZjw.text: Never a bad pizza pushed out of this oven.  Thin crust makes you feel like you are eating healthy.  This is our favorite pizza in Henderson.  Always try the pizza of the day. Happy hour is a plus too. They have mini pizzas for cheap!

RCCQZVjKSY3Z2jRCrkdBLQ.text: My family and I came in yesterday (party of 8) with no reservation and were sat right away with no problem.  Our server, Tyler, came over and took our order.  Tyler was very knowledgeable on the menu and even had them make a fresh batch of red sangria for me as I am allergic to berries :(    Our food came out and everything we had was AMAZING!  The pizza was light, fresh and PERFECT!  We had a nutella pizza and cannoli for dessert and they too were amazing.    The service here is great!  Tyler and Brandon were the ones who helped our table and they were awesome!!!!!  They are so sweet and have great personalities, I will definitely request them when I come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Best Nutella Pizza Ever!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. White Sangria!!!!

SK6KYwC5Jm8nDelo31dzYQ.text: If you know me personally, you know that I'm a die hard deep dish pizza kinda woman. So why on earth would I even agree to dine at a flat bread, thinly sliced pizza spot? Well, I'm a natural born foodie, so...no judgment and my theme is "Bring on new experiences with food anytime, anywhere!"  The bf and I were in town for a wedding so of course during our down time we wanna explore what Henderson has to offer when it comes to food and culture.   I honestly wasn't even hungry at the time we showed up since we literally had breakfast 2 hours before but this is the kinda schedule you gotta be on if you're dating a FOODIE bodybuilder. :P  We ordered the Vico Pizza Pie which had Wood Oven Sausage, Sauteed Fennel, Red Onions, Mascarpone, Mozzarella, Basil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil. All those ingredients sound amazeballs, don't they? Well, they sure were!  One thing that was off though was that our waitress told us that they serve their pizza Napoli style which means we have to cut into our pizza with our own knives and forks and that they do pre-cut pizzas at the customer's request but it's not standard. Our pizza...came out cut for us? WTF. We're all about authenticity and we were looking forward to cutting into the pizza and into the soft "wet" center ourselves. Oh well, I'm not going to knock down a star just for that.   The pizza was seriously amazing (mascarpone and mozzarella me anytime baby) and I'd totally come back here to try some of their other pizzas or specials they have. :)

s-J1ohqmy0Fo0SCHggsinw.text: My favorite place to go for pizza! Great for date night every time.   Ask for Patric, he is my favorite and I ask for him every time. Never let down by his service and the amazing food and drink menu.   I recommend the Misto, and the Margarita Pizza  And for a drink the Soreno is hands down amazing.

vx1ZL2AqiPA6fC8AmbYyKA.text: Fantastic pizza place. It would have gotten 5 starts if we'd not been seated next to the Hostess desk which apparently was the place for servers to hang out and chat. I can, however, tell you where the best clubs are in Vegas for 20-somethings because of it.   Back to the food - highly, highly recommend. Pizzas were all fantastic (Margherita, Quattro Formaggi (sans Gorgonzola) and Settebello). The Misto plate was large with enough for sharing with the entire table. I ordered it as a main and it was too much food for me.   Service - great. Tam was our server and was attentive but not overbearing. Friendly and looked happy to be at work!

xovmGQZjDkhuHaLvK9kvOw.text: This was the place to go!  The Beet salad was delicious and offered two different beets and arugula.  The pizza was plate size and very good.  I would suggest sharing one but did not!  Had to bring home but wasn't disappointed that I did.  Had the prosciutto platter and added a fresh mozzarella ball.  It was to die for! Had the gelato which was good.  The tiramisu was good too.  I definitely would go back to this place.  The service was excellent.  It is a small place and we did have a wait.  But the wait time wasn't bad.  They have a full bar but we choose not to wait there but the drinks were very good when we did get seated.  I recommend this place highly if wanting a good pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

FTH32CZSzrw08ZGC_PV1uA.text: Lovely little pizza place with great atmosphere, food and service! After enjoying your favorite salad and pizza, try the dessert pizza! It's soooo yummy!

BHxcCAaKdL4oD8Up96ZZFg.text: Rounding down from 3.5. I got a free pizza in my email (along with about 10 other meals around town, you should start signing up) so decided to try the place. I sat at the bar and the service was very good. The pizza, while tasty.. Is more "authentic" and less like the comfort food pizzas I go for.. Less sauce, more sparse, etc. If that's what you're into you'll love this place. Nothing personal!

JHhpnbZrwxmafhkw8RJEKA.text: Delicious! If you want pizza and such come here, other pizza places are budget, however this one is very fancy and delicious. I highly recommend the margarita DOC pizza and the tiramisu. Definitely come here and give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The settebello pizza

AzkCHFJOksI9AbRcuCDeCg.text: Located at the next block over from The District, it is a quick and convenient walk to enjoy a light bite.   This restaurant is a little difficult to find as it is quietly tucked away behind Cheesecake Factory and other eateries that can be seen on the Main Street, but finding this is worth it!   We ordered the Margherita pizza, which can easily be split between two people. It is large enough and hearty to fill your bellies without being uncomfortably full! The dough and mozzarella cheese were the best part of the pizza, the sauce was a little watery...however it seems like they make the sauce from scratch as we could see chunks of fresh tomato as we were enjoying our slices. I wish the sauce was a little thicker and less watery since it made the sauced part of the pizza less crispy and I prefer my pizza to be crispy throughout.   The prices are comparable to others at $13-$15 per pizza, and they offer a nice variety of dessert varying from tiramisu to gelato (dessert prices range $5-$10), which we will return to try one day.   This block has its own free parking lot shared with the other restaurants and Whole Foods.

9uyqhe4iJtiENvym2zE6cQ.text: Nice place....had business appt at The District and had lunch here. Nice place...smaller menu than I prefer....had the warm beet salad...tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Good latte!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Industrial piping on ceiling
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Warm beet salad comes in small skillet

DAuCCm5aK5lM1F_pN9ul8Q.text: I'm originally from Naples and therefore have a thing for traditional Neapolitan pizza. My quest is to find the best out there. Settebello did not disappoint. I could tell from the moment that I walked in that the aroma of fresh tomatoes was in the air.  Settebello is a small operation with two locations just off the Vegas Strip and the rest scattered around southern California and Utah. The restaurant is named after the seven of gold card in the Italian card game of Scopa. I've won and lost (mainly lost) many games of this in my lifetime.  I ordered a Margherita DOC pizza which came with buffalo mozzarella as any good pizza should. This was spot on and delicious, everything from the flavor to the crust and texture were perfect.   They are about sourcing ingredients directly from Naples, or locally when that is not possible, which accounts for the authentic pizza-making methods and taste here.  For dessert I ordered a tiramisu which was very good. The tiramisu was very creamy, but I thought the mascarpone was slightly too heavy on the coffee for my liking. Ultimately this is a personal preference though and the tiramisu was still delicious despite this.  On the service front, attention was a bit lacking considering I went during lunch when there were just a few other patrons in the restaurant. Once they served me my pizza they didn't really come back so I had trouble flagging someone down to order dessert and ultimately get my check.   From where I was seated at the bar I noticed the staff sitting in the back playing on their phones. If the slower service was due to a lot of guests that's one thing, but to have 10 patrons in the place max and still have to flag waiters down because they're playing pokemon or whatever was disappointing.   Other than this service issue it was a great experience and the pizza here should not be missed.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiramisu dessert
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Margherita DOC pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello named after the best card in the Italian card game Scopa

WC6h51vJfYrzAkFr-Rcumw.text: Wood fired pizza with super fresh ingredients & a very Italian menu! Even though sometimes it's hard for me to venture out of my norm (I LOVE fresh margarita pizza) I felt like this was he perfect spot to try something different! I ordered a pizza that had sausage with a pear and jalapeno marmelade: INCREDIBLE!!! I could eat that every single day! Also ordered a meat pizza & started with a side house salad. This place is !! Must check out for wood fired pizza & good salads.   I didn't try it but they also had gelato - next time that's a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

3tcXAr1PenqxbfjMNMnPUg.text: Recently ate at this Settebello's for the second time! Constant flavors and atmosphere. We were at an office party and had their salads as well as several pizzas. The service was fast and friendly and the lunch kept our drinks full. Their salads were very delicious as well as fresh. I tried the brisket pizza and their special with goat cheese, chicken and a balsamic drizzled on top. Both extremely delicious. This resultant is a great way to enjoy large groups or small. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun. If you are looking for a fantastic pizza... you've found it! Come on in and try it for yourself!

vXJh7dHy8_gAdOgULWdLnA.text: Stopped here for lunch on our vacation. Everything was just ok but not great. We ordered the pizza Margherita and the pizza bolognese. The pizzas were soggy and the dough tasted almost raw on the bottom. It was disappointing and not a great experience.

QqyH0BS3vlMcmjhnLZylbA.text: I usually come here for happy hour with my girl friends and today in particular I had a great time experience because of our server Lexi. She was very attentive & gave the best recommendations since we both bonded that we don't eat meat. The food was incredible. High recommend!

gVhkdyGGcTKJxx3PY9LAGA.text: Been several times. Always great!  The pizza size is a hearty meal for one, or a delicious part of a meal for two.  My date and I usually split a pizza and a salad (the Beet Salad is a fave!) and that is plenty for two big guys. If we're still hungry, we'll finish up with one of the delicious deserts.    Last night, we shared the seasonal special - the Ripieno Autunno, which was absolutely fantastic! One of my favorite things ever!  "Ripieno" just means 'stuffed' - and "Autunno" (as you might guess) is 'Autumn'.  This stuffed and folded pizza was truly special. Sweet squash combined with sausage and a generous amount of fresh sage stuffed into a perfectly baked crust made for a perfect cool-weather repast. Stuffed with Autumn, indeed!  As a bonus, we happened to be there on a Thursday - when the drink special is Margaritas of several different sorts for the extremely reasonable price of $4. I had the "Italian" Margarita - which had Amaretto and orange juice. Unusual, and I don't know if I'd call it a "margarita" - but I liked it! (I had a second).   Four drinks, the Ripieno and a very large salad came to just under $50 - which isn't cheap, but is quite reasonable for the quality of the food and the nice-casual vibe of the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Ripieno Autunno - Stuffed with squash, sausage, and sage. A perfect seasonal special for cool autumn weather!

SLXSg2qTRiTjOGQ0tESleg.text: Wish I didn't wait as long as I did to check this place out. I've heard good things from friends in the past and this is my second visit now. Not my favorite pizza place but definitely a good alternative to switch it up sometime.   The pizza is good, cheese platter is good, not a fan of their beets.

QsYWC5Jt9hjVjCvlwTHo1A.text: I got the Diavola pizza and a glass of Pinot noir after a long day of work. The pizza was a red sauce base with red peppers and a tiny bit of spice. Can't remember the bartenders name but she was so informative and knew the menu like the back of her hand. Very descriptive when she was explaining it to me.  She was also a sweetheart and approachable to talk to. Which I can't really say about many of my female bartenders encounters!  First time there and I will be back for my next pizza fix. Affordable, nice dark Italian pizzeria atmosphere and awesome staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

ct9Lw93Ow7OsGAquFOpJTw.text: Facility is very clean Service is good Food is oily and salty Price is too high for what you get  The pizza is too thin, flimsy, soggy, hardly any marinara sauce and oily. You could make better pizza at home. Salad is tossed with too much dressing. The meal wasn't as refreshing as we were anticipating based off of the reviews. Service is good and that was a bit of consolation for the sad food. We came about an hour before closing so there were hardly any people in the restaurant. Very disappointing.

ynlThry4BXA4LsK8aGXq5g.text: Extremely good pizza. This is what pizza should taste like. Everything on the pizza tasted so fresh and amazing.  The brochetta was so delicious especially with the pesto sauce. My first time having it and it definitely won't be my last.   I had the most amazing pizza as well. Didn't really know most of the ingredients so I just asked our server Tyler what he recommended and he said the Settebello which is a sausage pizza. Their sausage is made in house btw it was amazing. But I love my pepperoni so I added it on to the pizza, it's only $3 and it's totally worth it. But here they call it Calabrese (Calabrese = Pepperoni) But it's sort of a bit spicier pepperoni. OH MY GOD, best pepperoni I've ever tasted. So fresh and crisp and it has a lil kick to it. So freaking good !!!!!! My pizza also came with bacon, olives, pine nuts. And the tomato sauce is so delicious and fresh. I loved it.   My boyfriend got the Vico pizza with the marmalade on the side. And that cheese on that pizza was so yummy. It's like a sweet and creamy cheese. It has no tomato sauce on it. Comes with prosciutto, he's a big fan of that. But honestly, the pizza that I got.. the Settebello was the best pizza I've ever tried and you should try it to.   I realized that I've been to this restaurant before but in Santa Monica at the marina. And the quality of the food and service is exceptional at both locations. If your craving some authentic and fresh pizza, you gotta come to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Vico pizza

Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Settebello pizza was worth every cent, that amazing ness can&#39;t be duplicated at home lol come here to try this masterpiece!!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello on bottom and Vico pizza on top

o1fPEp_BfIiWQ5SyE2pOTg.text: I'm a local and this is a place I can always count on to be GREAT.  The pizzas are delicious as well as the salads.  The Ensalada Grande is my favorite salad bit many of my friends and family enjoy the Panzenella.  Favorite pizzas are the Setabello, if you like a meat pizza also the Emelia os amazing and if you like spicy The Diablo.  You really can't go wrong.  Great atmosphere, good for groups and families.  The servers here are always super friendly, helpful and on their game even when it gets super busy.  RECOMMEND!

oqaTvGZwBUw_x9qNTlRL-g.text: The best pizza ever! Especially the GF pizza options! Make sure to try Marinara Pizza with the Gluten Free crust!!

AYcsE87JeJ5m1elDxKZq5g.text: This place is sooooo good, good service, good vibe. Pizzas are individual with lots of yummy combination suggestions or build one your self. I got wild mushrooms and garlic, delicious!

GY0184eJIuMUSGve2ovm0g.text: If you are in Greenvally then this place is a MUST! True Italian Pizza - flour is imported from Italy.  The "Settebello" pizza is the way to go.  I like mine cut!

iN9VmXueGo3V0vBWmHxLoA.text: Off the beaten path if you're on the strip but this luckily wasn't too far from my parents' house. Stuck in a small but tasteful strip mall, in a space that reminds me more of a brew pub than a place that serves staunchly authentic Napoletan pizza (most of the ingredients are even imported from Italy).  Maybe I was expecting the red checkered table cloths...  Service was friendly and fast. Inexplicably, my wine was brought in a small regular water glass, while I saw someone at another table get what looked like a wine glass to pour her sparkling water into.   I had the Quattro Stagioni, which was a Margherita divided into 4 quarters: one with wood oven roasted sausage, one with salame, one with roasted mushrooms and one with calamata olives.   The first thing I noticed was how good the crust was. Super thin with small patches of  black from the oven. The toppings were not generous but that could just be the Napoletan methodology. The cheese was in small dollops rather than spread all over. I found the pizza to be  on the salty side, perhaps because they use sea salt. The olives were whole pitted olives which fell off as I ate the pizza.   The pizza overall was excellent and I managed to ram the entire 12" pizza down my throat in a record 15 minutes.  I brought my 5 star rubber stamp but couldn't quite pull the trigger on it. I really enjoyed it but it did not blow me out of the water. I definitely want to come again and try some more next time I'm in town.

ljC96i9n7mH_RSuCOtGH_A.text: This place is a must-go! I was in Henderson visiting my parents who live in Green Valley Ranch area, and had heard great things before finally trying Settebello. We were so happy with our pizzas...I got the Emilia, and at first was weirded out by corn on pizza but you can't even taste it. So light and buttery. Delicious. My husband got the pizza with brisket, it was so different and tasty. My Mom got the pizza with mushroom and artichoke, and my Dad got the margherita pizza. I couldn't choose a favorite; they were all so fresh and unique. Even the traditional margherita was amazing and tasted like it came from Italy. We started off with the salad with artichoke hearts and lots of freshly grated cheese. I also got the nutella pizza for dessert, which was the one dish I didn't care for. And the drinks! I got the spicy pepper mule, and it was just the right amount of heat. I can't wait to go back the next time we are in Henderson!

IlfuV07_y2u4KNMakUt6rQ.text: They do a nice twist on pizza and we enjoyed it. However, I thought it was pricey and not the best value for money.  I think it'd be a great place to go on a date with someone that you're just getting to know and would like to make a good impression on. I don't believe that we could afford to make this our family's friday evening place.

MCS9XhTroXpf_QUHvz78KQ.text: Fantastic pizza !!  This came highly recommended and it did not disappoint.   Its in the Whole Foods side of the District by Green Valley Resort.  Great atmosphere for conversations no loud music.  Everything we had was so good.  Next time in town we will visit again!

UNw6-sC64Zr1nNS1M17UJg.text: Visited Settebello for a dear friend's birthday. She wanted to try it so bad that it made ME excited. I must say at the end of the evening here is what went wrong:  1. The service was curt, though polite, and when I asked for a suggestion she nearly rolled her eyes and said, "everythings' good." For a place serving True Napoli pizza, I was surprised that it seemed the wait staff didn't take more pride in their product. I settled on the Margherita.   2. We ordered our food slightly behind a LARGE party. Though I am understanding and don't mind waiting for my food, knowing the chefs need to make things in order, I am discouraged from returning from the HOUR WAIT. My friend was getting tipsy from her martini sitting on an empty stomach.   3. The ingredients were fresh, delicious, amazing in their flavors and textures. However my friend ordered a pizza with Italian Sausage on it. In her entire pizza there were FOUR SLICES of tiny sausage on it. I get it that your ingredients are imported. But we didn't pay $15 for a pizza to get FOUR slices of sausage.   My lemon drop martini and friends glass of wine were wonderful. The pizzas tasted like heaven. But price and portion size made me wish we'd gone to Grimaldi's. And I'm sure my waitress was embarrassed from our long wait time because she never offered dessert.

lFOYDvQwMnDidmliO6fVXw.text: My new favorite place for pizza! I went to Italy two years ago and Settebello comes closest to the pizza I enjoyed while in Naples.   I had the Margherita pizza but added prosciutto cotto. The perfect tasting crust and fresh ingredients make this my new favorite.

HMFYbpQEBh5hkobzukZ30g.text: Service here is always friendly and charismatic. Since their products are imported from Italy, the pizza definitely tastes authentic. The pizza itself is really thin so even though it has a sizable diameter, I can eat the whole thing. For my tennis playing brothers, a whole pizza is not quite filling for them, however. I was a little disappointed the last time I went because there was a lingering burnt taste in every bite. Normally, the dough is amazing and the delicious cheese and tomato sauce is hard to beat. So we hope for improvement the next time around.

cC1UW4r4qYaERv8kK7DHLA.text: Great pizza. The salad I ordered was kind of lacking, but lets be honest that my my error, you don't go here to order salads. The pizza was perfection. Great light and fluffy chew tot the crust. The base was light thin with. Slight crisp. The sauce to cheese and toppings trio was balanced. Great pizza!

JPGPm9QzyltXLJk1_25pwg.text: We have eaten here twice and loved our pizza's both times.  We even brought the kids the 2nd time and they had a kids meal we were not aware of . We will be back!  One recommendation that we found out about the last time we ate there - try the pepper infused olive oil for a kick - so good!

zr5uMZnsbnKcoYrdwgYUkQ.text: Right of the bat, the server was friendly and outgoing.  We ordered a glass of wine, caprese,  and the calzone of week. We did a slight modification to the calzone and the server was happy to do it. The pizza was delicious. We would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

KQnD3vA5tG2kalC9OqzxQg.text: Hands down amazing pizza! This place was recommended to me several italian coworkers and it was delicious. Now if your used to a thick chicago style or maybe pizza hut...this is not for you. This pizza is for anyone who likes traditional pizza as close to authentic, thin crust...ahhh...just delicious! I have always been impartial to the margherita pizza every where I go and I recommend it here!

ewfEtckGgtTDElptuLLP2w.text: Mitchell was our server. He was very knowledgeable. He educated us on the menu. Very helpful being our first time. He had great recommendations and the food was delicious. We will definitely go back. Pizza has great flavor and the Nutella pizza is so good.

aK2ViG4aV3tU3qNloHK8cg.text: I don't get it.  What is up with the hype behind this place?  I get they have AUTHENTIC Napoli pizza.  I get that they use fresh, quality ingredients.   What I don't get is why I pay $13 for a soggy sponge with some toppings on it.    I used to work in a restaurant.  I made pizzas in a wood burning oven.  I hand tossed the dough.  I even made the dough from scratch.  And despite my being a busboy, not a cook, my pies were still better than those I had in two separate visits to Settebello.    I just don't get the hype, sorry.  (3 stars for the excellent service).

lsjGU535A1ryLN0MKA4l2A.text: Did you know that a former USC QB opened this place up?  I'm so glad that this restaurant exists. When I went to Naples, it was so ghetto that I was not comfortable enough to venture out to their pizza spots. Only if I knew it'd taste amazing, I would have been more ballsy! I really like making my own pizza (red sauce, onions, mushrooms, sausage) or ordering the Pizza Lasagna. The house salad is good but the Insalata Grande is not worth the $8 (trully boring). Both tiramisu and lemon tart were good desserts; the textures and flavors were on the dot but nothing unique (except for the price $5!). I think I'm officially a fatty because I don't get full when I share my pizza. I think I could eat one whole pizza on my own. I'm pretty sure actually.  We've dined in once before but usually we do take-out. Of course our dining in experience was so much better because the pizza was fresher but we like ordering take out from here when we have our friends over or want to stay in. Such a great place!

vdwl-BaX0_PKwS163jbitA.text: I found this place by pure luck and YELP of course. My son's class was the down the street, when I decided to do a search for pizza and Settobello popped up. The reviews were excellent, pictures looked delicious. We took a gamble, and it was a great choice. We ordered 2 pizzas which were fabulous, we ordered the lasagna pizza and quattro stagioni. We were still a little hungry so asked the server for advice, and he was dead on for a great pizza. We ordered the Settobello pizza instead of the nutella pizza. Next time we are ordereing the nutella and settobello pizza. The pizza crust was light and exactly how i like my pizza. I wouldn't do it any different way. I am going to try to be back every weekend.
