5FqdisZdstoom3A8MgOvOQ.text: You get a 4 because you're inconsistent. Pizza is great when the Neapolitans are working. Hemingway on the rocks is a great cocktail. I've stolen it off you. Thanks.

CXN47i3ODYY_T8Bq7R9r3g.text: When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie its Settebello.....  Seriously folks this is in the top two pizzerias in the whole damn country in the running with Bianco's in Phoenix. i cannot go to the state of Nevada with out stopping here. if you want to understand what classic Neapolitan pizza is all about this is the place to try. They also have some fantastic starters and salads.   Ciao bella!

JHSglPpjvrhh-zHCqurNUA.text: First off, I would consider myself to be quite advanced in the art of pizza making and have tried a wide variety of styles, both at home and in some well known pizza spots across the country. WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW ABOUT THIS PIZZA AT SETTEBELLO: This is authentic pizza napoletana (neapolitan). If you don't know, that means it's classic pizza as it was originated in Naples. It's a particular thin crust, slightly chewy type of pizza with mozzarella and basil as a typical starter. For me, and for many, this is the best pizza there is. There are very specific Italian standards that need to be met before one can get the official designation, and at the moment Settebello is the only place in Nevada that has it. For more information, look at the official organization's site yourself: anticapizzeria.net/vpn/h... Basically it means all their ingredients come from Italy, which would include Caputo flour (slightly different than the bread flour used in most pizzas here in the states) and San Marzano tomatoes, which to be officially authentic have to be grown in the volcanic soil of Mt. Vesuvius. The mozzarella in the U.S. is typically fior di latte, but Neapolitans typically use mozzarella di bufala (buffalo mozzarella), and they do include this option. Of course none of this would matter if they didn't cook it in a proper wood fired oven at very high temperatures. The pizza has to cook very quickly to get the proper balance of crisp, chewiness, and melted cheese. You'd be amazed at how long it can take to master this. So that alone makes Settebellos special. For anyone, much less a pizza lover, this is a classic dish that one must try in their lifetime. What you should expect is a thin crust pizza, with an airy crust that has spots that borden on being burnt, if not a few hot spots that actually are. It should be crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside, but not as chewy as a traditional New York pizza which has higher levels of gluten. The middle of the pizza will be soft, so absolutely do not expect a slice of pizza to hold up when you pick it up. It will droop and bend, and this does not mean it was cooked improperly. This is how it's supposed to be, and this is how we like it! In fact, anyone from Naples wouldn't actually cut their pizza into slices, they would fold it up on several sides and eat it. When I eat this pizza I definitely do not expect them to cut the slices, although they always ask, and I usually tear it in half first and then fold the halves once more and eat it that way. The waiting staff was always helpful. They allowed me to mix up my pizza so that one half is one style and the other is another style. The second time I did that the waitress got it wrong and thought I ordered two pizzas. They decided to just give it to me at the charge of one. Nice! I'm a big fan of red pepper on pizzas, particularly the napolitanas. But it's hard to go wrong with any of these options. Just remember, if you go with DOP mozzarella, which is made from buffalo's milk, it's going to have a much stronger taste that some people love, and others really don't like. If you're used to typical mozzarella, which is fior di latte, then feel free to keep it safe. You might ask them to take a peek at their wood fired oven, and see how it's all done. Seeing my pizza get baked is a pretty enjoyable experience in and of itself, and always makes the eating better. Bottom line is, you can't beat the ingredients they use at these prices, and the authenticity of this place can't be found elsewhere in the area. For me it's highly recommended, and every time I'm in Vegas I'm coming back. Apparently they're doing well, they have a restaurant in Pasadena, CA, but I haven't tried that one yet.

ohetlKWy1kDxY5IoFHfAOQ.text: Settebello is one of those places you think it could be all "hype" but you can't ignore forever I'm the last guy who likes gourmet pizza but this place knows what's up  All the pizzas are awesome just order any of them  Must try if you live in Henderson   Takeout is a good plan  Or make sure you get a reso One pizza per person

uDOTQkkXbT92goG7tJ4tLQ.text: We just moved to LV from San Diego and wanted to find a replacement pizza with GF crust like the fantastic crust at LJ's Pizza on Pearl. Well, this gluten free crust is different but it's very good. Fast, efficient service and the waiter didn't say "no problem" instead of "my pleasure" but he did call us  "guys" ignoring gender. Oh well, everyone does that I guess these days. The caprese salad was perfect, served on a cold plate and the half margherita, half inferno was very nice, with the inferno living up to its name.   We will be back soon for regular crust and another of the 15 different pizzas.

1IbZeav6jAiGgtZF4tNSjA.text: Had an awesome dinner from start to finish ! We had Mitchell as our server and he was great , very attentive and just an all around pleasant person . The food was amazing , my son loves the dessert pizza with Nutella!! Will definitely go back again soon !

EbtynA3sfer28XilhONlZA.text: Was very curious on how good Settebello would be, wanted to try it since it was authenticated by the Italian pizza association. I know that they use double 00 Caputo flour, which is good for wood burning ovens. It was good but not great. The pizza is light and airy and thin. I prefer a thin New York style pizza. More a chewy bite with a slight crunch, like Grimaldis. two pizza, 1 salad and couple of drinks came out to be $46 for lunch before tip.   What I also didn't like was that the pizza's were preset, no topping choices. I guess, I prefer Americanized pizza over authentic Italian pizza.

zRI9soYMjfjlfF-hydie4Q.text: First time at Settebello's and we happened to make it in during happy hour. Had the Mini Ripieno and Spiedini off the HH menu and also the brisket pizza. All the food was great except the brisket tasted like Philly cheesesteak which was okay.   The great staff has me writing the review. Our server was Vanessa. She informed us about happy hour and checked back frequently to make sure everything was good. The hostess and food runner/buzzer were also very attentive to us. Great staff! Will be back just for the service quality.

kHgBhBFOLnuVLl5OXrugQg.text: I came into this pizzeria for lunch with my best friend. Service was speedy & excellent. We both had the lunch special which was a margarita pizza & a panzanella salad. both were extremely delish! Price is super reasonable- the meal was around $12. they do free birthday desserts! we both decided that we would definitely come back!!

WyhKSLZ-HgDiefPHVnLrpQ.text: Service - Stellar.  Food - Not a fan. We ordered five pizzas.  The toppings slid off the pizza, the middle was watery.  Not to mention, they completely forgot my sons coloring book after offering him one and even my son's entree.

Z28DNfzMtByKuo32x5de9g.text: Love their pizza! Although it's more doughy, I just ask them to leave it in the oven longer for more of a crispy crust! Love love their tiramisu as well

3Jh-uDkHVqpmPCcVXw9PSg.text: Simply the best gluten free crust anywhere in the world! We will be back again and again. Friendly and attentive staff. You will not be disappointed if you haven't already been.

EfKxXzi_SJ1Sl9oN4dHXpg.text: After reading a glowing review in a past issue of Las Vegas Weekly and recently online through Yelp, I was really looking forward to checking out the $5 Happy Hour offerings at this Neapolitan-style pizzeria. We decided to go with the basics - the Calzone and the Margherita pizza. The personal-size calzone was tasty, however, the bottom quickly became a soggy mess in less than five and the top also lost its initial crunch!?!? The Margherita pizza was quite tasty with a light amount of sauce and cheese so that I could fully appreciate the chewy, slightly charred crust. The happy hour menu is a super duper deal for small appetites and budgets. I suppose if I lived in Henderson, I'd hit up this budget-friendly happy hour all the time, but it wasn't worth the drive from Vegas. Maybe The Lakes location has the same Happy Hour deal? The new location wasn't open last time I was in Vegas...  I feel service could be improved as: *We weren't greeted when we entered the restaurant, even though there were two employees chillin' at the hostess stand. *Our server/the bartender didn't check up on us. *We had to flag down our server/the bartender for our bill even though we were sitting around a while after we finished our food. Is neglect normal here, because I've eaten in bar areas of other restaurants and received plenty of service?!?!

p6vTWh6ml8mqmb3zqprwpw.text: This place is amazing. It gets a good rating for a reason. All of their pizzas are wood fired in a brick oven, which always gets brownie points. The pizza gets it's own unique taste from the oven and you can taste the quality.   The pizza: Every pizza is 12' regardless of what you order. The prices range from around 11 dollars up to 15ish and they not only have original marinara pizzas, but pesto and white as well. In fact, they have four white pizzas. They have other items on the menu as well, such as pasta, but really, who wants pasta when their pizza is so gosh darn amazing.  As said before, it's wood fired in their own brick oven and is sicilian style. The crust comes out chewy as expected and really picks up the oven taste. I ordered an Emilia, which is one of their white pizzas and not only the sauce,, but the cheese and meat.were cooked to perfection. I will go back many times to taste more.   Dessert: AMAZING. Almost All of their desserts are around the 5 dollar range. Their tarimasu was the best I've ever had. Usually you get an extremely small portion on it at restaurants, but not here. It is BAM in your face and huge. Oh, and delicious too. Pair it with espresso if you want to be in True heaven. Speaking of.  Espresso: If you are a coffee lover, I suggest trying their espresso. It is extremely high quality. That about sums it up really.  Service: This is also amazing. The waiters are friendly and professional. My drink (water) was never empty, but the staff didn't vug you TOO much. They were also more than happy to tell about the place and give recommendations to me, since it was my first time.   The only flaw, really, is that it's TOO good. There can be a wait time on the weekends, but it's worth it. Sooooo worth it.

koAqewC35WqpSuKZj7OYVA.text: Great fresh ingredients. They cook their pizza differently from your typical traditional pizza joint. However, they still met my pizza needs. I highly recommend anyone to try this place out.

8AwPD7gjFYqU9oH6YEL5Eg.text: The pizza is really wonderful, one of the best in town. They are mostly individual size pizzas, if that's what your looking for. I love the margarita, it's so simple and good but I've had many of them and they are all exceptional.

2busTlyVTgcE5XpeuEZnGA.text: The pizza here is excellent! I do not like thin crust but the authentic pizza at Settebello is the exception. I can't describe this pizza other than delicious. It's expensive for a small size pizza but the flavors make up for it. Order here and you won't be disappointed.

vyJwfCH9GBZ6f1xpIkpdOg.text: As soon as we arrived to Vegas for a short weekend, we stopped first at the restaurant. There we had the white pizza without red sauce, that was a very good choice.  The pizza is very light and delicious, we also had their salad.  It's already a set thing that when we are in Vegas, we pay this place a visit.  Check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. White pizza without sauce mmmmm...

eeOxeRUHUTZUcGiKiZepBw.text: Well, the hype is True!  And, Rod U. most recently, and many others before him, speak the truth.  Settebello serves great pizza.  Not just great Neapolitan pizza--great pizza, period!  Diane and I attended LJ's UYE here the end of last month, and I--a New York style Dom DeMarco's, Secret Pizza, and Biaggio's champion, and not one typically enamored by Neapolitan style pizza--was suitably impressed.    This is not your typical Pepperoni and sliced Mushrooms Pizza establishment.  But no matter!  The other fine Italian meats served here, Roasted Mushrooms, and outstanding Toasted Pine Nuts are just as satisfying.  As remarked by others, the ingredients imported from Italy are top of the line.  I loved the great flavorful slice of Italian ham Kevin P. was kind enough to extend me from his tantalizing order of Antipasto Misto.  And, the Soppressata I added to my Settebello was as spicy as my server said it would be.  My mouth was on fire!  And the spice lingered there, but in a pleasant, reminiscent sort of way.  My only complaint is that a 12-inch pizza is not enough for me--especially when the crust is relatively thin.  Settebello's pizza crust is not of the crisp cracker variety commonly found throughout Italy, but it is surely thinner than typical New York style pizza.    Yet my pizza was still hot and saucy, and I liked everything about it: the dough, Crushed Tomatoes that tasted like mild and wet Tomato Sauce, tangy Pancetta, relatively mild Wood Oven Sausage, in addition to the Roasted Mushrooms, Soppressata, and Toasted Pine nuts that delivered a nice crunch to a bite.  Only next time I might opt to add a milder Italian meat.  And I will likely order two pizzas for myself, and take half of one home after I have devoured the rest.  I know Diane will not object, because she may very well do the same.  When it comes to pizza, we do not mess around.  For dinner we usually order a large or extra large pizza apiece, eat as much as we can, and take the remainder home for at least lunch and sometimes also dinner the next day.  The only requirement is that the pizza must be superior in flavor, texture, and ingredients.  And, Settebello delivers on all counts!  The dough comes out of the super-hot oven with a little char for Neapolitan authenticity, but no char taste.  Diane, who is fussy about pizza (and most other foodstuffs) very much liked her Emilia Pizza, with ham, Mozzarella, and EVOO, even though she was skeptical going in.    To open, while awaiting the firing and presentation of my pizza, I also ordered an Insalata, and found the Radicchio to be somewhat bitter, but that is the nature of this beast.  Fresh mixed greens and a very good light Balsamic Vinaigrette overpowered the bitterness in any event, and the salad portion was quite generous.    Service was efficient and helpful.  The companionship of fellow Yelpers was enjoyable, and of course the food was great!  It was a fine and memorable UYE.  And, I plan to be back often to introduce other pizza aficionados with whom I am well acquainted, to the magical tastes that regularly emerge from the wood burning oven of Settebello.

Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. An Emilia

ViPszDt2CY6cR6PpyfAiZg.text: Grab your fork and knife.  No slices here.  True Napolitano pizza in Vegas (or as close as you're gonna get without a trip to Italy).  So it's a small chain of restaurants, all good.  Quality ingredients atop a perfectly blistered, chewy, well seasoned crust served by a proud and friendly staff.  Win!    This is the real deal.  They even follow the the standards laid down by the Italian government that define such trivial things as the basic ingredients of the crust, its thickness, and the cooking temperature.  The Margherita DOC is excellent.  The standard to judge all Napolitano pizza by, a simple base of crushed, ripe, acidic tomatoes, fresh milky Mozzarella, fresh basil, and a splash of EVOO.  Near perfect.  The diavola with its fennel flavored, gently aged finnochiona, sweet roasted peppers, garlic and mozzarella equally good.  Too simple?  The pizza Capricciosa with its aged, porky porsciutto, oil poached artichoke hearts mushrooms olives basil all atop the same sweet, acidic tomato pure topped with fresh mozzarella, outstanding without being overloaded with toppings.  The only weakness, the namesake Settebello.  The sausage lacked the aged, umame flavor so characteristic in Italian cured meats.  A minor point considering.  Very inexpensive for the quality.  Now if they would just move the tables much closer, encourage chatting it up with your neighbors, get some disposable paper table coverings and serve an abundance of wine....

3WRiIfGf_ly_-DCAYCSaag.text: This is very good, but not cheap Italian food. The meatballs are prob the best I've ever tried. The rigatoni was ok, and the pizza is pretty good. The caprese salad was amazing! Must try their mozzarella:)

E79nyRvlh2iVkLft7dWZxA.text: I have heard so many good things about Settebello and I finally got to try it!  First of all, the service is amazing - from the hostess to the server to the busser. Someone was always checking to see if we needed refills or anything else. I tipped generously for that.   Second, the decor was cute and very authentic looking. I've been to Italy and Settebello blended the wood and marble aesthetic perfectly.   As far as the food goes, I wasn't super impressed with the pizza brisket I got which is why I'm not giving 5 stars; it just felt like it was missing something. Also, while the meatballs were good, there was a lot of bread in them (sometimes more bread than meat).   Overall, I would definitely come back again and try something different!

ridMIAEa6bR0Krl3RVyGOQ.text: Still my favorite pizza place in Las Vegas, and actually anywhere!   I always order the Diavola with poached egg, garlic, and uncut. When I get the pizza with the soft yolk, I break it and spread it all over the pizza like a sauce. Somehow yolks add a creamy flavor to things that cannot be imitated with anything else I know of....yummy. Don't forget to ask for the spicy olive oil to drench over your pizza. The housemade chili oil adds a great kick.   If you have leftovers and decide to take it home, warm it up in an oven or eat it cold. Microwaving would destroy the nice crusty crust.   Service either inside, at the bar or outside is always friendly. It really seems like the staff likes working here and with each other. This reminds me of my restaurant days.

1Gcs5NQS0lBL8yo8j5vzeQ.text: We came here for pizza but what really stole the show was the cheese plate which is why it is getting a four star rating! It was so yummy! It came with several different types of cheeses, fruits, honey and jam. The honey was amazing! Sadly they didn't know the type of honey that is served with the platter but I would love to add it to my kitchen cupboard. I would need to get this again if we decide to go back.  For pizza we ordered the Pizza Bolognese. It was pretty good but since the sauce was so heavy it made the pizza flimsy and not crispy at the bottom. If you don't mind your pizza not as crispy I think you'd enjoy it. I did like all the sauce because it tasted good I just wish the pizza was toasted more at the bottom.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Bolognese pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Cheese plate

1hxHp56A-IXqToAZUYOymA.text: Ahhh Settebello. I have fallen in love with you like everyone else. So here is another 5 star review. Whoopee!   This is my kind of pizza place. Amazing food, great value, friendly service, and intimate setting. If you like extremely greasy, loaded on cheese, Pizza Hut style pizza, stop reading now because this place is too good for you.  Settebello has the perfect crust where the edges are fluffy yet crispy, and the rest is thing and delicious. They are constantly adding new pizzas to the menu and always are great. House made, fresh ingredients and never overdoing the sauce OR the cheese. I am truly happy after devouring a pizza with my husband here. My personal favorite, the Diavola and they have one currently with Jalapeno jelly that is the best white pizza I've ever had. I'm not even a huge fan of white pizza.   The salads and the appetizers are to die for. When I can get a salad that consists solely of arugula and no other greens, I'm a happy girl.   Settebello you continue to impress. Keep doing you.

8C4cm7e5pWH8E5Z1ZygGYw.text: Great, unique pizza. Not standard, run of the mill stuff. Always fresh. Highly recommend eating in, as the pizza isn't the same with takeout. Good appetizers. Whole family enjoys it.

6-io4PGeFao74eigp816cA.text: I enjoy their pizzas and wish we would make it there more. One of my favorite aspects of this restaurant is there attention to allergies. My sons are allergic to eggs, gluten, dairy, and nuts. This place is one of the few aware of the sensitivities when serving this population! I truly appreciate it!

rTrO_YRmHS6nar8TCKJ_FA.text: 2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge -     15/100 Michelle's Foodie Adventures - Eat Pray Loving my way through Vegas.  First stop, Settebello.   Been wanting to try this place out for a while now, and I finally did on my birthday!   Service was great -- server was patient, friendly and helpful with suggestions and questions.  The ambiance & decor was gorgeous -- loved the walls and the bathroom too!   It was a Saturday late afternoon and there was no wait.   I'm looking forward to trying their happy hour one day.    My favorites were the foccacia and the brisket pizza. These are both a MUST have if you haven't tried them before.   Foccacia - appetizer - soft pita-like? bread - you have to try it yourself. I tried searching Whole Foods, Trader Joes & most grocery stores for this... and Trader Joe's has foccacia but it's not the same.   The Brisket Pizza -- This was so flavorful. I haven't seen this concept anywhere else. If you love meat, this right here. You have to try it. Luckily my brother ordered it or I wouldn't have know how onoliscious this is. Better than the pizza I chose.    - If you can't decide between two pizzas then ask for half and half pizza, you can try both.    So far, this is my favorite pizza place in Vegas.   Other tidbits:  -there is a bar area with televisions.  - great for groups - in the District at Green Valley so there's shopping, movie theaters, parks, and casino near by. The District is gorgeous at night, great for a date night stroll. :-)  - after we ate here it inspired us to make some Italian / Napoletana inspired dishes.   I will definitely be back!

Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. This was my fave, the brisket pizza

q6IB2-iaRed2bkrbq-TODA.text: I recently ate here for the second time and don't know why I haven't been coming here more often. I really enjoyed my dinner and the prices even more.   The menu has so many great options. I finally decided on the Diavola pizza. The crust was perfect, spice level was perfect, and the amount of toppings was perfect. The ingredients all tasted high quality and fresh as well. Definitely no complaints on this option.   My husband had the Carbonara pizza and added sausage. He loved that they offer additional toppings, especially his favorite, extra meat. Again, everything was perfect with this pizza as well.  I loved the portion of the pizza. My husband was hungry so for him the size was perfect for one meal. I opted to eat half here and save the other half for leftovers the next night. The thin crust pizza makes a nice meal without feeling like you are overeating.   Settebello is a great weeknight option as well. We rarely eat out on weeknights because of time constraints, but Settebello was quick getting our food out. I love that I have a spot to eat on weeknights without spending too much time.  We were really impressed when the check came out. Pricing is more than reasonable for the quality of the food.

h_r7TOVu7HjRWnGEYsC2sg.text: We have been here many times. It reminded me of a pizza we had in Sorrento. I then discovered they fly their ingredients in from Italy. This is authentic Italian pizza. It doesn't get better an more authentic than this. If you want Pizza Hut or Round Table go someplace else. If you want to taste real Italian pizza without the trip go to Settobello.

3wgNgwzKxPPM_f3Fn6AuXA.text: After reading reviews I couldn't wait to try this place. I ordered the beet salad and the santebello pizza. The salad was good. But the pizza was what I was really looking forward to! And I will say I was alittle let down. I didn't really love the flavors of this pizza.

kWUsqC0z1oYA_EhBnGQ0Jw.text: I love this place! To get my husband to eat vegetables on a regular basis is a whole ordeal, but he actually enjoys their beet and arugula salad without a fight!! Seriously, even if you think you hate beets, you won't after you try this here! Of course Settebellos is known for its  Neapolitan style pizzas and every one we've had has been excellent. There's one topped with a mouthwatering peppery brisket, many topped with Italian meats and cheeses, others cater to a more vegetarian palate. Just remember to pair your meals with a cold fine glass of Prosecco or an Italian birra, followed with a scoop of Rum raisin gelato or a slice of their unforgettable Tiramisu! Oh boy I'm getting HUNGRY just writing about it!!!!

CrFYUkNL4G_Jib3qfWm5tA.text: Love pizza. Flavor, ingredients  service  excellent  Can wait to come back again    . .  . . .

Kallk6ILSjQbwJ-eWDU0mw.text: There are many very good 4-star pizza places in town with comparably good 4-star pizzas. What really puts this place at the top for me is the top-notch service and the fact that you can replace the regular mozzarella in any of the pizzas on their menu with BUFFALO mozzarella. This was a fabulous surprise for me because I am lactose intolerant and have been missing out on pizza for awhile now. So hooray for Settebello!

t2vw5AiKk4FDSCAvav-Aqg.text: I had the Capricciosa with crushed tomatoes, prosciutto cotto, artichokes, mushrooms, olives, mozzarella and basil. I was with my students from Italy and they approved! They said that besides the pine nuts that it was very close to the pizza back home. They also ordered Canolli and Gelato for dessert. As an added bonus, it is close to my home. I will be back.

YiLEv5vYgOxI2_mqCR4OZQ.text: Quality ingredients and a wood-burning stove make the pizza sold here delicious at reasonable prices! There are all different flavor combinations. My personal favorites are the Bianca pizza which is prosciutto and mozzarella, and the Quattro Formaggi which is a mix of fontina, gorgonzola, mozzarella, and parmesan. The focaccia is something I always order as well.  The ambience of the restaurant serves many purposes. You can easily celebrate a special event here, or stop by for lunch or dinner. The dining area has a nice ambience, and feels homey. It is clean and the service is attentive and professional. You get all this, but the prices are reasonable, so it doesn't break the bank.  The dining area isn't large, so if you have a large party, call in advance to make sure you can be accommodated, the tables can be moved together, but you will still be limited. Of all the pizza places this one is in my top five favorites.

2Tr83Ad9XMBrPUwNYq5SuA.text: Inferior experience, fails to justify the prices. You can get the same soggy pizza with good quality ingredients at Blaze for literally half the price, and then some.  The night we went, the person in charge of cutting the pizza could not even cut the pizza properly, or the slicer was dull. So we had to cut it ourselves.  Primary service was good, secondary service horrible. Was brought a self-serve unit of peppers in response to a request for cheese.  Doubt that we'll be back.

Tyler who was our server, gladly brought us another table's pizza (real quick) so I could take a photo of it. I love the thin crust Italian style pizza. Great options to choose from. Bellini's on Sunday with numerous options.. I chose Passion fruit ;-). If you like traditional Italian Pizza, get your slice at Settebello! This was a True Sunday Funday!

The dessert pizza with Nutella and strawberries was also great.  I tried my first Moscow Mule here. Wasn't a fan of the drink, but I dig that they have the proper mule cups.

J02xbDTBkRRBQtnOhyonxQ.text: To make things simple the pizzas were under cooked, over priced,& over rated. On the 4 cheese pizza which i ordered the cheeses were not evenly distributed on the pizza, each slice had different cheese flavors and was lacking cheese in total. The crust was mushy & soft.

nuIstP5MIYv9MdS-KehuPA.text: First time eating at Settebello this afternoon, and I was impressed! I came with my whole family - wife and five kids. We were promptly seated and introduced to the menu. The hostess provided coloring pages and crayons to keep our youngest three kids occupied. Our waiter, Patrick, did a great job answering questions and was very congenial and attentive throughout the meal. The ambience was casual yet classy, with a stone and wood pizzeria hearth motif. We ordered a beet salad as an appetizer. The salad was super fresh - sweet beets, sweet carrots, spinach-style salad leaves sprinkled with a tangy oil based dressing with rich crumbled cheese and pine nuts. We all ordered pizzas, which come in 8" and 12" sizes. As a man with a big appetite, I found the 8" Settebello pizza to be filling. I was able to sample from all the pizzas my family ordered: Cheese pizza, House Sausage pizza, pizza with pear & jalapeno marmalade sauce, and pizza with Calabrese meat. All had rich, fresh, tasty ingredients and were very flavorful. Understand the nature of this style of pizza is it is thinner, chewier, and able to fold like a taco. Excellent pizza, excellent customer service, I highly recommended this restaurant!

fehDn3dg6OnnhyVBvtptOg.text: I love their pizza!!! The whole "my eyes are bigger then my stomach" thing takes place and then (at Settebello's) after the "just one more bite, okay now just ONE more bite..." my delicious pizza has vanished into digestive bliss.

V4I4Og1wYYx5N7Fp9Q48hA.text: I swear I reviewed this restaurant before....   Anyways, I had a chance to go back last night, and it was as good as I remembered. However, I don't think it deserves a five star rating because of the inconsistent service and small portion sizes.   We started out with the Caprese (tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, olive oil, and sea salt), and the Misto (meat, cheese, and vegetable sampler).  The tomatoes in the Caprese salad had seen better days, and the mozzarella was -just OK. The Italian meat selection in the Misto was quality, but I was not a fan of eggplant or olives that came with appetizer.   We decided to share 2 pizzas for 5 adults. First we chose the Margherita which was basically a cheese pizza with a touch of basil throughout. What I really liked about this pizza was the tomato sauce.  It is flavorful and not too thick and pasty -like other pizza places. Our second pizza was the Settebello which was really different and delicious. What I liked about this particular pizza was the addition of toasted pine nuts. It gave the pizza a nice crunch and went perfectly with the sausage, pancetta, and mushrooms.  For dessert we chose the nutella pizza.  This amazing dessert is their pizza dough with nutella, bananas, almonds, and powdered sugar on top. Messy - but worth it! I was only able to get a bite of this wonderful treat because my wife turns into the incredible Hulk if you mess with her dessert.  Next time, we may have to order 2 nutella pizzas......

7YPKV-P5T2jZufH0kVJp7Q.text: Food was great! Had the arugula wrapped with prosciutto and a margherita doc. Alcohol was a little warm and our order was incorrect first time so I knocked off a star. Servers were friendly. Will come back again.

eWcTdCLMdJsMFga5G-j3Ag.text: I usually am not a fan of thin pizza, but Settebello is amazing.  This traditional pizzeria is always a treat for my family.

TdFYB0kmgJ04aC7_Cz3LWQ.text: The pizza is great but I hate how fast it gets cold..... My girl loves it!

dPe3b0VaBNHLVAAOKXMGqw.text: Love this place! Delicious pizza. And i am very picky about my pizza. Lovely server. Clean atmosphere. Also good for take out service!

pPzOH0hSC6gvIBzDR8WoOw.text: If you are looking for excellent pizza with high-quality ingredients, Settebello is the place to go. There aren't any unnecessary bells and whistles - the short, one-page menu lists just a few appetizers alongside the pizza, but the small selection ensures that every item you eat there is delicious. The pricing is reasonable, bordering on inexpensive, for the quality of the food you're getting.   Don't skip the appetizers! The salads are especially fresh and beautifully-constructed. I would recommend the Panzanella salad to share; it's light enough that it won't distract you from your pizza later, but with flavor and body from the shaved cheese and proscuitto crisps to make it worth your while.  As for the pizza, the dough is thin and soft with just a bit of a crunch; it'll fall apart if you try lifting the slices and eating by hand. You'll be happier in the end for having to pick up your knife and fork, though. You'll appreciate the distinctness of the ingredients; the toppings aren't drowning in seas of cheese and sauce and grease, and every bite is different and delicious.   The food is definitely the number-one selling point at Settebello, and the ambiance is a good second, with the cozy-but-classy casual atmosphere. The service needs a bit of work though - it's just "okay". For the excellence of the food they're serving, the average-ness of the wait staff is a bit of a letdown. They're efficient, but lukewarm at best on their own. They do a little better if you break the ice yourself, though. Don't hesitate to ask your server for clarification if you need help with the menu and all the Italian food terms, they give good advice.

Rjk6uSBSA0YXAxbWibFfvA.text: Note, this pizza is real Neapolitan style pizza. So you are getting a pizza that is not loaded with a ton of ingredients, rather fewer toppings and more simple, traditional, sauce and dough.   The service is fast, food always good, and staff very friendly. The pizzas are cooking in a wood fire oven that gets over 900 degrees F. Takes approximately one minute to cook giving the pizza's a thin crispy on the outside chewy on the inside crust. Most of the ingredients are imported from Italy, and the cook moved from Italy to help the owner start the location, which was originally of horizon and valley view.   If you like your pizzas with so much cheese and the sauce loaded with so many seasonings that it doesn't even taste like tomatoes then this is not the place for you. If you like authentic simple recipes and high quality ingredients, for an all in all reasonable price, then you will enjoy this restaurant.

GWfMIesvF4_bNOpdqE9fZg.text: The pizza was pretty good but our waiter, tam, was spectacular. He was enthusiastic, had a smile on everytime i saw him. Was very good at checking on our table regularly. Thanks Tam!

JFNpRA7_8SALUML0ungqaw.text: I was surprised to find real Neapolitan pizza in this area. This is the real deal.   Vera pizza. Qui si mangia bene.

k_Z7stSpG-fTH2xhkB1tRQ.text: My favorite place to go for pizza!  I always order the same thing. ..the capricciosa.  My husband likes to go here for their gluten free crust (which you can order 24 hours in advance).  The service is always good here and I always leave with a full and happy tummy!

I4WwxsjkZTvny5Zkypnm5g.text: My husband and I came for lunch one day and were immediately handed a regular menu which describes each pizza as well as a special lunch priced menu (the 2 basic pizzas on the menu were priced at $7.00 each and any other pizza on the menu was $9.00, all till 3:00 PM).  This special lunch "menu" consists of a laminated card which just states the pricing - no items are listed in detail - you have to refer to the regular menu for that.  We thoroughly enjoyed our pizzas which were delicious and for the price, what a deal!  A few days later we came back with guests who were visiting us.  First of all, this time we were not handed the lunch priced menu -we had to ask for it.  Okay- no problem - maybe they forgot, (or maybe not!)  All four of us each ordered a pizza.  Again, delicious.  Now time for the bill.  Lo and behold we were charged the regular prices ($13 - $15 instead of $7 - $9).  We questioned the waiter who said he didn't realize we wanted the lunch prices.  Hello - why would we ask for the lunch priced menu and then order the same items for full price?  It was obvious we knew enough to ask for the lunch priced menu and then we wouldn't order off of it?  A little deceptive, I'm afraid.  We could have made a bigger deal out of it but we had guests with us and didn't really want to carry on.  So, just want others to be aware - be very specific when ordering and tell your server that you are ordering off the lunch priced menu or you just might be charged full price.

jlAZBGLVHMaoBvQ6D7IuwQ.text: Searching Yelp for a pizza place close by my house I read the reviews for Settebello and decided to make a Whole Foods and Lunch outing. I'm so glad that I did. I can't believe I never really noticed this place since I shop at this Whole Foods a good bit, but it's fairly inconspicuous.   When it comes to pizza I try to be pretty open minded. I worked for a pizza trade magazine for over a year. In that year I had tried more pizza than any one person should probably eat. I have a hard time saying anything is "the best" since I try to appreciate each style for it's own merit. Saying that, it actually means a lot of me to give a pizza place a 5 star. This has to be some of the BEST pizza I've had in YEARS.   What to expect? VERY thin crust pizza with very fresh ingredients. The menu isn't huge. I've had a few pizzas now and even tried their proscuitto/goat cheese salad [can't remember the name]. Be aware though that since the pizza is so thin even I can eat an entire one by myself and I don't eat that much. I have definitely enjoyed several afternoons of pizza and bourbon before I went shopping. I probably should reverse that order though since I wind up drinking too much bourbon and buying random junk at Whole Foods.   On a side note I would watch the "bartenders" is you drink anything besides wine or beer. I drink my bourbon on the rocks. The last time I went the bartender neither knew what Maker's was (it's the best they have) and he was about to shake my bourbon in a shaker before I stopped him. I find it a little comical now but was a little taken aback then.   I definitely think this is the best pizza in Las Vegas and some of the best I've had in a long time.

KCAQvbdlgjQ-ZbKQIZRCRg.text: Food was really good but the service was horrible! The salads were very good and refreshing. The pizzas were amazing! We will return but probably to-go since the service was bad. When we arrived there were 2 other tables in his section and I thought ok maybe he's new or something but he only got worse as the tables left. We not once asked for several items so it's not like we were asking for much, just you know basic service. We ran out of drinks multiple times and we had a pile of dishes that the nice runner had to take. When he dropped check he didn't even offer dessert or say thanks. We had to get up and there were like 5-6 employees and they were all trying to get his attention to pay us out. Wow..maybe it was a rough day?

31x9F87mni1j_etw2GrMuA.text: This is my favorite pizza place. Ryan the server is very attentive and friendly. Highly recommend this place

mwCPyC6Wq6hiVC_lXmG_xQ.text: Would have to say this is my favorite pizza place, forget any of the chain pizza places, setebellos is the place to go. I enjoy going to setebellos on the days I crave pizza. My favorite pizza to get is the bolognese pizza. No specific reason except that it matches my taste buds really well. While it can get crowded every now and again I still enjoy it every time as the pizza is always worth it!

VJPn78OHreRGNdACTAZmRQ.text: Settebello's has added a happy hour from 3-6 M-F (I believe) and it is fantastic.  The food offered is different and delicious and the drink specials are good.  Brian served us and he couldn't have been nicer.  His recommendations were spot on, however, I would add a salad (their involtini is amazing) to the happy hour hors d'oeuvres and it would be a complete meal.  Brian said they filled up later in the evening but we were there at 5:30 and did not wait.  I am sure it is worse on Fridays.

3jiazR6RDCZKPc8RU4evhg.text: Good place for lunch. Had a nice lunch with pizza and had to take most it home. Great crust and great sauce!!!

566vVcZwBvwFrQlo12_nSg.text: This is excellent Napoli style pizza. Haven't had better anywhere, not even Italy. Great salads and house made gelato. Consistently delicious!

YxjyRAttAdDL7OKYP9y1cg.text: This spot is amazing! I travel Vegas for work and I'm always looking for a great eating spot. This place is truly authentic. I am a fan!  Bolognese and Margharita my fav

SLCbbzRDzPU1uH-8t8wu-w.text: Thank God for Settebello! It turns out that I've been under a rock for over 20 years. Did you know that "pizza" joints do not truly make real pizza? Unless it's Vera-certified (aka Verace-certified) then what they're making is an imitation. Quick history lesson: Pizza originated in Napoli, Italy. There, they set the bar for how pizza should be made. Since then, "pizza" has been replicated in different ways but many have not followed the original guidelines. So bottom line, unless it has a Vera certification of authenticity, it's not pizza. The good news is that Settebello IS. And, it's AWESOME. What we ordered: Pizza Lasagna $11.99 Settebello Pizza $12.99 GET THIS! Awesome textures and flavor profiles Special Pizza with white figs and ricotta In order to be True pizza, the ingredients and process have to be specific. For example, the flour is imported from Napoli. And it makes for a perfect crust. Their crust has a bite to it, but it's not crispy or cracker-like. It still maintains a doughy consistency, and I love that it's not bready. Toppings are generous and are not overpowering. Flavor combinations can be simple like a Margharita, but fear not foodies! They can also be very creative and different. One thing I was skeptical about was that they don't use tomato sauce. It's a no-no according to the Verace Association. (Yup. They even have an organization to mandate pizza... they're hardcore!). Instead, they use crushed tomatoes which I found to be SOOO much better. I want my pizza that way from now on thank you very much. There are only a few Vera-certified pizza places around and can be found here: pizzanapoletana.org/show... Please de-virginize yourself if you have not yet tasted True pizza. And if you're in the Las Vegas area, please make a visit to Settebello. And tell your friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. White pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. MMMM pizza

Igq_ys9QNaeZV22Pa7wxbg.text: I have been on a gluten free diet for a few years now. It makes it difficult to get great pizza. However in Las Vegas I am lucky to have more than a handful of choices. Many places buy the gluten free crust from a supplier, this is not the case at Settebello.   It used to be that you would need to call 24 hours in advance to get their gluten free pizzas, but that policy changed about 2 months ago, so you can now get it anytime.   Everyone in our party enjoyed our pizzas and appetizers and the service was excellent. I believe them that the crust was made in house and cooked very quickly and very hot. It was by far the best gluten-free crust I've ever had anywhere in the U.S. I had mine with Buffalo Mozzarella and it was great! I will be back to try more.

P5dG70701NLs0AGCOZyKrA.text: Split a salad and a pizza with a loved one for a wonderful tasty meal.  The pizzas and salads are always tasty and satisfying now only to the eye, but more importantly to the belly.  A bit more expensive than other pizza joints, but you fo' sho' get what you pay for here.

bl214PvxwNwaKOThFXjKhQ.text: This place is so delicious! I've gone here many times. The tomato sauce on the pizza is so sweet and like nothing I've ever had before. It reminds me of eating pizza in Italy. They have a good happy hour but the wait staff doesn't seem to know much about it. I think it's small pizza's for $5 and half off all drinks. Last time I went they only told me about the drinks when I asked and then I did some research and called and found out about the small pizzas. That's a great deal. They should push that more. Anyway I love this place and you will too, so just go! Ok? Ok.

61vablHNG8t8UAHXkV8O2Q.text: Delicious. Their ensalada grande is still on of my favorites, with mushrooms, pine nuts and artichokes. My friend and I both had a Californian Nebbiolo, which was tasty and in hindsight, we should have split a bottle, but the server didn't recommend it and we didn't think of it. Service was nice, not overbearing but attentive. I had the diavala, which was super yummy and my friend, the Bianca with prosciutto and arugula. Both were tasty, but I felt were missing something.... Something spicy, perhaps, more than just dry chili flakes.

ZOtz4KEMfAr9EYvaybevmw.text: The place was great! The staff was very helpful and attentive and the food was great! I ordered the Settebello pizza and it came out so quickly! I would definitely come here again, 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Settebello Pizza

DqlvOAwu512LnOEz60oT7w.text: Very good pizza. I've had the margarita, diavola, settebello, and one with hamburger meat in it. The pizza is really good compared to most places. I would say my favorite was the margarita. Good portion of sauce to cheese. Diavola was good, but I could have done without the red chiles. Settebello was interesting and good. The hamburger one was not good in my opinion. The dough and bread they use is fantastic. The sauce is ok, not a fan of the toppings or how all the cheese an topping slide right off as you go to eat it. Overall, not my favorite, but a pretty good spot for Napoleon style of pizza.

zhaGUnxoOy72Ov8GRIcLng.text: We had a late dinner here. They bake the pizza at 900 degrees for one minute. It feels a bit burned. I had mixed feelings about it. Atmosphere was nice. Service was just right. Would like to try other items in their menu next time.

YS3YkKZnJWTh7q3pK7kKZA.text: VPN-Vero Pizza Napoletana,,,,,Thats what sets Settebello apart from all the other pizzerias in town. It is the stamp of approval given by the pizza making authority in Italy, and only a handful of establishments in the U.S. have been given this distinction, so if you come across any of these establishments sporting the VPN signage on their front door, you know its the real deal like you would find in Naples, All you pizza snobs stop comparing it to NY or Chicago style, because it doesn't even compare! They're trying to keep tradition and integrity by following the traditional pizza making ways as they do IN NAPLES! If you want Pepperoni or Pineapple, CALL DOMINOS!!!  Okay, done with my rant...on to my review. Been going to Settebellos ever since they were first located on Valle Verde and Horizon Ridge. It was hidden away and not too many people knew about this place until they made the move to The District. The ingredients are top-notch, and ALL their pizzas are the BOMB! I've tried everything- Margherita, Carbonara, Ripieno, etc. and my favorite, The Settebello. The ONLY way to devour all this goodness is the minute it is placed in front of you and there's no better way to finish with an Affogatto,Double espresso with a scoop of gelato. Looking forward to return again soon,,,ALOHA!!!

37swpI4L5tkbao6x9InB7w.text: We have been coming here  for years and I check in most times (obviously). I love this place and my kid loves this place. I like some of the new menu items and changes over the years.   Couple of things that kept me and my daughter from giving 5 stars  Bring back the Italian craft beers.   Bring back the chocolate syrup to make chocolate milk.   Please and thank you.

gAxhfaStGMR7vx2GCCqAQQ.text: I had always passed this little cute pizzeria place when I would head to whole foods. This place is great! I had traveled to Italy in July 2013 and we stayed in Rome. The first thing that I wanted to try was the pizza and pasta of course! It was just divine. The Italians use fresh ingredients and the brick oven was the key! Settebello brought me back to Italy. I was a little skeptic because I really wanted some good pizza. My brother and a friend accompanied me on my birthday. We got our drinks right away when we were seated which is a plus for me. The waiter gave us a little more time to look at the menu because it was my first time. It was fun trying to pronounce the words but the had things that I recognized like the caprese or the cheese platter, and the meat platter which I must go back for. We settled for the carbonara pizza and the settebello. I loved that you could see the brick oven and let me tell you, when a pizza is made in a brick oven you won't be able to eat regular pizza again! The food came out and we dug in right away. The ingredients were so fresh, you could taste the basil and the herbs that were on the settebello, the yummy sausage and the mushrooms. The cheese and sauce just looked so authentic. The way they scrambled the egg on the carbonara was perfect, the flavors were bold and tasty. I really recommend anyone looking for a place to try authentic Italian pizza to try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The settebello $13 or $14. Amazing
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. This is the carbonara $13 or $14. Delicious!

5V7oW3B8bfaO2tiwOvK2xQ.text: Been to this location plenty of times. Great food nice set up love this place. Highly recommended for napolitano pizza!

Dfl__0I_n_rW3yvL6BR01w.text: Vico pizza was the best I've ever had. I'm here for the second time to have the same pizza. I can't get enough.

tmxeJQ9LZynq5C05YD9yUg.text: We went here for dinner on Saturday night and my Emilia pizza blew me away! I havent stopped thinking about it since and cant wait to go back and get it again! We sat outside on the lovely patio covered in beautiful flowers. It was great!

gCcJAK3NbEaLx3GrF6jLRw.text: The wait staff was awesome and the pizza was on point.  The flavor profiles were so unique and great, this place definitely carved a memorable flavor on my tastebuds.  I was not impressed by the special of the week, a calzone which lacked ingredients.  Will be sticking to the pizza's in the future!

crC4TVMwR0TGEAw6o6X22Q.text: Great service.  Grandson eats gluten free and they have the best ever. Gluten free margarita . Yummy.

4np3PWCE_e5MJp3j8V22ZA.text: I suffer from an addiction to pizza, and I have an overwhelming sense of urgency to try every single pizza joint I come across. I may need an intervention. I didn't come here to compare this to other pizza places in town, and if you are, you might be disappointed because you can't put this up against NY style or Chicago style, this is in a class of it's own......Neopolitan. Side note, this is the only VPN certified place in Las Vegas, and only one of two places in Nevada.  What we ordered...  Quattro Formaggi-Crushed Tomatoes, Fontina Cheese, Gorgonzola Cheese, Fresh Mozzarella, Parmigiano Reggiano, Basil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, I loved the strong taste of gorgonzola cheese, my aunt's thought it was a bit overwhelming, but I love cheese.  Margherita DOC- Crushed Tomatoes,Imported Buffalo Mozzarella, Basil, Parmigiano Reggiano, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, now if you look at their menu, there is two Margherita pizzas, please choose the DOC. The difference is the imported buffalo mozzarella, and it's excellent. DOC is denominazione di origine controllata, which translates to, controlled designation of origin, basically quality assurance for food products like cheese and wine, if you have ever seen a Chianti with a pink wrapping around the cork, it will say DOCG this way you are assured it's not manipulated.    Ended the meal with Torta della Nonna, I love lemon and especially when it's a chilled tart, nothing better in the summer, but this I felt fell short of anything special. It tasted old like it had been in the made a couple days prior and sat in the fridge.   Big props for all of the ingredients they import, and list on the menu.

UkTVgN1KcX8swbVdElkD5w.text: Yes, it's a chain....but a really good one. Service was quick. Order an Insalata Grande along with your pizza. One of THE best side salads I've tasted anywhere. The personal pizza's look big but the crust is super thin, by design. You can finish it.

tvyBxp9wx_tfGqbztydaiQ.text: My love for Neapolitan pizza started when I lived in Italy.  So to find out such a place like Settebello existed off strip in Vegas was amazing to me. We shared the Frito antipasta and Insalata Grande.  The focaccia was toasted perfectly and almost light for bread.  It paired well with the cured meats (especially the prosciutto), artichokes and bits of cheese.  The salad had super fresh ingredients and the perfectly dressed.  We ordered the Capriccosca pizza but substituted the prosciutto crudo instead of the cotto just because that's my favorite type of pizza. Definitely was not disappointed at all!

GAWPGxPV5KfteX2XDz6QXA.text: Wow I am so happy that the Bolognese is permanently on the menu!!! By far the best sauce that we have ever tasted!!! We still love the other pizzas but this quickly won as our new favorite pizza! There is no doubt why this was crowned the best pizza in Nevada!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza!!!!

Uy2pZMNQBU6YFBCVvpLsKA.text: Half tempted to go down to two stars based on the service. There were five of us co-workers, so as usual we asked for separate checks rights away. We all asked for water except one guy who asked for a soda. So at the end the guy looks at the receipts and says " I didn't charge you for the soda, don't worry about it". That's because you charged me for the soda! So I politely waited and told a different server about the soda charge and it was correct but my new bill had charged an extra .50 for the meat.. Heck with it! I paid for my meal plus .50 They were nice but waiting and waiting for refills and our order was too much.    The pizzas were good. We kinda did a spread where we all shared various pizzas. My favorite was the margarita (sp). The claim to be part of a secret pizza cult and this maintain True Italian style pizza, so of your in the mood for NY/ American style pizza then this isn't the joint to goto. The pizzas come in personal style only. I do like the food. Quite a bit uppetty on their prices. But then again look at the location.  Probably wont come back, with cheaper choices elsewhere for the same flavors. Nice ambience and a great setting for a date night

_JwvqGWaiJSWJ0mQSdi9MQ.text: This place does it right. My family and I frequent Settabello  d we love it across the board. Pizza is done in the traditional Napolitano way. D the salads are great , I highly recommend he Panzanella.  The pizza is perfect light and fluffy dough made with the highest quality ingredients and they always feature new creations monthly. Order a bottle of wine, sit back and enjoy a nice relaxing Italian pizza experience.  The service is attentive as well and I highly recommend this establishment.

ik_f3feB-CYppAUTG0D_fQ.text: This was our first visit here .  It had been recommend many times and assured us it would feel like Italy. I think our server was Justin not sure but the service was fast, friendly and good. I hate the new "artisan " pizza that has a blop of cheese then a huge leaf then a blop of cheese.  Having just vacationed in Rome that is not how it is done!!! This pizza was out of this world and the sauce was not the red canned tomato crap on most pizzas, it was delicious.  Then we finished it of with the best gelato we have had since being in Europe.  It was a great night and so inexpensive we cannot wait to go back and try the prosciutto platter we saw walking by!!! T

fMm6Y_NKNVQL_2McFiN3pQ.text: Awesome pizzas and absolutely delicious. Had 2: pizza Pere e jalapeno and Diavlo - both were really good but Pere e jalapeno was unforgettable. Will definitely go back for that alone.

5mspiyO_Na__V_miqDJehQ.text: I went here on a date Saturday around 8p.  I wasn't too impressed w/ the service or food.  I arrived a bit after my date was already seated. The waitress walked by me several times and didn't acknowledge me at all. After 20 min she came back to ask if we were ready to order, so I suggested she start w/ brining us water.  I guess she didn't like me for the rest of the night lol She was short and rude w/ us.  Basic 'hello, my name is____,' is not too much to ask for.  We ordered two different pizzas, but they looked exactly the same lol i normally would have questioned it, but I was on a 1st date so I kept my mouth shut. She never came by to ask how our food was or anything. She just dropped off the check while walking by.  The pizza was not good enough to deal w/ such bad service. Definetly not going back.

PqmeRIvrKMY5I_pheJY2Mg.text: This place is great. The staff are friendly and helpful and the food is excellent. We shared the Settebello pizza and the Insalata Grande. The pizza was awesome. I loved the sauce, and the pine nuts on it added a nice texture and flavor. The salad was good, but less interesting than the pizza. I'd definitely go back next time I'm in the area!

KFT_vMKEej6UQUv87-Ulyg.text: Good Italian Pizza.  If you want a pizza with pepperoni, this is not the place for you.

V-BC1regVc3zLZKdnSDpaA.text: I live all the way on the other side of town, so I seldom venture to this neighborhood. But this past Sunday (6/11/13), we were trying out a movie at the new Galaxy theater and decided to take advantage of the opportunity to try a restaurant on that side of town. After hearing amazing things about Settebello for years, we chose it.  It was amazing!!! The pizzas on the menu are all very interesting sounding - great combinations of flavors. It was really hard to decide. We chose one tomato-based pizza and one without tomato sauce: the Settebello and the Vico. We both preferred that Vico by quite a bit, but both were amazing. They both had the same Italian sausage and buffalo mozzarella that melted into a wet, gooey sauce all over the pizza. I think what put the Vico over the edge is that in addition to the melty cheesy goodness, it has thick cream on it as well. The crust for both pizzas was perfect - doughy but not too thick. Definitely upgrade to the buffalo mozzarella for any pizza! You can do that for only $3!  Service was really nice and attentive, and the space has a great feel - open ceilings so that you can see the air ducts and a bit of the loft look. I don't know how often we'll make the drive all the way over there, but I will definitely stop in anytime I'm on that side of town!

2M4RVyKBdQqyqR1pBtgkcg.text: LOVE this place the pizza was fresh and tasted just like it did when I lived in Italy.  This is going to be my new go to Pizza place.

t6tzj3hzxA28zrZttXZP2g.text: This is the pizza place to splurge on if I can get up and move to get to the place. Most of the time I am too lazy to go and opt for papa johns, but this is the real deal when it comes to great tasting pizza. It also taste better cause it's cheaper than 40$ for one pizza at grimaldis.. haha. No really, I like the pizza here better.

NKI_Q9JXCXkxy1QhDun98w.text: OMG!  I cannot express how happy my pizza made me!  I ordered the pear with jalapeno pizze and it only took one bite to realize how truly wonderful it is.  The artistry of making a True Naples style pizza is right here.  Their wood oven is one to die for.  The crust of pizze is Luke nothing I've had since I was in Italy.  Trust me, when I come back to Vegas, I'm coming here.

nC4w5aYCNDkqc4aVYf27tg.text: Totally legitimate and tasty.  I thought had every iteration of pizza possible until now.  They import almost everything from Italy.  The oven,  flour, and cheeses comes from there.  They use San Marzano tomatoes, from Italy,  which is by far the tastiest all kinds.    The pizza is quite different from what you usually get in the US.  The crust is thin and deliciously chewy.  It is in accordance with the strict pizza guidelines from Naples.

Gl-NDPpIuAGaM9Lr-Xz2Ng.text: I was told a pizza to go would take 10 mins, I have now been here half an hour and still no pizza, and I was told the just put it in the oven now. Trying to cover up and obvious case of a forgotten order.

uGhmE5IpBVGPDjHGyaMVMQ.text: The margharita pizza was delicious!  Lots of great flavors, not soggy and just really good pizza.

oSqOuD7mhOxNMTPbFHXuJw.text: You will dismiss the lack of ambiance when you wrap your lips around a slice of one of Settebello's pizza's..  Fresh ingredients, baked in their wood burning oven Settebello is by far one of the city's tastiest pizza restaurants to date.  The restaurant itself isn't very sexy but who needs sexy and ambiance when you have deliciousness such as their gourmet pizzas?  If you haven't been, you should make an effort to stop by, your taste buds will thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Lasagna Pizza..yum!

Ll29c53X18uDhEBp5LWq1g.text: The food is delicious.  Doesnt matter what you get you'll enjoy it. Servers worked fast and made the wait time go by fast.

K7OUS9QNKSoWLKkbSWTwMQ.text: I give 3.5 stars here.  Essentially, I give 4-5-stars to a place I would return tomorrow.  This pizza didn't do that for me.   And, all 3 of the pizzas we had today seemed to lack ingredients and what little ingredients were included seemed to just fall right off before entering our mouths.  Now I get that the Napolean style, True Italian pizza is supposed to be "wet" like this.  But it was hard to eat - even with a fork and knife like they suggest.    The pizza dough and crust was very good, but sliding cheese and toppings made it too much effort.  We tried the namesake Settebello, the Diavlo, and the kids cheese & sausage.  Hands down, the DIAVLO pizza was the best!  It was spicy and unique enough to stand out and be memorable.  The Settebello was simply forgettable.  We liked that there is a kids-menu (hidden, not on the menu) for $6.50 that is plenty of food for 2 kids, much less one.    They encourage you to order an individual pizza for each adult, but you could easily share one pizza for two people (with a shared salad or appetizer).    While I wanted to love this place and had it bookmarked for several months, it just wasn't my style.  The ambience is nice and the service was good, but I will keep seeking out good pizza in this town!

hH5uDem9xV-iOGpN-Le0WA.text: I've been coming here since they had the first location on Horizon Ridge and the quality has not changed a bit!   If you're looking for authentic fresh Italian pizza, this is the place to go.   I usually order the Panzanella Salad to start and finish with a margarita pizza topped with spicy sausage. AMAZING.   Best part is, the crust is super thin so you can easily devour a whole one to yourself. and trust me, you're not going to want to share

FvKPXE8YQ0x3Kiotl4C3mw.text: I'm not to happy about finding this place. I've lived in Henderson for 9 months and only now find this gem. What a waste of my time going to eat pizza at other restaurants. This is straight forward European tasting pizza. Service was wonderful and I think the restaurant is nice as well. I shouldn't share this with anyone but rumor has it that they have $5 pizza night on Mondays. I'll test this on Monday to see if that's the truth. Wait, never mind, it was horrible. I don't need anyone clogging up the line here and delaying my meal. Delicious!

S4uopeqUwZBHKGAR9ZhKyQ.text: Delicious personal sized pizzas with lightweight fresh crust. It's made in a real brick fire oven in the back, with you can tell by the crusts lightly charred edges, which i personally love. The wine and mixed drink selection here is decent and pairs well with the food type. My date and i ordered a salad as well to split and I'm glad we didn't get two! It quite large, fresh, and tasty ! This is a reasonably priced, cute little date nite spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

5ZKa292O5xD5AqxR9wN7Hw.text: I love this place. It's their simple, quality ingredients that make it amazing. They make authentic Neapolitan pizza. Their drink menu is huge! It took me a good 10 minutes to pick a cocktail to start with. The have a great wine list as well. They have a great happy hour. The cocktails are discounted, the wines are 2 for 1, and the food is mini, but same as their whole menu. The pizza crust is just like the pizzas in Italy. I always leave satisfied.

gxnawipoNyQuN2HpH_5S5g.text: I have been coming here for years. I'm the beginning I use to think it was average/ almost below average but in recent years it has really become one of my favorite quick dinner date spots and has some of the best pizza I've had hands down anywhere. The service is really good and i like that it has a very local feel. The meatballs are really great as well.

KZ_kVmXJ9C6r96_ujbjt2w.text: What can I say, my favorite pizza place in Vegas! Definitely check it out if you haven't yet. Will not disappoint!

mBnvAYEQg8pnzgNXESQKzA.text: Came in during the game and happy hour and the bartender Bryan was still very attentive. Answered a few questions we had about their selection of Bitters and even added my selection to my drink. Friendly and knowledgeable. Great pizza!

h_0SE9Kn3D4w6Rx3KaCVMA.text: When a group of Italians asks you to drive an hour out of the way to have a "real" pizza, the only thing to say is "yes!"  Settebello is the realest deal. Delicious pizza. Totally worth the drive. We had the Margarita DOC - magnificent! Finished the meal with the Nutella pizza and a couple of short espressos.  This is now a MUST STOP for every Vegas trip.

1j0sZCdRvuP1fOGWNViRBQ.text: Best pizza you have ever had in your life!..True ITALIAN !..I XAN SAY THAT..cause I'm an ITALIAN..DELICIOSO!..so good you will wanna slap ur mama..lol just kidding but fantastic..cute little family friendly place I usually do take out.small cozy dimly lit..could be a nice date place..I havent tried anything else but I will..it's too bad they dont associate with grub hub or any delivery service..that's my only gripe .

Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Best moscato you will ever have right from Italy

DXWXw7dS9LRAtSCT7igOJw.text: Proceed with caution, may be habit forming. If you want authentic thin crust, Neapolitan pizza that tastes like it's fresh out of Italy, then this is the place for you. This is my absolute favorite pizza place in the Las Vegas/Henderson area.  + Tasty, fresh hot pizza   + Margarita pizza is my top choice  + Insalata grande is light & a perfect starter to share + Located In The heart of Green Valley, by Wholefoods + They offer gluten-free crust + Service is always fantastic + The have a good happy hour (M-Th, 3pm - 6pm)  - They charge about $5 for gluten-free  - It's so good you will most likely overeat   Take a quick trip to "Italy" and get ready to devour some cheesy, steamy, heavenly PIZZA! If you think it sounds like it can't get much better, you're wrong it does. I've tried every single dessert, each more gratifying than the next.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella Pizza

NNWxIzeqAE7zrrgh0L_tsg.text: Disappointed! How can you get soggy crust with wood fired pizza! Besides underwhelming crust the dough itself is just good.  The ingredients left much to be desired in terms of quality. Italian sausage void of fennel.  Brisket pizza came with a decent smoky brisket and better quantity than the sausage pizza. Meat and cheese appetizer decent quality just stingy amount for 3 people; basically one small slice of 4 meats and 2 cheeses for 3 people.

uGxrxn2RjoiaR-VzwE-6Kw.text: Real pizza with a great chew and flavor. Salads always fresh and delicious. Service always great. A must go authentic margarita pizza.

avCaqx-p2C3hoUULv2rjEg.text: Amazing woodfired pizza!! Flavor is delicious. Fresh ingredients!! Excellent service!! We had a great dinner!

pcRzudKbTjzm0Rd0jMx4GQ.text: I meet friends at this location weekly, either for Sunday lunch or mid-week dinner. The service is always excellent and the food is always delicious and ready quickly. Several friends are vegan and they accommodate our needs every time, with no mistakes.   Yesterday, we were pleasantly surprised to sit on the newly spruced up patio. Even though the new 'greenery' is plastic, it creates a secluded space from the cars driving in and out of the parking lot. Well done!   Will definitely continue to frequent this place!

j0kZ2EKaDcMXZy3vt9dheg.text: Maddison and their whole team were amazing. This place is a gem. I've passed by many times and decided today was the day to go have a drink at the bar. 3 drinks later and a appetizer... I'm in love. This family owned Italian restaurant is by far one of my favorite places. Great happy hour

iJRK-JLrSp4m0D2oPjAPBg.text: I'm Italian and this is the best pizza I have ever had in the US. True Italian's ingredients!!! Thanks guys!

toolhhrlD-Eh7arn3XgQ6Q.text: Excellent pizza. Friendly staff. Nice location with plenty of parking. My only complaint with Settebello is their inability to deliver or work with companies that do (postmates etc.)  My favorite is the Margherita Doc...reminds me of the pizza I had at a small pizzeria in Napoli, Italy.

Fp47pDZKKPuJIiJzzn6cTA.text: I have never had a bad experience here.  Everything is amazing.  I love the variety of pizzas.  There is something for everyone.    We usually stick with the Misto plate and a Margherita pizza.  Very much creatures of habit.  And for good reason.  They are always perfect! Luckily for my waist line and checkbook, this place is a bit of a drive for us, or we would be all the time.

WqH8alOU2R5kZQLhZ8A-6g.text: We go to Settebello's at least 3 times a month, and every time it's excellent. All the servers are great, and food is consistently awesome. They don't have a huge menu, and that's why we love Settebello's. They pretty much stick to their core.

OtASL23lZhAJN9ZzVS9LcQ.text: So many great reviews, but the pizza was just ok. The recent reviews are not lying when they say the pizza is soggy! Ordered the Margherita and the Jalapeno which were both great flavor wise, but the Margherita was so soggy I couldn't even hold the pizza up :( My favorite part of a pizza is the crust and this one just did not cut it.   I really enjoyed the beets salad and the jalapeno pizza so I'm giving this place 4 stars. I'd come back here, I'll just stay away from pizza with a lot of red sauce.

ppFO9T7VS5Su-aXNEi_BCg.text: I really do enjoy the pizza here. My favorites are the Capricciosa and Margherita DOC. Their crust is thin which I like but sometimes can be flimsy and moist. Their ingredients are always fresh and they aren't stingy with their toppings. I just wish their cannoli's didn't have the added zest flavor. The zest kind of ruined the flavor of the cannoli cream for me. The staff is always incredibly friendly and professional. Overall, if you enjoy thing crust pizza and fresh ingredients, you cannot go wrong with Settebello.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Easily my favorite pizza, the Capricciosa.

LXs8kXnQPKxCZffqXG29KA.text: Hands down beats any pie in LV metro. Yes that means you too not so secret pizza and Tony's etc. Superb service also and they don't beat your ass with some overpriced dBag Anthony Bourdain dumpster fire of Kraft veggies and boutique beers and cocktails. Pizza made to order, big enuff for 2...OK, 1 if you are starving like I was when I flew in from Dallas, rented car, drive here and ATE 2 PIES! Did share 1 with wife but almost downed 1.5 pizzas myself and it was awesome awesome awesome. Best bang for pizza buck in 5 counties. Server gal was knowledgeable about pie and Napolitano pie specifically. She is beautiful and smart and nice and quick with the grub!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Half and Half of their two best pies

HbeIcMLIwxU0C37_Qa9vww.text: This pizza is the real deal. We are so fortunate to have authentic Neapolitan gems like this in Henderson. The "Bianca" is my personal favorite. We buy the flour to duplicate at home but you really need the 900 degree oven to pull it off. Exquisite!

C8sD8RYMRZe9upoIB-gmyg.text: Really good food and amazing customer service. This place was #1 on Yelp and we decided to come here because of that. There was some mix ups on the bill but Alexander took care of it and we will definitely be coming back just because of that. He is literally the definition is amazing customer service.

TXEzyqMDUby1KxzPNBwEiQ.text: Their pizza never fails.. always so delicious! The Panzanella salad was great! Just enough Parmesan cheese shavings for that hint of salt and the cherry tomatoes were fresh! My son loves their cheese pizza and he's a picky eater.  I also love that they have specials almost every day so make sure to check that out.  The service is always so friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Great specials!

kJ76e-2cS682Jv65txUsAQ.text: Love this place. AMAZING pizza! Delicious panna cotta! Went 2 days in a row! Obsessed! Great service too!
