SJYTbLG99IP4Al73l_p16A.text: Stopped by here for lunch with my husband 1.5 weeks ago because we saw this restaurant featured on the Cooking Channel's Unique Eats. This restaurant is different from your typical pizzeria because of their Neapolitan style pizza (slices of mozzarella on pizza instead of the shredded with toppings you desire all cooked in a wood burning oven).   When we came into this restaurant, we were immediately acknowledged and seated right away. This is what we ordered:  Settebello- This was definitely one of the better pizzas I have ever had. Our server said this was one of their most popular pizzas (he told this after we ordered it). This pizza was really good, as it had a nice crisp, thin and tender chewy crust. All of the flavors in the 1st bite was very satisfying and I would order this again. By the way, because this restaurant is trying to be as authentic as the pizzas in Italy, they do not normally serve the pizzas pre-sliced like you would find in other restaurants. But he said we could request for them to cut it for us if we wanted. We just cut a piece of the pizza to share ourselves.  Panzanella Salad- good portion, clean tasting and something I wanted because I was jonesing for salad for lunch. I asked for the salad dressing to be placed on the side and it came as I had requested. This salad isn't exactly memorable, but I got what I wanted and was satisfied with it.   Overall, our lunch was a good experience. It wasn't too crowded when we arrived (around 12 pm) but could see that they do get a good lunch crowd. The only negative thing I would say about our experience though was our server. He was rather strange because he would say some real odd comments that make you just kind of think 'what...?' .... but other than that, no other negatives.   By the way, this place is located in the same plaza as Whole Foods. There is plenty of parking and there is outdoor seating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Panzanella Salad with salad dressing on the side (as requested) $9 (prior to tax)
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Panzanella Salad with salad dressing on the side (as requested) $9 (prior to tax)
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello (one of their #1 sellers) $13.50 (prior to tax)

n6dMgCAGFZboVPBBtF8FVw.text: Pros: I love this pizza. I always get the Marinara. Fresh ingredients and consistently great. I've never dined in, but the cashier was very friendly and will supply napkins, etc. upon request.   Cons: limited vegan options. Rucola arugula salad seems to be the only option, and possibly the Marinara pizza and flatbread. I'd double check on those last two. As many times as I've been here, I seem to completely forget to ask about that.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Marinara pizza + Rucola salad
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Marinara pizza

KWsxf9I0qdGDitpMFF0GXg.text: OK this place is a tough review because again staff exceptionally friendly, place was beautiful, but the food was just not on point. Parking is pretty easy they've got nice free parking outside. Our pizza was definitely good but really soggy and either needed to cook more or have less sauce. That Neapolitan flavor was so good though so that's why I'm giving them three stars. I really happen to like that flavor but if you're not really into the flavor you'd probably give it less. Although is vegetarian friendly I was super disappointed with the salads. Almost all the salads had meat in them which is really strange, and they didn't even have an option for taking the meat out. They also have a gluten-free crust which is great. It's a tough review because if my husband was the one giving this review he would've given it a one star. He was super disappointed. It is pretty pricey for what you're getting but it is hard to find good pizza in Vegas. Overall not the best pizza experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza soup

4NN2oC94MOUe6Yi9jMvTEg.text: Ok wow this place is good.  When I first looked at the menu online I thought "dang $5.00 up-charge for gluten-free crust?!" ...most places are $2-$3 extra so I was kinda tiffed but wanted to try it anyway.   Wow, soooo worth the $5.00 extra, it's by far the best gluten-free crust I've ever had (been Celiac for years and have had a lot of gluten-free pizza). Never had such authentic tasting gluten-free, perfectly crispy in the right places and salted well so it was super flavorful.   We had the Settebello which was good but a little too meaty for my taste (fiance gobbled it up) and the Capricosa which was more veggie centric and sooooo soooo good. Also had the beet salad which is a must.   Our waiter Tyler was super attentive and knowledgeable about the menu, great waiter and great experience will 100% be back ASAP because I think this crust would be stellar with their Margarita pizza and I'm pregnant and already want it.

g6PV489Y1f0ryba402PwKg.text: I have been a Settebellos regular for years.  Not only are they my favorite pizza place in Las Vegas... they are my favorite pizza place in the country!  If you enjoy authentic Naples style pizza, nothing else comes even close.  I've tried almost all of their pizzas and my favorite is the Diavola... so much flavor packed into this pizza with the slices of fresh garlic, roasted red pepper, and spicy salami.  The ingredients are authentic and super fresh and the pizzas are always served piping hot.  Settebellos is also known for their great service and their wait staff are attentive and very personable.  They also offer a military discount... which this veteran appreciates greatly!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Diavola pizza

8tiqPQBsn8e-QWYEAcbB_A.text: Buona notte! Yes, its real pizza napolitano.  I asked a local with an Italian accent where he went for pizza when he missed home and he said Settobello--especially the gvr location over summerlin.  The caprese salad was good too.

2adq5tGQ-oqacxJHrJ5gfw.text: This restaurant was highly recommended to me by friends. You can go with a large group or on a xsual date.  It's pretty noicey and busy inside.  We were pretty hungry so we order 2 appetizers and 2 pizzas for 4 people. If you are super hungry like we were I would recommend a pizza for each person because the crust is a very thin crust so it wouldn't fill you up with only 2-3 slices a piece.   The pizzas are a really fancy type pizza which isn't bad but it isn't my jam. I like PIZZA with all the normal toppings maybe a fancy sauce here or there but something I can really sink my teeth into.    I don't think I would try it again based on personal preference because again most of my friends love it.

VOrj_mnWrvEc-BSrUlulVw.text: Settebello hit the spot on a day I was wanting pizza. We were seated promptly, I ordered moscato which was delicious. We ordered focaccia bread to start and beet salad. Both were served warm. We then ordered margherita, quattro formagino and the settebello to share with one another. One pizza definitely feeds 1-2 but more-so one with a slice or two two to spare. We tried each other's and all had slices to take home. Pizza tasted good with their chili olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette. My friend found a hair in his pizza half way into his meal and the server very graciously took it away and offered to make a new one. He didn't love his quattro formagino so he even allowed him to switch to margherita.   They've got a happy hour menu also, though it's limited for vegetarians. I was hoping they'd have an outdoor porch but they did not. I would return if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Happy hour offerings
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Focaccia
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello

iHIDVDtAhnXZNhpWOtpjgg.text: If you want a pizza with good quality ingredients and a taste that's the opposite of any fast food pizza chain this is the place to go! For me and my family the more simple the pizza the more delicious. This place nails it! From the delicious crust with the tiny blackened bits from the brick oven to the delicious simple sauce to the mouth watering buffalo mozzarella.... what else do you need?! We always get the Margherita DOC and the beet salad. The salad is perfectly dressed and just refreshing. I've invited family here as well when they are in town and they all say the same thing this place is GOOD! Again, if you like your typical "American" fast food chain style pizza, this may not be your cup of tea. But if quality is what you seek then give this place a try. Their staff is always friendly and gives great service and the place is always clean and inviting.

db00_E2LolRA65L4wZGfiA.text: We had the pancheta salad and the Vico pizza. I'm a big fan of Napoletana pizza and this one was really good. The only thing I didn't like were the croutons on the salad were soggy so I would suggest to them that they put them last on after they've  mixed the dressing into to arugula. Otherwise this was a great place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

Ox_Wjw40MKPe2nKnfaoyVQ.text: I've been here for dinner a few times and the food and service is always consistently great. In fact, looking at my pictures of their food right now is making me want to go back there right now!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Bruschetta,  delish!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza, yum!

zKQJwHYH27gJQgbyV1HGLA.text: Outstanding pizza. Lovely thin but chewy crust, some unique toppings. Service, happy hour and bar area all good too.

XK3sYqeMSQwhmNGJeaqyaw.text: First time here. Visiting family and heard about this spot. So glad we came. Service was great and pizza is delicious! Thin and doughy. We got the Settebello and Bianca along with the Panzella salad. We will be back for sure!

VCbUVmIkQeDPwqMNmvrnLQ.text: Had been here many times before, but just recently returned home from a trip that included a stop in Naples.  Well, when they claim their pizza is just like Naples they aren't lying.  After having the best pizza in the world and going thru withdrawals, we stopped in and got our pizza fix.  If you can't make a trip to Naples, make a trip here and you won't be disappointed!

pbq57IDv-jjrU-PYimpuHA.text: Good Happy hour prices and very good pizza. Gluten free options also. Service was great and nice atmosphere. Authentic style pizza, not the usual kind, prices are reasonable. Would recommend if you're looking for authentic Italian pizza.

UzZYWgcI6NTr23foqKR8Tw.text: Had such a great experience here. Everything we ordered was amazing and service was quick except towards the end.  It's located right at the corner once you turn into the plaza. The restaurant is small so I would recommend making a reservation before coming. We arrived around 6:15 and it was pretty full, and stayed consistently busy until we left. There were 3 large parties seated near us. They also have plenty of booth seating available.   The beet salad was really good! The salad was fresh and the pine nuts on top added a nice crunch. Goat cheese was cream, beets were sweet and the vinaigrette was slightly tangy, which balanced the dish. We liked it so much that we decided to make our own the next night at home!  The meat balls were a good size, there was 4 to a dish with enough sauce to scoop using the pita (pizza) bread provided.   I love pizza and can eat it everyday but the brisket pizza we ordered didn't leave a lasting impression. I think my bf enjoyed it more than I did. I thought the dough was very good and I liked the caramelized onions but the brisket was a bit dry imo.   We were stuffed by the end of our meal so we didn't order dessert but I'll save room for some next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

VJFBKKKe5vF6FisidgEZ_A.text: I like this pizza place!  I had the happy hour mini margerita pizza with prosciutto.  So good!  I will come back to try other things on the menu!  Only thing that is keeping me from a five star: my water glass was empty most of the time.  I drink a LOT of water and my glass was only refilled once.  I left parched.

cmWqwemFZ_JPMLsHjuDhHg.text: Oh my God can I just start by saying the cheese platters are amazing. We ordered a pizza, a cheese platter, and some salted caramel gelato to finish it off. We got the cheese platter first and it came with some marmalade, cheese, olives and some pita bread. On the table we had oil and vinegar to also use for whatever we'd like. All of the ingredients on everything that we ordered tasted so fresh ! A lot of the ingredients are made in house and you can truly tell. The pizza was really good but the crust on the pizza was very thin almost too thin to hold the ingredients on it. The gelato that we finished with was creamy and salty and sweet and just delicious. I wish the pizza crust was a little thicker but that definitely wouldn't hold me back from coming back here. The prices were a little expensive but well worth it due to the freshness of the food. I recommend this place to anyone looking for some inexpensive food with a really fresh and good flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Cheese platter and cappuccino

fC-aIc00q8qdeycpIvzIiw.text: We ordered the Misto appetizer, it was very good. I ordered the Settebello pizza. It was great. I would order it again. Both dishes were delicious. The only negative part of the evening was that the pizzas were brought to the table 2 minutes after the appetizer. We had to eat the pizza while it was still hot to we practically had the appetizer for dessert. I would still come back though.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Misto looks great.

nySkMKDMm-mxyVX423WhPA.text: Went here on a Tuesday with my wife for a rare date night. Food was great! Service was great! On Tuesdays they have 50% off every bottle of wine on the menu. Really an amazing experience and will be going back soon!

yjrL9MXsG8ELDBqUmkSIIw.text: Settebello is my favorite pizza spot in Henderson. I've been here multiple times with friends throughout the years and it never disappoints. Of course, Settebello scratches a very specific pizza itch since it's Napoletana style. It wont be like a pizza you get delivered or a New York slice. It's very thin, with a delicious chewy crust and char spots from being in the oven. It's pretty "wet" for a pizza, so some opt to eat it with a knife and fork.  My favorite pie is the Margherita pizza, but I've also had the Diavola and that was very good.  My favorite appetizer is their Involtini di Prosciutto. It's Prosciutto Crudo wrapped around a generous portion of arugula and goat cheese. Topped with MORE goat cheese, Parmigiano-Reggiano, a balsamic reduction and EVOO.  They have some really unique craft cocktails on their menu, but I would definitely recommend enjoying one of their many wines that will complement your pizza. Save the cocktail for dessert.

VRt1tTFOuY_Mel3rWJ1BTA.text: First and foremost, this place is so adorable. Super New York vibe. If you call 24 hours ahead they will make you a gluten free crust. This I found very interesting. Because the dough is made from scratch and it has to rise over night, can we say FRESH! so awesome. Since we didnt call ahead we decided to just stick with a salad. I had the Insalata Grande. Only 8 dollars it consisted of Mixed Greens, Fresh Tomatoes, Artichoke Hearts, Roasted Mushrooms, Olives, Pine Nuts, Cracked Pepper, Shaved Parmigiano, and tossed in a balsamic vinaigrette. I also had an espresso martini. WOW i could drink 10 of them. and made with illy coffee? yes please! Ill def be returning here, and next time ill call ahead for a gluten free pizza :)

_e-bzc_0wUFLlEW6hW-ZsQ.text: Most amazing pizza I've ever had. Hands down.  Sooo for my birthday this past weekend, visiting from CA, I wanted to try a new place I have never had before. Settebello's Pizza came up during my search, and I figured why not? Who doesn't love a good pizza. I just didn't expect it to be as amazing as it was!  We get to the Henderson location and walk in. We weren't greeted by the hostess, who was just standing there. So my sister walks up and asks if we can have a table for 3. The hostess was like "oh well I don't have a table right now so you can just check in the bar area." Uh....ok?! Thanks for the great customer service. No hi or how are you guys doing? Must have been having an awful night.  So we went and sat at the bar and the bartender's customer service completely made up for her lack of enthusiasm. Cute guy, slicked back hair and glasses....I can't remember his name. Asked if we had ever been there before and we told him we hadn't. He gave us a bunch of suggestions and told us his favorite pizza to eat and told us if we had any questions to just let him know. Well, I had lots of questions. Seems silly but their menus are hard to understand with ingredients that must be in Italian. I was like what's this? and this? and this? The bartender was so patient. My fiance was starting to get irritated but I didn't want to order something weird lol. We ended up just telling him what kind of toppings we wanted and he made it happen. Amazing food and good customer service so we will definitely be back!

oyML88FovY23wZjdrDT6DA.text: Whenever I hear about something being so hyped up I get a bit hesitant specially when a few of my close friends didn't think it lived up to the hype.   We were in the area, got shafted at a few options we wanted to go to over this, but glad we ended up going. I haven't had a Napoletana pizza in a while.   We started off the meal with a Misto ($13) plate which has a assortment of bread, meat, cheese and accompaniments. The bread was a bare pizza and our plate consisted of pickled cippolini onions, basil, artichoke, salume di napoli, mortadella, proscuitto, light cured ham, parmesan, provolini. You can taste the quality of the components and I love good charcuterie and was pretty happy with it.   We got the Del Cafone pizza ($12). The toppings were quality and the pizza crust was decent. Napoletana pizza I don't think is for everyone and it's not a substitute/nothing like other thin crust styles. I like a bit of a char flavor and chewy, airy in a spongy way type crust is alright for me since I find that enjoyable in certain breads like pao`.   Finished the meal with a dream bomba ($5) which was a peanut butter ice cream covered in a chocolate shell. It says it has a caramel heart, but there was very little of it. It was okay, but I kinda wished I got a panna cotta. Ordered this since I haven't had a bomba before but keep seeing it pop up on menus recently.   The service was very good. Friendly and super attentive without being intrusive. Our drinks never reached more than half empty, helpful with tips, intuitive about the check, etc.  If you're a fan of this style, then come here specially since it's VPN certified. This isn't the best Napoletana I've had in the US (Bollini's or A-16 wins for me) but your best bet in Vegas for authentic Napoli pizze.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Del Cafone
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Misto plate

gv6SfIPZOrBBApm_EFP-PQ.text: I enjoyed the pizza. We had the margherita, bolognese, and diablo pizzas. I really liked the margherita pizza. It's a very thin crust pizza, but the crust stays soft in the wood fire oven. The size is decent for a personal pizza, but it is defiantly more of a traditional type pizza, sorry dominos lovers, this is not for you. The service was very good, but also very slow in my opinion. I also thought the pizza was a bit overpriced, but so is everything in the district. Over all if you like this type of pizza, the place is nice and you will probably enjoy this restaurant. If the American style pizza is more your speed, this is defiantly not that.

fecAoLVT_vbNyeVf9ePIcw.text: Boyfriend and I wandered in here on a whim in search of pizza. Oh boy, what a joy to find! While slightly more expensive and will probably be considered a treat, this place was amazing.   We showed up for a late lunch, and our waiter was so very helpful. He told us about the history of their pizzas, how they're quite authentic.   We ordered two pizzas. A regular pepperoni and a chicken something or another. Both were delicious. Four slices for what looked like a 7-8 inch pizza. With both pizzas, for the two of us... Filling. Great find, but the prices are a bit steep.

Ep7DJRw_8JSOLKTNKb28PA.text: Dined here once and will never return. While the food was passable, (nothing outstanding but not slop either) the prices and the wait staff will keep me from eating at this restaurant again.  Our pizzas were pretty small and did not contain many ingredients. I understand they serve margherita pizzas, but all the other times I've eaten them I left the table feeling full. This was not the case here. The crust was thin and took up a good portion of the pizza. We wondered why they only sauced about 50% of the pizza. The cheese was tasty, but I would have liked more than a few little pieces on the pizza.  For such a small pizza, the cost was certainly not worth it. I would have no problem if the food was outstanding, but it was just an average pizza. Many other smaller pizzerias in town offer better tasting and larger pizzas for less money than Settebello.  Our waiter was anything but approachable, making it seem like a chore to get a place setting for one person in our group. Throughout the meal, our waiter was rarely seen. He basically took our order and gave us the check. The server who brought our food out was the one to check on us!  I usually try to keep non-food related criticisms to myself, but this restaurant had too many strikes against it not to mention the negatives. I would only dine here again if someone else paid for it, and even then, I would make sure to have a place lined up for food later on.

O7cbleZevv4cZN0gy210DA.text: I lived in Italy for 6 glorious months and I have been searching for Italian style pizza ever since I left. After 7 long years, I found it at Settebello! This is not your typical American pizza joint. You order your own individual pizza and you eat it Italian style, with a knife and fork (or they will slice it if you prefer). The ingredients are straight off the boat and that is what makes the pizza delicious! They get their meats from Salumi in Seattle, it's Mario Batali's father's cured meat shop. He spent months perfecting his art in Italy and you can taste the perfection!  The signature settebello pizza is a real gem. My husband usually orders it so I go with the pizza Bianca. It doesn't matter what you order, everything is a winner. There is always a special pizza of the week and if you get on their email list they will send you the specials in advance. This is dangerous because it makes me want to eat here every single day!   I have also had the pleasure of trying the salads. They are just as good as the pizza and they will gladly split them for you.   Since leaving Italy I have also been on the lookout for Italian gelato. Again, Settebello excels above the rest. The gelato is very authentic and  they have a special flavor every week. My favorite so far is the vanilla cinnamon, sounds crazy but it is crazy delicious!  The prices are a bit high, but they are flying the ingredients in from Italy for crying out loud! You don't need to buy a ticket to Italy to have authentic Italian pizza anymore, just stop by Settebello on your way home!

9G9Ejrt7XwqupoRG4OqfZA.text: Tonight was def an off night for this place. Our service started off great... But then it seemed like once 9 pm hit people were sent home and our server just couldn't hang with the multiple tables.  Pretty sad because our pizzas came out at different times (2 of us), and my box never came, our plates were never cleared (not even after our dessert had come).    The pizza was delicious though as usual. I hope they can get their game together during the 9-10 hour, especially for those arriving around 8:15.

v2Xfbk8SXdIJd542EnFPuw.text: I'll admit... I'm a pizza snob, 100%.  So, for this place to get five stars is definitely saying something.  I tried this place with a friend on a whim.  Someone we had met had recommended it and we were looking to grab a bite before hitting the town for a bit.  We went in and I appreciated the small menu.  Small menus are my favorite because it makes me feel like the restaurant really knows what they do well and focus on that, rather than offering pages of options.  We settled for the beet salad and the pizza bolognese.  I don't love beets, but my best friend does so I settled for her.  She LOVED it.  And when I say loved it, I mean she has dreams about this salad.    Now, the pizza bolognese sent me to heaven and back again.  Normally I don't go for what we on the east coast call "specialty pizzas" that have the works on them.  Being a Jersey girl through and through a plain pie with a nice, crispy crust is a dream.  So I went with what was closest to a plain pie and that's the pizza bolognese.  Instead of regular tomato sauce, the crust is covered with meat sauce.  Well, I was amazed that something could be so good.  I didn't even want to go out anymore!  I would have sat there and eaten this pizza all night if this were an option, sadly they were closing since we got there so late.  There is no other way to describe this pizza other than to use the word "perfect."  It makes me extremely nervous that I will be living extremely close to Settebello in my new apartment.  I will definitely have to practice will power and stop myself from ordering this pizza every night.

Wqnq3wCIBCzImpmFjyprdw.text: What a find! Thank you, fellow Yelpers, for the reviews on this place. We ordered the Pizza bologne and the Settebello. Delicious wood fire pizza, anyone? The crust was chewy and perfect and toppings were flavorful and fresh. Also, the best, hands down, tiramisu to be had for miles around. All in all, the price is so fair for the quality of food that comes to your table. The service was quite prompt, friendly, and helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

smyP2cRNFqvtQ8znVE-WUg.text: This is definitely the place to go if you like authentic  pizza... We walked in the place and knew right away this was the real thing... pizza here is more then fresh it's spectacular with fresh ingredients and delicious flavor, just the way we had it in Italy ... Also the service was numero uno ! A real cool place in Las Vegas ... Muy bueno ;-)

eVcym30ohhJz7BsTg9Qahg.text: Love the thin, slightly burnt crust =) We ordered the settebello & capricciosa. Reminds me of the pizza I had when I was in Milan. Super fresh and tasty. Sometimes it's nice to eat pizza with a knife and fork. They also have the blood orange san pellegrino here.. so it's a nice little treat to complement the pizzas.  I really like the surrounding area. It's nice to take a stroll post-meal to sneak in a small workout.

Pb7JZEXiCphR4OXzqq_13g.text: Truly a different type of pizza. I really enjoyed the crust and the toppings were fresh and of high quality. We ordered the Settabello pizza and were pleased. I can't say anything bad about the pizza but I think I enjoy a New York style pizza more.   My only complaint about this pizza place was the lack of customer service. With this being our first visit to this restaurant, it would have been nice for our waitress to be able to explain the menu or how things worked. When we asked questions, we were met with short responses and our waitress made us feel like we were wasting her time. We truly did not feel welcome as customers.   Overall, if you're a fan of this type of pizza, you will enjoy the food. If you know exactly what you want and don't want to interrupt the waitresses day (EVEN THOUGH THAT'S HER JOB), you might really like this place. But if you are new to the style and this type of pie, try another place. One with employees who value their customers.

pkdXb_SRlHY9wE2JUbYYNw.text: Just had a Gluten Free Divola. I think it was the best Pizza I've ever had and I've eaten tons of pizza before I found I couldn't eat gluten. Amazing amazing amazing.

7hn4IKahvQ2f8BrKsr585w.text: When pizza is this good, it's a shame when it's over. I came to lunch with Dana S. and we ate til we could no more eat. Actually I'm sure that we could have eaten more, we just ran out of food.   We ordered the namesake pizza and it was delicious. However, one of the pieces hardly had any topping on it and the pinenuts were not evenly dispersed. Verrrrry important in a pinenut pizza! I gobbled heartily and was sad when it was over.   I also had a salad which made me feel better about myself. I don't know if I would get one the next time because it was on the pricey side but it was tasty.   I want to come back and try other pizzas. It's located by Whole Foods--the Yelp map is a little confused. Also--swing by WF after for gelato...it's half the price!

iLeKc7TaatymGPRaS-lsGg.text: I've been searching for a restaurant that follows the True Naples (Napoli) tradition of pizza making for quite a while.  In my journey I've discovered that it really comes down to the quality of ingredients, coupled with an oven that is made of the right materials, and is heated in a proper way.  I'm happy to say that Settebello has NAILED it.  Their pizza is as close to a True Neapolitan pizza as you can get, short of traveling to Naples itself.  Slightly crispy on the bottom, soft on the top, and chewy delicious.  The authentic flavor of tomatoes, buffalo mozzarella, olive oil and basil - it doesn't get any better.  The owner went out of his way to bring you a True taste from the birthplace of pizza, and it shows.  Though they offer more styles of pizza than what is traditionally available (to suit the expectations of an American market probably), they do it within reason, and they keep it delicious.  Literally everything we had there was great, from the prosciutto, to the caprese, to the absolutely perfect margherita pizza.  If you want that Naples authentic pizza without having to travel to Italy, this is as close as you can get.  Pro tip - stick to the marinara or margherita pizza if you want a True taste of Naples.... and for the love of all things holy, get the basil-wrapped prosciutto drizzled with their house balsamic.  You will cry tears of joy.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Margherita pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

FHRCttiGICENn39HbEAnCw.text: Happy Hour is one of those elusive things here in Vegas. There aren't many really good happy hour places, but Settebello delivers. On the happy hour, not their pizzas. You have to pick those up.  The plates are great for early snacking, very reasonably priced and quick to come out. The drinks are even on discount. Very few things are better than sipping a sangria and eating their delicious food while enjoying the 100 degree temperatures in the shade on their patio.  Service was good, attentive and prompt. Food was excellent and quick to arrive. Dessert was decadent (Sweet Cream Gelato in Espresso, a perfect finish).  I'm eagerly awaiting an excuse to head back, except next time get a pizza.

HL3XdJAHp6-NK-VufV5Tow.text: I know I give too many restaurants a 5-star rating, but I would give Settebello six stars if I could.   I went for lunch and it was not overly crowded. The appetizers were delicious and our pizzas came within 10-15 minutes of ordering them. The pizza itself makes me drool just thinking about it. Fresh mozzarella, the sauce is made of crushed tomatoes, and the seasoning was divine. I learned that authentic pizzas aren't cut, but I had mine cut anyways.   The 12" pizzas are big enough to split with someone else if you get appetizers. I'll be going back again for sure.

szWS-m45jnn6rJANvYme4w.text: The pizza bolognese wasn't anything out of the ordinary the pizza crust was thin but not crisp it was a bit soggy and the taste was okay. We also got the only pasta available it had bits of asparagus nothing special there isn't a lot of variety. Service was good.

PAwSIV0LVwI2rq_A17aK9Q.text: Ok I see lots of 5 stars but being a NYer I would say its good pizza not great. I like the thin crust and the folding and eating but the crust got soggy and couldn't hold the toppings on the pizza. The salad was bland. The kids get a nice portion and of course the gelato that came with it was a hit. My friends got the bomba and if you like caramel, chocolate and peanut butter it's fabulous... At least my one bite was lol....love peanut butter! The service was good and quite attentive. If we are in the neighborhood on a playdate who wants pizza we would go again, otherwise there are other restaurants right next door we might pick instead. And with all the pizza places in Vegas there are others I would run to first....

KhXOAlrS5Hqk82BO6gYd9g.text: I lived in Rome for 3 years and have searched high and low for a good pizza restaurant since moving back to the States. Settebello is the real thing. I feel like I'm back in Italy when I have their pizza.  Absolutely fresh high quality ingredients and the types of pizza they make are hard to find elsewhere.   Friendly staff, service is usually excellent, but can be slow when it's packed. The restaurant can get noisy so don't expect a quiet romantic setting. I especially like that I can use my Italian when chatting with some of the staff.   I highly recommend Settebello.

coyJWrpEh9fouSmvKbCE3Q.text: Great pizza with awesome ingredients. You have to try the panna cotta for dessert. It is amazing with the strawberries and balsamic reduction

rXkxK2rZKMHQEgvfI2QC2w.text: First, let me say that I'd give it 6 stars if I could.  My husband and I live more than 30 minutes away, and I refuse to eat pizza anywhere else.  We must brave I-15 every time we go (which is always seems to be a virtual parking lot), resulting in a 35 minute commute each way.  I have dined at Settebello an average of twice per month since my last review in August 2009, and have yet to be disappointed.  It is amazing the level of friendliness, attentiveness and overall customer service that is consistently  maintained by the staff.   Settebello is extremely family-friendly.  Since most of our friends have young children, it has been a wonderful choice for us to meet up and enjoy a meal together.  They offer all children imported Italian breadsticks to keep them occupied, while parents peruse the menu; additionally, there is a child's tomato/cheese pizza (only slightly smaller than the regular size Margherita) which comes with a complimentary scoop of gelato for dessert.  I just had to get another 2 cents in because it is very easy to have one great meal somewhere, but another feat entirely to have EVERY meal be tasty and delicious, backed with great service.

T8R2RNUMS8Ww9nt9BUfKRQ.text: very good pizza. I like the thin pizza throughout and small crust. It was easy to eat one pizza myself and not feel stuffed. Also, very nice location off Green Valley Parkway w/ nice shopping area outside. I think we ordered the Settobello pizza, Quattro Stagioni ,and the Pizza Lasagna. I would definitely come back for more pizza.

zGo4VEhCwmnwr4-zugu0Ig.text: Don't know what has happened to the Henderson location.  Not only has the food gone south (very bland and tasteless) but they are allow there male servers to mimic the scum that walk the streets with their pants so low that there butts hang out.  I can tolerate it when I don't have to pay and eat from the person who dresses like this.  Or maybe it is just that the management doesn't care!

ZsSuyUWOEbhWQQWBco8c9Q.text: Excellent pizza! I haven't tasted pizza this good since I lived I Italy. Outstanding! I highly recommend.

8tX8BYghaYi6cuNHzu4mxg.text: We always order a salad with a margherita pizza. Can't go wrong there! Service is good (though we go early so we are usually the only one's there) and the food is superb!

_OQ5u-UMVgdvGRY_pHJreg.text: Only rated 3 stars because we've had better pizza and caprese salad at a nearby pizzeria. Even the extra crispy crust couldn't save this pizza.

NuN6suiZ_BJdivy6VD0ocA.text: I have lived in Italy for 3 years . What better place to experience real authetic pizza than Italy, right? Lucky for me I love pizza! And Settebello's lives up to my expectation. It saved me from feeling doomed to horrible pizza when we moved to LV.   Warning: this place is not for deep dish hardcore lovers whose minds cannot be changed. Also, REAL ITALIAN style pizza is not the same as brooklyn style pizza. Italian style pizza is supposed to be thin crusted, fresh toppings, light on the sauce and seasonings, and make a person content- no stuffed.   And I love Settebello's!!! Here's why... all their ingredients are fresh. My toppings: proscuitto, mushrooms, arugula, and pepperoni. They get it right every time. The crust is thin and just right-- just like in Italy. The sauce is not heavy and just the right amount- just like in Italy. The seasoning... when I first tried Settebello's pizza,, the smell of the seasoning reminded my husband and I of our favorite pizza place in Italy.   I cannot rave enough about this place. Living in North Las Vegas, the drive to the District for the pizza is well worth it.  I have even eaten at their location in Salt Lake City, UT which is amazing as well.

u2lU8sXC44_udkOSEV3S0w.text: Settebello makes the best pizza in Las Vegas, yes the best. I am partial to Neopolitan pizza and Settebello does not disappoint. Their menu is not extensive nor is their wine list, but I come here for pizza only. It's location in the district is perfect. If you can venture off the strip and have a craving for pizza without a doubt come to Settebello.

jIZLBsZPrA9fS4kSYxavGA.text: I could rave about the pizza, but I'm going to start by complimenting the Web site.  The owner writes about apprenticing to a famous pizza maker in Italy, and then proceeds to tell you why Napoli-style pizza is distinct.  There's a great line on the site about how pizza crust should only use flour from one mill in Italy, and how the tomatoes are never made into sauce but simply crushed over the dough.  It's like Marcella Hazan's book, distilled into delicious bite-size web pages.  (If you have read her classic Italian cookbook, you know what I mean...)  The web site also identifies where their ingredients come from.  You're pretty hard-core when you're a pizzeria and your flour comes all the way from Italy.  In fact, when you walk into the door, there's a big stack of flour sacks right behind the host stand.  All of this would be so pretentious if the pizza weren't awesome.  And it is.  This is the closest thing I've had to the pizzas I enjoyed in Rome on vacation two years ago.  And for all the joking in this review about the flour, it really does make a difference.  The crust absorbs the flavor of the toppings but does not get soggy, and it's robust enough to stay in one piece until you cut it.  The only con is, as many other reviewers have pointed out, the price.  $13 for a pizza is pricey, but a plane ticket to Italy is at least $1,000, so I really don't think you can complain too much.  As a final thought, why is it that when an Italian politician says anything, you just let it go in one ear and out the other (see Berlusconi, Silvio for a modern example, or Craxi, Bettino for an earlier example -- corruption is really a bipartisan activity in Italy).  However, if an Italian chef says that the building blocks of your meal are imported from Italy and cooked in an oven hand-assembled from bricks that are also imported from Italy, there's no question he's telling the truth?

_9m8Xun_ODogzNrrvnvmQg.text: thank you Yelp! for telling me about Settebello...  its actually pretty embarrassing...  ive been staying at Green Valley since they opened...  really the only place i stay when i go to Vegas which is pretty frequently.  anyway...  enough of that.  just flat out delicious pizza...  an epiphany in a sense.  the dough, the sauce, the cheese...  it all just sings a beautiful italian harmony.  let me put it this way, my sister and i shared the Capricciosa, and after my first slice, i was actually taking the toppings off and eating separately because i wanted to eat the True essence of the pizza.  after this experience, i can now see why the "True" Napoli pizza is the Margherita, its all you really need.  maybe the Quattro Formaggi will figure in there on the next visit (believe me, there will be a next visit), but thats it.  other foods ordered included the Pizza Lasagna (also delicious) by a friend who met my family for lunch, the Quattro Stagioni shared by my parents, and for appetizers the Caprese (ridunkulous), the Involtini di Prosciutto (heavenly) and the Misto (decadent).  really, if you are a lover of pure italian cuisine + crazy fresh ingredients of the utmost quality, you must try Settebello.  but do yourself a favor...  stick to the basic Margherita, have an order of Involtini di Prosciutto to start, and share a Misto plate for your cured meat kick.  when the separate elements are this divine on their own you begin to understand why pure italian cuisine is so refreshingly simple, yet wonderful.

f2lAsnb0BAsvBv_tAdJn0Q.text: Very nice setting with helpful, attentive wait staff.  My wife loved their pizza (very authentic Napolitano style from what I remember from our trips to Italy).  The tiramisu was also good.

wiK7JVMMz27uTlPaHXgNfw.text: The best pizza place in the valley hands down.  The food is always consistant and great.  Service is friendly and attentive without being too much.  Well priced and delicious.  Happy hour is a great deal.  I love sitting at the bar.

_FJnwl6LoY8zcYA--Ddklg.text: Ever since I saw an episode of Man v Food that talked about the Vera Pizza, Napoletana certification, I've been looking for a place that made truly authentic pizza. When I ordered their signature pizza, the cashier said that it would take 5 minutes. Now that's a sign of a super hot oven that properly cooks a pizza. The dough was super thin with a crispy puffy outer crust. The toppings toppings were very fresh and the sauce wasn't overly salty like most pizzas. I even liked the fennel sausage and I absolutely hate fennel. I now feel cheated by the other pizzerias that claim to have authentic pizza.

cSAT7qPRucvRu0xxfh3u-A.text: Best Pizza in town!!! Really authentic italy style pizza.  Highly recommend!!

xUIJ4-vPS-65jtWVwwLFHg.text: Amazing pizza and salads.  The Bianca is the only Pizza I've tried here because its so amazing, I don't want anything else.  Would give 5 stars if they had a decent wine list!

SNpBJHMjOhOm1OQ2HVyt8w.text: the margarita pizza is so yummy! just the right amount of sauce and cheese and it makes probably one of the best pieces of pizza I've had in Vegas.

ioui-rZ56sV8IzV5rQceIg.text: Authentic Italian pizza. I love the margarita pizza, thin chewy crust- fresh and full of flavor. The salads are simple and tasty as well.

5yw_3LIdDmaxB0X9xKWXjA.text: Love this place reminds me of Naples ! It is not your American pizza ( which I like too! Chicago,NY,and Boston style) but its like being back in Italy.Thank you!!!

zIsHPdjT0qC1wzZ6TO7P8Q.text: Ronin's review made me want to try this place...so I did.  Now I can honestly say that I have experienced the world's perfect pizza!  Thin crust that's crispy and chewy at the same time, fresh and simple ingredients, and a slight smokiness to the crust makes this the best pizza I've ever had!  Settebello only sells pizzas and a few salads, and that's it. You won't find hot wings, cheezy garlic bread, stuffed crusts, dessert pizzas, fried chicken, or any of the (usually nasty) unnecessary non-pizza stuff here.  They make just a few things, and they do them RIGHT.  I had the Caprese, Margherita, and Quattro Stagioni, and was impressed with all of them!  It was so good, I ate the Caprese salad and a few pieces of pizza before I remembered to take pictures LOL!  Friendly service! My only complaint is that this place isn't closer to where I live!  My server was very friendly, and it was packed during lunch hour.  This place is truly a gem!  Update 2/1/07 I just had to go back!  The pizzas were perfect again.  The server was very friendly, and the guys in the kitchen had nothing but smiles on their faces. I love, Love, LOVE this place!  Do yourself a favor and check them out!  Update 3/4/07 Drove all the way from NLV again, so that DH could try Settebello's awesome pizza!  I was a little disappointed this time around, the pizzas were soggy and not hot, as if they were sitting on the pass for too long.  The server that was there wasn't nearly as friendly as the weekday server.  As we were leaving, there were two hot pizzas on plates, ready to be served to the tables, but they were sitting there for at least a couple minutes because the server was busy.  The pizzas were still good, but would've been better if they were given to us before they became soggy and lukewarm.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello&#39;s Margherita - Quite possibly the world&#39;s perfect pizza!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Quattro Stagioni - Yummy!

GaMNG2WbRTJDP8vrT-5H5g.text: I've eaten here at least a dozen times. The food is always perfect. I order the Insalata Grande which may be the most perfect salad ever. Mixed greens, roasted mushrooms, pine nuts, marinated artichoke hearts, shaved parmesean....oh yum! Then I have a pizza and it does not matter which one because they are equally exquisite. I love the smokey charred crust that is chewy and crisp. Perfection!

SqEt9SdoKoRB4pU1S45BQw.text: Great pies!! Go there during happy hour and save a lot of money. The desserts are very good also.

mjGN6wGYqB5oi3p5cqJNHA.text: The pizza was pretty good but the flavor was ruined by having burned crust on the under side.  The blackened dough pretty much destroyed the experience.   After we complained they offered to remake one of our pizzas. The second was better but still blackened. The Nutella pizza was awesome and so was the gelato.  We drove from the strip and I felt it was a waste of time considering all that is offered on the strip.

zXvqN09IHOrvSnOkLqJnWA.text: I look forward to going and checking out Settebello again. On my first visit I unfortunately ended up with an upset stomach on my way there but was so determined to go that I didn't let that stop me (I probably should have).  The pizza was very interesting. Coming from NY I am very judgemental on pizza and my views on what it should be and taste like... making it very hard for me to find a pizza I am satisfied with. The pizza I had was tasty and had interesting flavors. My girlfriend seemed to enjoy hers as well. The atmosphere was very relaxed and it was very quiet the afternoon we visited.  The server was ok... no major complaints but didn't blow me away with friendliness either. Will go again sometime to give a proper tasting and review.. for now this will have to do.

i4vrzXrZj9rk1x5atkVO0w.text: I do not like their pizza, it was soggy, undercooked and really not good at all, oh and the salad was gross (how you mess that up is beyond me) I am a thin crust NY style pizza fan, and this was nothing like that,  not for me!

ud5BGx9EWD7vrapPbhBulg.text: Even though there have already been excellent reviews written for this establishment, I need to include my kudos to the owners and staff.    My husband and I came across this restaurant by chance, as we were thumbing through one of the tourist magazines while waiting in line at a casino buffet. We were intrigued enough to add it to our "to do" list while we were in town last week.  We called on Wednesday night, to verify the hours of operation only to learn that they were out of pizza dough and would be closing earlier than anticipated.    Not to be dissuaded, we arrived around 1:30 pm Friday afternoon.  The place was busy, however, we were promptly seated.  Our service staff were very friendly and attentive.  After looking over the menu, it was clear that we would be ordering more than just pizza.   We ordered the Focaccia and Involtini di Prosciutto from the appetizer menu and for the main dish the Settebello Pizza.    The Focaccia was amazing with the sea salt and olive oil.  The dough was crisp yet chewy.    The Involtini di Prosciutto was a wonderful treat.  The baby arugula had a very mild peppery essence, but when combined with the mild goat cheese wrapped in salty prosciutto and drizzled with olive oil and balsamic reduction.  OMG, delicious!  Our only complaint was that we only received two.    The Settebello Pizza was an enjoyable experience.  The description that the pizza can be a little bit soggy was close to True.  Then again, I don't mind eating my pizza with a fork and knife.  I am not a big fan of sausage (I don't particularly care for fennel seeds), but even the sausage on this pizza was good.  The earthy combination of the mushrooms, pine nuts and pancetta was a tasty treat.  Then to add in the crushed tomatoes and mozzarella took this to the next level.  We left the restaurant very satisfied and happy to have found the ad for it.   As we were driving out of town the next day, my husband pulled out the "to-go " menu for Settebello's.  We called in an order for the Focaccia and the Involtini di Prosciutto.  We just couldn't resist taking advantage of one last opportunity to enjoy these tasty items before heading back to AZ.  This is not the American-style pizza that many of us have been force-feed over the years.   If you are expecting or enjoy the thick, doughy, greasy crust pizza, this is not for you.  For the rest, this is amazing pizza.  While I have never traveled to Itay, I can attest that this is one of the best pizza's I had the pleasure of enjoying in Las Vegas!

bGSFzN93iEGn6iVTXumd5Q.text: Thumbs down! The pizza was soggy and soft. This is the 2nd time I'm trying this place and will never ever go there again!

tpOvn-odIxqwlUzJZdEuRg.text: By far the best pizza I've ever put into my head! My god is it divine. The crushed tomato sauce is to die for.. PERFECTO! haha My fiance and I come here as much as we can and the service and food is always wonderful. Very clean. Go there now!

ACvuOP0FrlRPAHNfsL1KXQ.text: If Settebello wanted me to write in their high school yearbook this is what I would say.  Remember that one time we ditched Whole Foods and went to eat pizza instead? That was the best.  Your cool. Don't ever change. See you soon!

is_U1n0g9fzUspOWRfUOYQ.text: Meh is right!  I wanted to like this little place, tucked away in the eastern end of the district with a cute atmosphere upon walk in and friendly staff i just wish the food followed through with similar positive marks. I wanted to use this place as a regular spot for work lunches in this region of town as its relatively in expensive for a lunch for two and its open and clean setting it seemed inviting enough. Its simple i ordered their Capricciosa pizza which was one of the 3 on the menu with two meats instead of the others with just 1 or less. The pie came out and it was what i expected with a very fresh looking feel to it and looked appetizing, and smelled pretty good as well. The best part of the pizza was the freshness of the vegetables that went on it, the sauce was just ok, and the crust was the weak part of the meal like others have said. Its just soggy and painfully not up to par for this type of pizza obviously. I really wish the management at this place would recognize that this is a common problem and try to improve upon it as i really want to like this place but cant return if there are so much better options to take my business.  Positive note the tiramisu is very good and is the reason this review for 3 instead of 2 stars. But then again im pretty easy to please when it comes to dessert, but arent we all.

XBgbUUj4YlKk3YKavjqDOg.text: Fresh, friendly and full of all things delicious. This place has become our family pizza joint, The kids pizza is a cheese pizza, a drink and a small gelato for only 6.99. Delisioso abd a deal.  My wif and I start with salads, I Love the Caprese.  The Lasagne pizza is my fav and the wifes is Diavola.

eFjvLA5xSWj1SZ6xxZ9b6g.text: I got to Settebello around noon on a weekday, and there was a pretty good crowd; not full, but lively.  It's an informal place, with a glazed cement floor, dark brown with some black in a square geometric pattern.  The simple wood tables are completely bare.  An open kitchen contains a large wood burning pizza oven.  Fans attached to the black industrial ceiling provide air circulation.  Lots of windows give the place a bright and airy feeling.  I tried the eponymous Settebello pizza:  crushed tomatoes, pancetta, sausage, mushrooms, pine nuts, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.  The crust was thin and chewy, with black char spots on the bottom.  And the flavor!  I could have eaten the crust alone.  The crushed tomatoes tasted fresh, as did the mushrooms.  Small amounts of mozzarella and other toppings served as an accent to the crust.  This is one very good pizza.  Settebello pizzas are very different from the standard American pizza.  At Settebello, the crust is the star.  Toppings, including cheese, are applied sparingly; they play a supporting role.  I think this has disappointed some people, who came expecting one thing and got another.  Settebello is a good 20 minute drive from The Strip.  No pizza place is worth that kind of drive, but if you're nearby, it's definitely worth searching out.

owOqldz2LV8HvhFvcCpiKw.text: Great pizza, great salads, and exceptional service each and every time I've been there.  I was happy to find out that there is a location in Pasadena also.

nmhj96vKcjBfCzqbWZtTfA.text: My co-workers and I had a delightful lunch on 4/18/13. Our waiter, Corey was warm and friendly. The pizza is some of the best, so fresh and flavorful. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We will be back!

rAfAoBpvI7qvmwd6TBcedA.text: Best pizza! Every time I am in Las Vegas I make a trip to come here. The settebello pizza and the diavola pizza are both amazing. Such a great experience.

30n4nX3VlFt5jUJSLOVc1Q.text: The best pizza place in Las Vegas, hands down.   The arugula salad is always amazing for a non pizza choice.  The Misto is also great with its selection of salumi and cheeses.  All of the pizza's Ive had there were delicious, the Settebello and the Carbonara are my faves..  Service has been great and just ok but I will keep going back.

KiEN9nc-H4ruN3pkzwkCiw.text: Really fresh, top notch pizza. Quality will blow your mind. The prosciutto appetizer is also one of my favorites. Service is great on the inside.

f9gU5ntwd6oG-d6oobS8uA.text: I have been going to Settebello since it opened in their old location. The best thing about them is the pizza of course. However, over the years, you take for granted the fantastic and friendly service. The food and service are always consistent and wonderful!  I think the best compliment I can give Settebello is that when we have visitors come to town we take them here. It's a a guaranteed winner. We have been there with people from Wisconsin, NY, Oregon, California, Washington and probably a few I am missing; everyone loves it and it's always good. Thank you Settebello for always being so friendly and good. I will be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

ORnzft2q3EpWVQK1K6MPIg.text: Excellent. I had the Margherita pizza and added arugula and caramelized onions.  I couldn't detect any basil on my pizza, but other than that it was fabulous.  Perfect crust - chewy & well-toasted. The salads are amazing - can't beat the prices and they don't skimp on the goodies. Dessert.  For $5 you can get a Nutella pizza with fresh bananas and slivered almonds.  It's the same size as their entree pizzas - about 12".  And I think they apply the Nutella with a squeeze bottle.  It's beautiful - a grid of thin lines over the whole pizza, edge to edge.  The bananas are put on while the crust is still hot so they soften a bit but don't get mushy.  I've had Nutella dessert pizzas all over the country & this one is the best so far. You could go the the Strip and pay a LOT more for a similar meal but it won't come close the the quality & authenticity of this comfortable place.

ZZeWaJscgR03ShKRNbaByg.text: This has to be my favorite spot for pizza. The gluten free crust taste like roasted marshmallows and it works! I have never has a bad thing here and the customer service is outstanding!

DInMuNB7njrS1jH5mWVsjg.text: I have been going to this restaurant for a few years now. They have the best pizza in town as far as I am concerned. It's clean, the food is good and the service is fantastic.  My favorite is theie margherita pizza  Along with their tomato  mozzarella salad.  Everything taste fresh looks fresh convenient parking if I could give them 10 stars I would.

Vovfg9JcJR8_HaLL3Te3Eg.text: Oh so delicious!!  Our friends brought us here and I'm so thankful! The service here was on point! Our waiter was so informative and helpful.  Drinks didn't go empty and he did it all with a smile! Awesome!  Now for the food - with my 5 star review you should guess how much we loved it.  The Quattro Formaggi pizza was wonderful topped with fontina, Gorgonzola, mozzarella and parmigiano reggiano.  We also tried the basil pesto pizza topped with strips of pancetta.  This was my favorite! The perfect balance of toppings gave this pizza top prize!   It's easy to fall in love with this pizza place.  This girl sure did!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Meatballs with focaccia bread
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza Pesto - my favorite!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Settebello

o97dfpASfzKzh6m0Q_q-fQ.text: Over lunch they offer any of their premium pizzas in 8" size for $9. We tried out the settebello and Bianca pies. They were good, but not great. I'd howevet give these guys another shot and order a large pie of their margherita or a simple pie to see how they do a classic.   The pies were good, but usually when pizza is amazing, the ingredients, texture, combination, proportions, etc. all sing in perfect harmony when you take a bite. The pizzas we had were fast tracked to be pros, but were still getting there. I was a wee disappointed since on yelp they have STELLAR rep.   Atmosphere is nice in Tuscan style with warm yellow hues. Don't sit near the oversized, wall-pendent. Huge globs of dust everywhere and there's fans around.   Good service experience.

K5_vuMday9jM0u_GDBtO-A.text: My family and I ate a delicious and most enjoyable meal here. My dad, who has been to Italy, says that this pizza is the closest he has ever found to the pizza he ate there. In addition to this, the desserts were excellent, and the staff was wonderful. We would all gladly return.

LROZ7F9esfmfUDkXjNv0pw.text: We have been coming to settebello for a long time and the reason they are still open and busy after all these years is because the quality is consistent. We never, ever had a bad experience! I love their pizza! I am from Italy and their pizza reminds me of the flavor of pizza I used to eat in Italy. Their Tiramisu is delicious also.

tMZ_b3wA_LepeXAOErYEVQ.text: Best pizza in LV... and don't get me started on the pasta  super fresh ingredients, great ambiance, gr at wine and beer selection.  A must when in Vegas.. 10

tJtFL_QnP6E68Pdru2jmwg.text: This place is just "good". Not bad, not great.  The vibe is real chill, but the Italian decorations seemed force so much so that it was disingenuous.  The caprese was just okay. The tomatoes were half the size of the buffalo mozzarella, which kinda sucks. Always like to have large tomato slices so that each bite you get tomato and mozza.  I had the margherita doc pizza which was full of flavor, but the middle parts of the pizza were too thin to hold any sort of ingredients. In other words, when you pick the pizza slice up it flops. And not to mention the sauce has a lot of water in it so it drips off the pizza, which gets messy.   Other than that the service was excellent. If your looking for a pizza place in Henderson, come, it's a really good and decent restaurant.

dcqzy0BIwhbXw6kv8WIdvg.text: I was turned on to settebello by my Italian professor in college (he was actually Italian and moved here from Italy, not just an American guy who spoke Italian). He said this was the one place he'd found that serves authentic Italian pizza. I went with my boyfriend and it remains some of my favorite pizza to date. Love this place.

Mfb5xSzfwPv53w8fu-ObtQ.text: Once again, our visit was wonderful!!!Food, service, atmosphere.   Thoroughly loved our insalate grande ,margerita pizza, house chianti and expresso. p.s. I included a photo of my husband with the pizza:-)  We will return next time we are back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. All mine!!!

j7y2GPpPQbSU6WguN-H20A.text: Is this what pizza is truly like in Italy? If so, I'm moving there! This pizza is delicious - fresh cheese, smokey crust and all. The salads are refreshing. The happy hour is amazing... $5 mini pizzas and great drink specials. I love the location: it's on the side of the District near Whole Foods. Not quite a 5 star experience for me as I haven't always had the best service... usually that just means I wait longer than I'd like for drinks. And they don't have my favorite dessert anymore, the Dream Bomba. If you don't know what I'm talking about, you're better off because they don't have it anymore since switching distributors. This place maybe slightly overrated but it is delicious and it never disappoints!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. If you&#39;ve seen one Margarita doc pizza from here, you&#39;ve seen &#39;em all, but it was delicious!

oNOuRO7KPoU5lTVyp0NbJQ.text: My wife and I went to Settabello's with a couple of friends for dinner because our Italian foreign exchange student said it was the closest to real Italian food she had found here in Vegas. The service was fast and the waiter was very helpful when we asked what would be some good choices. We salad, hot beats, a meat appetizer and two pizzas. The food was great and they kept our drinks. Nation point I would highly recommend trying this place if you haven't yet!

HvaWitQ0UjcO4PSMqnDfqQ.text: Met some girlfriends for dinner. Not a big pizza fan, and with it being happy hour I decided to check out their bites menu. I was excited when I saw their meat and cheese plate. I was surprised at its low price. Now I know why, because it was probably the saddest meat/cheese plate I've seen. 3 pieces of meat, 1 slice of white cheese, and a chunk of parmesan (that was the best part) Poor presentation, but when you're hungry, you eat. One of my friends had their pasta and enjoyed it. Some of the ladies had pizza and liked it. I had a couple of drinks which I thought were priced high by a $1 or $2. Our server was nice and accommodating. As for returning, I would again with friends, but would not go out of my way to visit because of the food, it was just ok.

PGu9RwzgREUp47XegV42qA.text: Settobello is awesome classic Napoli style pizza. Everything is fresh,great quality and perfectly balanced. I enjoy eating a pizza and a salad time to time.

sYjvM6on4p71Cx55VyYXCg.text: Thoroughly enjoyed this place.  We loved our waiter and I regret that we didn't get his name, but he helped develop some of their recipes.  I am super picky when it comes to pizza, honestly it was the best pizza I have had in ages.  Make sure you try the pear and jalapeno pizza. I know its a goofy combination and I agree it is, but I am here ti tell you that it is unbelievably great.  We ordered 4 pizzas and this pear and jalapeno stood out!!  Nice to see a real pizzaria.  Plus, their food is not expensive at all.

HIoazRO2_VEwsASzgdjsJw.text: The food and service are awesome.  The Margherita DOC pizza is really good.  The piatto misto is too.  They have a great selection of beer and wine, as well as whiskey.  And some great happy hour deals.  They also have some great desert options.

OBzipJLBNO0Pync9YD6CLQ.text: From out of town, randomly stopped into this place and SO GLAD WE DID. The food was incredible, we ordered the brisket pizza and it did not disappoint. Our server Thomas was amazing, and on top of everything. So impressed by this spot. Will be back next time we are in town!!

c8HyBfKivkkF5JCu6Y4svg.text: So when we first came here, it wasn't bad. This place actually had such a great environment, not to mention the food was pretty good as well. But this time was very different. When we entered the restaurant, the environment was completely different. The waitress blinked a few times, almost walked away, and then reluctantly greeted us. I didn't think much of it. I just thought maybe she was busy, but when I looked around, it was pretty empty. Anyways she acted pretty hostile which made me sort of feel unwelcome. I ended up forgetting about it cause maybe she had a tough day. UNTIL. There was a family behind us with the same server and she was so nice to them! Like she was literally laughing and smiling and it's like she was a completely different person! When she brought us the food, she didn't even get the order right. We ordered 3 pizzas and instead she brought us 4. She thought since we had another guest coming that we would want an extra one EVEN THOUGH we said nothing of the sort. Of course the food was good as usual but the waitress basically ruined my experience.

NIQAnnwkV4yax-X6MmONBw.text: Best Gluten Free Pizza crust!  Love the Argula Salad with Shaved Parmesan to go with it.

qcp4cAiKctrKLzuYApQYwg.text: My husband ordered me a gluten free pizza to go on a Monday night at 7:30pm. They said it would be 10 minutes so he left the house and was literally back in 15 the transaction was so quick! Pizza was delicious, we'll be back!

BVgTwmTPo8SA7Jt_IFaO-g.text: Started with the bruschetta and it was perfect, tomatoes were fresh and flavorful and the bread was soft and delicious. It was seriously my favorite, no complaints at all!!  Well lemme back up, I actually started with a watermelon margarita and holy guacamole, who knew an Italian place could make a great margarita and watermelon rita at that?!? It wasnt super sweet, it was amazing!! Enough that I had 3 :-)  Okay next we each ordered our own pizza, i went with the  bolognese i think i spelled that correctly...anyway it was yummy...my daughter and friend's pizzas were better but i did like mine. It was a sweet sauce, their pizzas are thin crust and very flavorful!! Our waiter (Tan, Tam one of those) was awesome and described the menu in detail and pizzas in detail.   Can't wait to go back and try some of the other pizza options!!

OBPhhXCjdL3c4_nq7Uuu5Q.text: This place is son good!   My friend and I came on a Monday night for their $5 margherita pizza night. Started with the caprese appetizer. It was awesome! It was really big for the 2 of us, but we finished it anyway.   I had no idea when the pizza came out that it was full sized! What a great deal for $5! We each ate half, so next time we will split.   Their pizza is really, really good. Didn't even add parmesan cheese on top or anything, it didn't need it.   The bill was very affordable with this deal, and the food was great! My friend knew our server, so of course service was excellent. I can tell he is a really nice guy anyway from his interaction with other tables as well. Will definitely be back!

Txbw--grUaDuOuwqk-RVbA.text: We came back again as it's been a while since we last visited. Our visit was so incredible that I just needed to share.  The hostess greeted us rather quickly as soon as we walked in. We asked if we could sit on the patio. We really must have been the only crazies that wanted to sit out on the patio in July because none of the patio seat cushions were on the chair hah! The hostess was kind enough to put them on for us, so no big deal!  Our waitress was Madison and she was incredible! We both recognized each other, but couldn't figure out where from. Later in the evening I realized that we both went to college together. Small world! She came out to check on us throughout the night. Even though none of her other tables were outside, she didn't forget about us! Which is pretty incredible because I feel like sometimes when you're outside, you're easily forgotten about. But Madison did a great job refilling out drinks, making sure we were good and making sure our food was brought out in a timely manner. Hats off to her, for sure!  I had a moscow mule while my husband had a beer. My mule was delightful! I opted for the garden mule, and it was full of delicious fruit flavors. We started with the focaccia bread as well which is what their pizza crust is made out of but honestly, you can't get enough of it! It's so tasty!  For dinner, my husband had this brisket pizza and I had the traditional margarehita pizza. He said his had a little kick to it because there were some spices added, but he throughly enjoyed the taste of the brisket and the pizza overall. My pizza was also incredible! The red sauce they use is not too sweet and not to spicy. It's a perfect blend.  We will definitely be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. My husband out on the patio

i90-fOwe1nb-B45pF1leHA.text: Stumbled on Settebello while exploring the area! Sat at the bar and ordered a Quattro formaggi (4 cheese) pizza with prosciutto! It was really great...in fact pizza was so great that it is comparable to Italy and to high end places at that!  Highly recommend!

The salad was so good I would come back just to order that again. The dressing wasn't overpowering and it was so fresh. The pizza was the best gluten free pizza I've had. Can't wait to come back and try other flavors.

ZJoylPKOzocOZPOo8s63Yg.text: One of the rarest encounter as a foodie is Verace pizza Napoletan (vpn) certified pizzeria. When I first heard of vpn pizza in the Las Vegas area, I knew I had to give it a try. The association of vpn (avpn) give special designation to pizzerias who meet strict requirements that respect the tradition of the art of Neapolitan pizza makings.   Settebello is a vpn certified pizzeria with three locations throughout Las Vegas. I visited the green valley location which is closer to where I live. It is located in the green valley plaza with plenty of parking available. I came in late afternoon on a Saturday. No wait line. I was seated promptly upon entering the establishment.   Settebello serve a variety of vpn pizza and beverages to choose from. The prices for the pizza were decent for the quality that you get. I love that they have flavored sparkling water. I opted for the grapefruit which was refreshing and good on a hot day.   I ordered the Bianca pizza (Aragula, Parmesan, prosciutto, basil, olive oil) and Vico (sausage, marscapone, red onion, basil, olive oil). They were both so delicious with fresh topping ingredients. The pizza dough was light and chewy. I would request for crispier crusts next time and recommend to those who like their crust extra crispy to mention it when ordering.   Staff was great and polite! I will add this place as one of my favorite pizza places in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Vpn #228
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. VPN certification

IhzDQgi5OiWuK83mVWHnKw.text: Found this place on YELP! When we first walked in the place was packed at 7:30pm and I thought that's a good sign. It looked like family night.   Food: Half capricciosa half Settebello - amazing flavor combination! Not even sure where the sauce is, I don't think they have sauce on the pizza  it was delicious. One of the best "finer dinning" pizza I've ever had. Ingredients were fresh which made the difference and probably added to the wonderful taste.   insalata grande - a simple salad  but also delicious!   Drinks: Sin tax IPA beer and solerno drink that the waitress recommend. Both were good.   Next time I'm in the area I will try this place again!! The pizza was really good!!   Parking is great, lots of spaces in a newer complex so everything looks shiny, new and clean!

6_6Q8UkTEmM-WDnz4lKsxg.text: I've been a Settebello fan for years, but haven't spent much time at the Green Valley location.  I was here recently for their Happy Hour (3:00pm - 6:00pm), which is my favorite HH in the Vegas valley.   I'm not a huge drinker of alcohol, preferring the rather basic Moscow Mule as my drink of choice, which is only $5 on Mondays.  Plus, the Happy Hour menu is chockful of $5 items;  you could order each one and easily share them with a friend and not spend a chunk of money.  There are four of these $5  items on the menu:  Piatto Misto (sampling of Italian meats and cheese served with focaccia);  Mini Ripieno (prosciutto cotto, Parmigiano, and fresh mozzarella); Mini Pizza (Margherita or Marinara with one complimentary topping);  Spiedini (Prosciutto wrapped around Fontina cheese, served w/ a mini Caprese). I love the food here and the service is always attentive.  Settebello will continue to be a reliable go-to for me.

nZGV1AxIj1tUJJB3c9Ra5A.text: I went there to meet up with a girlfriend for a girls night out. I eat a gluten free diet due to a food allergy so i wasn't sure what i was going to end up ordering. I didn't know they had gluten free pizza! I was really excited to try it, we got the DOC I think it was called and it was delicious. The waiter (I didn't get his name but he had curly hair in a man bun) was really awesome and said they could change gloves and would be very careful out cross contamination which was appreciated. It made me feel at ease and he even brought out a bag of their flour so I could look at the ingredients in regards to my allergy. Thumbs up for him   I will definitely be back with my hubby!

QBwE10SPP7y9JggWK15D1A.text: The best of the best. Same pizza like the one we have eaten in italy.  We love their margarita Pizza and we especially love their Monday's especials. We can never let the Nutella pass that is a must eat at settebellos, whether we are eating in or taking out

RZAHEb678lXcL2E7OvrXqA.text: Settebello is one of our favorite date night spots. The pizza is absolutely amazing, the crust and toppings are delicious, I love that they always come up with something new to try and fall in love with. Service is great and the prices are a bit high but very much worth the occasional splurge, highly recommended!

_BGM6j4QTWxPuFzTpfKjNw.text: We found Settebello while looking for a restaurant with great service and food that served gluten free food.   Any pizza can be made gluten free, just add $5. They are very conscious and knowledgeable about celiac and can cook your pizza in a special way if needed, which is always good when you need to be GF.   We ordered two pizzas and a salad to split between three people. The gluten free pizza was the best gluten free pizza I have had! That says a lot because I have had many. It doesn't even taste like gluten free pizza.  We also ordered two regular pizzas to go for the non-gluten free members of our family.  Tam, our server, was fantastic! Definitely will be back.
