yj0TMHHJlvqz8Vp3gYdAAg.text: So I tried this place a year ago and didn't like it, but wanted to try it again because the concept is good, reviews are good, and it's close to home. However, second time and still don't like it.   The pizza is SUPER wet and floppy. I understand people say this is a "fork and knife" type pizza place, but the flavor isn't even there. The sauce was extremely bland. And if you try to eat the pizza with your hands, you will have the crust in your hand, while the toppings and the rest of pizza all fall down. Pizza should have some type of structure to me and Settebello definitely does not.   So I think this will be my last time coming here. Service was good (reason for two stars), but pizza was terrible and there are too many great pizza places in the country than to ever have to return to Soggyville.

jDQjYfAhVf-XMiG7QIipTQ.text: Love the pizza here!  So I'm off my no carb kick these days, and I've been indulging in pizza on occasion.  I swear it's only occasionally!  The pizza here truly gourmet style!  I mean delicious!  They use different oils, cured meats and different cheeses that all taste absolutely delicious when combined.    My girlfriend and I started with the bruschetta!  Also delicious!  One final comment!  We attended a cycling class in the morning!  A must after eating all the carbs!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

27kB2ulH4myXWcsNqiZFNA.text: I don't give 5 stars to no one but if you come here; you will understand the love.   It all starts at the Hostess. Cheerful, attentive, aware, helpful and kind in the midst of ravenous, possibly hangry, Neapolitan pizza provocateurs gnashing at her like Velociraptors on the hunt. Without a worry because she knows the power she wields in her mighty pen, where one overt pouty mouth moment because it was not your time, may cast you to the imagined dog house where only those that can hear a dog whistle can hear their name and know their time has come.   Calmly, the Guard of the Gate calls the name of the next fortunate souls to dine at the church of the Napoli wood oven. Purveyor of the delicately arranged enigmatic flavors that pop like snaps of pencils breaking in your hands. The surge of spices, herbs, other worldly olive oil and the cheese... what dost thou place on the crust of this opaque pizza so warm, melted, chewy and bright? Mozzarella and what else I say!?!?.What are the mystery flavors that brighten your day, make the bad day go away and cause you to close your eyes to accept all the senses being touched by this pizza angel. Now let's speak  to this dough, the crust, the edible pallet with ingredients married in the church of the chefs imaginations. I mean who thinks to put jalapeno marmalade on a pizza with Calabrese?!?! Oh that sweet meat heat! And that delicate chew, allowing the teeth, gums , tongue and palate to dance slowly with the pizza, tasting every element; flavors, textures, heat and if you close your eyes and nom, nom, nom out loud, I swear it tastes even better. Trust me!  I'm going to just leave it at this...there is no where else you need to go to have Zah! This is a great place to take a date. Great wine, cold beers, oh and the appetizers... and the salads. I die for the beet salad.   La pieste de resistance?!?! That dessert pizza. Just look at the pic ... it speaks volumes.

Fb2JSsWdV-zHIV9RmRmzfw.text: BEST PIZZA IN VEGAS!  Seriously Nevada pizza sucks but this is just so much awesome.  Believe the reviewer who stated about their certifications to keep them truly neopolitan.It is.    I  gotta add more hours to my work out so I can justify my new addiction.  And their cocktails are awesome.  Go here.  Don't blame me or the other reviewers for enabling your new addicting.  ;).

ZC9ngqHri-mv_b9LKRAoLQ.text: I feel Settebello has earned the 5-star from me; I have been numerous times for lunch, dinner, and happy hour. They never disappoint.   The food is so fresh, authentic, and always consistent. They have a genuine and vibrant staff with a relaxed, casual atmosphere.   Even though it's not the most convenient, I will continue to visit often, as they are easily the best pizza I've had in Henderson and so much more!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

1N9RQ2VBvQSJj-4CyaAYYg.text: I know this is supposedly the best pizza in Vegas, but I guess I'm not a huge fan of it...  First off, the service here is wonderful. They are all very attentive and friendly, checking to make sure everything is to your liking. The wait can be long but they'll give you water as you're waiting. There's always the option to sit at the bar too and get some appetizer before a table opens up.  The menu has a decent selection of pizzas and they usually have a special pizza of the day. You can get pizzas with or without tomato sauce. The pizzas I have tried are the Diavola, the Vico, and one of their specials of the day but I can't remember too much about it.   Diavola - It has a very nice little kick from the crushed red peppers and the salame gives a good saltiness.  Vico - The mascarpone pretty much melted and mixed with the olive oil and was a great substitute for having no crushed tomatoes. I was skeptical about no tomatoes but was pleasantly surprised. I also really liked the fennel and wood oven sausage, even though I generally am not a fan of sausage.  So why the 3 stars? I'm not a huge fan of their crust. It's a bit too wet and thin for me. This is one of those very thin pizzas where it's probably easier to eat with a fork and knife. For me, I like a crust that can hold its weight and has a nice crunch. Theirs is nice and doughy, which I do like, but it doesn't have that solid crust I really like in a pizza. Their toppings are great and all work well together, but there is very little.. I know this is supposed to be how traditional pizzas are, but I guess my poor student budget doesn't agree with it too much.    This isn't the best pizza in my eyes, but everyone has different tastes. It is undeniably good in terms of quality of toppings, but it just doesn't have the amount I would like. And that crust, it leaves me wanting more crunch!

sdOXLrhy44QAexfEPgflQg.text: Ever since my favorite pizza place closed down, my family and I have been on the hunt for a phenomenal pizza.  I'm very picky about pizza and don't eat it often, but when I do, I only want the best.  Settebello makes a good pizza.  It was a good size and tasty.  It's not my first pick for pizza but it is the closest being here in Henderson.  Service is eh.

bbDidaFq3XsnYy_y9WaQjg.text: As my brother is proof that not everyone likes the Napolitano style pizza, this is right up my alley. When it's nice and thin as if they wish they could create this on a big slice of naan or oversized cracker, that works for me. Lots of flavor and good individual size. Only have taken this to go so not sure about this service so this is purely on the fact that I consider this a great pizza.

n6LnrM-KITB22PRjwbpsvA.text: I've been on a search for amazing pizza, and this is one of the best pies I've had anywhere. The crust is textured incredibly well, the chewiest crust you've had. The Emilia had an amazing set of toppings that tasted both fresh and perfectly complimentary to each other.  Near perfect.

ZtMbr4qpwribiNZZAeqVdQ.text: This place is a hidden gem! Knock your socks off pizza with fresh generous toppings! It has the perfect ambiance to make pizza feel kind of classy lol. I mean it's pizza: You don't need to dress it up much, we already love pizza. We will definitely be coming back.

q117zRd0XnXQuMsizIQLaQ.text: My family and I had a late lunch here and the place was hardly packed which was nice.  We started off with the insalata grande salad of mixed greens, fresh tomatoes, artichoke hearts, roasted mushrooms, olives, pine nuts, cracked pepper, shaved parmigiano reggiano topped with balsamic vinaigrette.  The salad was refreshing and delicious.  We ordered two pizzas - Margherita with crushed tomatoes, buffalo mozzarella, basil, parmigiano reggiano and extra virgin olive oil and Settebello with crushed tomatoes, pancetta, sausage, roasted mushrooms, toasted pine nuts, mozzarella, basil and extra virgin olive oil.  The pizzas were light and thin crusted, and the toppings were fresh and flavorful. The salad and pizza were delicious, and we'll dine here again when we're back in Vegas.

Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello pizza

-6qlaqRq7q8zuAlLNN5DeQ.text: Thanks Yelp for helping us (visitors for a week) find Settobello.  Ordered a Settobello, Bolanese & a special (white veg pizza with spinach)...all point on and definitely we will b back before we leave

cOghm3GGZ075uiUIbLD05w.text: WOW.. you thought you loved pizza before?  Head on down to Settebello and be blown away!  The pizza here was amazing and tasted so freakin' good.  My buddy Wayne C. showed me Settebello and explained to me the story behind their pizza making and how their ingredients are flown fresh from Italy to be prepared right here in Vegas.  The pizza definitely accounts for the taste and the price was actually pretty decent, which is surprising.  I usually equate the GVR area with forking out tons of cash but I was pleasantly surprised with Settebello's quality and pricing.  Since I've visited here, it has become pretty hard to munch on a regular ol' pizza and put a smile on because most other pizza pies I've tried doesn't even compare.  Definitely won over my vote for best pizza ever and I look forward to frequenting this joint again to try the Italian drinks and appetizers.

IaG39Vo--TXShOW6tigudw.text: I like many, love Pizza. So much i have spent years trying everything and spent years making my own. I prefer traditional, crispy thin crust pizzas.  So Setabello Pros: great location, nice atomsphere, menu and  awesome ingredients.                          Cons: execution and staff.  They have teens making these pizzas everytime I have gone. I get soggy pizza (with great toppings)  and a  burnt crust which is detreminal if it's too much which it has been 90% of the time.  Great flavors with their quality ingredients, but not so great texture and defintiely not what i consider traditional.   worth a try, but not the best.

agsGlocxSFE-9o1vt4EeMQ.text: I started coming to Settebello when they first opened this location. I came every week up until I moved out of state 4 years ago. I finally move back to vegas and this is the place I missed so much. 12/14/16 Such a disappointment with the service and the food. I am very familiar with the style of pizza this place serves I know it very well since I was a regular earlier years, but this time around I was so disappointed. Our server was absolutely the worst! Took forever to get refills and to go boxes seems like we were forgotten about. The pizza was lacking flavor and toppings! It was also burnt. The server never came around to ask how our food was. This experience was unpleasant and I'm not sure if I would return

S9Rtrm10QZ53WFqhpd00Cg.text: Great pie.  Love the authentic crust and location in GV is great.  We visit often..

eIunDXQxwLS8ZmEE8ys_NQ.text: Can't beat living in the center of The District.  How wonderful is it to be walking distance from this gem.  This place is delicious; the pizzas and appetizers are full of flavors.  The wines and cocktails are inexpensive.  Fiance and I ordered a bottle of wine for $30, and it tastes like a $90 bottle sold everywhere else!  Settebello has a rustic-Italian ambiance.  Very cozy as well since there's about 20 tables, a bar, and a kitchen in a 1,000sq.ft. area.  But I like it!

dKc0KMKEu21AWBlCI2hS4w.text: Service has really tanked under new management. Servers are usually too busy chatting amongst each other, and I recently had to wait an hour for a to go salad and focaccia bread. Yeah, I called ahead and was quoted twenty minutes. No biggie. Waited an additional 35 minutes in store for my food. Asked for extra olive oil, balsamic, and lemons on the side. Got salad dressing and didn't realize it until I got home. The food is still the same, but it just doesn't feel like my good ole neighborhood pizza joint these days

QPKAS9zp3yMGCaQdwA1R2Q.text: if I could give it zero stars I would. awful awful awful.  VERY expensive - 2 pizzas, 2 salads $100. really?  not much sauce but tomato chunks instead,   gloppy cheese, almost like cottage cheese.   never go again.

mhIM4jkguvO8YEGX9IPfXg.text: Got the prosciutto wrapped arugula appetizer and the Settebello's pizza.   Amazing. The arugula had thin sliced mozzarella and this balsamic glaze that made it sweet, salty, and light.   The pizza was so thin I could see through it. Crust was crispy, the gobs of cheese melted in your mouth and the sausage was seasoned well with the right amount of heat.   Best pizza I've had in a long time. Don't waste any time, come here. You won't regret it.

60YVqK9n7Xg-ZIodDS1UUQ.text: Probably the closest to Neapolitan Pizza you're going to get outside of Italy! I'm a huge fan of Buffalo Mozzarella (creamier, softer, and sweeter than than cheese from normal cows), which they have here (The Margherita DOC). You'll never go back from buffalo mozzarella -- go the extra mile. You'll never (and should never) go anywhere else for pizza in the Valley.

Eu8J41i0O1HAj9WigFLmBQ.text: Eh.   I was excited--nay, thrilled to try this place for the first time. Since they are certified for their pizza from Italy I had to try it. There are mixed reviews, but despite my better judgment we went for it yesterday.   We ordered their misto plate, basically pizza bread with meat and veggies, their settebello pizza and their lasagna pizza. The misto was salty from the bread to the meats paired with it. The veggies were cooked then chilled, which wasn't pleasant to me. As for their pizza, it's okay. The crust is chewy, toppings are okay and the sauce is between acidic & tangy. Overall, edible but nothing I'll crave again.   Good experience with service but the food is too mediocre for my taste. Sorry fans of settebello--I am not a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Part of the menu

QCAmY7cPtOwRTLc2QCEAYw.text: This was my third visit to Settebello and it was definitely my last.  One of the reasons I am willing to pay for over priced pizza is because they offer gluten free crust. The other reason I came here was because I love Nutella on a pizza for a dessert and this is one of the few places where they offer it. My friend and I decided to split a pizza for dinner and intended to share a Nutella pizza for dessert. I ordered the gluten free pizza and told the waiter that we would also be ordering a dessert pizza. After we ate the first pizza, I told the waiter that we were ready to order the dessert pizza. He said, "I hope you didn't want that gluten free, we don't offer it." I corrected him and told him I had eaten a gluten free Nutella pizza there before and I knew they offered it. He went to check with the kitchen and then came out and told me they would not sell me a gf dessert pizza because "they we were running out of gluten free crusts and they were saving them for regular pizza orders." Seriously?! I am PAYING for the pizza, plus I am paying the ridiculous up charge for a gluten free crust.  Apparently their idea of customer service does not include serving customers who want gluten free pizza unless they want to order the $20 pizza versus the $16 dessert pizza.  Well, don't worry Settebello, I won't be bothering you with requests for gluten free pizza again.

xmKABwSSfIEkX90P-EUzcQ.text: Love this place and my kids do too - here are the top reasons:  1. Fast.  This pizza cooks quickly.  2.  Great big booths!  3.  Authentic, unique and super yummy pizza - the kids menu is great (make your own pizza with gelato at the end) 4.  Great salads for those of us who don't eat a lot of carbs - I love their Arugula Salad  Just a great place to go - comfortable, great food and kids friendly!

XuNWNc2XoMPXADD4ixJ6bQ.text: This place has some amazing pizza. I'm someone who can't eat pizza at regular chain restaurants (ex. BJ's, italian restaurants, etc.) or delivery places (ex. Pizza hut, dominos, papa johns, etc.) because they produce such a poor quality pizza. Here they make all their pizza wood fired and having been to Italy before, this place tastes just like pizza you could find in Italy. Definitely recommend this place if you're craving Pizza and its in a really nice area as well.

IyjwGk4fdf8WaWYsaE7pwA.text: Lived in Vegas almost 9 years and this is by far my favorite pizza place. If you have ever been to Italy, this is authentic Napolitano pizza. Everything is fantastic! Including every dessert on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Panzanella salad

yS0TsUzKBQlHQCZZeBrxww.text: First off, AMAZING salad. It had artichoke hearts, goat cheese, pine nuts, arugula, and a delicious balsamic. I could eat that everyday.   The pizza was great!  Our only complaint is that we've been twice and even though we asked for well done the second time, the center of the pizza was soggy. The crust is delicious and the sauce creates a flavor explosion... So there has to be a way to keep the pizza napolentana style on the soft style without getting a soggy center. I still loved it, just can't do take out or leftovers because you would open up a really soggy mess if you tried to eat it on the second day.   We will definitely be back time and time again.

UEKMzcQ7IaZ822JakytgdQ.text: Definitely recommend the pizza with arugula- it gets really crowded for dinner and is a bit pricey but very yummy!

dA1Sh3EFUe07kgwELBEbjg.text: Probably the best place in Vegas area for italian style pizza. Prices could be a bit lower but still reasonable

Q0nLo-fzpRBzbsKUIX537Q.text: All the pizzas are mouthwatering. The beet salad was tip top. I fell in love more and more with each bite. And I'd encourage everyone to cap off their meal with the "to die for" tiramisu and un cafe. And eat your pizza with a fork and knife! The pizzas fall apart easily do not try and pick your slice up...it's a good thing though because the pizza dough is dripping in this amazingly robust marinara. And to top off the whole experience the entire wait staff was incredibly good looking and polite.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Un café
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Beet salad, goat cheese, spinach, arugula
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

SoQGbGhbrpeKDBwZNHBd9g.text: Tried margherita pizza last night - I like woody smokiness of the crust but sauce, mozzarella cheese , and basil were not very flavorful. I'm not sure how you screw up a simple pizza like this. This is a second trip there and I find it disappointing. Ambience is good.

K89KpDp8DRrWQzTgC2v0AA.text: Awesome food and drinks! One of the best pizzas I've ever had. The staff is all very knowledgable of the menu which is a plus and I believe all their ingredients are imported!!

Q5os-0KhQVouKNXIw9VyqA.text: People rave about this pizza but it just doesn't do it for me. It comes out seemingly not cooked enough. You lift up the pizza and the cheese slides off. Weird texture to me. Have eaten here a few times when friend invite me, but I'll pass on the invite from now on. I always leave hungry cause I wasn't satisfied.

lvMCMRndh4kC4DfpTxxYlw.text: The pizza is excellent - Napoli style, as everyone else has noted.  The ingredients are fresh and delicious, and the selection is varied. The ambiance inside is quite casual. It was started right here in Vegas and there are only 2 other locations in the country. Prices are good - about $12 for an individual pie. Bonus points for being somewhat close to my house. Double bonus points because I went there with 2 toddlers who were running around and screaming and the waiter was super nice and accomodating, bringing us extra breadsticks, etc.  Overall, Settebello is definitely at the top of my non-strip list for visitors.

NlsRyKv4mysP-30zhrWYCA.text: Great Happy Hour and really friendly service 1st, a shout out for the bartender MADISON or was it MADISAN? She was GREAT and my wine glass was never empty, she was really helpful with my wife's food orders (my wife is a Vegan so thats not easy.) and she had no problem making suggestions (i like that) The food was all above average and tasted great from the happy hour menu The only reason I gave it a 4 and not a 5 is because they have their own label for all the wines and i can't find them on the internet, I like tracking and saving wine info with Vivino app My wrap up is: Service 100%, Food was AMAZING (I didn't like the Tiramisu that much) Wine selection, Very Good not huge, but I liked all the wines I tried (5 in all)  Im not sure if the 5th wine was good or not, my Buzz was making everything seem good by then haha  I will go back for sure

LwkdT7IxuaMWOPosJL5btw.text: Can't believe people keep giving this place great ratings! I can make better pizza at home with my oven. LAS VEGAS. Please head to either Chicago or Detroit for great pizza that has depth and has big flavor. Pizza in Las Vegas sucks period. One place I want to mention is Home Plate Grill at Blue Diamond and Decatur. Lots better.   The pizza I had was 'The Settebello". Very dry and had little toppings. Expensive and very small too. The only plus was the ingredients were quality ones but not many covered the pizza! Too much bread showing.

DpKKYmaTpdT8cnLru8yVJA.text: We have been to Settebello many times both here in Henderson and in SLC. When we went tonight the service was not good - all of the servers seemed unhappy to be at work and weren't nice at all. The food was good. Inside it had to be at least 90 degrees - not sure if the air was broken or not. Needless to say it will be a long while before we go here again. Too bad because the food really is good.

OuNExad3pD2rjibz2j-L0w.text: beautiful food with great eye-appeal and amazing flavors.   we started with the involtini -- thinly sliced prosciutto wrapped around baby arugula and goat cheese, drizzled with olive oil and aged balsamic then finished with shaved parmigiano-reggiano. gorgeous dish -- the peppery greens and creamy tang of the cheese were perfect foils for the rich, salty pork. well conceived, well executed and well received.   if you still have lingering doubts that quality ingredients carefully sourced make a huge difference, close your eyes and just smell your pizza (ours was the SETTEBELLO -- crushed tomatoes, fennel sausage, pancetta, roasted mushrooms, pine nuts, basil, mozzarella. the aroma from the toppings was pure pleasure.   here's the criticism -- not exactly love at first bite. i had some very serious problems with the texture.   their pizza's really soggy especially in the center. now, i understand that's a personal preference but pizza you can eat with a spoon's kind of a turn off for me. i'm sure the style is terribly traditional (and SETTEBELLO makes an awfully big deal about the authenticity of their pizza) but the wet, spongy crust was just tough to get passed.   ours was a little undercooked and the fact that we were the first customers of the day and that the oven probably hadn't come up to temperature didn't help. as much as i enjoyed the flavors, their pizza felt like wet cardboard in my mouth. still i gave them four stars -- yeah, it was that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. CANNOLI with mini chocolate chips
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. SETTEBELLO PIZZA
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. WYATT nibbling shaved parmigiano-reggiano

wphdSIyYihf-uqs8J_n6UQ.text: OMG! Fabulous tasting pizza crust.  I mean it was truly a memorable experience eating here.  Between four of us, we had the Misto, and we tried four different pizza (ended up taking 1.5 home).  All good, with the exception of the Margherita, which was a bit on the soggy side.  I enjoyed it so much, I will go just for the Misto--A Sampling of Italian Style Meats, Vegetables and a Bite of Cheese. Served with Focaccia!!    My only reason for JUST 4 stars was the 'tiny bit soggy'  Margherita pizza.

vgdUIKf9SFwgLTUSRYBEMA.text: Off the strip but that will never keep me from coming here everytime I visit sin city  Came for happy hour, buy one get one free.  Epic deal.  Came up hard on four cocktails and 6 beers.   *note-must be seated in bar area and may not be beer from there Italian import menu.  Started with prosciutto appetizer which is wrapped in arugula and goat cheese.  Amazing with cocktails.   Second appetizer was the misto which is sliced cured italian meats, veggies and cheeses.  Went perfect with my pale ales.    Ordered Capricciosa with prosciutto, artichoke hearts, mushrooms and kalamata olives.   Bold flavor, good topping combination and very unique pizza.    also got their namesake, Settebello.  Pancetta, sausage, mushrooms, and toasted pine nuts!!  GET THIS PIZZA FIRST  'NUFF SAID  Sweet cream and hazelnut gelato and panna cotta for dessert.    Left settebello satisfied and smiling like a kid in a candy shop

gJDTXPVgt8RCkX9RM1aN-Q.text: My second favorite pizza place in the country! They have simple cheese pies or! Delicious new combinations of dressings and things you don't normally see in a pie. One of my favorites they have is the Involtini di Prosciutto! Prosciutto wrapped around baby arugula and goat cheese. With more cheese shaved on top balsamic and olive oil on top. You can never go wrong with the cheese pie. Which one person can eat themselves! Or order a couple and share. I love the little marks the food gets because it comes straight from the oven. Such delicious tasting food! They are busy! I've never had to wait long for a table though. They have an awesome menu so no matter what you pick I am sure you will enjoy!

v1srQZaep6Cn_LEvuUVelA.text: Food was good, service was good, overall atmosphere of the restaurant was not good.  Was extremely hot inside, I don't think there was any ac running, and no blinds on the front door so intense sun glare for most the meal.  Overall not a nice dinning experience.

lqdvO6SWqFtI33u8T3g4JA.text: Great authentic pizzeria. This is the real thing, if your looking for American pizza this is not it. Traditional Italian pizza, softer crust, but fresh. Everything down to the condiments,  silverware and music are italian. Try the Mist if you love good antipasto. The Inalada Grande (salad) is awedome, and i dont like dalad much.Great atmosphere.

GR1TwQ1lKp1k_98E8RuhvQ.text: Just had lunch here yesterday and it was so delicious! We had the involtini, the Emilia, and a bolognese pizza that I can't remember the name of. The Emilia was one of the best white pizzas I've had in Vegas. All the flavors were so unique and the ingredients tasted super fresh. I've been wanting to come to the actual restaurant for a long time after having it to go with others. I'm really glad I finally went and can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Another bolognese pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Emilia
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The involtini

PtwFZNWHIhNZRRbcDHhOKQ.text: Three and a half stars is more accurate.      I was searching for authentic Neapolitan pizza near LV.  This is it!        The decor is chic and modern and the food was delicious and satisfying.      The bummer:  the waitress and entry phase.  We had to flag her several times and it seems we were bothering her.  The place was not crowded at the time(4 in the afternoon).  Also we had our children with us and they didn't offer crayons or a kids' menu at the beginning of the experience. How do I know they have those items?  We saw them at the entry podium.      There needs to be a refresher course on customer service for the serving staff.

UNdxekxs7HpFPLFEbAHN9w.text: This is my family's favorite pizza joint, hands down. The service has always been amazing, the atmosphere is comfortable, and the food-delicious. The pizza and the cappuccino are just like everything I've ever had overseas.   Now if they would deliver to my house, I would be in Heaven. And fat.

Ul1_ZcGIs8K8lrOY3eel9g.text: The service is bad most of the time, however the food is delicious. The regular crust gets sloppy and wet in the middle so go for the gluten free as its chewy and holds its texture. I don't have gluten restrictions and still choose it over the regular every time...trust me you won't be disappointed.

nFme_4GQp0Gi3SkPtYUPWw.text: The place has a great atmosphere and the service is pretty good but when it comes to their food, I can honestly say, I have never been more disappointed. It all happened somewhere between the the near topping-less margarita pizza and the puddle of grease that formed from it's limp "thin crust." Maybe we just came on a bad night but I have never had a pizza this terrible. If you want a good pizza and a good atmosphere your better off going to metro pizza. I've gone there countless times and haven't been disappointed yet. Even a 5 dollar hot and ready is better than this fraud of a pizza joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebellos version of margarita pizza

ouaT8fEBdAlBD-5CqpnEyw.text: Settebello is my fav pizza place in town. No wonder this place has been posted on Seven and Vegas weekly so many times. It is truly a local gem place. Atmosphere here is very casual with a full bar serving by the side. All their ingredients are imported from Italy (flours, olive oil, cheese, tomato, Prosciutto Cott...) I pretty much tried everything on menu already. Everything tastes good. Here are my fav: 1.) Settebello pizza, 2.)Capriccios pizza,3.) Bianc pizza, 4.) Insalata Grand salad, 5.) Caprese, 6.) Panna Cotta   Also, they do have happy hours. All small bites are $5 each with half priced selected cocktails and beers.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

b2dzOuMWv9JrxXUFw08V4w.text: By far, one of the best pizza joints in South Las Vegas.  Perfect Italian style fire burned pizza.  Appetizers during happy hour are delicious.  Atmosphere is great, owners are great and staff is great.  We even hosted one of our monthly club meetings here and they handled a group of 22 flawlessly.  When we have that pizza craving, Settebello is always our go-to choice.  Bellisimo!

6Q2R97Kg38rER8xlEhcjKQ.text: Whenever in Henderson Settebello beckons me. Delicious. Authentic. Yeah. Mmmmm.  I give it five stars because the pizza is delicious and reminds me of the year and a half I spent in Italy. It's not like the standard American-style pizza served by nearly every other pizza joint.  But don't let that scare you.  I'm not a pizza snob, I'll gulp down the ordinary stuff too.  Ordinary is ordinary, Settebello is Pizza Napoletana and worth trying.   My favorite pizza is the Settebello with olives substituted for the pine nuts.  If I'm lucky and can eat there often enough that I don't want the same thing as last time, then I go with the Diavola.  A great combination of flavor and kick.   The service has always been attentive.  I've not had a bad experience in the dozen or so times I've been in.

iqn9Ad_8wVTNCVat9b17wA.text: It's great service.  Just not my type of pizza.  Try for yourself, you may like.  My niece who's 18 loved it.

dez_FIWOE_sHIhH4WLxqUw.text: Incredibile, Gustoso, Fantastico, Bella, Semplicemente la Migliore.  I do NOT speak italian, however, when you taste the food here, your mouth will be exploding with simple and great flavors that you will describe as Amazing, Tasty, Fantastic, Beautiful and Simply the Best!  1.  Parking - In the District and parking in the area they are at is very, very good. easy and short walk!  2.  Ambiance - Very nice, you feel like you are in  an urban environment compared to other places, and certainly 100% more visible than their former location at an empty strip mall on Horizon Ridge.  3.  The Wait - If you go during peak times, guess what, you gonna wait. There is not much room to wait, so you can give them your cell and walk around and wait outside or at a few of the shops. This is where West Elm gets most of their foot traffic me thinks.  If you go at slightly off hours,  like dinner on Friday at 7:45 pm to 9:00 pm, you can usually get a table immediately. During normal hours, you get a lot of larger families.  4.  The Food - Wow. what can i say?  I love PIZZA. I love Martino's Pizza at their place on Coronado Center and Eastern. I love Metro. I really enjoyed 3 Brothers when they were open.  I enjoy all the stuff in a mixed combo.  I would scarf down these pizzas!  Here at Settobello, the pizza is so DIFFERENT and so amazing...  a.  the ingredients - sure they have some combo's, yet the tastes are not overpowering or oily( I like this) or with tomato sauce.  the tastes are so subtle and so delicate, yet when mixed, just as good if not better than the normal pizza from other places.  b.  the crust - Wow again. the texture and taste, with it's slight taste from being cooked in a very hot wood fired oven. I cannot imagine that I, who usually stuff my mouth with food and swallow, stopped to experience the simple tastes. I normally don't get all that! I am the kinda person that when you ask me  how the red wine tastes, I will tell you it was, well, red. I don't distinguish the subtle flavors normally and for this place and their pizza, it was a great experience to do this!!!  c.  the how - as the crust is thin and the serving is about 12-14 inches round approximately, it is best to ask for it sliced if you are sharing, or at least eat with fork and knife.  If you are sharing go for whatever you  want to try, however, one pizza is plenty for one person, as it is thin.  We had the Settebello, the Margherita and the Pizza Lasagna... I am going back soon and maybe today!  5.  Dessert - Order the Nutella Pizza early, as it takes time to cook like a regular pizza, as it is the same pizza crust topped with nutella. You have like Nutella, however, I do and my kids do and this was a great tasting hot pizza dessert.  We also tried the Panna Cotta which was great.   6.  Service - While I was waiting with three kids for 35 minutes on a hot evening for a table, I could not help but watch the service.  Never, let first impression rule you. I assumed the service was going to be unorganized, all over the place, and just not efficient. What I got was caring, a lot of people jumping in to hep each other. Simply I experienced a group of people working toward a great experience. Very nice.  From a reformed pizza scarfer to one that likes this stuff they serve here at Settebello, I say, GO FOR IT.   GET OFF YOUR BUTTSKI and GO NOW.  Take action NOW.  Imma getting hungry.....

pu3AdNBWuQlScUmnrQ9-ZQ.text: I love this pizza. I'm from a pizza city, and in my opinion there are too many crappy pizza places in the valley. This is traditional European pizza just like what you get in France and Italy. I love the simple tomato sauce, and the fresh topping. Absolutely delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Diavola. Great &#39;za

IIVm41J2Uk3MxE7XzWnmYg.text: Great pizza and service. The carbonara pizza was a bit disappointing on the flavor end but the pear/jalapeno pizza was outstanding. Apparently, that flavor is specific to the Henderson location as one of their employees created it. The rucola salad was fresh and flavorful. Definitely get the shaved parmesan on it.

WBM_kXbO4jJDT3DRTniCtQ.text: Loved the selection of Italian beer. 2 for 1 at happy hour too.  The pizza was good but not mind blowing or anything.  I tried the Vico and the Settebello. The nutella pizza was also very good.  Definitely a cool little place I would go to again.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Vico and Settebello. Good selection of Italian beer, 2 for 1 happy hour!

ypcYvs7_BOzlLgGaXioiGg.text: I've been staying at the Green Valley Ranch for a business conference this week. I decided to explore "The District" a little and my coworker and I landed on Settebello. Absolutely worth the hype.   We started with a couple glasses of red wine and the Involtini appetizer (arugula and goat cheese wrapped in proscuitto crudo)... amazing. It was every bit as good as it sounds. Delicious and fresh and the perfect portion size for us.  After inquiring with our server on his favorite pizzas, we landed on the Diavola and the special for the evening which was a Bacon Jam Pizza. Both were absolutely incredible... I couldn't even pick a favorite. The Diavola was spicy and had the traditional red sauce which the Bacon Jam was the perfect mix of salty and sweet, with goat cheese and a white sauce base.   I saved room for some *peanut butter gelato* that was decadent and rich... an excellent pair for my red wine.   I have no complaints! I loved the ambiance and the service (the servers were all very good looking... not that that matters ;).   Next time I'm in Henderson, Settebello is my first stop!

lI1Jq5OjoWJ0oVvxSrXBiQ.text: Great pizza! Great service! A friend of mine recommended me to go to this place for the quality of its Napolitano style pizzas and he was right, it was perfect!

Q_IzPj6g_AlaYSyfcaPJcQ.text: If you're a fan of thicker perimeter crust, you'll be a big fan at first bite. Minus one star for soggy middle (to be fair, we took two pizzas home in a professional pizza bag. it was 8 minutes from restaurant to our home.)  Service was outstanding! We will be back.

7rC_RmlSjBxTI69rQngy4Q.text: Easily some of the best pizza we have ever had! An absolute must try for those who appreciate substance over quantity. If your a Numero Uno type, you might want to skip it.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

0XeMu0ZQABRuJ0xl4kWG6Q.text: Amazing! The freshest ingredients and competitive prices. These are your classic thin crust pizzas, not lathered in sauce and toppings. Keep it simple with the wife's favorite, the Setebello, or go spicy like me and snatch up the diablo!   Dine in or take out, you will always have fast and efficient service. We're regulars already and don't see any stopping in the future!!

jV98QShTbuC8QTmHO7LSLA.text: Delicious, gluten free!, soft and chewy, thin crust pizza. Can't go wrong here, salad was also tasty! Staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely eat here again!

beoK55cYwrBHZYhDMxYtcg.text: This is my favorite spot.  We always get the margherita pizZa and insalata.  Great texture and flavors.

H1zwcsRswHEecuRwxroKlw.text: Thank you Settebello's! You make THE BEST MARGARITA PIZZA (Get the D.O.C.) in Henderson! That's a complement from someone who frequently goes to gastronomic town in Italy and loves a True classic margarita. So hats off to you Settebello's, this is a delicious wood fired pie. Fluffy dough, fresh tomato sauce, fresh basil, and buffalo mozzarella cheese. Simple, quality ingredients utilized well.

G00IMen_V9c9ylmJZRbprA.text: Started off our meal at Settebello with a Spritz cocktail and then moved onto a fresh beet salad and the Vico pizza.  TheSpritz was very refreshing, and the beet salad was a nice compliment. The colors were beautiful with yellow and bright red beets combined with bitter greens.  The Vico pizza was served with fennel and caramelized red onion. It was cooked perfectly with a beautiful chewy crust.  Unfortunately, they ran out of Panna Cotta for dessert as well as the pistachio gelato.  I still opted for an espresso which was served with a small biscotti. The crema on the espresso was a dark caramel color, and the espresso was very nicely balanced.  Stems up!

aXwxu9mSrtMd16yXmE0n5A.text: Pizza is excellent here. I have only ordered pies for take out and they are excellent just like you would get in Italy. The pies are smaller than the average pie and crust a bit thicker so I would order extra. The pizzas are more expensive too!

uCU--MZD90cBk8EdWa7muQ.text: Loved the Settlebello pizza!  The crust tasted super fresh with just the right amount of char on the bottom.  The toppings were the perfect combination.  The Diavola was a bit on the spicy side so we would probably not order that one again.  The restaurant is spacious and clean located in the District across from the Cheesecake Factory.  Service was prompt.  We will return to this pizzeria the next time we're in Vegas on the way to the Green Valley Ranch.

IFXZTCrM-yFX2HZH_M57HQ.text: Best pizza in Vegas! I'm from Italy and my mom is from Naples,  this Pizza perfectly represent the original Napolitan style.  Love the Bianca but get tomato sauce on it

3AJORtYSEPCeg9kmxIa_HQ.text: Great pizza, nothing more nothing less, I would stick with the Settebello pie, it's the best

6lG87R2cgsWaGCLFFZ4aLg.text: My Brother-in-law and his wife were in town and we wanted pizza, so we chose Settebellos. We have a one year old son and I am always worried how he would act. We were greeted warmly and seated quickly. We asked after receiving our waters if we could move outside. Even though the door was closed and no one was out there they were happy to let us out there even though it would mean more walking for them! We had the whole patio to ourselves, it was great. I don't know why but we were treated like royalty, the service is go great.  The pizza's are awesome, my sister-in-law lived in Italy for 2 years and said it was legit Italian pizza. The pizzas came out fast, I fold each piece and eat it like a pizza taco. I always save the crust to eat with the balsamic vinegar. Definitely my favorite pizza joint! We had the bomba for dessert and it was delicious and big enough for two to share and be satisfied.   This place is OK for kids, just be mindful of the other customers. :)  As for leftovers (if you somehow happen to have some) I reheat mine in the oven, not the microwave, and it tastes much better.

EkTl-Ll6lK0wLhAh5S_Seg.text: Wow. What can I say except the best pizza I have ever ever eaten in this country. Yes, it is that good. Trust me, this is how neapolitan pizza should be. They are True artisans. They are recognized by pizzaiolo association in Napoli, Italy. All of their ingredients are of the best quality and even sourced from Italy, i.e. cheese from Modena, prosciutto from Parma, tomatoes fromSan Marzano, etc. I think even thelour is from Naples.   All of the appetizers are delectable, bt my favorite is the involtini di proscuitto, prosciutto wrapped around arugula and goat cheese with a sprinkling of balsamic and some parm. Sublime. Theyoffer about 6 house made pizzas, but I always go with the margherita and two toppings. They recommend you limit it to two in order to savor it fully. This is how it should be, in my opinion. I usually get mushrooms and prosciutto crudo, it is the best!

lGt7abAQ3sR4HUu68QiEiw.text: Do not be fooled by the positive reviews on this place. Everything barley edible. I guess I just like "American" pizza. Everything was bland and there was hardly any meat on the thing. Would never recommend this place to a friend.

zN3RwyFXDBsF51IPso0Dvw.text: Guys I have to tell ya, I was, as usual extremely excited to eat here on Friday evening. Couldn't wait for the meatballs smothered in delicious marinara and cheese, my Prosciutto Wrapped Arugula salad and  Settebelo Pizza.  The waiter took our drink order and we ordered the meatballs.  After about 5-10 minutes he came back and  took the rest of order of the salad and pizza.  He asked if we cared if it came out as it was ready and we said sure no problem, thinking the meatballs would be first and maybe the salad then the pizza.  The pizza came out in about 3 minutes after the order was taken and that had me thinking it's was someone else's pizza then the salad came out after the pizza and then heaven showed up THE MEATBALLS!!!! As I cut into the meatballs and placed on in my mouth I've come to find out, the hard way, they were all frozen in the middle.  I Mean really FROZEN. Sent them back and no manager stopped by and the waiter went into ignore mode!!!

bYRbTkfsLLS3HKw-uTsTrw.text: On this visit I once again had the quattro formaggi - topped with tomatoes, fontina, gorgonzola, mozzarella, and parmigiana reggiano cheeses, strips of fresh basil and evoo.  The gorgonzola cheese was really overpowering - I think some accidentally slipped through the chef's fingers because it's never tasted this strong. For this reason (and the tiramisu, which I'll get to later) I gave it 4 starts, which is killing me as I love this place.  The restaurant was packed (on a Thursday night) so we opted to eat at the bar. I would definitely eat there again as the counter area was huge!  We decided to try dessert for the first time. My husband has never met a  tiramisu he didn't fall in love with, but this one was just ok. I tasted it and was really disappointed, but we come here for the best pizza on earth so we can live with the fact that their tiramisu sucks!  There was something called the Dream Bomba calling my name, so I forced myself to order it: chocolate covered peanut butter gelato with caramel and chocolate drizzled over the top. OMG it was fabulous - da bomba!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Dream bomba - orgasmic!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Quattro Formaggi (hubby threw two sausages on it)

gT0fdKOXhzMDvJwpUJDTJA.text: Not a bad pizza place for the price. The ambiance is nice there, the pizza was pretty good too.   I give the pizza 4 stars, just because I prefer a thicker crust and less cheese than there was on it.   Review is 3 stars because of the service. The beer I ordered was room temperature, and nothing can ruin a meal like a warm beer. The wrong pizza was brought out, but was quickly remade, and our water was refilled once in an hour even though my cup was empty for a long time.   I might come back, but it's not a place I would go out of my way for.

rHVnKsIHZ1Lqvxp82AKqwQ.text: Absolutely love this place. The pizza is phenom! The wait staff is super nice and the drink list looks like it has a lot of potential -- I haven't tried it yet -- this is my go to Neopolitan style pizzeria! The certification is on the wall! Can't get more authentic Italian than that!

Ju9X9jEqQQwEXPHuRZL57g.text: Oh hey Italy...thanks for moving in down the street from me!  My 4 year old wakes me up and asks if we are going back to Settebello every single freaking day of my life because she values the wood fired, folded slice of heaven.    Settebello has been a 2 times a week kind of a place for us...I don't see that changing any time soon.

lsYyo1TgfhtT0pX7gKt7Bg.text: 1 star only because I have to put anything....but how sad to see this place have such horrible customer service....my husband and I used to love this place....we sat for 10 minutes waiting for our server and no sign of this illusive Adrian they say was supposed to help us....mind you there was probably only about 5 other tables sat...Never coming back to this place with so many other wood fire pizza locations there's no point.  The only plus side was our busser who got us some water and apologized over and over again for the crappy service....no wonder this place has looked so empty lately

RqkUeP61ObgvY6dZJkhJxA.text: My fourth or fifth time here and always impressed. For a pizza joint that is right in the heart of Green Valley and reasonably priced...I would definitely come back! There are so many pizza places to choose from, but if you want something light, fresh, but yet still satisfies your appetite, come here. Pizzas and salads are so tastey and freakin fresh! Wine list could use a bit of a selection, among the dessert list. Wished we got the Nutella pizza instead of deciding to burn some calories by walking over to whole foods for their nasty Mochi ice cream. Yuck! Next time we will definitely trust our gut and stick around for dessert. Service was very friendly and super fast. Got a table right away on a Saturday night! We just got lucky with timing I guess.

7y8glzjB3aYTOF8r-PoDqQ.text: Great lunch or dinner spot, they mastered pizza satisfaction. This place caters to those who can distinguish between the cookie-cutter pizza places and those who want freshly baked, handmade, and quality ingredients type of pizza ...that makes you close your eyes with each bite and think you're in Italy.

2jDlB2Oz_raxkBqYDKhgmQ.text: The smell of pizza welcomes you as you enter the restaurant. You can see the beautiful oven from Naples, just like the one that I saw when I went to a pizzeria in Napoli, Italia. We didn't want to wait for a table, so we sat at the bar. Over large marble slabs, the bartender reached across, put down two bar napkins and asked us what drinks we'd like.  We ordered:  Del Sole: Vodka, Campari, Limoncello, Orange Citrus, and some tart yet sweet concoction, mixed up to create a 16 oz. sunsetting blended color of deliciousness that paired quite well with the pizza, possibly because of the tomatoes' acidity. Del Sole means "of the sun." Oh what fun!  Negroni: Gin, Vermouth, and Campari, came on the rocks and with a lot of strength. This 8-ouncer'll do you in on an empty stomach, and although it doesn't completely complement the food, it's got a kick to it. Negroni means "big black ones."  After she gave us drinks, she put our order in for the Antipasto called Involtini di Prosciutto, meaning Wraps of Prosciutto.  Involtini di Prosciutto: Two wraps of thinly shaved prosciutto tightly stuffing arugula together, just like a bacon-wrapped hot dog, with shaved parmigiano reggiano and mini chunks of goat cheese to create a flavorful party for your palate.  While we were snacking on that, our bartender asked us what we'd like for our meal.   We chose:  Margherita Pizza: San Marzano tomatoes crushed into an amazingly sweet and slightly tart sauce, basil, mozzarella, and olive oil. The pizza crust came out with air bubbles just like the pizza in Naples. However, the crust was not crispy like the crust in Naples. Either way, the sauce is truly intensely packed with flavor and the pizza was great none the less. We got the pizza unsliced because that's how Italians get their pizzas.  Settebello: the same awesome tomato sauce, pancetta, mozzarella, thinly sliced oven roasted fennel sausage, white button mushrooms, pine nuts and basil. Pine nuts go very well with basil. This pizza is an art piece meant to be devoured as a savage and enjoyed as a king. It was absolutely delicious. Again, we got it unsliced, but next time, we might just have to slice it.   We didn't order dessert as I had tiramisu waiting at home, but we did see the bartender keep scooping ice cream for spumoni and we overheard her not being sure whether it was cherry or strawberry, but nonetheless we're sure it was delicious.   We will be back for more and to try different things on the menu next time. Arrivederci.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza Oven from Naples
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza Settebello
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza Margherita

wrUGR5o0-2qr6msKKKUw1w.text: Fantastic pizza, 100% authentic, probably one of the best in Las Vegas. Everything else was just as good. Tyler took great care of us as we had a large party with the Ferrari Club. We will be back for sure.

fKX98pv9GGJmhDv4yZNuSw.text: I've returned back to the establishment again and the service was much better and the food great. Staff super friendly even though they were extremely busy.

Lq6YxbHPLqCVUYHcgbfZAQ.text: The last time that I dined at Setebello the meal was beautiful so I couldn't wait to come back.  Today I took a friend to lunch and we were served burned pizza, so I showed the waitress the black crusts including the bottom and edges.  She confidently assured us that the "blackening" is a natural part of the baking process without even offering an apology.  She did offer to have them remade but after that explanation we figured we would just be served 2 more black pizzas, so we politely declined and left hungry.  I don't know what was more distasteful, the burned food or the waitress's cavalier attitude.

tSos70EuVh77_9NkZ5scKw.text: We were looking to pick up a delicious early dinner to take home. My boyfriend and I called settebello and ordered a order of caprese and the person over phone recommended the settebello pizza. The pizza and caprese were both very good. I am glad we decided to stop there. Mitch was very kind and willing to help over the phone.

8vwCyw9eJlB47o-FQok1pA.text: I love this place, I feel like I'm not in Vegas but on a vacation in Italy. The appetizers, drinks are delicious. The pizza is so fresh it melts in your mouth. And for dessert cannoli yummy.

L2gReDrWAFpWth5sx-N9xg.text: Setebello rivals any SF pizza joint, without question. It seems like Neapolitan pie is all the rage no matter where you turn in the US. Some pull it off better than others.   This location is "out there" if you live in LV proper, but perfect for folks in the 'burbs like my family. They don't have to get a sitter for the night and trek all the way to the Strip or Downtown for a nice meal.   Warning: Setebello gets packed between 6:30-8 pm! Even around Christmas, we had to wait a good 15-20 minutes to be seated. And no reservations for groups under 8 people. There's a small bar where you can have a cocktail and wait. They serve several wines by the glass and make a mean cocktail as well.  Pizza is well worth it! They really nail that Neapolitan crust - bubbly with just a pinch of black on the bottom. Always order the house special (if it's still available) and a Margherita. You can't go wrong with either.  Of all the fine dining experiences in Las Vegas, Setebello is a nice alternative. It's casual, family friendly and still serves gourmet pizza. You don't have to stress about parking or wearing anything shiny, just show up and expect to carb out a little. With wine, of course.

PChtGC39ODl6ICO2JjrBBg.text: This was my very first time trying this style of pizza.  What I liked about it was that it was simple, light, and not greasy like some pizzas can be. The cheese on the pizza was superb, and the chewiness of it went perfectly well with the rather flat, thin dough. That was the part I didn't like too much about my pizza; the pizza dough was very bland and tasted a bit like what I would imagine what hardtack would taste like.  I suppose it contributes to the simplicity and lightness of the pizza; nevertheless, it lacked flavour, save for the burnt black bits at the edge. I'm glad the cheese and the toppings were good enough that this didn't bother me too much.  I would've given this restaurant three stars if I hadn't ordered dessert.  The dessert menu had many appealing choices, but I had no trouble settling on the Affogato (I am an espresso enthusiast.) I chose chocolate gelato to go with the espresso.  The gelato was creamy and smooth, just as I would expect out of anything labelled "gelato."  It was a delicious dessert for a mocha-lover like me.  The tiramisu was also good; the best part about it was that it wasn't too sweet, which seems to be a common flaw in many tiramisus.   The service was just fine; everyone was attentive and fast, and I had a good experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Affogato (chocolate gelato with espresso)
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza capricciosa

_cIitclCRQZrQQjSOQizXg.text: Have been going here for a couple of years now and it is hands down the best Neapolitan style pizza in Las Vegas! Their margherita pizza is a pizza purest's heaven, but I also love the Capricciosa with prosciutto, artichokes, mushrooms and olives...mmmm!  I also have enjoyed some of their salads, particularly, the beet salad with goat cheese and the simple Rucola with arugula, large Parmesan shavings, lemon juice, sea salt, pepper, and olive oil-- pure, clean healthy flavors!  There prices did go up $1 across the board about 6 months ago which puts them in borderline outrageous pricing for what they serve, but the District @ GVR is definitely a "mini strip" with restaurant offerings that are all premium compared to other local eateries.

p2bn1x7PsCyQktW82o2c_Q.text: Love, love, love this place! The pizza is probably the most authentic Italian pizza you can find in Vegas/Henderson. The prices are extremely reasonable and they even have specials + happy hour!  Never had a bad experience so far with the service and always can't wait for my next visit to get my fix of their amazing menu!

nK3TUZzJZe_DJXPYhljJ3A.text: I just love this place the salads the pizza. Happy hour absolutely excellent. Friendly staff. Will definitely be going back.

hzwZRcn7oxQF6G4RTU_-7w.text: Seems quality has took a down slide. Ordered 3 pizzas and a beet salad Togo today and was not impressed. When hungry teenagers say it sucks that's pretty bad. I tried it myself and they were correct. And trying to convey to Brittany over the phone I just wanted 1 with sausage and pepperoni was quite challenging. Salad was delightful though. Two deserving stars

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Very poorly cut. 2 HUGE pieces and 2 tiny and 2 about right. Ice cold (she did tell me 45 min) and SO Flimsy. All the mushrooms piled

OzkFnozhwx6ocoluRIduCg.text: First time at this place. Walked in and was greeting by two employees. Great guys. One explained the menu and described one of his personal favorites. I ordered the Margherita DOC. I came out quick and It was delicious!!! Worth the drive from my hotel out to Henderson for sure!

am92JsnJWumwlu3S3u9TmQ.text: More than impressed. The service was outstanding and the food was great as well. Our server made awesome recommendations and the wait staff and everyone was very accommodating to our party. The meat selection of the meat & cheese appetizer as well as the focaccia was also quite delicious! Best ham and pepperoni I've har anywhere. Cannot wait to be back!

nCM3X6OeEjeIKCY58L_TUw.text: Tried Settebello for the first time last night. Here's my disclaimer... I do enjoy bland foods. We ordered both the Insalata Grande and the Beet Salad.  Overall I enjoyed the beet salad more due to the dressing and the wonderful flavors. I found the Insalata Grande bland and boring. I loved the portion sizes as they were quite large, enough for two to share one salad.   I liked the fact that they offer several pizzas without a tomato base. The pizzas are 12 inches round and enough to fill up two people with a decent appetite We ordered the Vena pizza which we enjoyed. We added the arugula from the salads on top of the pizza which made it more flavorful.  I would like to return in the near future and try some of their other pizzas!

m_WbCx4HvxU8jt0Enw_QXg.text: Sadly the place has grown in popularity and declined in quality. When I lived here in Henderson I brought clients here at least twice a week for lunch.  I've eaaily visited this location more than 200 times, never a complaint.  I was also a patron at the old location off Horizon Ridge Parkway.   Visited last night with friends as our guests.  4 salads, wines, 4 pizzas.  My pizza came first, cold, soggy.  It had sat ready before it was brought to me.  Wait, wait, wait for the other 3.  5 minutes, 10 minutes, 15 minutes the other 3 pizzas arrived.  Mentioned, just mentioned this to food server, she said "Sorry, they only can do 5 pizzas at a time".  Crazy logic since we were a party of 4. Poor quality, slow service, not on my list of must visit places anymore.  Sadly, quality and service greatly diminished.

EN2it6_TS3ZfU7uMie1MGw.text: The pizza was awesome!  Tasty and crispy crust and just the right amount of cheese and toppings.  Thanks so much to Linda and Tami for introducing us to this place.

C3eHRFfQPMgbx_s0CHazKw.text: This is my favorite place for authentic Italian Pizza and salad. My husband and I ordered the Margherita and Diavola individual pizzas. I was satisfied with our waiter! I'll be coming back soon.

7sT3Ed2dtjAz8xMW45wl-w.text: Report card grade: Exceeds Expectations  I am impressed. We were in Las Vegas for a night and were starvin' marvin for some dinner on a Sunday night. We asked the Trader Joes checkout lady where we should go. She said "the pizza place on the corner of the Whole Foods shopping plaza." So off we went in search of pizza.   The front door displays several restaurant recognition stickers (Michelin, Zagat, Trip Advisor, etc.). We arrived and were greeted with a friendly staff. The menu is appetizers, salads, and pizza. No mas. We ordered a salad and pizza. Let me break it down for you.   Salad: Involtini di Prosciutto - Ingredients: Prosciutto Crudo Wrapped Around Baby Arugula and Goat Cheese. Topped With Goat Cheese, Shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano, Balsamic Reduction and Extra Virgin Olive Oil - Review: Had 4 slices of delicious, thinly sliced smoked proscuitto that really enhanced the salad. Balsamic reduction added a nice touch to the already flavorful lemon based oil dressing.  Pizza: Settebello - Ingredients: Crushed Tomatoes, Pancetta, Wood Oven Sausage, Roasted Mushrooms, Toasted Pine Nuts, Mozzarella, Basil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil - Review: Pancetta was thick and fatty. Yum. Fresh tomato sauce. Good combination of fresh flavors.   Got my fix of pork balanced with fresh ingredients. My stomach was full and happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Involtini di Prosciutto: prosciutto crudo, baby arugula, goat cheese, parmigiano-reggiano, balsalmic reduction, olive oil
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello: tomatoes, THICK FATTY TASTY pancetta, sausage, roasted mushrooms, toasted pine nuts, mozzarella, basil, olive oil

lTNwCWy7xxjqCE1CZRz3eg.text: Arrived around 830pm, not very busy. Ordered a latte (which was very good) and for the appetizer ordered the Focaccia (which was good. They offer you vinegar and oil with which we declined). For dinner we ordered the Pizza Bolognese (it was just right and very tasty.  The service was very good. Unfortunately like most places in LV they use tap water, which had an effect on my rating.  It was not crowded whatsoever on a Wednesday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

fKdjblaV2UJMcZE0w7L4sg.text: If you love pizza and appreciate a good pie, this is the place to stop and eat at! This place is so good!  A must!  I can't even express enough how good it is!

YImYDZk-m7sljVclXeQ6uw.text: Settebello  This establishment is the ultimate pizza experience. Settebello Pizzeria shines with the thin crust model. Thin-crust pizzas are notoriously crunchy, thanks to their slim and crispy base. I came in searching for fresh and minimal ingredients to quench my thin crust pizza craving. I settled for the traditional Margherita with Crushed Tomatoes, Mozzarella, Basil, Parmigiano Reggiano, Extra Virgin Olive Oil. The only drawback is that the crust is sensitive and tends to burn hastily, but in retrospect, still compliments the overall package.  This establishment is popular with those on the go who are looking for a lighter pizza choice.

9KZTJtFc_8YPlZZglbNDvg.text: This oven backed neopolitan pizza is unique and super good .... Love the one with the brisket.....

tV3-cwR02_L7b-pGoP1oKQ.text: If you love pizza this place is a no brainer. Neapolitan style pizzas hot out of the brick oven. We ordered the panzanella salad which is the only salad you can't make any changes to. Has arugula , prosciutto crisps , fresh fennel , fresh juicy yellow & red grape tomatoes and cucumber. Off the top of my head I may have forgotten something. Oh yah ! The Parmesan ! How could I forget ?!It's so buttery and creamy it literally melts in your mouth. You can definitely taste the quality of the tomatoes. Super yummy and the olive oil. Must have been some good olive oil. Oh my.   The Emilia - white pizza with prosciutto and basil. Heavenly ! The saltiness of the cheese and prosciutto with the chewiness of the crust. Basil on top. OMG !   Margarita with pancetta. My sister decided to order pancetta on hers. Honestly I would have appreciated a bit more cheese but this is Neapolitan style pizza and I think less cheese is what they're aiming for. It was good just probably would have been better with the Spicy pepperoni.   Remember these pizzas look bigger in photos then they actually are and can feed one hungry person and 2 semi hungry people.   Tiramisu - this was rich , creamy and decadent perfection. Layered with lady fingers , cream and espresso. You could definitely taste the sharp kick of espresso. It was so good !   Servers were all friendly and helpful I will definitely be back for more pizza and dessert !

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiramisu .... Wow this Perfect ! Creamy and decadent sharp kick from the espresso.
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Emilia ! Nomilicious !
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Margherita with Pancetta

rinT8J8TXFMgwaPNT9lxMw.text: This is great pizza, discovered the spot passing thru LV a few years ago, now it's a destination for us every chance we get coming or going from the SF bay area...

UZCdd6QkI3FdDCYmWK1yhg.text: Went for a quick  and light lunch before we headed over to Lake Mead.  Atmosphere/location: rustic, casual, cozy; located in a big outdoor mall/shopping area  Food: -Insalata Grande: we loved this salad, my Bf and shared it, they split it for you so it was convenient; the dressing was perfect, loved the olives and everything else -Settebello pizza: we shared this one too; the portion was just right for two of us since we wanted not-so-heavy lunch; the crust was okay, not too thick or thin, but a bit soggy and chewy; toppings were delicious!  Service: friendly, appropriate  We would definitely go back when we're in LV again.

UM3340l3m9tALUkGnKoBdA.text: I went here twice! the first time was great and customer service was ideal. the second time the customer service was slow and impersonal. i understood that they were busy, but it took 10 minutes to get our drinks back, 15 minutes to get our pizza ordered, and 25 minutes to get our check AFTER we asked for take out boxes. the pizza is always absolutely amazing!

a14mUBoqi4KF4z5hbvOGQA.text: LOVE IT!!!  I live on the Vegas Strip but it is so worth the drive down to Henderson for this pizza.  Their pizzas are all thin crust pizzas made in the traditional Napoli style and are utterly DELISH!  Each pizza is supposed to serve 1-2 persons depending on how hungry you are.  My husband and I split the lasagna pizza and the involtini di prosciutto as an appetizer.  Also, you must have the caramel & peanut butter gelatto confection for dessert.  First time in a long time that a dessert has left me at a loss for words.  He had the cannoli and it was perfectly creamy and crunchy and cinnamon-sugary...  wonderful.

yGnMPci7JuufbnkXasUbgA.text: Super yummy!  Loved everything we ordered!  The Bellini was great & the peach sangria was awesome!  The staff was very friendly & made it one of our favorites now in Las Vegas!  We are going back next month & we can't wait to eat/drink up at the bar again!!!!!!  Awesome experience & great prices too!

iYEWRRgSSRLLSYQLhjlWJQ.text: Very different from Grimaldi's. The crust is chewier and not as crisp as Grimaldi's. I had a Margherita pizza and the Insalata grande and split both with a friend for lunch. Perfect portions for both of us. Salad was perfectly dressed with just the right amount of cheese. Pizza sauce was delightfully fresh. I'll definitely be back. I like the location too. It's tucked away from the main drag of the Strip mall.

BX6rAYWyf5HTQbt26IOwyA.text: very good pizza.  my son ate 3 pizza's himself.  he's a really picky eater.  next time were in the henderson area, we will probably be back.

Y4uUgjG7nQK3Hk0ALlnH3g.text: We must have been there on an off day. I just dont get all the raves, I have lived in Italy and I  know anybody trying to serve a pizza like Settebello would never stay in business for long. First order is a good dough - Settebellos dough I suspect is frozen, low gluten, the same stuff white bread is made out off.  Sure they blister it nicely before serving, but it has no flavor, the crust alone taste like hot dog buns. There is not a hint of good quality olive oil on the crust and the crust comes to the table with the middle so soggy it was gross.  The crust was so mushy we had to ask for a fork scrap off the ingredients and eat them solo - the crust simple was not for human consumption and stayed on the plate - a gummy mess. The top ingredients are for the most part good, cheese is good, not so much the sausage, but that is a matter of individual taste. We had wine which comes in silly tiny non stem glasses. The wine list is okay, nothing interesting or ambitious, but then again it befits everything Settebello stands for. We did not have the courage to try the desserts after seeing them on a table next to us having been left half eaten. Would we go back,? No,of course not - the search for a good pizza in LV goes on.

rOJIRVP0nOOeFtCODgXVUw.text: I went here for fathers day... so please consider that ... it was busy. My favorite is the Misto but that night they ran out of the artichoke and my daughter's pizza order they made a mistake. The food is good and I feel fair to give it a 3 star. I think if everything was up to par and it was not fathers day ... I would recommend 4 Stars. I would recommend Misto to everyone.

MKGDknxXvjm8UBVN7kN0pg.text: My favorite is the Pizza Bianca w/ arugula & proscuitto. This is the real deal Neopolitan style pizza, designated with the Vera Pizza Napoletana (VPN).    They don't slice them unless you request so, feel free to tear away pieces italian style instead!  If you're in the area, I suggest you stop in for a treat.

VIrIl6AfSfXMcPzi4-AwGg.text: Settebello....  Theresa B. and I went here after a long day of shopping. The place was very casual with pictures of different sites in Italy like Napoli, and even played Italian pop music. We ordered the Insalata, a salad which included mixed greens and a nice cheese that started with an P(Parmesan maybe? I forgot the real name...) For our main entree, we ordered the Quatro "something" thin-crust pizza (My Italian sucks!), which included salami, sausage, mushrooms, and calmata olives. However, Theresa B. isn't fond of olives, so we substituted with arugula instead. The food was delicious! The only bad thing was that they served the arugula uncooked on top of the pizza. I would have preferred that it be cooked with all the rest (Maybe it shrinks too much?).  This will not be the last time I venture to Settebello. When I'm craving for some authentic Neopolitan-style pizza, I will definitely come here...  -The pizzas are 12" in size, and can feed 1-2 people. Most of them cost $11.99 each.

WSsJHsZtcqmNvOH5w2MpSA.text: Truly amazing.  I dream of the Diavolo....  And the rucola salad is such a simple and beautiful salad.  I've been coming here since it opened and maybe I'm just partial to the original but something about it just tastes better than the SUMMERLIN location.

jZ3DFWzoAcUzcm5K8nCcHg.text: Service usually sucks. I don't understand how a little place like this can run without any discernible management or the owner's presence. It shows, as the waitstaff is almost completely untrained. We've been there three times and have yet to see anyone who looks like they're doing more than cooking, waiting, or hosting.  I hate the layout. It can't be feng shui, I know that. Having all the tables pushed to one wall, the open kitchen off to the other, separated by a no-mans-land about 20 feet wide presumably for waitstaff and customers trying to get to the bathroom, and the long counter off the kitchen with a single stool (who is that for? was there supposed to be counter seating?) really doesn't feel right.  That said, the food is really great. Enough to far outweigh all the negatives. Like, I can't believe this kind of pizza can be found in this town. Every other piece of pizza I've had in Vegas has totally sucked, and here's this little place that just totally nails it with traditionally made, wood fired hearth cooked pizzas. 3 and just under 1/2.

IFgaExbRVIYp5B-PmmdGXA.text: The closest u can get here for an authentic italian pizza... Be aware u may not like it if u think u r getting lot of cheese of ingredients... But that is the italian way

Aiso1yW6sTJIjPHBPBhuNA.text: Pretty good pizza and quick!  We ordered 2 pies and they were out within 5 minutes.  They use a super hot oven that chars the pizza up perfectly.  They have many offerings and the dessert is great too.

KUIp2ZCghYfGaPlN5fpwtg.text: To date, I've found no one in the Vegas valley who does Neapolitan pizza better than Settebello. Granted, they're not my favorite in the entire U.S. (Pepe's in New Haven, CT would take the cake there with their Everyman pricing and their variety of toppings/options), but they do what they do, and they do it consistently well.  Never once do we come here and wonder how flavorful or well-spiced or well-cooked our food I'd going to be. Obviously, they've found a formula and they're good at teaching their staff to prepare, cook, & serve their pizzas and salads to their exact specifications -- and I really dig that! I like not having to gamble on the expected tastiness of my lunch or dinner (coughBRIOcough).  For what they are, they're a tad bit on the pricey side, which I blame in part on the franchise (though I have no idea what the original location in SLC charges) and in part on the fact that the spot they chose is in The District, which is infamously in such debt as to be in foreclosure. I also blame this in part on the fancy-pants imported ingredients, but I guess one has to do all that to get one's "Vera pizza napoletana" certification. Yeah, not bloody likely, but anyway...  The pizzas are on the largish side for one person, but not quite enough for two. However, splitting a salad AND a pizza seems to be just the right amount of food without feeling uncomfortably full. My boyfriend do this every time we go and it's perfect (he's got a pretty healthy appetite, too). I can recommend anything on the whole menu, as long as you like the ingredients. I'm not a huge fan of sausage--yes, ha, ha--so I like to stick with the other meats. I won't eat mushrooms on pizza & they're happy to leave those off for me. If you're a pepperoni lover, try the peppered salami; it's the closest thing to pepperoni that they have there, and it's even SO much tastier!! They also have the best damn espresso & biscotti I've pretty much ever had.  My only semi-complaint about this place is the service, and then only sometimes. The kids (the servers look like they're barely halfway through high school, which in and of itself isn't a bad thing) are pretty nice and helpful most of the time, though you get the occasional one who's sulking around in a cloud of bummed-out-ness (I'm assuming because some girl/guy didn't smile at them in math class that morning) and thus doesn't seem to be super excited to be there serving you. That's fine with me, though -- I don't mind that as much as when they get super bored and hover over you like a hawk. For example, we went for dinner on July 4th and there weren't too many patrons, but several servers. No fewer than three of them came by no fewer than 5 times each while I was STILL EATING and wanted to take my plate. One guy literally came over and stood there as I swished my last bites of crust around in oil/vinegar on my plate and raised it to my mouth--which I did very slowly as I stared him down--so he could take it to the kitchen for something to do. Go fold some napkins, son! Go refill the condiment bottles! I could easily come up with a list of things you can do that doesn't include stalking me for my plate. Oy.  I'd knock half a star off for that, but Yelp still hasn't gotten with the program and allowed half stars. (Hint hint! Get with it!) Bottom line, I'll still keep coming back time after time for the most consistently delicious Neapolitan-style pizza in the valley, and the more-often-than-not good, friendly service!

et-5O0sGM-xIy8Qw-zZmyA.text: proabbly the best ive found so far in Vegas. awesome!  lil crowded/tight fit in the bar area...

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. awesome

fLyVy-cP_DgkcrYMcbHTvA.text: Pizza reviews, in my opinion, should be separated by catagory/type of pizza. Chicago style, Cali style, NY style, chain, Napoli style, etc. All potentially delicious, but with very different and crucial characteristics.   Settebello is Napoli style at its best! Brick, wood fired oven, thin stretchy crust....*drool* sorry! I try to attempt to switch it up and try all their different pies. It helps when the whole family goes so I can try someone else's as I'm addicted to the Bianca... prosciutto crudo, parm, mozz, olive oil topped with fresh arugola that wilts slightly from the heat of the pie. Man, it's good! But I have managed to order others, and here's a few stand-outs for me: the Diavalo, crushed tomatoes, peppered salame, roasted red bell peppers, red pepper flakes, garlic, mozz and olive oil. The Capricciosa, crushed tomatoes, prosciutto cotto, artichoke hearts, roasted 'shrooms, olives, mozz and basil. In truth, my family has tried most of the menu and likes it all. A big favorite of ours is their Insalada Grande. For my youngest, my husband and myself, it is our absolute favorite go-to salad in town. The vinaigrette is perfect and it is never over dressed. My oldest likes it as well, but excruciatingly picks out the artichoke hearts (hates the pickled ones), purple leaves (grrrrr) and the parm shavings...all of which her younger sis is more than happy to take off her hands.  We go at least once a month, sometimes more. Last, but not least, for heaven's sake get yourself a cappuccino!!!  It's Illy, and it's bloody perfect!

RoeP0SNg7s3Kz29aZzQJVA.text: Highly recommended, make the trip if you can! Every visit has been delicious. Pizza is simple in the best way. Staff is friendly, and even when it's busy, the atmosphere isn't overwhelming. Make sure to get your own pizza; you're gonna want to eat it all!!

ejOGNgpk2Q7v5N6Ai_qzUA.text: I am from NJ where I would enjoy pizza at least 3-4x's a week.  When I moved out here I couldn't find anywhere near the quality of NJ pizza (no, not Metro or Girmaldis either).   I kept hearing about Settebello and Joey's Brooklyn Pizza.  I finally tried Settebellos.  It is amazing.  Would do well in any borough of NYC and NJ.  I strongly recomend it!
