VAqWpDfZDLPMnfnw5fgrnA.text: Arugula salad was basic and crisp.  Sausage pizza was excellent.  Service was prompt & accommodating to my special request to be near an outlet to recharge a GPS system.

RZb4PV0wS6UB7q7vPSEpIA.text: A fine certified pie. The crust passes the fold test though I felt it was a little bready. The sauce was top notch. Great service just before noon. The atmosphere was a fit for the area though maybe a little sterile.

_SBabxclIiTxMePV44Ersg.text: This place is as good as it gets.  I used to live in chicago and while I'm a fan of the chicago-style pizza, I would throw chicago-style pizza in front of a bus to save Napoletana-style pizza's life anyday.  Can we just talk about the crust?  The chewiest, softest, goodest (yeah I know it's not a word) crust in the UNIVERSE.  I've never had a bad pizza here and I've been here probably at least 25 times.  This is my ultimate suggestion to order...no matter how many or few people you are with.  You can always take some home:  Get an apertivi to start.  Anything with Aperol in it is ok by me.  Ensalada Grande (mixed leafy greens, kalamata olives, artichoke, sauteed mushrooms, tomato and parmigiana cheese)  Misto platter--Italian meats, cheese and foccacia bread  ANY pizza or ask for the Ripieno calzone.  It's not on the menu anymore, but by far my favorite.  I like it more than their pizza.  Then pretty much any dessert.  Happy eating yo!

2IggYfvV9dwmdI3bOEOaBQ.text: UNBELIVEABLE pizza for Vegas!!  As a New Yorker and pizza/sandwich snob, I have yet to find better pizza in Clark Co.  MUST BUST

OPAJPHxWa3zZ5FyN48NHBQ.text: We had spent the afternoon at the Fine Art Gallery in Bellagio getting inspired by the Monet's. We decided on an early dinner and headed to The District to go to Cheesecake Factory. Well, the wait was a good 45 minutes. I was willing to wait but we had the kids with us so my husband recommend we walk over to Settebello. We had never been there before but we always pass by when we head to Cheesecake or Whole Foods. Every time it looks like everyone is having a great time and the vibe looks awesome. It was busy but we were seated right away. The decor is lovely and adds to the vibe...relaxed chic, perhaps. All of the servers are young and well, attractive. But better yet, they are super friendly! I love that in a  server- just talk to me like you're my friend... Also, he spoke to my daughter and her friend (5 and 10 yrs old) very sweetly as well. He kept asking "Girls, do you need anything? Girls, are you okay?" It was very endearing. He even gave them some breadsticks that come with the kids meal even though they did not get a kids meal. I could tell from the moment I tasted my Americano that they only use premium ingredients. It was a very fine Italian coffee. I have to say that Naples style pizza is my favorite and Settebello does an excellent job at it. The ingredients are just so quality and that makes them so delicious. I ordered the Capriossa- mushrooms, artichoke hearts, Kalamata olives, basil and olive oil. It was such a lovely melody of flavors! Also, the meal was very light (especially for pizza). It was just such a lovely experience all around. I was so very impressed by the quality of food and service.

u_JAYLu6HyCQ6iymmtdBbg.text: Went here with friends and we all were of the opinion that this place was great.  We started with the Misto plate, which was great.  It was a generous helping of cured meats, cheese, olives and focaccia.  Next time I will likely make a meal out of this appetizer alone.  We all had pizza and they were also very tasty.  All of the ingredients seemed fresh and simply prepared.  I had the settebello pizza which had great flavor, the crust had great texture and I do not remember the center of the pizza being too soggy as is common with other Napoleon style pizza places.  At the end of the meal I tried the panna cotta, which was very good and had a healthy amount of strawberries and sauce.  Over all this meal was great, all of the food was fresh and delicious.

b4cwE2aL6rpIMKO8v8_UJA.text: I ordered the Capricciosa. Settebello offers authentic Italian pizza, the proscuitto was very tasty, the service was fast and i enjoyed my visit. I will go back when i have the craving for pizza.

abiRtbb7OjXKJoS8atikIg.text: Been here twice. Service is good. First time was good.They brought out yummy breadsticks. Must have forgotten the second time. Second time pizza was a bit soggy. Not good. Salad good both times.Prob won't go back :(

_Lmo34_ZFvgFPzmXD2x_Mg.text: The pizza was okay, more like appetizer bread.  Very disappointed that pepperoni is not available as a topping.  Would like to go back and try a main entree...Great Italian coffee!!

jR6tggFrJuNz0J3Mr-dtOg.text: Went in for happy hour which is only held in the very small bar area. Bartender was extremely inattentive to us. We had to ask several times on several occasions to get a drink even after putting our empty glasses out towards the bartender to signify we were looking for another drink (which was just a bottle of beer - not like he had to make some foo-foo drink that took 5 minutes to make). Bartender did not explain the way happy hour worked & when we questioned him on it - he gave us attitude. He had originally told us that he had put in our drink order before happy was over but when we asked him to get our order he said that we could pay for another drink if we wanted it instead - it should have been on the happy hour special. Ordered the small pizza with sausage on it - it was so doughy in the middle it was gross & just a floppy mess. He also added my items into another group of people's bill even though I came 45 minutes after them instead of starting my own separate bill. I wouldn't even spend the $5 for happy hour here for food or drink. It's definitely not worth it even if it's not far from my house.

RoVD34YDu7pJjXrFQNhQ8w.text: I love my man, believe me, but everytime I eat here, I want to kiss the man who makes my pie. It is the most perfect pizza you can make...everytime. If you are looking for Dominos or Pizza Hut-style pizza, this is not for you. If you are looking for crispy flatbread, topped with gourmet ingredients (many flown in from their native lands) and cooked right, this is your new favorite! It is never crowded for a late afternoon bite, but be careful on a weekend evening. It is not bursting at the seams, but there may be a little bit of a wait. If all of the five star reviews so far don't lead you to believe it's the best, go try it and prove them wrong!

KEHiM0pBvq9_ufIqOFyFGQ.text: Good pizza.  Just wish they have bigger sizes.

X8yEJiudYy4cCoHVbnoUhA.text: Mama mia! I have never had pizza so good in the state of Nevada. While I am a huge fan of the Secret Pizza spot at the Cosmo, and Broadway pizzeria, this is something completely different. Those places are how Americans eat pizza, this is how Italians eat pizza. The closest thing I've had on the west coast is Ken's Artisinal in Portland (also incredible). With that being said, I've only been to Setebello twice and the visits were within 3 days of each other because I couldn't wait to go back. I had the pizza Setebello, their signature pie, both times. Hands down the best pizza I've ever had in Southern Nevada. Great selection of beers, both Italian and domestic.

4QtlgjaGGtUiCnAqCfscZA.text: Good thin pizza.  The pizzas were not as crispy as the other Napoli certified places we've tried, but damn good.  This is what pizza should be.  Every time I eat a pizza like this, I want to commit retail terrorism and burn a pizza hut/papa johns/dominos to the ground.    I had the Diavola and my wife had the Settebello.  Both were amazing.  They came out and were really large, but they're so thin it wasn't a problem.  This is the type of pizza I crave.

M6tUcEwZAuL79xCZY07XvQ.text: This place is the bomb.  All ingredients are from Italy.  I have even been to Rome and yes the pizza tastes exactly the same.  The salads are awesome too.  Tiramisu awesome.  There has been absolutely nothing here that I have not that was delicious.  Im not even a huge fan of sausage on my pizza but here it is the best! Literally everythings good! Not a huge wine or beer list, but still a decent selection.  The only thing Settebellos has that is less than perfect is the service which isn't even bad, but never had a server really go above and beyond which is not even a complaint, just a statement, lol.

S4QpUbSMcWpJyiPWY5GO4w.text: I was so excited to eat here, given all the positive reviews.  However I was very disapointed.  The pizza was way overpriced, lacking on toppings and literally RAW dough.  I have eaten Pizza all over Italy, so I am familiar w/ the concept, it was just executed poorly.  When we tried to complain the Manager was terribly rude and begrudginly credited us for the raw pizzas....eventually.

JsZ_ObFF-_eKsDkRUYfQkA.text: I'm def a review kind of girl but I am not sure how this place got such great reviews.  This is some of the most expensive pizza I've ever eaten...  For about $13 a person then to add meats its like an extra $2 per meat...that is crazy.  The drinks were outrageous prices.  The servers were not the friendliest I've seen. My pizza was more or less just a dough mess.  I picked up a slice and everything fell off leaving nothing but flimsy dough.  They asked if I wanted it sliced and of course I said yes but they must have meant creased instead because there were just lines in the pizza... I actually had to cut it myself.  This is def not a place I will ever be going back to.  :(

wKha0momxiUntPRovIoDQg.text: I can't say enough good things about the style and quality of food here.  Simply prepared with high quality ingredients, the unique food and preparation speaks for itself.  These type of neighborhood restaurants are always good - but this one is particularly unique in what they offer and the quality of what they serve.  Joined some friends and family her the evening, shared an Ensalada, Pizza Del Cafone, Pizza Lasagna, et al - all was excellent, service was simple and efficient - food and ability to talk with the table guests was great.

l1Vy2F80HwX48QNDhuDrUA.text: The best pizza in Vegas but for the True pizza connoisseur...it's not as good as Tony's Pizza Napoletana in SF.  I ordered the margherita which was really good.  My wife ordered this Mediterranean pizza which she loved.  My kids, however, were disappointed that there were no real kids options.  My 8-yr old wanted his usual pepperoni but had to settle for salami.  My 5-yr old wanted a cheese pizza but had to settle for a margherita.  When he saw all the tomato sauce (minus the cheesy mozzarella) he was not pleased.  I'd like to return when I'm craving pizza, but I doubt my kids would want to go.

xNIZqjc53pjVucDCSCNUow.text: fortunate to have such authentic pizza in Henderson. Everything is good Quattro fromage is a favorite. Do not expect American pizza fare here, leave that abomination for dominoes. This is the real deal.

Arla5Snxp7TcPLuYBh9m4A.text: it wasn't all that spectacular as all the reviews suggested which is the reason why I went. had the pizza carbonara and it wasn't bad, but it was great. the egg made it very soggy in the middle. also ordered the beet salad and it was just whatevers and kinda pricey ($9). also had the tiramisu and like I said, it wasn't bad but wasn't great either. the place was clean and staff was friendly. I just didn't see what all the 5 star rating was about. maybe I didn't order the right thing? if you go here you won't regret that you went, however there are other places that are comparable as well.

jJfibnRlV-4YwK3sI0TWkw.text: This place is amazing, amazing, amazing! Every time I go to Vegas we have to visit. I went to high school in Naples, Italy and the pizza is just like home. I get together with my high school friends here and we have a great time and it takes us back to those days!  I normally go with the Margherita pizza and get a caprese salad, you can't go wrong.

BQY1S65W4-41Ac_JMYHIKA.text: Second time at this place. We really liked the pizza, but the service is not the best. The server was very slow and seem careless. The pizza took to long, but it was good. I have mixed feelings about this place, not sure if we will go back. Oh, and like other reviewers mentioned, its too hot in there.

Xjbua8sRamuRZ6dsMR8qtQ.text: After much anticipation and plenty of procrastination, I have finally gotten around to trying out Setebello after my girlfriend and I decided we were craving pizza. If you come here expecting a big, greasy chicago style deep dish however, you will be disappointed (and stupid, for not reading the title of the restaurant). They only do authentic Neapolitan pizza here and that is what you will get. If you are open minded to this drastically different definition of pizza however, you will fall in love.   It's cozy inside. There are a couple of non-descript italian themed decorations, a modest bar and a fire oven conspicuously  located in the middle of the establishment. If you go in the evening there's bound to be a wait but trust me when I say it's worth it. We were eventually seated and our friendly waiter was happy to explain the quality of the ingredients, the serving size, and a number of other questions a foodie like myself would normally ask during a first time dining experience.   A single pizza tends to serve one average appetite, or two small appetites (with the addition of an antipasti). My girlfriend chose the spicy Diavola and I went with the popular Capricciosa. They were simply heavenly. My pizza was delicately covered in artichoke, roasted peppers, succulent olives, and fresh basil which added perfect flavor to the mouth watering cheese over their fresh crushed tomatoes. Believe me when I say you can taste the difference between these quality ingredients and the crap you can buy at a major corporate pizza joint.   It's surprisingly thin and light-- many people eat it with a knife and fork and you can always request to have it served sliced if you wish. It's perfect if you aren't in the mood for excessive carbs or fats but still want a satisfying meal. I had no problem finishing the whole thing and could have easily eaten the other half of my girlfriends pizza but she insisted on saving it for later :P  I have had Neapolitan style pizza before and my girlfriend has had the stuff in authentic eateries in Italy. Both of us concluded that this was, without question, the best pizza we have ever tasted. This has instantly become one of my favorite spots and I guarantee I will be back here several times over the next few months. If you are in the Henderson area and you have not tried Setebello, you have NO excuse not to come here. Hell, if you're lactose intolerant pop a lactase pill and join in on the fun-- I firmly believe all residents of the area owe it to themselves to experience this place.

nSyO-U4gQcxld9O5HS_5NQ.text: Well, after many years of frequenting this restaurant, what seems to happen I feel has.....to begin with the staff is quite young and unattentive, my last experience there was around 6 oclock pm on a Monday, we were one of four in the place for dinner and our two pizzas took an hour to bake, after eating the delicious yet oversized salads, we decided to ask the waiter to bring the pizzas to go because we had to be to a movie by 7:30 and never imagines it would take so long, unfortunately the waiter nodded his head but the pizzas were brought out fresh on plates, making it take even longer to return them and box them up, sadly this is a place I put down in my book as a "TO GO" restaurant, because the food is amazing but the service and staff are a bummer.

dpkhVdYmpvpmLH9vSE5WHg.text: Settebello has what seems to be extremely authentic Italian Pizza. I, not being Italian, have zero credibility for this claim, but they use Italian Words to describe them and they are very lightly cheesed. Some are not cheesed at all if you'll believe it. They also believe in whole olives as a topping. All of it with lots of Olive Oil, all of it is excellent. This is serious pizza. It is also very little pizza. This is the only pizza place where I can comfortably eat the whole pizza. All of it. Despite having a substantial radius, the pizza is virtually two dimensional. Pizza.  Beware adding toppings: you'll pay for it. Not saying it's not worth it, the Italian meats here are exquisite, but it may require you to redistribute your stock portfolio.  The authentic Italian beers have prices that make even the most seasoned beer snob (and yes I mean myself) wince. It's not like Italy is known for beer, and these beers are largelly unknown outside of their native land. $15+ They dramatically skew the value proposition if you're looking for an exotic beer drinking night. Regular beers  are more reasonable, but unremarkable.  The prices are overall great. Most of the better pizzas are $12 or less. Keep in mind they are just for one person, but still an excellent value. The dining room is small but pleasant and gets great light. Service has been great.  They don't have ranch. I realize this is very "authentic" but they need ranch.

etPM1JHeFSl_x7aoa3Ttlg.text: This place is awesome, tied for best pizza in my heart. HIghly recommend. I eat here at least once a week!!!

rJP94CbGbVIyjgPbcPG2fA.text: Good pizza! Even though I didn't love the  Quattro Stagioni pizza I had last time that much because of the taste of one of the cheeses I knew that besides that I would probably hv better luck nxt time.  I have an Italian friend and claims this is the closest to real Italian pizza she has tried in the US. Small but good menu.  The reason I don't give more stars is because the service has been just standard but we keep coming back for the food.  This time we enjoyed both the insalata and the Emilia pizza.  Like the simplicity of their menu and not too slow service.

EmVv3f6J7zi5vr17nenYDA.text: My husband and I tried this restaurant for the first time after reading all of the amazing reviews and we walked away very disappointed. The pizza we ordered, the margherita, came out minutes after we ordered it, and it was not even hot. It was soggy and barely had any flavor. So we tried dessert, the canneloni and the Bella Della Nona, and they both were flavorless as well .We didn't even finish them. The restaurant is also extremely loud because of the high ceilings. The waitress was nice and so was the hostess, just very unimpressed by their food. We will sadly not be returning.

ib4CMPveTK54sqXmTEB_zA.text: Always great pizza and service. Margarita is classic and they mastered it. If you like it spicier, diavola is for you!

JDxjYbjHcVrHQ2HqUPhwzg.text: Stellar food, great service! You can't beat this place. Wonderfully authentic. The ingredients are the freshest, most flavorful you can get and their new menu items like the beat salad and the Pizza Bolognese are amazing! Something for every taste, even the kids. Don't forget to treat yourself to a panna cotta for desert.

Ydv2L6BwC-mDLnydmAIZkQ.text: I LOVE this place. It's so yummy and the staff is great. As a college student, I studied in Italy for a semester, and let me tell you, THIS is authentic Italian pizza! Heaven. I'd eat it every day if I didn't think my derriere would get too big.

UYCDlYyjc3Ed4CNHWQnJuA.text: My family and I stopped here for lunch on a Thursday afternoon. It was very good. The salads and pizzas are perfect for two people to share. The kids meals come with a full-size pizza, drink and gelato for dessert. The kids meals were $6 which is quite affordable. The salad was one of the best I've had and the pizza was very good as well. Good value for Vegas!

Gkv2oyPqVSAxfp2Voqz4ZQ.text: This is by far the best pizza in Henderson/Vegas if you like "wet" pizza (pizza Napoletana).  I love their Quattro Formaggi pizza; the Gorgonzola on it is a special treat.  Only the finest ingredients are used, especially in regard to the Misto appetizer (a sampling of Italian style meats, vegetables and cheese served with focaccia).  The menu is sufficient in size, but focuses mainly on pizzas (no pasta etc.). Daily/weekly specials do add more variety (these are not posted on the website/menu).  The service however, leaves something to be desired. The wait staff is courteous, but lacks enthusiasm, speed, and the cultural/culinary knowledge I expect when dining at such an authentic restaurant.

SgkhRnpF7tfBjgZDi2KT2A.text: Pizza is a way of life for me. I take it as serious as somebody would take an IRS audit or having a child. Pizza holds the hope of a nation inside of it's golden flaky crust. We are the children.   Whatever. This is Las Vegas, home to thousands of transplants from the mid-west. Anytime somebody talks about pizza, everybody has some random story about the hole in the wall from their town that makes the best pizza ever. Every place out here is a chain or a gut bomb grease fest. What does it take to get a decent pie out west?   I'm not sure Settebello qualifies. This pizza is sort of a subsidiary of the normal pie quest I reference above. Yes, it is pizza. Sure, it is delicious, but it's not what you're thinking of when you're sitting around with a few buddies watching a football game and somebody says "Hey, let's get a pie".   Settebello is a traditional pizza in every sense of the phrase. They have several topping choices which will remind you of your typical topping choices, but taste 10x better. On this occasion I ordered the Margherita pizza with the wood fired sausage. It was amazingly good, but again, not a normal pie. The sauce is basically crushed tomatoes, but the best tasting crushed tomatoes you could imagine. They throw a little basil and mozzarella on there and you're good to go.   If you don't arrive here expecting a pie in the American sense of the word, you'll be just fine. Just make sure you ask them to cut the pizza for you, because they won't if you don't ask them.   Minus one star because the olive oil / vinegar bottles they leave on the table leak EVERY SINGLE TIME, which prompts you to have it on your cell phone, or shades, or all over your hands, etc. It's annoying.   Yo Settebello, get some new oil / vinegar bottles, na'mean?

L04k2i4iKnKkj0cUM_kHJQ.text: Must come back! Food is so freaking fresh and yummy! Loved loved loved the Caprese. The Settebello pizza was super awesome as well. Place is small and not as busy when I went (after lunch before dinner). Our waitress was friendly and always checked to see if everything was good. Another waiter came to fill my water when he saw it almost done. Looking forward to trying all their other menu items!

N0NH6uYBAHX320w0TQqeJA.text: I do not get the love for this place.   We had to go have another dinner later the night we went here because we hated this place so much.  First of all, it's pretty expensive.  Second, the pizza was so thin and soggy it was awful.  I will never be back here.

4KumvqrbyqnyEoVcBbTnpg.text: Settebello has good wood fired pizza, we have been many times and usually go back about once a month. The only bad pizza we had was a special with raspberry jam on it, sooo bad! They will serve you a whole uncut pizza unless you ask for it to be cut and sometimes I forget this, it makes me wonder why? I guess that is how they do it in the old country or something, every restaurant needs it's little twist, but that is kind of annoying. I think they should do the opposite and serve it cut and ask if you want it whole! Two individual pizzas, split a salad and a soft beverage and your at $50 for two, just seems expensive for pizza, maybe that is from my childhood pricing! I would give three and a half stars if I could, just not four star worthy.

HrvFVzatR6HkhS9ABAA_Sw.text: Went on a Saturday at about 1:30 pm. For a light lunch, my wife and I each had the green salad and split a Pizza Bolognese. The shaved parmesan on the salad was excellent. The pizza was also very good. Sauce was tomato sweet and mozzarella was fresh. I thought the crust was slightly salty and very slightly undercooked however. Service was very good. The atmosphere was calm and quiet. All in all a nice experience. My only complaint is this: this style of pizza, while very tasty, is not filling.

8vHMaEL1INySyl-WIsZRyw.text: Love this spot, very good food and great prices!! Settebello pizza with insalata grande salad my favorite

Q0Hol4RvArXnsWJr28lviA.text: First time here, we were pleasantly surprised. Prices weren't  bad the food was absolutely amazing. Our server Cory was extremely friendly. He Explained the menu and answered all my silly questions. Omg, they have a Nutella pizza. I definitely recommend for a quick date night or just to try somewhere new and refreshing.

d0zNy-hxQh6SgKvVS5smIw.text: I initially thought Settebello would be like Grimaldi's and I wasn't very excited to dine here.  Boy was I THRILLED to find out it wasn't and it was AMAZING.  It was a beautiful afternoon so we sat out on the patio and had outstanding service.  I cannot remember the girls name but she was blonde tall and was SO personable.  When she realized we were first time diners she recommended dishes and drinks which were great!  For drinks I got the Old Fashion which was good.  My friend tried the gin cucumer drink which was good as well.  For our appetizer we had the meatballs which were very flavorful and delicious.  For our meal we had the pizza that has the egg in it.  It was OUTSTANDING.  The server said it was kind of like a "breakfast" pizza but it was still perfect for dinner.  We decided not to get dessert however I will DEFINITELY be back and will have to try it!  The only negative about our experience was the plate my friend was given had a big chip missing out of it but that's ok. We loved it here!

8uzmXjgFVeWxHR6N3_mXUg.text: I still love this fabulous napoletana certified pizza! My favorite pizza to order is the settebello or the special of the day! The insalata grande and insalata involtini are my two favorite salads of any restaurant ever!  They have some great innovative cocktail concoctions so i try a different one each time.  Be ready to get lost in pizza heaven with this unique taste and style -nothing ordinary about it!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello pizza

7S07JUZk1qGN6PqqFQqLMw.text: Settebello's has ruined all other pizza places for me.    I may have to go back and reduce previous 5-star ratings to 4 star just because of how much better this product is.   Just wow.  I had the "settebello" pizza and it was perfect.

DOLufVVdQRt-Q4ZHPrrh7w.text: Never lets me down.  So darn good.    Quite pleased with myself for venturing out and ordering something different.  I usually get the delicious Settebello namesake pizza.   This go around we tried the Tartufo (truffles, walnuts, speck, cheese) and the carbonara.  Nice contrasting choices if I do say so myself.  The tartufo was a white pizza and the carbonara had the excellent red sauce.  Both were scrumptious and had me making my OH face during the first bites.    We also tried the nutella s'mores calzone.  I don't even like marshmallows, yet it was pure bliss.    I maintain.....best sit down restaurant style pizza in Las Vegas.

f_gKw6krXZF0aMwUzrFH-w.text: Don't come here if you are not into pizza! There is nothing else on the menu but pizza and some salads - but no other Italian dishes like pasta etc.  But you certainly get authentic high-quality Italian food!

7u3MFST4qhFBIxMqndA44Q.text: I haven't had a pizza here that I didn't enjoy. Not as good as Grimaldi's, but definitely my second favorite pizza place in town.   I I'm fanatical abotu pine nuts (pinons) and this place uses them liberally. Sometimes I'll ask them to add an egg on top when I'm feeling fancy. I usually like to ask for it to be cooked a little more  thoroughly to add a little crisp to the edges. I haven't had anything I haven't enjoyed here. Salads, pizzas, desserts. It's all good. The more toppings the better at this place.

Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

NvoMVWV6phy6icUh63kt7A.text: While I was out and about running errands. Hunger struck and only one thing sounded good... Pizza! Not just any pizza, I wanted a Margherita pizza like those I enjoyed in Italy. Settebello has long been on my list of places to try. It was finally time to give it a whirl.   When visiting the District, I go west on autopilot. Well, I had to turn around because Settebello is on the east side of Green Valley Parkway. I parked and popped in for lunch.    I was quickly seated and I knew just what I wanted, The Margherita DOC ($13.50) with Crushed Tomatoes, Fresh Buffalo Mozzarella, Basil, Parmigiano Reggiano, and Extra Virgin Olive Oil. Settebello serves up Pizza Napoletana and it is authentic. This style of pizza is cooked quickly and typically eaten with a fork and knife, but they will cut it into slices upon request. Settebello's Margherita DOC is pretty darn similar to what I had in Naples. They import ingredients and the quality is noted. However, it's worth mentioning Naples wasn't my favorite pizza in Italy, it's a bit wet for my liking, but still enjoyable when in the mood. My craving was satisfied and the best part? I only had to travel to Green Valley to get it.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Margherita DOC

NelB4dNbE6XqLaMyfA13DQ.text: WHO ARE THESE PEOPLE?? WHERE ARE YOUR TASTE BUDS??WHY IS THIS PLACE GETTING GOOD RATINGS??  this food is garbage easily the worst pizza my wife and i have ever had, i had to instantly order a soda to get this terrible "pizza" taste out of my mouth.. i won't bother with the salads 1 missing dressing the other missing 2 ingredents just paid the check left a nice tip and swore to never come back again and warn others of such False ads

kp2vc8Pj9OYyBCqUSyNmSQ.text: Flavorful ingredients, ok that's the only good news because the pizza crust beneath was very floppy soggy. Now let's talk about the service. Jake was our server. He greeted us and knew from the onset that two of us were first time attendees, two were regulars. He explained a list of things, and gave us some time to look over the menu....lots of time. He was either a greedy server or the manager loaded him down with tables, because he was dashing past us like Hussein Bolt. When we flagged him down to order, he took the order and he later returned with two of the four pizzas. Half of our party began eating (please don't wait for us, it'll be out soon). We were still waiting 10 minutes later and flagged Jake down to ask where the other two pizzas were. His lame excuse was, "they are just putting the arugula and meatballs on your pizzas. Really? Where did you go? The arugula plant out back? The meatball tree? So half of the food consumed, the second half of our order arrived. Unsatisfactory on all levels. One of us wanted a little more marinara for our pizza, Jake said it would be .50 for that. Really? Yep, he charged us!!! Bad tip from me and I'm a 20% guy. And a bad Yelp review

fb0rqX2JAIduQ-_EWIcNJw.text: This is my favorite place to have pizza. My favorite is the Emilia. I always sub the cotto for crudo because cotto is more like ham to me and crudo is more of a thinner and cured.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Emilia with xtra corn and crudo instead of cotto!

8LkCQGApYTdK2ogS73rb1g.text: Good pizza. Different from big chains. They use mozzarella  di bufala, which is a thing in Naples. Excellent  restaurant.

RKU0QSDDXDwcq2KiXwTsSg.text: We've been enjoying the fine Napoletana pizza here since moving to Henderson. OMG - taste exactly like the pizza you enjoy in Naples Italy. Great salads and beets salads as well. Natalia is the perfect mgr rocking a great vibe & attitude. See you again very soon. Ciao!

iC5FB1toAJekZrDeeRLa8A.text: The pizza was great, specially the Margarita and Veggie  one, but the atmosphere was may friendly!!

ZJSR5oB7mUAKtfccjaSOWw.text: Decided to patronise Settebello again after just a couple of days even though it is a significant drive away from where we live. This time during the week (Tuesday) and in the afternoon (4:30P) instead of evening.   I got the namestake Settebello pie and reordered the Nutella pie w/strawberry for dessert this time paired with Hazelnut gelato (the special was oreo, which did not sound personally appealing). While I did not like it as MUCH as the Four Cheese I tried on Sunday, it may have the virginity effect that made that pie taste so much better in my mind; only way to unscientifically test if this is in fact True is to try the Four Cheese again, perhaps this time with the Settebello meat toppings as an add-on. Food was excellent in any case and the service the same.   Observation on the 3PM-6PM 'Happy Hour': 5$ ea. for a mini pizzas sounds great for finishing off the entire menu offerings in regards to pizzas. The next time we visit we will probably go that route; just requires that one sit at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Valentine&#39;s Day 2013 Promotion.

MkdtCYqZ99LmORaCxXwGCQ.text: The best pizza you will eat in Vegas! The bread is amazing along with the service!! I get the special every time can't go wrong!!

uKnPt4-BxmICfg12o4zubA.text: This seems to be one of the better pizza places in the metro LV area, and even though it was out in Henderson, if you have a car, it's worth the trip out there. They had great individual 12" pizzas fried in a brick oven, plenty enough for even a hungry person. Good pizza, Neapolitan style. My only criticism is that my crust was a little limp, and I had to hold it with two hand to keep my toppings from sliding off, so I recommend asking them to leave it in the oven a little extra to get a firmer crust.

YMkIJK1uyRtbAPQ_jxSnww.text: We were greeted and acknowledged when we entered. The staff was attentive and asked us immediately what we would like. Table was cleaned and setup quickly and then we were greeted by the server Austin. We would definitely will be back especially since the staff was on point with the customer interaction.  We weren't blown away by the pizza though. Maybe it was the hype from friends, but don't get me wrong, it was good pizza. We ordered the Insalata, Margherita pizza, and got meatballs for an app at the recommendation of the waiter Austin. Meatballs and salad were great and ordered a kids cheese pizza for the little guy in our family who loved his pizza. Want to come back and try the Nutella dessert pizza.

0JjIQSKC6COHiYfswAsIDQ.text: Never a negative word with this establishment!!! Delicious food professional waitstaff and beverage offerings nicely chosen to enhance what ever direction your tastebuds might lead.

17wqMLwh6_6tiSrZFl0uyw.text: I've eaten here 6 or 7 times over the last year.  Good pizza, most of the time, more on that (and the reason it's not 5 stars)  The good: diavola pizza paired with their chosen Italian beer is great.  Sauces have good flavor, meats and cheese tops notch.  Great thin authentic Italian pizza crust and taste.  Really great Italian beers that are hard to find in the US.  The bad:  it's not consistent.  Staff seems to be mostly college-age kids and both the food and service varies dramatically.  This trip my pizza had slightly to severely burnt crust all the way around and the staff didn't seem to concerned to fix it.  Service also varies in the same way.  The really great Italian beers---they run out of them, all the time, a real bummer.  Id still recommend it, but be warned your experience could be great, mediocre, or just plain bad depending on the staff that day.  If you're cost sensitive - skip it.  It's pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

m98rHmy45O7bIGhxJI8i-w.text: Service is excellent! Waiter was very knowledgeable and was not pushy. Restaurant was casual, but intimate. Pizza are about personal.size, but shareable if you were not too hungry. Tried the Margareta pizza and my bf tried the Settabello signature pizza. Both were good. Waiter did inform us the style of pizza was a thinner crust baked at 1,000 degrees so the middle would be a little "wet". Different, but good. Had a latte at the end. Would come back again. Definitely would recommend.

yUR0SPsvzTo8EtC83Ml1dw.text: My recommendation: Pizza Lasagna  As an appetizer, the Caprese is a winner.  I'm not a big fan of pork and unfortunately that's the only meat topping they have but I don't miss it for a second here. All of their pizzas are so tasty. Especially the pizza lasagna. Settebello's has the best pizza I've ever had in my LIFE!

GB2eoBU6R5ongq_jcipuUw.text: Such great pizza, I wish it weren't so far from my home.  However, I have schlepped over there three times now and have tried the Diavola, Bianca and Pizza Lasagna (still a pizza, but with ricotta mixed into the toppings).  I would be hard pressed to pick a favorite and will probably keep working my way through their menu.  The pizzas are large enough that I can't always finish one, but not so big I only want half.  They use quality ingredients and the crust is the perfect blend of crusty exterior and chewy, flavorful interior. Last time I was there, it wasn't busy but service was not good.  However, I can overlook that when the food is this amazing.

XrrjxgEoUarWXru-5bflgA.text: It depends on your individual taste in what you enjoy in a pizza. For me it was not the end all of pizzas. I guess I did not like the chewy soft crust. I prefer thin and crusty. My husband and son enjoyed theirs. I had the settebello and hated the sausage. My son had one with egg on it and he loved it, my ever loving husband who does NOT experiment had cheese. I will say the misto appetizer was very nice- wish I had stopped there.

uESfayvhJ0MGjFzyi_qmrg.text: It's not just a pizza place" said my daughter when I was somewhat dismayed that Settebello was my daughte's choice for a last supper of sorts before she moved from Las Vegas to small town Wyoming.  The Napoletana pies are great, service is somewhat slow, but when you see the impressive oven that each pie is nurtured in it is understandable.  My daughter and I got the Quatro Formaggi, Yummy times 3 one thing missing was fontina, they were out of fontina and ssubtituted with ricotta, not my favorite for a pizza, thats why only three yumnmies.  Another at our table got the signature Setabello, great mix of flavors, if you love mushrooms you will give this four yummies, I personally would have liked more panchetta.  The other pie at our table was the Quatto, everyone gave this four yummies.    We enjoyed the meal and with all the dining choices there are in Las Vegas to choose a "pizza place" for a "final" meal says much about the quality of food.

_4RZfazJFeFFjafqLF2ZVg.text: I was not expecting quality Italian pizza in the middle of a desert. This pizza is fantastic! I like the Margherita DOC because it comes with imported mozzarella, fresh basil and crushed tomatoes versus the standard Margherita.

ZOhSdcmdcAlWxYbznm6J2A.text: Delicious pizza served by pleasant staff. The spicy pizza was hot enough that is did not have to ask forgot sauce!

xsoph9AjRosj4NhDC2lL2w.text: I loved this place reminded me a lot of being back in Italy. This place serves as close to authentic pizza as I have found in Vegas and in Houston. We ordered two pizzas: a) margarita (tomato, basil, garlic, fresh mozzarella) and diavola (spicy pizza). Both pizzas were awesome - LOVED IT. The Wife not so much she said it was ehhh. We had panecotta for dessert but it had this berry glaze which could have been omitted. The panecotta was good - could use a little Madagascar vanilla bean in the mixing process. We would return.

VtumglHUclYZbnkZKVNaWg.text: As a member of an organization called Vera Pizza Napoletana, Settebello follows a set of standards designed to ensure the quality of their signature dish. These standards include working with high-quality ingredients, following an established recipe that includes hand-rolling, and cooking in a real wood-fired oven. The result is pizza that tastes far better than the doughy, sauce-smothered, greasy mess covered with rubbery cheese-substitute that is served in most pizza joints. Like the organization's name says, this is "True Neapolitan Pizza," as Otton himself trained as a pizzaiolo in Italy for 3 years before opening Settebello.  And the pizza at Settebello is sublime -- especially their signature pizza, the Margherita. The crust is thin, chewy, and full of rich, wheaty flavor. The layer of crushed tomato actually tastes like fresh tomatoes with a hint of olive oil. And the mozzarella cheese and fresh basil are perfectly proportioned to complement the pizza without overpowering it. It's pizza you can eat and still feel good about afterwards.  As good as it is, Settebello isn't just about the pizza. Their commitment to quality extends to their entire menu. Their focus on fresh, high-quality ingredients makes for really amazing salads. They don't just pull some roughage out of a bag and pour some dressing over it. At Settebello, they lovingly construct their salads by hand, and it shows, with perfect proportions that create a nice mix of flavors.  My favorite salad is the Insalata Grande, which combines roasted mushrooms, marinated artichokes hearts, pine nuts, kalamata olives, flakes of parmigiano-reggiano, fresh tomatoes, mixed greens and balsamic vinaigrette. The peppery crunch of the greens melds wonderfully with the tangy chewiness of the mushrooms & artichokes, with the tomatoes, nuts & cheese adding nice counterpoints. It's such a fulfilling experience that I've often ordered it as a meal in itself.  I'm no pizza purist. I'm willing to believe in the possibility of good pizza that doesn't follow the tenets of Vera Pizza Napoletana. What matters to me is the final product. Does it taste good? Is it satisfying? Settebello succeeds on both counts, in ways that have kept me coming back again and again.  Also, the service at Settebello is always excellent, and the prices are reasonable.

V1Vu2Rf9AgHOX38dxQ-Dsw.text: The only bad thing is that I can only give 5 stars to Settebello. Carmine is an artist of the "white art" and nobody else in town, even with the same (or better like due forni)  ingredients is able to do what a real italian from (around) Naples like him can do. Every pizza is a masterpiece perfectly crafted with passion with just the right tasteful amount of toppings and cooked perfectly to delight even a very sophisticated palate.  Bravissimo Carmine! A presto.

S3pBq1NwBL0GIJg8pyAUbA.text: Pizza perfection! The products they serve at Pizza Hut, Domino's, etc shouldn't be allowed to be called "pizza" - this is what a pizza should be. Charred crust, crushed tomatoes (they taste so fresh) and fresh garlic, with an assortment of delicious meats and cheeses. It's a little sloppy, which I like - I always fold my slices in half, to avoid oil from the cheese dripping everywhere.  I've tried most of the top-rated pizza joints in town e.g. Pizza Rock, Grimaldi's, Secret Pizza and Settebello is comfortably my favourite

EWLJ9_q-zwK_xjXJVgrD2A.text: Nice environment. But best pizza in Vegas? Not so much. Friendly fast service was the best part. The pizza was good, different and interesting. But for my fellow westsiders Grimaldi's is much better and closer.

izJaLCd62JsjS3J3O1fVxQ.text: One of my top 3 pizza places.  My favorite is the Diavola.  Great crust like a traditional Neapolitan pizza should be. Thin, yet chewy with but of crunch in the crust.

-SR5oW8Oc6vStgvHIYUZLA.text: Anyone who knows me knows I don't easily give out 5 stars. When it comes to Neopolitan pizza, this pizza gourmet has found heaven. I did take out since I was rushed and had a good red waiting for me at the hotel. My only regret was not having totally hot and fresh at the restaurant. The crust was thin and had a nice stretch. True to Neopolitan vs NY style, the crust was lightly cooked and not crisp and the cheese was not carmelized. The quality of the ingredients was excellent. I had a Davola and they were not skimpy on the ingredients. I would go so far as to say that if they keep this up they rate in my top 20 worldwide. The price was $14 for what I see as a generous personal pizza. I will price it as $$ but really good for the money value.

34PMhyoSQHVd4Lr7slzUcA.text: I was super excited to try this place out after hearing how a couple of my friends loved it so much.  I was so disappointed.  My pizza was so soggy that I couldn't even pick it up, and ended up eating it with a fork.  Also, not much cheese on it at all, just five or six small blobs here and there.  When I eat pizza I want cheese in every bite, and I don't want my bottom crust to be under cooked and soggy.  I guess this type of pizza is just not for me, I'll stick to my traditional pizzeria pizza.

nLzfB2kLkSVePiU6G_xF0Q.text: Excellent pizza. The best. Had antipasto.  Was great. Prices somewhat ok. But service sucks. Needs new management to control the staff.  Very disappointed on staff but pizza greattt

GvbTOQyOxEp8lAwfV9H1NA.text: if you want True Italian pizza... this is the place you want to go.  pizza is thin and crisp and something so special.  if your looking for Pizza Hut this is not the place.  no supreme here.  I love the margarita pizza with prosciutto crudo or the sausage with pine nuts.

uMXpDMuDKweKcj-4FOHemw.text: Yum!  In any big city pizza places aren't hard to come by.  Some are fine, some are good, few are great.  If you're looking for a New York, Jersey, or Chicago style pizza, Settebello is not your place.  This is Napoli style. Before you try it, drop the expectations of what you know of pizza.    My first visit to Settebello was on a date.  The date was mediocre, but he got major brownie points for choosing the venue!   That was probably the sole reason any more dates followed... This was at their old location on Horizon Ridge, now they've moved to a more visible and accessible location next to the whole foods in Green Valley.  I was in love with their pizza after my first experience.  Check out their website for their story of their imported oven (one of the super hot brick ovens that cooks the pizzas in under two minutes) and information about the origin of their ingredients.  These pizzas are thin, Napoli style crusts.  Cheese is fresh mozzarella (depending on what pizza you get, it's not standard) applied as splotchy discs - not the half inch thick layering of rubbery mozz that most American pizza eaters are accustomed to.  They treat cheese as it should be treated, less volume, more quality.  Aside from the crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside crust, the toppings are the reason I return.  High quality tomatoes mingle with marinated mushrooms, caramelized onions, and they serve pizzas where pine nuts and artichoke hearts come standard... Sigh... My response to these pizzas makes my boyfriend jealous.

dyHI1YxmaNk952U1t7WZnQ.text: Ok, i HAD to up the rating to a 5!   Reason:  We keep coming back and this place just doesn't disappoint!!   The Insalata Grande salad and pizza are the best we've ever had!!! I added a few pics from our most recent visit!   Try this place, you'll be hooked too!!! ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Went again today for a late lunch early dinner (5:00pm) with the husband and this time brought a friend...   This place is consistently good!!   Great pizza and salad and great service!!!! There were about 3 girls walking around all the time, if you made eye contact one of them was there to see if there was anything you needed! Our friend ordered the Pizza Lasagna and didnt read the menu good and didnt know it came with ricotta cheese (he doesnt like ricotta) and when he said "oh, i didnt know it had ricotta"  they could tell he wasnt happy and they offered 2 times to take it back and make him a new pizza. He ended up keeping it and just picking it off.. but i thought it was very nice of them to offer, even though it was his fault for not reading not theirs.   Keep up the good work Settebello's!!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Husband enjoying a slice of heaven, ohh i mean pizza!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello&#39;s Margherita, add x-tra garlic... Yummy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. One of the best salad&#39;s ever... split with Husband-Its HUGE!

ToeGjlaa6-ohZY1zuka6GA.text: This is hands down the best pizza I have ever had-period. Yes, it is a very THIN crust so if you try to hold a slice like you would a Pizza Hut slice, the toppings will fall off. Yes, some parts might be a little charred, but it adds to the flavor in my opinion. But the crust is amazing- they import the flour from Italy! The toppings are fresh and very flavourful, and the crushed tomatoes (sauce) is great. Be warned though that they do NOT slice the pizza unless you ask them to. They observe the traditional way it is done back in Italy, and it says so on the menu, so for those who whine about it, learn to read. Be thankful they even offer because if you brought your American butt to Italy and asked for it to be sliced you would be laughed at. Or thrown out.  Their Gellato is good, but try it on their Nutella Pizza (made with the actual Nutella from Europe, not the one sold here in America) and you might die. Of awesomeness.

Ivl2aU2qoG7c_9QU_LavHg.text: We tried this restaurant given the high reviews and were disappointed.  Both my wife and I ordered the Settebello.  She substituted the Buffalo mozzarella and I added anchovies.  The food came out quickly (too quickly).  On the good side, the toppings were extremely good although the pancetta was undercooked.  On the bad side, the crust had little flavor, was over charred on the bottom and severely gummy in the center.  The waiter told us that this was standard for Neapolitan pizza, but I've had food in many Neapolitan restaurants and this is just not True.  The oven obviously was too hot and the pizza needed to cook more slowly.  They also need a more flavorful recipe for the dough.  In addition, we asked for parmesan cheese and what came out was the terrible Kraft type parmesan that had little flavor.  It doesn't cost that much to get real parmesan cheese and grate it at the table or right before.  Add to that, the diet coke I had did not have adequate carbonation.  The place was clean and the tables were nice but there is virtually no sound deadening and it is very noisy. The waiter was very nice, however, but you come to a restaurant for the food.  Perhaps we just got a bad meal, but we won't be going back very soon.

IFo3x7UTAiJV-kPRjBu5PQ.text: This is probably my favorite pizza joint in Henderson. If you hate Pizza Hut Domino's Papa John's etc. you'll love this place. Also great salads and meat and cheese platters.

pcPly6UayP64veqsiqh2uw.text: After trying Novecento, I knew I needed to try Settebello to determine if one was better than the other. I got margherita pizzas at both and I have to say I can't really pick one over the other. They both have fresh tasting ingredients and great crust. The things I do like better about Settebello is that they offer a happy hour menu, and I did prefer the salads here. I had the Romana salad which had Parmesan and goat cheese, artichoke hearts and prosciutto. Delicious! I'll probably keep going to both places, but if you prefer a nicer sit down restaurant with waiter service, this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Romana salad
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Mini margherita

0v3Cr-WnQgchFsmUFJ19HA.text: Not sure how I haven't reviewed this place before but this is absolutely 100% my favorite restaurant. I am constantly impressed with how amazing their pizzas are. Every single one I've tried becomes my "new favorite". They have wonderful atmosphere- really feels like you're in Italy. The servers are always extremely nice- I've had Vanessa multiple times and she is wonderful-and the hostesses are extremely nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. 7$ lunch special

1MV8m7prge2q9f66oQFFrg.text: I love the pizza here. Very fresh and tasty. I can tell the ingredients are fresh and of high quality. The salads are delicious as well. I have tried most of them on the menu and have no complaints. Only thing that irritates me a bit is the service...that can be improved in my opinion. Besides that the pizza is worth a try.

1ABMw_d2RJ8ubcKuDT6WtQ.text: We saw this place across the street when shopping for running shoes and we figured we would give it a try.   Oh my,  the meatball appetizer is absolutely delicious.  The pizza was pretty darn good too.  I love pizza and I'm always on the hunt for the best one out there but this kind of pizza doesn't seem like THEE pizza for me. The crust is thin and overcooked and the rest of the pizza is extremely thin.  Be cautious when taking a slice because it will flop down and your toppings will slip off.  Don't get me wrong,  I will definitely come back and try more,  because delicious will always be delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Meatball appetizer,  so yum!

-g48BwpOwycQgLJ8zuE75A.text: First time eating here and it was delicious!!! My husband and I enjoyed every bite. Will recommend to others.

LulluVgdlCUH2Xkh8Gj-nA.text: This was an awesome place to eat and relax!  We started with the appetizer cheese plate and s mini Misto meat plate.  The flavors were original Italian and very satisfying.  There were five of us, so we ordered the Carbonara Pizza and Diavola pizza which more traditional.  Both were light and delicious! We followed with a finale of Various Gelatos and Cannoli.  The whole experience was flavorful and and very delicious.  Before we left we were already talking about our next trip here!  Mitchell our server was very attentive and went out of his way to please! Come here even the price was astoundingly reasonable!

dVFH-A9f2_RndvtUGuad4A.text: Always amazing.  The Diavola pizza with chili oil added is *kisses fingertips* deliziosa, and the Bianca (arugula, prosciutto, parmigiano Reggiano) is delightful.  The Nutella pizza with strawberry is uh-mazing.  UH-MAZING.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella pizza with strawberries...*drool*
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

WRS6Z8q-MLa9zEu44jOzkA.text: We have been to Settebello on multiple occasions.  The first of which was a great overall experience except for the rude hostess, who was to busy gossiping to greet or bid is farewell. I had written the place off but my girlfriend convinced me to try it again and we have been back many times. So find a new hostess Settebello!!  Anyway this evening our server was Matt, who was fantastic! He have is the best service we have had there this far. We started with two salads, the caprese and the Pere de prosciutto salad. All the salads have been incredible there! The panzanella and caprese are my favorites. We also had there special pizza of the week, which had walnuts, bacon, maple vinaigrette and pears. It was the perfect combination of sweet and salty! It was the best pizza I have ever had!   I'm glad I have settebello another try, I am a huge fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. There special pizza of the week!

aisB8atwrZAr2GEBLXrIIg.text: I really do love this place. They use Italien 00 flour just like in Italy for their pizzas. It's thin and crunchy, one of the only 2 places in town I get a good pizza. Keep going I love it. It's always busy and we always got lucky getting a table with 5 people. Had Bruschetta and Salad there also and both tasted really good.

V2287HGiwyD6MgrvDzJavg.text: Really good pizza and great service. Pizza is a little soggy in the middle but I was explained before hand so that was fine. Pizza is a thin crust style and is very fresh. Atmosphere is upscale casual and fun to people watch. Great for a sir down lunch or dinner with a drink. I would come back for sure.

5NSt0X-OBzve3CUEGkbVKw.text: Awesome sauce, awesome cheese, awesome dough. Quite authentic to what I remember having in Italy though not as thin.   I think it was around $12 for a pie. It takes 2 of them for me to consider myself "full". Tax and tip, you are at $30 a head on pizza (for me anyway)....but it's REAL good...will probably come back a couple times a year...will check out their location on Sahara in the SW of Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Probably not the best pic of their margherita...because it was so good.

o4L4syHkSb7Fr3tbRkxErQ.text: From a picky New Yorker, I can say it was great tasting and great quality.  It is not New York style, however, the choices and varieties offered are unique and quite good.  We had the brisket pizza and while it's a stretch from dough sauce and cheese, but it is a real treat to the taste buds.  We had the margarita also, it was good.

K6k1fn4Hla8vxef5TlOrTw.text: Another fabulous dinner at Settebello. Decided to get it to go this time as it was Sunday and football was on. Started off with the Involtini di Prosciutto. Delicious!! Thin slices of prosciutto wrapped around arugula with fresh slices of shaved Parmesan and a drizzle of a balsamic vinegar sauce.  Instead of getting the "settebello" (my favorite), I decided to try the Capricciosa. I thought it was really good, my only complaint was the large pieces of artichoke hears. I wish they were a little smaller. The pizza was excellent otherwise and still hot when I got home. I love the Napoli style thin crust pizza here which is cooked very quickly in the brick oven. Yes, its a little pricey but for me definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Capricciosa
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Involtini di Prosciutto

nh7odEadWMOn12VXDwa-VA.text: I just had the pesto pizza. Yum! As always, the crust was perfect. And the pesto offered a great herby kick. This place remains the gold standard for pizza in Greater Las Vegas.  And the wine list is quite nice. I had a couple Moscatos to celebrate my coming birthday.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Moscato
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pesto Pizza

Sx2Vp8j9d8zBo-Be7YV84g.text: I went there last week the salad was great the pizza tasted good but I wasn't used to soggy pizza

cG4HWOmFQrpCGOCLmm6r7Q.text: When I want great authentic pizza this is the first place that comes to mind.  They are very conveniently located in a shopping center, which can made it difficult to find parking at times. When you walk in it's very clean, not huge, casual, and everyone is very courteous.   Each pizza is big enough for one very hungry person to each or two not so hungry people to share. I've never had a bad pizza here. My favorite is the the Bianca (and I add prosciutto). Each pizza is very simple and to the point. There isn't anything fancy added just simple, fresh, top-notch ingredients. They don't hide anything. They don't try to reimagine or rediscover the traditional pizza, they make it the way it's supposed to be made.   A must if you are in the area!

3PCpmnvCmTWHjHrqZMyo_w.text: Their salads were delicious esp the pear prosciutto and the pizzas were great. They do need a changing table in the rest rooms. Some of us dine with our families that include children.

5lnhB-o1JoSyf9ukVD0kyQ.text: Amazing. Very satisfied. If you don't try this pizza it's your loss.   Its light pizza, not greasy, just perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

RmvdmXC-Jqa5Nq-R2aquwg.text: Was in town for a golf tournament and wanted a good sit down pizza place.  We found Settebello's and it was great.  Different than normal pizza choices but very good quality and incredible taste.  When back in town we will surely revisit.  We will also recommend to friends coming to visit Vegas/Henderson.

3XNhXXy6MgjqoV3kHGfqMQ.text: Ok. We had a great time at Settebello tonight! The restaurant is beautiful, cool-comfortable and well laid out.     We were lucky to get Tyler as our server. You can tell when someone is actually interested in you and he is. He recommended the Insalata Grande. A lot of people say Balsamic dressing. This was a dressing like I have never tasted (and I've had a lot of Balsamic!)   Did I mention the salad was $14 and big enough to share and had three times the amount of goodies (artichoke, olives...)  Everything thing we had was like nothing I have never tasted.  Next we shared Pizza Bolognese. Hand thrown, bubbly crisp. Remember I said everything tasted like nothing I've ever tasted? The Bolognese is at a completely different level.   Of course I have to have a sweet. Chocolate Gelato was my favorite balance of light and smooth and chocolate.   And again don't forget Tyler. He was just nearby but not in our faces. Delivering our meal himself and checking in at the appropriate times.   No kidding, we had a great time on a Thursday night!

LAB_uSWy7mkbWDAewFoD1g.text: The pizza at Settebello is hands-down my favorite in all of Las Vegas and Henderson. I spent a decent amount of time in Napoli, and ate a lot of pizza in that city. Settebello is by far the closest thing to what I ate in Italy. My husband is originally from Rome and he loves it as well. On Monday's they have $5 Margherita Pizzas which is a smokin' deal! Even though I absolutely love the food here, I have to mention I was super disappointed in the service when we dined here on 4/29/2019. The restaurant wasn't very busy but our waitress was non-existent. She wasn't very friendly, didn't check to see if our food was okay, and didn't ask if we wanted our empty sodas and waters refilled. She actually didn't check on us once. I don't consider myself a needy diner. Just be somewhat nice and refill our drinks, please! Definitely had the impression she was ready to go home for the night and she wasn't happy too serve us.

6SCsNb3fsDZWS6nr1m0Zow.text: Best pizza I've ever had. Had half diavola and half settebello with added arugula. The settebello was my favorite.

G3yz9d1R0n9oxGid1tJskQ.text: Literally some of the best pizza you will get in Nevada!   Everything here is super fresh here, and the service never disappoints. I highly recommend the Margherita DOC, it is amazing!

CWU2YYrIPf_soydUfDkcow.text: Cool off with some homemade and seasonal gelato! Flavors such as: blueberry cheesecake, peanut butter cup, and cookies and cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Enjoying gelato after our pizza dinner.

EtUmN9uAArwn7C5AEMBVIA.text: This location in The District is warm and inviting. It has a small bar area and then a dining area, primarily with booths. It's lots of wood and cool art. Good ambiance and decor.  They have a pretty thorough cocktail, wine, and beer list. The menu has appetizers, salads, etc. But, of course, the pizza is the star here. What I like most is that their pizzas are unique. The combinations they create are things you'd never think of. And that makes it difficult to decide on a pizza.  On my latest visit, I opted for a pizza with gorgonzola, prosciutto, and chopped almonds. It was seriously delicious!  A pizza is small enough that a super hungry person can eat it all in one sitting (as did my dining partner). For me, though, I ate half and took half home. And it was still delicious reheated.   The staff were friendly and attentive. Our drinks were never empty, which I always appreciate.   All in all, a great place for pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

GDm61uAjoZBADNQt7o7Y-w.text: When Settebello gets things right, I'd say it's a 4-4.5* product - wonderful Italian-style pizza with a thin, crisp crust, and I also feel like their toppings are pretty high quality. I usually opt for something off the daily special list but am also a big fan of the namesake pizza and the Diavola.  The problem is that every so often, I'll be served a pizza that is undercooked or is way overcooked (as in heavily burnt - I definitely appreciate char, but I mean really overcooked). I just don't get the quality control issue since it can go either way.  If you can deal with occasional inconsistency, this is a great place - but it's a gamble.

iD5_h2bYr7syx83Zcex5tw.text: Settebello's is tucked back a bit. In The District's East side, it shares a parking lot with Whole Foods and Cheesecake Factory.  IT IS WELL WORTH LOOKING FOR!   The Margherita pizzas are plenty big for two people. Just about any topping you can think of not your usual run of the mill cardboard box pizzas. The desserts are excellent, Gelatto and Tiramisu are what we tried. They were priced between 5 and $10.  The staff is very attentive. I wouldn't go here for a romantic outing as it can be quite busy. Definitely friends or just a good night out. Very clean too!

1n2HbTkmZ_JXiI83DaybPw.text: Italian style restaurant located in The District shopping area.  We came on a Friday night and it was very busy. The waitstaff was attentive and friendly.  I started with the sangria which was great. We ordered the meatballs for an appetizer and I was underwhelmed. One of the meatballs was burnt. For our meal we had the margherita pizza. It was undercooked and cold after 5 minutes.  I doubt we will be back.

OuaLQnuus1CoC7214dueMQ.text: while visiting relatives in henderson i requested to go to an italian restaurant, of course we did the yelp search and found this this restaurant with ratings of 4&5 stars. wrong!!!! this italian restaurant was horrible the napolitano pizza was burnt and was absolutely not napolitano. living in san diego where we have little italy and being italian i found it  a total disappointme it was a step up from olive garden horrible, service, and horrible "italian  sorry if you had a half star they absoulutely earned it

-KwTTkHRt0d6RiLkRXMNfw.text: The best pizza and service hands down! I eat here all the time, try the pear and jalapeno pizza - I promise you don't regret it!! I know it sounds weird, but trust me just do it! I have brought many friends here and they've all loved it!

3SnKrHobwe4caDpSus2cvQ.text: We have visited Settebello a few times now in their downtown Salt Lake location and loved it every time. We actually had no idea they had other locations, but came across it in our travels through Henderson. I can honestly say the quality of food and service is consistent between the restaurants. And their gluten free crust is actually really good, which is really hard to come by at a pizza place. Definitely worth the stop.

Jc3iZaTJgR6Td9EeOdxIYQ.text: I would put Settebello in the top tier of pizza places for us. We've enjoyed just about everything we've tried. To top it off, we're less than a ten minute drive so those urges for pizza can easily be met. The service on our last trip kept our meal from being perfect.  We usually get one of the salads to start and if I don't go hog wild, one pizza is usually good enough for my wife and I still leaving room for dessert. They'll split the salads in two portions for you without request. My wife likes the Insalata Grande ($9) because she loves kalamata olives. The prosciutto platter ($13) is definitely recommended especially with the mozzarella di bufala ($6). The Settebello ($13) is one of our favorite pizzas and we always enjoy the tiramisu ($5.50) for dessert.  What was disappointing on our last visit was our Margherita DOC was brought out literally two minutes after we received our prosciutto platter. Not helping things was that the pie was under-cooked without any charring or blistering so by the time we got to it, things were a soggy room temperature mess. A little common sense with timing from the server and the problem could have been avoided especially when the pizzas only take a minute to fire.  We're hooked and we'll keep coming back. If you come and the service hits the mark, there's no doubt you'll have a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Cannoli
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Margherita DOC

Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Insalata Romana- arugula, speck, artichoke hearts, goat cheese, shaved Parmigiano, pine nuts, lemon vinaigrette, balsamic reduction

PF7CdIq8uWK-Op1Amm4Drg.text: Fantastic!  Seated immediately with excellent customer service all evening.  Ordered the arugula salad w prosciutto, pine nuts, artichokes, shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano and a Quattro Formaggi pizza - simply Fabulous.  The salad was huge but delicious with every bite.  While we were there the place filled up and when we left there was a line to get in that was 10 people deep.  Can't wait to do this again!

R1KpDg1QhO18J8sVzF_A9g.text: Best pizza in town!!! Lexi is amazing, she was very kind & made sure everything was okay at all times. The hostess Madison was also very nice and accommodating. Everyone there is super awesome! And the food is the best! Customer for life!

f5UhWbn3RpN9HNL4fydXKQ.text: Stunningly good find in vegas for gourmet pizza.  Prices were quite reasonable too, which is hard to find in this city.  Got the magherita for the kids and the diavola (pepperoni and roasted red pepper), both were perfect with flavorful crust.

FOpDvKQ1hN1BwnmdBLk-1A.text: Meh, ok pizza soggy in the middle flavor was ok  Wife's pizza was extremely burned. Soggy in the middle as well  I get the idea behind Napoli pizza, just this was overpriced and under delivered  Salad was very tasty and the service  was good.  Looks like most people just go to drink wine. Maybe it helps get the pizza down.

bDol0qwv2qRnaACOguCMlg.text: Just like other reviewer's, I found the middle of my pizza very very soggy. The outside of the pizza crust was good. The ingredients them selves were very delicious and fresh. Good quick service, went there at 8:30 PM it was empty.

qKyJql2onn2YBvVaK2Ve6w.text: I will not discount the fact that my previous fifteen visits have been wonderful with great food and good service. But I learned an important fact on my visit yesterday. Don't come Saturday lunch...I thought we arrived late enough to avoid the lunch crowd but I was wrong. Very busy, full restaurant, servers (only 3 of them + a food runner) were out of control. They were on a pace which I considered close to a run. No one greeted us at the door because there was no one as they usually have a host person. A few minutes later a server came. We were seated at a table but then a booth became available. I got up to request from another server a seat in the booth. She said she'd ask....two minutes passed....I then told my wife let's just move there. Of course not without the restaurant rules...it was in another servers station so our previous server literally was not pleased with my decision to move. A young man approached....we ordered and I asked for two waters. Water never came until our food was delivered after I asked again. Food runner was very polite. After our meal was served we never saw our waiter again until I asked for the check. No one checked if we needed anything during our lunch...of course we did. When he delivered my check, it was an inappropriate"thanks guys." I don't like the casualness toward my wife. If I had impeccable service I could possibly overlook it but we didn't.  What did we learn today? Put a wait at the door if your service staff is buried. I'd rather wait ten minutes to ensure we receive the service that I normally expect  with you. I will be back...your food is top notch. 1 * for service. 5 * for food.

tE9neok7iDs0I3FRfWmMMQ.text: We come here all the time and we are always satisfied! Food is so delicious from the appetizers all the way to the dessert. Our server, Tyler F was so knowledgeable about the menu and very professional. Our favorite pizzeria

_KSrtzOybj663n926DdwJw.text: One of our favorite pizza places to eat in.  I don't recommend getting to go food.  Service is always great. Good is consistent and yummy.

IOzIJuc--Gfq00QFuO1XZw.text: I love this place!  It is by far the best pizza place in the Las Vegas Valley!  Being Italian as I am, I know my pizza's "Yum"  If you like pizza, you like to taste each individual ingredient in each delicious bite of pizza, this is the place of quality and you should differently go!  The prices are very reasonable and the ambiance is very Italian.  I had an awesome conversation with the General Manager, Natalia Formisano and a True professional she is who knows the business of management, people, customers, and takes pride in providing services and products that make this pizza place 2nd to none!  As a business man of many entities over the years, she should be promoted to definitely a Regional Manager Position!  Great Job!

zIY_7G33GLMx4vS-tqSDRQ.text: What is a better post work out meal other than Pizza!?  Had a lunch date with my bestie on a Tuesday afternoon. It was pretty dead so we got sat and served very quickly. We opt out of sharing a pizza because she wanted to go a vegetarian route and I am all bout my meat. I got the Stelebello pizza minus the mushrooms (yuck!). The meats on the pizza were fresh. I loved the basil and nuts in it. It was probably in the top 5 best pizzas I ever had.   We also ordered some fruity beers. I forgot the names but we shared a apricot beer and a strawberry beer. That strawberry beer is amazing. Ever since we've tried it we have been trying to find it at spirit stores. So good.   The one thing that was a little disappointing was the cannoli. It just didn't meet my expectations. It was a decent size but the shell was too tough. The filling wasn't as good as others I've tried. We also got Affogatos! omg those were to DIE for. I got the hazelnut flavor and it was so good. Best one I've had.   I will definitely come back. It's not on my side of town but I will drive all the way over there just for the pizza and affogatos! Yum.   Also, I didn't get to ask but is pepperoni a topping here? I didn't see it on the menu at All..

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry beef-- bomb
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Apricot beer
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

pgjJytHr0WpOpQm7Wf5dDQ.text: Solid food and nice people! Came here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and all the staff were lovely. They even got us water cups to go on a hot day for free which I've never experienced at a restaurant before.

zikMXy73Fr6rixaX6uYWQg.text: Before I ate here the waiter explained to me the crust was thin, crispy, yet chewy and the cheese was a "wet" mozzarella.  I'll try anything once.  A unique pie with unfortunately soggy wet floppy crust was presented to us. If that's obligated to the style then this probably isn't the pizza place for me. It was like topping soup poured on paper-thin soggy flatbread. But hey, it was a good soup, and the waiter complimented my fresh haircut. B)

F66zni82M-1O6drb3WoNdQ.text: The Pizza at Settebello was awesome!  We had two pizzas and both were perfect combos in my book.  The Settebello and the Cappicola.  I'll attach a picture later.  They also have happy hour with discounted drinks and food.  If I was a local, I would definitely hit this place up for HH, sit at the bar and watch an NBA game.  The service was nice from the host to servers to bussers etc.  Very reasonable prices for high quality pizza (see their menu).  Extensive drink list.  I was extremely satisfied with my Settebello pizza experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

dZA0ViLW8oaN5tcooOM8Yg.text: the pizza was literally soggy af.  the crust was limp and flappy.  it was like i was eating pizza soup.  i could never return and be okay.

qClO9fdHUzc8BuXx7WZnjA.text: The food is consistently very good, the service is very good as well although it is a small place and they get over-run at times during lunch.

oFKkHG1zLycx0FK---clow.text: Definitely in love with this location. We sat at the bar and the bartender was very attentive. He told us about the happy hour menu and that we still had time to order. The Moscow Mules were well made, not too sweet and just perfect. The appetizer was delicious, along with the best beet salad I've ever had. Fresh ingredients for sure. The brisket pizza was perfectly cooked and the combination of onions and brisket is so savory. We will definitely be coming back to this location and thank you for giving me a birthday coupon to celebrate my birthday! Keep up the good work and thank you for everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

z5JZW5gjvlsru5dCXYlOkQ.text: Yum, but their Summerlin location is yummier.  Settebellos is your basic thin crust fancy pizza joint. They have a pretty consistent menu of pizza that does not change like the location in Summerlin does. The pizzas are thin, but big enough that you'll probably want to share a pizza with 2 people. Pizza with jalapeno marmalade: Yes, yes, yes. It's the perfect combo of sweet plus spicy and you won't regret your choice. The marmalade is just a light glaze on top, it does not replace the sauce.  Settebello Pizza: Heavy on the meat, lacking in flavor. It was just a regular thin crust pizza with heavy toppings, but nothing special. Skip it and go for something that stands out a little more.  The Summerlin location has a fig marmalade which beats the jalapeno. Can you guys put that on your menu too?!

19ntx4aEmmNKIddyi7F2cg.text: Pizza here was not as good as I hoped. It's kinda soggy and definitely not crunchy at all. When you hold up the slice from the crust side it sags down and needs to be folded to be consumed, which was a surprise.   The insalata grande was very good but I wish the pizza was better. The ingredients were quality but I was disappointed that the crust had no crunch.  The cannoli dessert looked great but didn't taste as good as it looked. There was an overpowering taste in the cream that I couldn't put my finger on but really ruined it for me.  Overall not a great experience.
