1mbl8svLjNtBvjidxdKaCA.text: I've given it a shot twice now to give a fair review. Both times it tasted fine, but the crust is just a thin wet layer of sog. I mean it's the equivalent of eating a tasty bread bowl of soup. The bottom part of the bread bowl. We asked for it more toasty and we got the same thing with crispy black edges.  For the price, wouldn't return. Oh well.

ASQ7XXxv4-jSFRgVrrw5Gg.text: I have been to settebello plenty of times and there's no doubt I will continue to go back. The food is delicious and authentic and the staff is always so pleasant. You can sense a genuine camaraderie amongst them which resonates with their guests like myself. I dined there earlier this evening and our server, Loren, was amazing. I was in the mood to try something new and she was very helpful and had great suggestions. When she suggested the pasta for an entree I almost regretted asking for her input because I thought the pizza's were the reason people went to settebello. Nevertheless, I took her advice and the pasta was DELICIOUS. Apparently they can do no wrong when it comes to Italian food! For anyone going for the first time, I recommend ordering an appetizer and a salad with your meal, they are worth it!!

_Bt811v-nObeP0I02fcDIA.text: We went to Settebello based on Yelp reviews. I'd have to say it was just OK. Service was very good and we were seated as soon as we walked in which was somewhat surprising considering it was a Friday evening. We ordered 2 pizzas. My pizza tasted fine but the crust was soggy. Something wasn't right with either the prep or the cooking. My wife's pizza was fine. Also ordered a bottle of wine which was ok but expensive for what it was. Gelato for dessert was fine. I would not say I'd never go back but I'd give someplace else a try before returning.

n750Qhv5sc7E0nRBhx_jGw.text: We love this place. The pizzas are always delicious. The mixed meats and cheeses were also excellent. We go at off hours and always have pleasant chats with the staff. They also serve Peroni and Moretti which many Italian restaurants do not.

AW3k115Jqhxm1KFtI8-Szw.text: One of the best local pizzerias to go eat in Henderson. They have a variety of pizzas and other items on the menu. My family ordered the Bianca and another one with anchovies, a Margarita pizza and I ordered the featured pizza: Carnitas. It was absolutely delicious, it came with a slice of lemon on the side, reminded me of a taco(tasted like one too lol). We ordered dessert as well, the strawberry gelato tastes just like in Italy  and we ordered a Nutella pizza, it was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

dmd-3y-SiIStG01v6RTTww.text: Came here for their Monday night special... $5 personal Margherita pizzas and $5 Moscow Mules! Such a good deal :)  Everyone got a Margherita pizza, except for myself; I got the Misto appetizer (selection of meats, cheeses, olives/pickled veggies and a big plate of focaccia bread). Everything was delicious, my Misto platter was definitely big enough as an appetizer for a table of 4-6 people, let alone a whole dinner for one person.  For drinks me and my boyfriend each had a couple of moscow mules and our friend had the Sangria Roja.  The normal prices weren't bad at all, I think the Misto was only $15 and well worth it. We will be back for sure.

CjEgoL0T2FMUwmuNGKXSrg.text: Came here for lunch with a few of my friends.  They have a great lunch deal where you can get specialty pizza for 9 dollars and a salad for 4 dollars.  Environment: located in the district near Whole Foods. It is in a pretty busy area. The restaurant itself is pretty small and cute with cool Italian design. They also have a bar area where you can sit as well.  Service: the service was great, the staff were really friendly and were pretty quick about getting or orders in and bringing them out.  Food: I got the lunch special with the beet salad. The salad is so delicious with fresh beets. They give you the red and orange ones and well dressed arugula salad. I ordered the brisket pizza. It was good with melted white cheese and brisket beef with onions. I do feel that the pizza gets kind of soggy in the middle which was a little unpleasant. The crust though taste great if you dip it in vinaigrette. My friends all got the setebello pizza which was good as well. I do feel like it had a lot on it also making it pretty soggy, but it could be because of the rustic dough they use.   Overall, good lunch spot with a good pizza deal and salad. The only drawback for me with the soggy center of the pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello classic pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Brisket pizza!! Yum
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Beet salad, delicious and large !

awz6edSOVTPXz371pjdOTg.text: I had to come here after seeing the pictures on yelp. When I see a restaurant I have to try, I make every effort to go. Not having a car in Vegas is rough. The amount is been spending on uber and lyft eats up a lot of my food adventure expenses.   I came here with my manager and I ordered the Pete e Jalapeno without meat. I didn't realize we were sharing..sad. I could've simply ate the whole pie myself. I guess it's good I didn't since I've been munching all day. Her clients brought her so many goodies!   So this pizza. I'm so glad I came! This is so far the best brick oven pizza in Vegas. The dough was extremely chewy and fluffy and just perfect. The amount of charred pieces on the crust was perfect to stain my teeth. I just love smiling with chunks of pizza pieces. (Sarcasm) the pie was fabulous. The spread they used was way better than I imagined. It had a hint of sweetness.   I really wanted a pie with pesto but didn't see it on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pere e Jalapeño

QQJlCfl3mX8_AmJkwlw5bw.text: "ECCELLENTE" There is a reason this restaurant has the official Napoletana Certification (which is very rare and very difficult to get). They are required to use the same ingredients and cooking methods as it made in Napoli - the home of pizza. Great friendly service. Atmosphere is like any smaller pizza house. No bells and whistles. Just great Napolitano pizza (thin crust in wood fired oven). Smaller bar which I did not try.   Not sure small kids would appreciate the quality.

NKcZh7puglMlI9ENDMX73A.text: Used to be the best pizza in town and we used to love it but the last few times we been there the pizza were very poor loaded... very little cheese and on the Bianca almost inexistent prosciutto ( plus I particularly asked to put more cheese after last times incidents) pity...

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

VuJI9Dp17gH7kuMuZJAwhA.text: Best pizza in LV? Maybe, I am still a big fan of Grimaldis. The pizza is more Italian-Napoletana style. Very saucy and the crust is one of the best you'll ever eat. The cheese is fresh and sauce is probably the best pizza sauce ever. The saucyness of the pizza can be a turn off to some folks. I really don't think that Napoletana pizza works with topping on top.   I highly recommend that you order Margherita pizza, especially the one with Buffalo Mozzarella. I also tried the Caprese salad for an appetizer. It was delicious. The quality of mozzarella is excellent and favlorfull. During weekdays they have drink specials from 3-6. Its B1G1.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

0ZZcLhtghg3ydtnKoaO3zw.text: Decided to do takeout tonight. Got a settebello pizza for about $16. Pizza was thin crust and flavorful. Good mix of ingredients. So glad it's just around the corner from us.

Xs8Xcqcw24c_TjPb72u-zA.text: We stopped by Settebello after work for a relaxing dinner on Sunday evening.  The restaurant was full but we got sat in a booth right away. The waitress was very pleasant and explained how they cook their pizzas.  They are cooked in a 900 degree oven so the crust is crispy and the inside is a little moist.  I order the garden mule, this was very interesting.  It was a spinoff of the Moscow mule with blueberries.  We ordered the warm beet salad and the settebello pizza.  Both were fantastic.  The beets were cooked with goat cheese and pine nuts, the dish came out steaming hot.  The pizza was also delicious.  I will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Warm beet salad
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

DNCWZGM9CvQX6I9NxtmEaA.text: WOW! I never knew pizza could taste sooooo good! you each order your own 12" pizza so you really get what you want...the freshest prosciutto to roasted mushrooms, fresh mozzerella, in house crushed tomotoes....this is making my mouth water just talking about it.......the hand tossed oven baked crewy hot crust!!! so delicious.   THIS IS THE ONLY PIZZA YOU SHOULD EVER EAT! and once you do, say good bye to Round Table, Papa John's, the pizza joint on the corner or where ever you are getting pizza and come to Settebello and eat like you are in Italy, Ciao~

XEMrOQl2hIhAlK0FeojfRA.text: Pretty solid Italian pizza.  It comes in one size which is six slices, plenty for sharing (with an appetizer to add) or large for personal pan for around $12-14. The wine and beer are also very fairly priced (the wine especially at about $6/glass regularly).  We had a pizza which came with sausage, mushrooms, pine nuts, and spinach.  Crust was great, the ingredients were great, but the cheese did fall off the pie rather easily.  The service was good and the environment was solid.  I would come back again for both the food and the price.

NYyOtSulGo4FpeVOEr7WDg.text: I was not impressed. Soggy pizza  and very dry crust I ordered sausage there were a few crumbs of it on one side of the pizza. I have had much better I won't return.

7LX4tySzXG_wJ5tfP79q7A.text: We were very excited to try this establishment. It is very pretty inside but a bit too warm. The cheese plate with focaccia was excellent. The wine reasonably priced but slow to get to the table. The pizza seemed undercooked. I could not even pick my piece up.  My husband had to go through 3 sets of utensil to get a set that was clean. Our pizza did not come out together, my husbands pizza came out first. The staff was unaware and in attentive. the sun was shining into my husbands eyes. We had to ask the shade to be lowered.   We ended the evening with tiramisu which was also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. the bench in ladies restroom with it&#39;s torn up seat. Take it out,better not to have it than to have something in poor condition.
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiramisu!!!!
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settebello pizza. Looks yummy

f9q7jEq3vPTgXbYHjY2HGA.text: I have always enjoyed picking up a pizza every so often as I have lived minutes from here for years but it is not until recently that I have come to know and enjoy the fantastic experience of dining in. We had a dinner for my moms birthday with a large party of 12 and it was seamless. They both accommodated and served a cake that we brought in addition to flowers balloons and favors. The food is so fresh light and delicious- you can't imagine such a great light taste to pizza!  The daily drink specials make dining here both fun and dangerous. $4 margaritas on Thursdays! Overall- fantastic fresh food with friendly attentive service. The best pizza place in town.

RtOCc9-vW5Ts_ftsZI9zCQ.text: Settebello is one of my favorite pizza places in town. Definitely my favorite pizza place in green valley. Took about one second for me to fall in love with this Neapolitan pizza. I will admit this style of pizza is not for everyone. My favorite pizza is called the Settebello. Also love the happy hour at the bar. $5 mini pizza with one topping, absolutely!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. The Settebello pizza

f6Sm8Z3GLGENw1Ytl2dYqw.text: As a pizza aficionado I give this a 4.5. I dock half a point for finite texture issues with the dough and a lack of creative "special" pies/toppings.   With that said this is probably as authentic of a neopolitan pie I'll find in Vegas and I'm ok with that.  The sauce is perfect. The dough could have a more drastic crispy/doughy differentiation but that comes down to the types of flours used not the quality.    One very stiff negative for me is serving Rasputin stout from a bottle, not on nitro.  I was seriously appalled at this oversight.  It doesn't do that amazing beverage justice.

ndaW_k4PIsl9pY_7KP27rQ.text: My husband loves pizza and had heard from a coworker that Settebello had excellent authentic pizzas.   We went on a Friday night and it was busy! It was only about a 15 minute wait and they let us know our table was ready by sending a text to my phone.   The restaurant is pretty big and has a nice bar set up. You can also sit outside which is nice. This is a great place for a large group. Today we got a booth which had a marble table top. They have really unique art all over the walls.   The pizza is cooked in a wood oven and the crust is thinner and chewier then most crusts. It kinda reminded me of a whole wheat tortilla. Our waitress explained that the pizzas come in 12 inch personal size.She also explained that traditionally the pizzas are not cut into slices. (But they will if you ask.)   We started with the Rucola Salad and the Focaccia bread. The salad was a bed of Arugula dressed with lemon juice and sea salt. It was ok. Nothing special. The Focaccia bread gave us a sample of the crust to come. I enjoyed dipping it in the nutty olive oil and tangy balsamic vinegar.   For our pizzas I ordered the Emilia which had an alfrado sauce instead of the classic tomato sauce. They called it an Italian cream sauce. It also had prosciutto, basil, parmigiano, and mozzarella cheese. I loved the toppings. They all melted together so well. With all that cheese how could it ever be bad! My husband ordered the Pizza Carbonara which had crushed tomatoes, pancetta, egg, parmigiano, mozzarella cheese, and bits of basil. I liked Joel's, but I have to say I really enjoyed mine more. (He did as well. lol) That Italian cream sauce was so tasty! I would have loved a bowl of that sauce to dip my Focaccia bread in! (mental note that for next time!)   Settebello is a great pizza place. Looks like it also would be a great place for happy hour. They have a full drink menu that I would love to come back and try. The staff was friendly and attentive which is a huge plus. My only gripe would be that it was waaaay hot in there. Like sweating so bad I needed a napkin hot! But other then that my experience was great. When I'm craving real pizza I'll sure be back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Emilia
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Focaccia
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Rucola

YFPL_bEsc4qgy2Vv-610VA.text: 1/2/16 This is now one  of my top three favorite pizza places.   Pear and Jalapeno pizza is my new favorite pizza.   Our friends thought it might be too hot for me,  but it was the perfect amount of heat from the Jalapeno.   The crust was thin and perfectly seasoned,  I could eat the crust by itself.   We also ordered the settebello pizza,  but I preferred the pear & jalapeno pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. 1/1/16 Settebello Pizzeria (grenvalley,  lv)-Pear and Jalapeño .  So yummy.

dKb0dZPAx62mkqwITepHBQ.text: We were in town for a Volleyball Tournament.  Stopped by for some takeout pizza.  Bought the Diavola and the Settebello pizzas.  Also bought the Insalata Grande.  All was just excellent.  Service was super as the employee giving us our food opened each box to show us.

HTpjB63ZiB-hArG3cdo6ag.text: Since I moved from France to the US, this place is the best for pizzas. I tried many places in the US, and this one is without hesitation the best.  Not too expensive, with a great service, I come there each time I am near Vegas.   Every pizza lover who' s passing by should try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Daviola pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella pizza

K5sFlNL-A-z7X3b5lfJFfw.text: I absolutely LOVE this place! All the times I've eaten here the service has been good and the pizza is amazing! It is actually authentic Italian style pizza, not the fake stuff from the chain restaurants.  The Ingredients used in their pizza seem to be high quality! This is one of my favorite  pizzas in the Las Vegas valley

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummmm

F1yaoMDytgtwH2972Dy20Q.text: Came in for happy hour. The food was amazing! New place for pizza. I'm super picky and like natural stuff which they use here. Happy hour is great wine is BOGO we had moscato delish!!! We also tried the four items they offer on the happy hour menu...all amazing!!! Will come again soon and will tell my friends about this great find! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Mini pizza...happy hour :)
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Calzone...yummy :)

OutHM-i-PFfW-TerB33law.text: Probably some of the best pizza I've had in a while. The crust was perfect: chewy on the inside but crisp on the edges. The cheese and toppings were tasty, but not overpowering. The (Moscow) Mule sampler was excessive (in a good way). Three full sized cocktails! Beers are in bottles and not on tap. Service was fantastic. Great advice on selections and very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States

QfIFtwk-FfV8EMlS3NpAuw.text: This pizza must be made with magic.    We were visiting Las Vegas from California and staying at a hotel on Las Vegas Boulevard.  Based on the reviews on Yelp we decided the 20 minute drive to Settebello  would be worth it.  The pizza here is the best I have ever eaten.  The crust has a similar texture and taste of the Indian bread naan.  Does anyone not like that bread?  The sauce and cheese were perfect.  When eating it I thought I died and went to heaven.  One pizza is just the right size for one person.  Every time we visit Las Vegas and want pizza this is the restaurant we will go to.

0QUjGnI_oEXyg3S8KaBAJQ.text: I like their pizza. It's pretty authentic the way they make their crust and sauce (or don't sauce) the crust.  The reason I give only three stars is because of the toppings. Sometimes the freshness isn't there. For a restaurant that's so close to whole foods, their toppings better be fresh. Otherwise, I'll just go to whole foods and buy the stuff to make my own pizza at home. Of course, then it wouldn't be made in a brick oven, the ingredients would be fresh though!  I like the pizza with arugula on top. The last few times I've been, the pizza was overly oily -which either means they put too much olive oil on or they put too much cheese on while the pizza was just out of the oven- and the arugula was sad looking. Almost like the pizza was made earlier and they reheated it.  Then there are other times I go and the pizza is great!   I think they need a bigger and better appetizer or primi menu. They also need more Italian liquor and Italian wine. Hey, they want to be authentic, don't they?

v4hYSOoz6QCKYb7trmzQOQ.text: Again, I love this place.  Husband wasn't that thrilled with my choice until he bit into his settebello pizza with sausage, pine nuts, mushrooms, etc.  THEN he decided I was right, this place is good food!

TIAhKl4-8TgH3hWKNLsMwQ.text: I have never been so irritated in my life.. The crust is soft and soggy on the inside and totally black and burns around the edges how can you even sell that!!

rjyXT-02PgLuK3HUy8-rzg.text: My wife and I were here some months ago for pizza and salad apps.  Ordered beet salad with goat cheese and greens, which I had enjoyed before.  My wife ordered appetizer with tomato and basil.  My salad didn't have the goat cheese! Her's didn't have the basil! Waiter told me the goat cheese was mixed in the dressing and could not be seen, weak. We ordered pizza, one full hour later was told it had not been started yet!  We left. I think the poor service was due to the fact we did not order alcohol and we're taking a booth that could hold more people.  I guess if you want  good service and food made according to menu, drink up. Probably won't be back.

wYqwS4ginzvipZ5ZYhZJMw.text: Vreat food and service.  Moderate price but well worth it.  Margarita pizza is my favorite.

TJ2vYcNSMWCpM5-9B37m5g.text: Out with my Mom, sister, and niece, we wanted to go somewhere that would satisfy a craving for pizza but still appeal to our need for good, creative food.   Service was fast and friendly for a Friday lunch. The waitress made recommendations we loved; from the wine to desserts, she was able to address all of our "I am having a hard time choosing between ____________ and ____________. What wine do you have that is not too _________________ but will complement _________________?  She was on her game and catered to the adults as well as the three-year old firecracker sitting across from me.  Mangia! Mangia! The Caesar salad was tangy and bright and crisp. The cheese was sharp and the addition of the anchovies was a great salty bite (and that they offered them was a plus!).   The Misto plate (antipasto plate) was huge! Amazing options for meats and cheeses - four or five each! - and really creative olive and vegetable offerings. The perfect accompaniment to the salad.  Involtini di Prosciutto - Wrapped up a bit like a carpaccio canneloni (or a cannoli, but the inference to the sweet might throw someone off? I digress...), the arugula and goat cheese were wrapped in prosciutto, topped with olive oil, balsamic, a little sea salt, and more shaved cheese. Light, flavorful, and perfectly fresh, you get the bite from the greens, the creamy sharpness of the cheese, and the salty velvet of the meat all in one bite. If I had nothing else at this meal, I would have been supremely happy. This will be easily become a staple for me.  Mom, sis, and the kiddo had pizzas. I tried the toppings of the Quattro (think 4 different pizzas, served on one pie in quadrants) and one of their prosciutto specials and found them to be very tasty. Loved the sauces, the cheese combinations, and the veg/protein options. Again with the fresh, fresh ingredients.  I didn't care for the cannoli. Not that it wasn't made well... but the cream had dried fruit in it and I am purist when it comes to certain things. I have to admit, I'd take the gun and leave the cannoli. The coffee, gelatos and cheesecake were great. Nothing unique, but excellent nonetheless.  A solid, tasty, perfectly executed meal with lots of options, fantastic service, and good pricing (2 huge pizzas, misto, salad, prosciutto, desserts, wine and coffees... for $90?).

PmpxTuWAJ9x1FO1ceFHFlw.text: Well, I had a date to meet up there since I never eaten there before but of course, this guy flake out.. nevertheless, I decided to invite one of my gay hubby out for dinner later that day just because I read the good reviews about this place and I wanted to try!   Wow, this was the first time I tried authentic Italian style pizza (I had settabello, which is my favorite). I love the crust, how some part are slightly burnt but I love the flavor of it. The center of pizza got bit soggy yet chewy crust. My friend had other one that had olives, I forgot the name but the amount of olives placed on there tasted overwhelming. We also had caprese, of course, that is always delicious with balsamic vinegar but I could make this at home!   I'll be back to try other items!

lLWTZ5JDyq9Y-KzNxZH2wQ.text: Good pizza and good service. Great dessert as well. It is a good pizza no doubt but I have been to some places that do it better. That said, I don't know what other options are in the area and I know how jaded I sound. Definitetly worth going to at least once to try!

ircp1L98nWiqqwecIzvryw.text: You get the feeling that you are in Naples, Italy and just stopped in for a quick lunch or snack. The food quality is authentic and good. The service is a little sketchy. portion size is good. Full bar with a good selection of Italian wines. Both the pizza and the antipasto are noteworthy. Deserts are excellent as well. Definitely recommend and the prices are reasonable.

G2dT3mFVkdRmE-fzMRDhJA.text: Excellent! We had a Caprese salad & Pizza Carbonara.  Both were outstanding and reasonably priced! I'll be back!

csEyEWdcCLriksOanKbVEg.text: I had high expectations going into this place because of the Certified Italian Pizza.  Started off with the Misto.  Nice little selection of meats and a little bit of cheese.  I liked the addition of the Olives and Artichoke Hearts.  I am an Artichoke fiend.  Probably the highlight of the meal.  I decided to try the Pizza Lasagna.  I wanted to see if they were able to capture the essence of a good lasagna.  The Ricotta was nice but it did not represent the fusion of Lasagna and Pizza.  Fork and Knife deal, it was soggy and wouldn't hold up when folded either.  Washed all down with a couple of decent Del Sole.  Maybe the other selections are better but you would have to take another Yelper's word for it because I am most likely not to return.

FLhjEo13H-ONdP-CMi6U4g.text: If you enjoy pizza, you'll most likely enjoy Settebello. The pizza flavors are quite delicious... and are made with fine ingredients. The flavor profiles are amazing.   Happy hour is nice, as well. There are usually deals on drinks if that's your thing.   Also, my favorite aspect of this place is the desert. The nutella pizza is AMAZING!

ep4lAG7jUzqvisnfXsw36A.text: Life changing pizza. You cannot afford to miss this food. Miles beyond above anything else, nothing even remotely compares. I've been coming here since they opened in Green Valley, and have never been disappointed in the hundreds of margarita/garlic/salami pizzas I have devoured. Each better than the last. A+++.

2yZP0nc2LmX7ZqwJIJ_FUQ.text: Don't really care for Vegas, but Henderson seemed really nice and almost sane and also featured grass on some of the boulevards. I wanted to spend more time there.  This Settebello is seemingly identical to the one one in SLC in terms of menu, which is good. Maybe a bit more or less formal? Can't really decide.   Regardless, really mega good Napo pizza. The Caprese appetizer was massively  delicious.

jLzGmnrj8akP1aa-AamYqg.text: This place didn't start out promisingly. A sangria and antipasta plate later I was thinking it was a giant mistake to come here. The sangria was pretty mediocre and the antipasta plate was terrible. The pizza, however, redeemed all. I ordered a carbonara pizza with egg on top (my new fave pizza topping) and thought it was delic. The crust, tomatoes, mozzarella- all perfect. Was I back in Naples?? Almost a 5- if only that delicious egg wasn't overcooked. Other than that- awesome pizza!!

XzLhgJOGPMFOi5hQ5MIaLA.text: The location is close to GVR and Whole Foods which is great. The pizza was something different with the background on why this pizza isn't cut into slices...but that is as much history as I need about pizza. We all know that the Italians got pizza from Spain...yada yada. The review on the pizza was delicious with the crust being a bit chewy. The ingredients were fresh and the reviews are spot on.

M8lylZF8PKNxSIl4JQLHgw.text: Usually one of our favorites. Waited 1 hr.  for pizza that never came. Finally left after paying for salads. Mentioned to hostess on exiting. They were very busy but should know Friday in December always is. Very disappointed.

vfQlqa6dh54W9JNLHVnHFQ.text: Favorite pizza place in Las Vegas. Excellent pizza and salads every time we go here.  Truly Naples style pizza! We've always had great service here as we'll.

utaD6oh0GL23BMzeRKbqzA.text: Settebello's makes the best pizza I have ever had. No questions asked.  The margerita is very very good, and you will certainly not be disappointed. I would give it a 4 star.  The Pizza Carbonara is fantastic. The egg on the pizza is awesome, and I would give this pizza a 4.5. My only problem is that the pancetta can be a bit salty and sometimes overpower the pizza.  Finally, the Settebello pizza. It was actually the last one I tried because I am not generally a fan of sausages. Yet theses sausages were nothing like the overpowering sausages that overpower most pizzas. This was pure, fresh, sausage perfection, and this pizza was absolutely legendary. A 5 star pizza, the best pie I've ever had.  NOTE- Unless you are absolutely starving, I am not sure you can eat a pizza and get dessert. I have tried and failed twice, so maybe split a pizza then go for the epic-sounding desserts.

Y7bTrYwT4xhmMgZtsF6EUg.text: Love this place!! I alway no what to order and they get it right all the time! FYI, this is no Metro Pizza or Grimaldi's Pizza. It is more on the ITalian side of the pizza world. The are part of the Vera Pizzaria Napoletana establishment.   My go to is the Margerhita with Italian Sausage and onion. I always ask for the vinegar and oil with my pizza. It's delish!  My one little gripe, and this is a small one is the service is a bit slow at times.   If you haven't gone you need to go!! It is my default when I don't know where to go in this town.

nx7g_J_mJAo9fal8ApfGIQ.text: We have loved coming to Settabello's since a friend introduced us to this fantastic pizza joint over 3 years ago!  This is authentic Italian pizza at it's finest! I almost always order the same thing every time that I come here. There Arugula salad is so delicious! Not sure where they source there Arugula but I can eat there salad with just fresh lemon and cracked pepper on it and the flavor is so intensely delicious.  For the main event I order a pizza ,no cheese with extra crisp cooked crust with marinara , garlic, mushrooms, pine nuts, olives, roasted peppers and artichokes and then I finish it with fresh arugula. What can I say...When the Arugula is great you put it on everything. The crust is nice and thin and they use a wood fire to cook the pizza.  The Menu is tight but in my opinion they have perfected what they do best. They serve beer and wine and they also do a daily happy hour.  They have a great kids meal that consists of a pizza, drink and homemade gelatin for under 6 dollars!   This is an other one of those places that is so good that we travel almost 23 miles from the other side of town to eat here.  If you love a delicious  thin crust then this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Bella and her olive and artichoke pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. My delicious vegan custom pizza
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Arugula salad with artichokes and olives

X2XMM1uGO-X80UHnVbxVuA.text: The pizza is SO tasty!! The dough is almost like an Indian naan. We ordered the Settebello for the namesake. Good taste with the sausage and mushrooms and fresh tomato sauce. The pine nuts add a little crunch which you don't come across too often on pizzas but is a great addition.  We also had the Diavolo which is also nice! The peppered salami is under the cheese and has a small kick that surprises you when you bite into it a piece of pizza. The fresh basil and peppers are a lovely addition.  We still prefer the Settebello pizza. The restaurant gets 4 stars only because it teeters between being too pretentious and not and when we visit we don't know which side we will walk into.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Front: Diavolo Back: Settebello

HMf0rBtLghd9KISMDme0yg.text: I came here for LJ (UYE) with bunch of other yelpers. Literally took up two big tables eight. They did great job of taking everyones order and really for the most part getting everyone orders right. When it comes too big parties its usually more hassle but the staff there really on point. I know never saw anyone on our table with empty glass of soda or what not. Before I even had chance too finish had a server come up ask me if need another drink. Yelpers do we literally was the last ones too shut the place down but the staff never pushed us out. Yet again another start for service and just handling big party.   I have been here once before but it been while so looking forward too the pizza and the company. The thing about this style is traditional not suppose too cut the pizza (although if you want they WILL cut it up for you). It can make for interesting eating not only using fork and knife action. Also the fact that its thin crust pizza and depending on the pizza order can be even more tricky. Think of it as part of the fun! I order the Stellebello. I enjoyed. I like the combination of pine nuts, sausage, sauce, and just the right amount of cheese. The crust was good. The pizza cooked in cold brick oven so its not your traditional crust crispy but more on the soft side. So if thinking getting crusty crust you will be disappointed. It decent size pie so warning lay off the bread. Lol! Or else going have hard time finishing off the pie.  I am fan of Stellebello! Just that since its in Henderson would much rather go with my favorite closer too home. Sure if in the area someplace would stop by get my pie on.   Mahalos too LJ for setting up the UYE. As always great time meeting new yelpers never meet before and seeing friends again. Till the next UYE.

pef8dvCD-QuGev0pSM2uqQ.text: The best I have had in Vegas and I am comparing it to, Cosmopolitan secret pizza place, Grimaldis, rosati's, the pizza joint on Sahara and jones, and any others I have hit in Vegas this is in a league of its own   I tried the Settebello and the *Daviola those were so fresh and flavorful our bill was 29 bucks worth every bit of it  The girl waitresses had awesome eyelashes too

7-DegFjQCj896e1VgKBvug.text: Always five star tastes here. The bubbling cheese and crisps edges from the 900 degree oven makes this the most desirable pizza by our family.

RIAAPNdKw5mdVQNHhqKjww.text: We were looking for a place to have our family dinner and decided on this restaurant based upon its ranking. The high marks are deserved. The atmosphere, the delicious pizzas, service, and price was superb. Get the warm beet salad - probably the best beet dish I've had.

lyN9l57HThxNr41oWIqNXA.text: Place is amazing !! Great food ! Great wine !  Great decor ! Definitely recommend the Cesar salad and house red wine !

3s3MyBXJd9zEpLb9DnlZ2A.text: This place is simply amazing!  My (Italian) family- ranging from 3 years old to 63- and I have been probably 5-6 times in about 6 months and we have never once been disappointed.  The pizzas are authentic, fresh, and interesting.  The salads are so delicious too.  They have awesome app/drink specials weekly and their "Pizza of the Month" never fails to disappoint.  Their wine, cocktail, and beer menu is varied as well.  What else can I say?  Friendly and knowledgeable service in addition- if you are unsure what to order I'd recommend asking the wait staff for suggestions.  My perfect zonal suggestions- Panzanella Salad or Caprese, the Misto App Platter, and the Pizza Brisket, or Margherita DC Pizza, plus gelato for dessert!!

1l7IWEdGdR3Ep8_nZJrHvA.text: Next time you are in Vegas, save yo' lovely selves the burn & hustle of "The Strip" & abscond to sleepy Henderson. Trust me on this. And then as night falls skip over to Settebello by the Cheesecake Factory near I-215 and North Green Valley Pkwy and treat ya' lovely selves to the most authentic "pizza magia di Napoli" South of Area 51. Read up on the company schizzle  @ Settebello.Net, but if you like me, you'll wan' go over there yo'self an' see wha' the hoopla is all about.  Taste of the puddin'.   FACTOID multiplied by HYPE: Since 2005, proprietor Brad Otton & crew have been whippin' up a cross between street magic & edible art from a non-descript corner of a strip mall near an equally non-descript Whole Foods Market.   My fave @ Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana is the Vico pizza with "Wood Oven Sausage, Sauteed Fennel, Red Onions, Mascarpone, Mozzarella, Basil, Extra Virgin Olive Oil". Goodness for days ..... the kind that will stand a little refrigeration and microwaving the mornin' after. Serious yummy-yums right here if y'alls allow me to wax "neologistical"!  My only fear is that the owners may fail to bottle "the magia" when they finally decide to franchise & spread out. Hear they have set up second shop in Mitt Romney's backyard (Utah). Not sure if I'm gonna venture that far but its certainly worthy of a note to self.  Max-man representin' H-City here while quackin' in me boots. Reason? I'm "afeared" Henderson will be swallowed hide & hoof, as Vegas or its ethos rather, spreads out like a canker sore from The Strip, from foothill to foothill: the same Vegas that like money is founded upon a skim, no, actually make that a scam.  No?  Monsieur Max, digressing in characteristic facon.  Bonne journee.

BFjPF7ux0_G23R1NDoUs-w.text: We had been out shopping all day and turned to you my fellow yelpers to guide us to a delicious meal for a reasonable price and you did not disappoint, so thank you!  We arrived and was quickly seated in a booth in Cory's section. He was personable, knowledgeable, and eager to accommodate at will. We ordered the Insalata Grande to share with the Pine Nuts on the side. Cory had the chef separate the salad into 2 portions and it was ooh so yummy. The shavings of fresh parmigiano was wonderful and the balsamic reduction was a perfect blend to cover but not saturate the leafy greens... so good my friends!  Alright the pizza... we ordered the Stellebono and of course modified it to accommodate my dislike for pine nuts and pancetta even though I am full Sicilian, I preferd to substitute artichokes and fresh garlic on my side. The oven cooks at a 1000 degree temp so if your pizza comes out a little more done or blackish in color than you prefer they are happy to remake it. We opted to just eat ours and it was delicious and a little juicy (from the toppings I assume.) WARNING: this is NOT your average pie. It is more of a gourmet pizza, so If you're looking for East Coast style pie this is not it.  We are good eaters and a single pizza and salad was enough to satisfy both of us comfortably.  When we come to Vegas we will stop back in for a more casual meal in a beautiful atmosphere at a decent price.

LuTnJc0Pbx0_YdC4tErZ0Q.text: You will love the pizza here if you like the clean fresh doughy crust kind of pizza. If you like greasy pizza...... DO NOT come here. I love the clean taste Setebello provides. I forgot the name but I came in for their one of their lunch specials which was a specialty 8 inch pizza [as opposed to 12in on their regular menu] for $9. You can add on a salad too for an extra $4. The pizza I chose had artichoke, mushrooms, and prosciutto. Super clean taste, just wish the pizza dough underneath was more crisp cuz my pizza ended up being soggy. The waitress is friendly but the hostess that day just looked like she hated her life which is a turn off since they're the first people you see when you walk in. Pizza here is a bit on the pricey side for the portion and toppings you get but hey it's probably because of the location and quality of ingredients they use.

KcKZi_ZoWEnmXsiLJl-FbA.text: We have ordered to go two times. Their pizzas are delicious. Be sure to order their margarita and ask for extra basil. It's a little pricey, but absolutely delicious!

hTUv62d3esRr2rYL7xvWQg.text: Patrick is new but one of the best servers we've had here! Quick, helpful and really pleasant. The special this week is amazing; they are often great but this week was really tasty, we will probably come back for another tomorrow! It should move to the main menu...

lhR315iTYpSPV-97qZNRyA.text: Awesome hand crafted pizzas! Salads and wine selection are ok... But the pizzas are great! I love the spicy pepperoni! Definitely worth a try!

gJUTpcrtAtgBL7gu8vkqfw.text: Excellent wood-fired pizza and reasonably priced! In a great location too! It's fun to walk off the pizza in the beautiful district after :)

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Butternut squash and whipped potato pizza with goat cheese for fall. Def. wasn&#39;t my favorite but I love how creative they can be!

CCdJ2hPt3n06P7G6yIz9qA.text: The atmosphere was much more casual than I expected.  The outside of the restaurant is a stark contrast to the inside.  It's a cookie cutter commercial building with plain written all over the facade and a boring font "Settebello" sign overhead.  Inside aged brick walls, wood trims, iron art accents and exposed copper vents added to a slightly more inviting and warm ambiance.  Our server was very personable and attentive.  We split an Insalada Grande and shared a Settebello pizza.  The salad was brought out already split and was the perfect size; mixed greens, tomato, artichoke, mushrooms, olives, pine nuts and large shavings of Parmigiano Reggiano tossed in a flavorful vinaigrette.  The pizza came out not long after we finished our salad.  It looked amazing covered in tomatoes, pancetta, sausage, mushrooms, pine nuts, basil and fresh mozzarella.  I love, love, love the crust on a neapolitan pizza.  And this one was amazing; soft and chewy with a little bit of amazing grilled char on the bottom.  Everything we had that little extra gourmet flare to it that I've come to expect with a neapolitan style pizzeria.

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Insalada Grande, split
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. A little bit of char crunch and flavor, beautiful.
Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Settlebello

cvjf0Mc7RB3dhvWI8ZQ9GA.text: This place has amazing pizza!  I can't say its the best, because there are different types of pizza. If you're looking for a light pizza, with a thin crust, that tastes like authentic Italian pizza, and gives you a whole personal size to yourself, then you want to come here.  I ate the whole pizza to myself, and didn't feel an ounce of guilt.  In fact, my muffin top didn't spew over at all!  I ordred the Pizza Carbonera and was in love with all the flavors: crushed tomatoes, fresh mozarella (this really makes a difference in a pizza), the crust cooked to perfection and really thin, and the cured bacon....yum!  I'm definitely coming back to try other pizza on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Settebello Pizzeria Napoletana - Henderson, NV, United States. Pizza Carbonera! Yum!

U1-5k3r40teI6VRmoj8Ryg.text: Another enjoyable meal. I ordered a insalata grande to start, fresh Parmesan and plenty of olives. Our pizzas were made to perfection. My Margherita was yummy, I liked the amount of cheese used and my crust was baked just the way I like it. The capricciosa was also baked to perfection , the artichokes and prosciutto were just right to give it flavor . Only thing negative I noticed this time around was the panacotta, it was delish but the presentation was slacking. Ordered the traditional one with strawberries and noticed it was sloppily made. As you can see on my photos the the dessert looked much prettier my last trip. Our server Ryan was pleasant and he brought our food quickly and refilled our drinks without us even asking. Easy parking and outdoor seating available. Another great experience, we'll be back for sure!

HfzGfBWLq-h5eDtzFKuPqw.text: Settebello is probably the best pizza in Henderson. It is located in the Whole Foods parking lot of The District. Miss Molly T. and I got our lunch on couple of weeks ago, and both of us were extremely pleased with the drool-worthy pizza.   We decided to split the namesake Settebello Pizza which had crushed tomatoes, pancetta, wood oven sausage, roasted mushrooms, toasted pine nuts, mozzarella, basil, and extra virgin olive oil ($13.50). The toppings were fresh with quality ingredients and the crust was cooked perfectly, but it is definitely a soft pie like crust. I found it easiest to just fold the slice and eat it that way instead of trying to have the soft crust hold the weight of all the toppings. It was very very tasty. They also have a selection of Italian beers and pasta.  The service was attentive enough and the pizza did take a little while to come out. No they do not deliver.

KppLf2n6A1byZm6sCHRQhw.text: A very unpretentious restaurant, with a casual and comfortable ambience. The decor does have a slight European flair to it, but not in an overpowering way.    The menu is simple, with about 10 or so pizzas listed, some antipasti and not a whole lot more. The level of service is excellent, bordering on exceptional. Our server was Ryan, and he was well-assisted by the rest of the staff.  Ryan was very well-informed about his menu, understood instantly what we were shooting for - one white and one tomato pizza to share - and guided us to very good and complementary choices.  Service was fast and attentive - drink refills always appeared just a few minutes BEFORE glasses ran empty - and the food came out quickly, fresh and hot.  Napoli pizza is rather different than the American version, so comparing the two is a little like comparing apples and oranges. I'd eaten pizza a few times in Italy, and new what to expect.  And I was not disappointed. The ingredients - prosciutto, spinach, cheeses - were all fresh and delicious.   Ryan, and then later the busboy, made some recommendations - such as dipping the pizza in a balsamic reduction - that impressed us greatly.    Price for two, was just under $50.  On the whole, we were very impressed.  We will recommend this restaurant to friends and almost certainly visit again.

uUy8NBpAOmYFYUIuCARdQQ.text: I from ca here visiting  my son in Henderson and they wanted pizza so we found this place and the pizza was great we had the Daviola and it was very good the only draw back was it could of used more cheese but it was enjoyable.  I would recommend to friends.

d9x87LY56KEqsPc-_WDvcQ.text: This is the only pizza spot we frequent. They have great quality imported ingredients and a friendly staff.   We are moving to mountains edge area, but will make the trip over just to get our fix!

wg5EEPGD_ih31mw5n41DZw.text: Never would I have guessed that I, a New Yorker who finds LA's Pizzeria Mozza the best gourmet pizza in the country, would have given 5 stars to a pizza restaurant near Cheesecake Factory in suburban Las Vegas. But I am -- and it's worth it. During the week staying nearby, I came here twice and was wowed every time. I first chose the proscuitto and romaine lettuce pizza, and it was perfectly crisp with the right combination of ingredients without being messy or too greasy. The second night I chose the white pizza with fennel sausage, and it honestly beat the Susan Finiger's fennel sausage pizza at Mozza. The gelato here - especially the peanut butter gelato -- is not to be missed. The best cup of coffee I've had outside of Europe. If you are in Vegas, Henderson or at Green Valley, this is a must.

ENTjdVCw1F_lInWPYIwXdA.text: five stars, that's it! If you want to have "pizza" as in, the True Italian pie with cheese on it, look no further. If you are looking for a deep dish crap most people call pizza, move right along. Fresh ingredients, nice sauce without spices (as it should be), fresh cheese, slightly burnt sides....just awesome. Like going to Italy without needing a passport. Best cappuccino in town (depending on who makes it tho), the tiramisu will get you tipsy, and the hazelnut gelato is great!

kW9bFgNWMmmFfDgTItZT0A.text: Fabulous in every way. Extensive menu so something for everyone - and everything is prepared to perfection .. Service is outstanding no matter how busy it gets, and it does get busy. So happy to be able to do a True 5star review

Adgaq9Ku2f81fBwlctaSHg.text: The fondest memories I have studying in Italy: drinking espresso at Bar Rosso in Campo Santa Margherita, and smoking cheap cigarettes with friends all day long, and eating a ton of food.... I literally stuffed my face with so much Italian (food) that I should have come back 300lbs heavier, which since walking was the main transportation method in Venice, I managed to lose weight (best fricking deal ever)!!! It was, to say, a most wonderful experience....  Since then, I've quit smoking (lozenges are the way to go), but still guzzle down the caffeine...And having Pizza in Italy was another out- of-this-world experience; having an individual-size, thinly crusted pizza, eating with a knife and fork with the freshest ingredients,  you couldn't ask for anything more satisfying than even the simplest of them all: the Margherita.  With just three ingredients-Basil, Tomato Sauce and Mozzarella, it is the purist and most difficult of flavorful pizzas to achieve. Click below to read more...  And Settebello brings me back to those fond memories, it captures the essence of Italian cooking with fresh and raw ingredients to create their Pizzas.  They are licensed by the VPN (Vera Pizza Napoletana) an organization created in the 80's to preserve, promote and educate the traditional art of Napolitan Pizza making. The VPN Charter provides strict guidelines and requirements to protect the integrity of this culinary discipline, which is why Settebello's pizza catapults me back to Italy and it's wonderful, rich style of humble yet elegant cuisine.  Primarily a pizza restaurant, Settebello does provide some appetizers which is comprised mostly of breads, salads and cured meats.  All of these are absolutely delicious and I recommend ordering one in each category if you're hungry.  Our personal favorite is the Involtini di Prosciutto: Prosciutto wrapped around Arugula and Goat Cheese with shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano, Balsamic Reduction and ExtraVirgin Olive Oil on top.  This is an incredibly satisfying and evolved dish, it combines a salad quotient with a cured meat app that is developed and sophisticated: the peppery bitter greens with the creaminess of goat cheese and the buttery Prosciutto Crudo is just symphonic, add the sweet/tart Balsamic and fruity Olive Oil and it sends me over the top........  Moving on: we have two Pizzas that are our favorite, (and pretty much the only two worth getting): the Settebello and the Diavola.  Due to our new harm reduction policies, we can only order one pizza to split, but still order a dessert.  May not be conducive to food blogging, but it is what it is, (look to future posts for updates on other dishes).  The utmost favorite is the Settebello: with Fennel Sausage, Roasted Mushrooms, Toasted Pine Nuts, Mozarella, Basil and Crushed Tomatoes with a drizzle of Olive Oil, this is the supreme Pizza of the Napolitan set...  We thoroughly enjoy eating this pizza, with all the topping working so well with each other, (sometimes I like to add some Pepperoncino and a little more Olive Oil to enhance the flavor) and it's balanced well with the toppings to crust/bread ratio, so you get your carb cravings sated simultaneously...  At last, for dessert, there's quite a selection at Settebello, but our two favorites are: the house made Cannoli and Tiramisu. This time, we ordered the Tiramisu, a creamy and decadent dessert with Marscapone Cream, Lady Fingers soaked in Espresso and Disaronno and powdered chocolate on top.  The serving size, in my mind, too small (a cake pan is more my size)!  It's a great dessert, totally authentic and hits the spot after a great meal.  Settebello is the best Pizza Place in Las Vegas, definitely a must if you enjoy an elevated dining experience with good authentic Italian food!  Rating (Out of Five Stars)  Food:          4.5 Ambience:  3.75 Service:       4

TFYaK7GrfR2iZ3nAsPd-RA.text: Pizza was excellent, went there twice during my training while in Henderson/Las Vegas.  Both times the pizza was excellent, the staff was very knowledgeable about what they served on the menu, and the beer selections were unique while very satisfying.

SAyeVlrxMBZxvkS9uTbs_A.text: The best place in town!  The food is amazing, and the the team of workers are the finest!! I highly recommend Settebello  Pizzeria Napoletana to everyone who wants an enjoyable atmosphere with fun people and the best pizza and wine in town!

dAvi880cZBKAbK9ELN6ifg.text: Great food, even better customer service. We came in for the first time an hour before closing on a Sunday night. Tam was wonderful, and his recommendation for the Jalapeno pizza was spot on, he's an asset to this restaurant, we will definitely be back.

Cen9Q8CSygzv6tNjNflAPA.text: great food, but limited menu with only pizza and salad. would be nice to have some type of chicken dish cooked in brick oven on the menu. the bar always seems to take a while for drinks and service can be hit or miss. they hire high school kids to serve and doesn't seem they get the best training. A lot of server/hostess gossip at the front desk - save your stories for when you are off. Even with the couple negatives I continue to eat here.

RDJrp2QaSNJl3X3qqeQVlg.text: Second time for me. Overall great experience, quality place! Prices seem reasonable. Seated almost immediately. Fairly busy for a Friday...and that means the food is good. Our server Whitnee was very pleasant. Also she was very happy to help with recommendations and made sure everything tasted good. We got three pizzas. All were very good. I had the Diavola, good I'm taste and quality. I was warned of the spicy meat on it and it was spicy! But it was pretty good. Only bad thing of my experience was I had to ask to have another water after completely drinking mine. Tiramisu for dessert, very well done. I shall return!

xtE2vBgA5A5C351ZtwJbEQ.text: I've had pizza in Naples, Sali's pizza in New Haven, & I've had Tony's pizza in SF; this pizza is not good.  either the dough is over hydrated or the oven isn't hot enough. They have a beautiful oven it's just to bad their packaged dough and sauce taste like Ragoo... it's also a chain restaurant like packaged food!  ALL I CAN SAY U CALIFORNIANS NEED TO MAKE A TRIP TO NEW YORK AND GET ON THE RIGHT PAGE! THIS PLACE IS A DISASTER! I wouldn't feed this stuff to my dog!

8Gm4aUWz9rcIcxL1FFR9cA.text: Love this place! Lunch with clients, or lunch with my husband. Has been excellent every time! Try the Settebello Special, it is the best. Fresh ingredients, great crust, and the flavor is amazing.

5Qmmt3BgFVToyL8h2Z7Iew.text: My girlfriend and I were directed here by her Italian professor. Having lived most of her life in Italy, she said that Settebello offers the most authentic Italian cuisine in Henderson and Las Vegas. I am sure a few establishments on the Boulevard would protest, but based on flavor alone, I would have to agree. I grew up visiting the Italian restaurants along Federal Hill in Providence, and unless you are in New York, you probably cannot find more authentic Italian dishes in America.  Unlike those opulent Italian eateries of my youth, Settebello is simple. Tasteful country, dark wood tables in an upscale, modern open dinning area match the menu's simplicity - pizza, appetizers (antipasto and salad), and dessert. In a way this reminds me of classic American diners, where In-N-Out draws its inspiration from. A few dedicated items, carefully prepared, creates a tastier, and in this case more authentic dish.  Any pizzaria west of the Mississippi is traditionally met with skepticism, but Settebello returns me home to the streets of Federal hill, thin crust, warm, authentic mozzarella, and refreshing tomato sauce.  When visiting Settebello you will feel at home in casual attire or business casual dress. The service is prompt, and for an open dinning area, the atmosphere is surprisingly quiet. My girlfriend and I were on our way to a film, and the pacing was perfectly comfortable as well as timely.
